description:
What can I say about Hot Cookie, except, YASSSSS! Hot Cookie is a small, touristy, cookie bakery in the heart of the Castro District. All the classic cookies are available here, as well as amazing new crazy cookie concoctions they have. From the "Basic Becky" that is chocolate chip, and your Granny oatmeal raisin cookie (my fave) to modern favorites like matcha maker and coconut macaroons cookie (yes I named the cookies). If you're also looking to get kinky, they have coconut macaroon penis. It comes in dark chocolate or white. I prefer dark to be honest....both in cookies and in real life. TMI...

Anyways, Hot Cookie is a very cool place. The location, though small, is pretty great. Outlooking the amazingly rainbow scenery of Castro District. If the pictures of different customer's on the wall, hot cookie underwear, to the penis shaped macaroons doesn't interest you? I dont know what will. Not only that but prices are pretty cheap. Cookies are all under $5. To be honest, they got me at penis macaroons! There's certain places that you really don't need to explain. People just need to see it for themselves to see why it's popular. If you're ever in town and want to visit the Castro District, this place is a must on the bucket list!
author: Oliver B.

description:
I was skeptical - can it be gimmicky AND the best chocolate chip cookie? The answer: absolutely. 

The basic bitch is just a down to earth, excellent cookie. Crispy around the edges and soft and buttery in the middle, despite not being hot out of the oven.

I was too excited and also got a Mac Daddy (white chocolate macadamia nut) which I didn't have time to eat that day - the next day it still had that beautiful crispy edge with a soft middle.

They sell the cookies by weight and they're really reasonably priced. The shop is fun, the names are fun, and the shop/people are fun.
author: Austin L.

description:
Dick on a stick is a must-try item when you visit the Castro! 

The line can get long but it also moves pretty fast. They are very efficient inside. The shop is really small but there are plenty to choose from off the menu. They have things from cookies to brownies to macaroons. 

You can either get a penis or boobs. They are coconut macaroons which came out very nicely. It wasn't too sweet and it definitely tasted very coconuty so make sure you like coconut! They are either covered with white chocolate or dark chocolate. 

Don't remember the price but it's an experience!
author: Yuan Z.

description:
This is a fun little shop in the Castro district.  There are a lot of cool gifts including red undies and other funny items.  Their main attraction is their whimsical sweets that you can see from the street.  Super large cookies, and their phallic shaped macaroon.  

We were enjoying the smells of fresh baked cookies and expected this when we ordered the Penis & Venus macaroon.  After snapping several naughty pictures, we were slightly underwhelmed by the flavor and the macaroons were a bit hard.  

This is a novelty shop and I think it's worth visiting once.
author: Tina M.

description: The place to get a penis.... cookie fix!! Such a fun and cute spot, I highly recommend anyone whose first visiting to SF to try this spot out!
author: Elise L.

description:
Hot Cookie serves super large cookies and novel dick shaped treats!

Their cookies are not bad, and I don't think they are worth the price. 

I tried the matcha maker and the peanut butter chocolate chip, which are both alright. I couldn't really taste the matcha in the matcha maker, and the peanut butter chocolate chip was a bit sweet for me.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
As I write this review, my leftover Granny cookie is staring at me waiting to be eaten.

We strolled into Hot Cookie on a sunny, but windy day. It was the first time for both of us. All of the freshly baked cookies were just staring at us through the glass saying "buy me!" (Side note: love the names for some of their cookies.. Basic Bitch, Pokie, Granny, Coco Mac Daddy and White Mac Daddy, etc.) The staff was friendly and they didn't rush us as we perused the smorgasbord of cookies. When we received our package of cookies, I was hoping for a nice warm sensation in my hand, but instead it was a stiff white package.

Despite Hot Cookie's cookies not being hot, they did taste better than a Mrs. Field's cookie and a Cookie Corner cookie.
author: Aimee I.

description:
Should we talk about the penis cookie for a second? We all know it's the reason you're stopping in... for the penis. (No shame.)

What you must know about the penis cookie, is that it is NOT an actual cookie. It's a coconut macaroon, aka chocolate-covered shredded coconut treat, which to me is basically candy. You can get it in dark chocolate or white chocolate, and even add whipped cream for a fee, but it's not a cookie.

Is shredded coconut and sugar your thing? Then you might like a giant $8 penis. Me? I happen to not enjoy coconut macaroons, so I was pretty disappointed with my dark chocolate penis with sprinkles. 

The actual cookies behind the glass all look slightly over-baked and/or were flattened out. I'm probably very picky about cookies because it's one of my hobbies (baking, not being picky), but this is San Francisco. High standards!

I want to say we ordered a chocolate chip or a peanut butter or something else simple, and I recall being disappointed. 

I came back another time and ordered a toffee milk chocolate cookie.... now that one was pretty good! Cookie flatness be damned, the flavor was great. 

All in all, Hot Cookie is a fun place to visit and snap photos with, but there are much better cookie options in San Francisco. This is a novelty place for sure.

Tip: Buy a pair of their Hot Cookie underwear and post a picture on social media. You'll get a free cookie!
author: Melissa B.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked for forever because of its novelty, but I never drive or am around Castro St.

I was in the area finally and had to get the dick cookie because, cmon, pictures. It's basically just for that though, pictures. It doesn't taste that good, (well I was also very full), but I could not finish this. It was just a very large chocolate coconut macaron.

I also ordered a butch bar, which seemed to be like peanut butter chocolate bar, not bad.
author: Kenny N.

description:
I walked in, saw pictures on the wall, snapped a few cookie pictures of the baked goods and walked out. Not something that was on my agenda to do for my day. Overall, these cookies were great baked and good tasting.

My wifey got a few snacks from penis to matcha, noting I call a threat. The whole shop smelled like the Pillsbury doughboy made a porn movie.. idk what scene but that sucker smelled good.. the shop smelled great. I would recommend.. unless you feel uncomfortable. My Matcha cookie was awesome tasting.

Overall. Great spot.
author: Leo Z.

description:
In the words of Vanessa Vanjie Mateo, 'GET DEEZ COOKIES BABY"!!! Definitely came here because of how phallic the cookies were but I'd come back again solely for the quality. Definitely a must try in the Castro!

Mr. Penis ($8) - Dark Chocolate Coconut Macaroon. Definitely some richer dark chocolate here, and the quality of the coconut macaroon cookies were really good and delicious. They also have the option of having whipped cream and sprinkles on them, which I passed out on. Super delicious and honestly a pretty huge cookie (but for $8 it better be a huge cookie)! 

Miss Venus ($8) - A White Chocolate Coconut Macaroon monstrosity. I personally preferred this over its dark chocolate counterpart (as I'm not the biggest fan of dark chocolate), but the quality of the macaroon cookies were both equally as good. If I had to come back I'd definitely snag a Miss Venus.

White Chocolate Macadamia Cookie ($1 for a day old!)- Super good! Though it was a day old it was still super delicious and still a good, moist cookie. I'd definitely snag a day old cookie to try if you're looking for something not as phallic to try.

The location is definitely tiny, but adorable. The inside also features tons of photos of happy customers and drag queens, and they also have their iconic 'Hot Cookie' sign out front. Honestly my biggest highlight here was finding out how many phallic things I could say about their iconic cookies.

I mean Hot Cookie is most arguably a definite spot to go to spot in the Castro, especially if you're visiting the Castro for the first time. I'd put Hot Cookie at a pretty moderate 4, as the only reason why for me it wouldn't hit a 5 is because of how pricey the iconic coconut macaroon cookies were, however the quality of their cookies were pretty good. And like the iconic Vanessa Vanjie Mateo said, I'd definitely come back for these cookies, baby!
author: Allison O.

description: Iconic. Hot Cookie is so delicious. I constantly crave cookies from here and although it's kind of far from me, i make the trek. I highly recommend the toffee chocolate chip cookie, snickerdoodle and matcha snickerdoodle ($4.50). What's rad is that they put the ingredients online! I was nervous my lactose friend wouldn't be able to eat these cookies, but all the ingredients were online so I could check! The staff are very friendly and accommodating too!
author: Caitlyn S.

description:
Somehow, I was previously too busy eating cookies to review Hot Cookie. 

So let's rectify that. Because this may just be the perfect cookie.

Everything here looks good. Every single thing. Even the coconut macaroon which I am not a fan of. This tiny little storefront has plenty of cookie options, and you can see them baking in the back. 

Onto the Cookies! 

Peanut Butter Chocolate - I love peanut butter. I like chocolate. I liked this cookie a lot. It had some nice crunch to it (moreso than the peanut butter cookie). Gotta say peanut butter won my heart. 

Peanut Butter - I'm a sucker for peanut butter. And this is the BEST peanut butter cookie I have EVER had. They didn't need any extras. Get your nuts and reeses out of my peanut butter cookie. This cookie was THAT good. No jazz needed. 

Sticky Nikki - Chocolate chip cookie with caramel and pretzels. The pretzel adds a nice salty, crunch. The caramel is gooey. The chocolate is mmmm. 

The ingredients here are just high quality, the cookies are perfectly baked, and they are just damn good. Mouthgasm.

Imagine your perfect cookie...Crunchy, sugary edges with a thin crisp bottom layer and gooey center. Now, if you aren't imagining a Hot Cookie cookie, then you are thinking of the wrong cookie!
author: Libby J.

description: Came for the smells, stayed for the naughty pics and left with two cheeky cookies. Clearly a Castro landmark. They even have $1 day old cookies which I thought was pretty neat. I spent $16 on two cookies shaped like a  and a  - a little pricey but I'm a sucker for novelty and embarrassing my husband with baked goods. Next time, I might have to grab a pair of their red undies....
author: Daisy K.

description:
Penis and Venus cookies?!?! 

So very San Francisco. 

When you finish your distraction with those novelty cookies (great marketing btw) you will find the other baked goods here are solid.

Frosted brownies are every chocoholic sweet tooths dream come true. 

The dipped brownie is deep chocolately overload. You will love it! 

The chocolate chip is crispy around the edges and soft in the middle, just the way I like it! 

The white chocolate chip and macadamia nut cookie boasts an abundance of chocolate and nuts- you feel like you should have paid more for it. 

The sticky Nicky cookie is my favorite. The caramel and salty pretzel pieces make this my favorite salty sweet treat from here! 

Hot cookie wins my dollars because they do what they do best year after year - bang out some mighty fine sweet treats!
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
I indulged in a nearly $3 (price determined by weight) toffee chocolate chip cookie.  Nothing shaped like a phallus, not dipped nor was the cookie scrotum even sprinkled.  

It wasn't even warm, much less hot.  

For me, this ended as a novelty item.  Been there, done that, seen the endowed mannequin in the window.  Don't need to return.  

And the service?  How long does one need to stand at the counter until s/he is served?  Apparently a couple minutes, which wouldn't be horrible except they each looked up at me and continued doing what looked to be nonessential.  

Decent cookie, though nowhere near their namesake temperature.  Pricey cookie, only for the novelty of getting it in the Castro...
author: David B.

description:
I came to visit the Castro district during my tour of SF and my friend brought my to Hot Cookie for ...well a hot cookie. Walking in, you are greeted by not only a number of cookies but also a wallpaper of photos submitted by people wearing the Hot Cookie merchandise, mainly their speedo-style briefs. It is every eclectic but still somewhat classy and OK for kids. Besides the main cookies such as the snickerdoodle and the toffee, they have others such as the Coco Mac Daddy (which I got) and the Penis and Venus cookies. 

The Coco Mac Daddy was white chocolate with coconuts shavings. The price is based on the weight so they weigh the cookie to determine the price. Mine came out to a little less than $3. I asked for it heated cuz who doesn't like a warm cookie? He put it in the microwave and gave it to me afterward. Overall, I felt the cookie was decent. Not the best I've had and probably overly white chocolately and not enough coconut flavoring. The concept is interesting and appealing but the cookies I've heard are just OK but worth a visit just to check out the spot and area.
author: Kevin L.

description: Only tried the butch bar and it was to die for! My daughter had a fudge packer cookie and frosted brownie and she loved hers too!
author: Bella S.

description: Hot Cookie is in Castro District, the first gay neighborhood in the US, in San Francisco. You can probably try this when you're clubbing or bar hopping in Castro. I don't visit The Bay much, but I have a cookie every time I am in the area. While exploring the city during the daytime, I decided to buy some day-old cookies since they were like $1, and they had a bunch since I was there in the morning. Their regular cookies are large at 3 to 4 ounces, and the regular price is about $3.5 and up. Toffee Milk Chocolate is a must, White Chocolate Macadamia was good and what I expected, and Fudge Packer Cookie was chocolate rich. One day I'll try the special cookies, like the penis-shaped cookies, for fun, but most of the time I would rather have more regular cookies. I should've packed lighter so I could have taken some home to Los Angeles (even though we have many cookie shops, too).
author: Brian I.

description:
Let's be honest - people come from all over the world for the penis cookies. Yes, you can bring the kids for some traditional chocolate chip, gingerbread or peanut butter ones, but mostly, people want the dick pics for their social feeds. Normally straight dudes don't like having anything phallic near their faces, but all caution is thrown to the wind when they have a warm Hot Cookie in their hand.

The shop is really small, so don't be discouraged if you see a line out the door. The staff is fast and friendly and get people in and out pretty damn quick. Weekends and times when the nearby bars are hopping ensure longer wait times, but if you're strolling through the Castro midday, it's usually pretty easy to grab what you want with minimum effort.

The penis pastries are good and there is a lot of it. Might be worth sharing with a friend (if you're into that sort of thing) and they come in both chocolate and vanilla covered offerings. I preferred the choco, but the vanilla wasn't overly sweet either, so it was easy to down it all in one sitting.

All the cookies are soft, warm and if you don't want a dick for dessert - they have a ton of regular cookie options to choose from as well.
author: Ryan C.

description:
One of my friends came down from the bay area and brought me some cookies from here, so I was excited to try them. I was looking forward to eating a chocolate covered macaroon penis, but unfortunately was given a snickerdoodle, peanut butter, sugar cookie, and chocolate chips ones instead.

The chocolate chip cookies were my favorite and tasted great when you put them in the microwave for 10 seconds- otherwise they taste like any other chocolate chip cookie. I like how thick they were, and there were plenty of chocolate chips as well. 

I've asked my sister, friend, and mom to get me cookies from here during the past year and still haven't gotten the chance to eat the penis one! Hopefully I will have the opportunity to order the dark chocolate covered one the next time I come up here LOL!!
author: Dung N.

description: I had heard about this place from a fellow yelper at a yelp elite event. So the last time I was in the city, I made my bf make a detour here so I could pick up some cookies. This place is located in the heart of the Castro. The atmosphere and décor fits right in with the neighborhood. It's a tiny storefront. Three people can barely fit inside and the glass case full of cookies is the main thing in that place. I got three cookies to try - the toffee chocolate chip, the basic bish/b*tch, which is chocolate chip, and the mac daddy, which is a white chocolate macadamia nut cookie. I think the toffee chocolate was my favorite. It's a little different and in the best way. The regular choc chip is pretty basic and I would say the macadamia nut one is my second favorite of the three. The cookie s are also a good mix of hard and chewy - slightly harder on the edges but softer and chewier in the middle. Really good. Each cookie is over 3 bucks each but they're huge - practically as big as my face. I would totally come back here again, especially since they're open late till midnight and 2 am on the weekends.
author: Alison W.

description: How can you go wrong with cookies!  And they have sooo many kinds and they are huge.  I became a huge fan of the sticky Nicky and the matcha green tea.  And they have penis cookies .  The staff was very helpful with deciding flavors but if you know me I ended up buying like 6 different kinds!  A must go in the Castro and don't forget you penis cookie!
author: Mary B.

description:
An interesting bakery in the Castro neighborhood of SF! They have some interesting decor to say the least and some interesting cookies as well. I got one of the "fun" coconut macaron cookies and a day old oatmeal white chocolate cranberry. Honestly, was a little underwhelmed given that the coconut macaron cookie was $8 and just shaped into something interesting. Besides the unique feature of it, the actual cookie was kind of dry. The day old oatmeal white chocolate cranberry one was better despite the fact that it was a day old. 

Besides the cost being kind of high for some average cookies, I also thought that the service was quite slow. Yes, it is a small shop that's very narrow, but there are still 2 employees working behind the counter. I noticed that 1 employee was very slowly decorating/making more things but wasn't really helping the other employee who was doing cash register (and pretty slammed). There were several customers behind me who weren't patient enough and just decided to leave after waiting a few minutes in line and it not moving. It would have definitely sped things up if the other employee had just started helping out with taking orders. 

Overall, if you've never been here, I think it's fun for a unique experience. I don't think I'd come back again as there are plenty of other bakeries in SF with better taste and service.
author: Michael Z.

description:
Ooohhhhhhh you naughty Hot Cookie!

This is not a bakery for the kiddos, unless you park them outside on the street and just bring them a normal cookie.

But Oh yes this is a bakery for us fun lovin adults! 

Of course Hot Cookie has the normal cookies, brownies, chocolate sweets you would find in a bakery, and omg it smells so yummy inside the shop, but I came there for the anatomically correct cookies. HAHA

My anatomically correct cookie (pc for yelp yall) was a chocolate covered coconut macaroon and honestly I just went to get a cookie, didn't have high hopes for the taste of the cookie. But  I have to tell you, this cookie was perfectly stiff & moist, the chocolate didn't melt too much though it was a tad messy but you best believe I loved every minute.  The chocolate coating was thick enough, and the coconut macaroon had great flavors.

You best believe when I am back in the bay area, I will be making another stop at Hot Cookie. hahaha
author: Monica O.

description: When the name is hot Cookie but they serve cold cookie you might be disappointed, however in this case even a cold cookie is a good cookie.   It's a cookie and who does not love a cookie?  Also, according to my companions the snickerdoodle recipe that they are using strays from the original Time honored tradition of an exemplary snickerdoodle cookie
author: Ondrea B.

description:
Most definitely a tourist trap, but a cookie is a cookie. What? You're in SF, eat that phallic cookie with pride. I don't remember how I got here but I left with a cookie or two in hand. Whether they were phallic or not, I leave that up to your judgment. I will let you know that I had too much whip cream spill onto my shirt.

So if you want something else, Hot Cookie has other design options. Other cookies and brownies and macaroons are available too. So you have a good variety to order from here and they bake them in front of you not that that's very exciting. Would I pay as much as I did for these sweets? Probably not, but once in a blue moon is fine.
author: Derek T.

description:
I came here for the D-pic. 

Located rightly so in the Castro District, this cookie shop carries an assortment of cookies but I think they're most known for the penis shaped cookies. Being tourists in the Castro district, we had to try. 

The penis chocolate covered macaroon cookie was very hard to bite into. Jokes aside, really, it was rock hard! I was afraid I might chip a tooth biting into it. My bf and I didn't think it was worth the price ($8!). But maybe it's worth it for the gram?
author: Nancy D.

description:
My friend had to come here to try the penis cookie and I would say she is not disappointed at all. It is a coconut based cookie (shortbready,macaroon ish,cakeish) covered in chocolate and sprinkles. 

The store front is super small so be ready to order. Fyi the decoration / photos are hella hilarious. I want a pair of the undies now :33

The hype is real and it delivered.
author: Na X.

description:
This is a bakery right at the corner of Castro famous for awesome sweets and um, salaciousness. Don't what that means? Yeah just drop on by. You'll figure it out in no time.

Parking? It's very nearly at the corner or market and castro. So you can try you luck on side streets or take the pretty effective public transit. This isn't fisherman's wharf or the FiDi so side street parking is actually possible usually -don't even try on the Castro Street Fair day though, unless you get there before ten am.

This is a walk up with no seating, which means you'll be grabbing and going. The selection changes up all the time especially the cookies, but there are a couple of things that are always there. Specifically, phallic coconut cream thingy's. Phallic. Really? Why can't I just call them the super awesome penis treats they are? Oh, I can't use penis on yelp because it's a forbidden word and I'll get reported(again)? Well, penis. They also have vagina shaped brownies if you prefer, and female torso thingy's made out of the same stuff as the pen...phallic cookie. 

Anyway, if you really want to enjoy a chocolate sweet with cream at the tip, this is the place. I mean, duh, but otherwise no selection here is bad. I tend to stock up at this spot because well, it's perfect. I'm particularly fond of the butch bar which is like a Reese's but much much better. It used to be that if you fit into the underwear's they have and get your pic on the wall, you'd get a free cookie (and at least one phone number). I'm told this no longer is the deal-at least since I've got older-but there are tons of snaps of fit women and men(but mostly men) on the walls inside wearing the shorts (and mostly nothing else). Gives you something to look at besides the penis pastry, and well ......welcome to the Castro. Regardless of your position on the whole pen...phallic thing, the baked goods here are some of the best anywhere. 

So totally worth it. A must do for any visitor.
author: Steven W.

description:
My sister wanted to do 3 humble things during her San Francisco trip: travel to the Golden Gate bridge, sneak away into Japantown, and... visit Castro for Hot Cookie.

Take a guess at her selection, or look at the photos below.

AMBIANCE is giving you red light special realness, mixed with the quaintness of a food boutique. There is nowhere to sit inside, but there are a few bicycle racks to lean on with a friend or two. Stuck in line? Let the collage of hot men clad in branded underwear along the walls take your mind off of things.

ORDERED oatmeal raisin cookie, chocolate chip cookie, and the infamous dark chocolate penis cookie.

FOOD was honestly some of the best cookies I've ever had, especially considering the size. For about $3 a cookie, it doesn't break the bank for a nice bag of goodies to take home.

RATING is a sizzling four. This place is an institution for Castro dwellers, and a must-see for visitors to the neighborhood. Awesome customer service makes for a great trip and a gaggle of laughs per bite.
author: Nicholas G.

description: The best cookies in San Francisco. I lived there for 6 weeks over the summer and never came across a better cookie store. They have a variety of choices (probably 15) and they are quite filling. You pay a more than your average cookie store but it is worth it--trust me. I cannot remember the name of the cookie but my favorite was the one made with green tea and partially covered with white chocolate. The names of the cookies are quite entertaining by the way.
author: Omar S.

description:
They don't take babies as payment!

If I lived in SF, I'd be a regular here. I got a Pokie per recommendation of the guy behind me, a white chocolate chip mac, and a mini white and mini regular chocolate chip. I intended on saving the minis for my mini, but I couldn't hold out that long. Sorry, T. IOU.

The Pokie didn't disappoint. I would have never picked it out for myself, and I almost second guessed the guy, but I'm glad I didn't It was delicious. They all were. I came in the afternoon on a Sunday, so they were a bit picked through and understandably so. They are freaking good cookies. Real freaking good. 

I will definitely be back the next time I'm in SF and hopefully will get to try the penis cookie and the boy scout cookie... What a weird sentence to end this review on, lol.
author: Amy E.

description: Truly live up with that HYPE! Line went by very quickly and the staff was super duper friendly. Those sweet goodness cookies are so hot. Definitely get to try their Mr. Penis - macaroon penis on a stick with chocolate covered. It was kinda dry inside and with whole pack of sugar overload goodness! Other than genitals goodness, make sure do get to try their HOT COOKIES, they are so freaking delicious, just can't stop eating their cookies. I would prefer their cookies over macaroon with chocolate covered any day! Love that pecan chocolate chips cookie, everything I love in one Cookie, how awesome is that :) Stop by when you are in the area!
author: Emily Y.

description:
Yawn. Yes they have penis cookies. But true devotees come for
(1) macaroons
(2) cayenne chocolate chip cookies
(3) rice crispy treats

Let me write a brief ode to their massive rice crispy treats. They come with a topping of marshmallow Creme. That not tempting enough? You can get a plain vanilla one, one mixed with m&m's (not my favorite), or one coated in chocolate. Personally I don't think chocolate marries well with rice crispy treats but you may disagree. 

My favorite is what I call the queer unicorn rice crispy treat. It's a blend of rice crispier and Fruity Pebbles. So it tastes Fruity and looks like confetti and, yes, it still has a tasty coating of marshmallow créme. Don't you wish you had one now?
author: Tim P.

description:
Super cute place!!

Hot Cookie is really small & parking is lowkey a pain in the butt, but the cookies are totally worth it! So my first time, I got the famous penis cookie (lol).. Pretty good! I thought it wouldn't be that good since it's dark chocolate, but it was really good!! But my other two visits, I've gotten Coco Mac Daddy and the regular Mac Daddy. Both super freakin good! They're both white chocolate macadamia nut cookies, but the coco one ofc has coconut Lol.. 

I always go to the city for Boba Guys (i freakin love boba guys) and each time I go, I gotta stop by hot cookie.
author: Dominique E.

description:
Been to a darn lot of bakeries and chocolate places lately so had to try Hot cookie located on Castro. Smaller place than I had anticipated but a big sign so you can't miss it.

Went with a couple different baked goods including a white chocolate  , chocolate chip and their signature item and all of were very average to me like a Mall Bakery.

Service was very friendly and the interior was very welcoming.

I like lists what can I say? 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the SF Bakeries I've visited and I indicated what they're known for or a dish I recommend:

Rod's SF Bakery rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). ?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.

34 Panaderia La Mexicana=mexican sweet bread
35 Hot cookie=Cookies
36 Les Gourmands Bakery=Croissant
37 Mee Mee Bakery=Cow ears
author: Rod M.

description:
PHALLIC DIABETES!!!!!!! Did you even visit The Castro if you didn't take a scandalous selfie of you nibbling away at a penis cookie from Hot Cookie??????? Semen has 5-7 calories per teaspoon (?), while this cookie has tens/hundreds of times that...but to each their own

Wow...that thaaang was HUGEEE. And boy, was it hard...and WOW it lasted wayyy longer than I'd expected ;) (because it was too much to finish in one sitting HAHAHA plz get your mind out of the gutter...you nastyyy, child!!). The ever so famous penis cookie ($8) is a cocoNUT macaroon coated in dark or white chocolate. I've seen pictures of it with coconut shavings, but today's had rainbow sprinkles. I've also seen it topped with whipped cream, and I wasn't going to get any on mine, but the worker didn't ask if I wanted any :( if you don't have a massive sweet tooth, this may be a little overwhelming...nonetheless, delicious!! While it is a little hard to bite into at first, the coconut macaroon works really well with the chocolate coating!! Worth trying at least once!!

It's a pretty small store. I've walked by a few times and seen a line go out the door, but luckily, today there was no line!! There's a neon light sign outside, and when you step inside, you'll see that the walls are decorated in pictures of people wearing the red Hot Cookie underwear...so very SF. I LOVE IT HAHAHA. They also have a bunch of other cookies and treats (like rice krispies and brownies)!! Price is determined by weight

Bottom line: Whether you have a genitalia-shaped food fetish, or you're lookin' for your cookie fix, or you really don't like sweet stuff at all and are just #eatingfortheinsta, Hot Cookie is sure to have something for you. I think I'll be back!! Not sure if I'd get the penis cookie again (kinda really pricy for what it is), but I'd like to try some of the other stuff like the regular cookies--they have super interesting combos!! I think there were some made using cayenne??
author: Kithumini J.

description: Simply off the hook, a must check out when in the Castro.  Don't forget to ask about yesterday cookies for a near free experience!!!
author: Maurice D.

description: This is hyped up because of the penis shaped cookies. It's in the Castro, it's just a cookie to get for kicks and giggles because the cookie taste wasn't to my liking. They only have a dark or white chocolate coat and one type of cookie which is coconut.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: I decided to get the stickiest of cookies, but it was an amazing decision.  I went with the Boy Scout Cookie which has marshmallow, graham cracker, and a chocolate drizzle.....so good! I loved having a soft cookie with the crunch and texture of the graham cracker.  My brother told me that it can get really busy so when we walked by and there were only a few people in line, we capitalized on the opportunity.  I can't imagine trying to make a decision with a bunch of people standing in line behind you so it was nice not having that pressure.  I definitely see myself coming back here on my next visit!
author: Jamie J.

description:
Love this little gem in the Castro! And delicious tasting cookies!

It's a tiny little place, only about 2-3 people can fit inside at once. But there's always people there.

We tried the chocolate macaroon, the hunky monkey (it was ok), and a double fudge chocolate (that one was really good)! 

Try something different each time you visit.

Warning though if you have young kids: there's half naked men photos posted on the walls everywhere and penis shaped cookies on a stick.
author: Monica G.

description: We love the macaroon penis cookies here! Every time I'm in San Fransisco I try to make my way over here just for their cookies!
author: Brittany H.

description: Humorous cookie spot in the Castro district of SF. Wasn't in the mood for the flavor of the funny dick cookie but got a snickerdoodle cookie covered in marshmallows and chocolate drizzle. Cookie was good, right amount of chewy, nice toppings. Staff was friendly and service was good, prices not unreasonable and cookies are a decent size.
author: Heather L.

description:
Damnnnn. These cookies. There are some pretty creative ones and they are all delicious. I stopped by after SoulCycle for a little post workout treat. I picked the Boy Scout cookie and the toffee chocolate chip. I forgo their famous cookie since it's coconut based and I'm not too big on that. Their Boy Scout cookie was basically a s'mores cookie. It was a perfect combo of all textures. It was delicious   The toffee chocolate chip combo has always been a favorite of mine and this one did not disappoint. It was chewy and gooey. 
The service is also quick and friendly which I love since there was always a flow of people coming through this tiny shop. This will definitely be a stop again when I'm in the area and craving a cookie
author: Celia Z.

description:
What is a trip to San Francisco without a swing by Hot Cookie? Albeit, a slight tourist gimmick that plays the Castro's name, I find Hot Cookie's selection of sweet treats to be pretty good.  

COOKIE: You know, that dark chocolate covered cookie. I must say, the cookie was mighty tasty. It wasn't dry at all and the chocolate wasn't overbearing on the cookie. The ratio was just right and it definitely can be split among 2-3 people if you aren't looking to eat too much cookie. There are a lot of choices of sweets, so don't worry. There's something for everybody, even your conservative grandparents can enjoy Hot Cookie. 

SERVICE: A little chilly by the people we saw that day, but nothing out of the ordinary for me. 

For its price and the amount of cookie you get, welcome to the high cost of San Francisco. I usually take friends here if we're around the area and walk around Castro St, but on my own, I don't usually venture just to go to Hot Cookie. What an SF establishment!
author: Albert H.

description:
Who doesn't love a cookie? If you're walking along Castro St, you'll most definitely spot Hot Cookie and their red, neon sign. Get past the underwear hanging in the window and check out their cookie selection. Big as your hand or small 2-bite cookies, they have quite the selection.

We skipped the gimmicky penis cookie and just got a few to try. They were fairly stocked of everything except peanut butter which I wanted to try. Cookies we did get were alright, but I'd recommend for others wanting to get a lot of cookies to share since they charge by weight.
author: Lindsey C.

description:
There's no better way to feed the drunchies than Hot Cookie. Super tiny shop in the Castro that has always has someone in there who is -- very much like you -- living your best life. (Thanks O.)

The cookie selection changes often, but never disappoints. Whatever your taste, you'll have about 3+ options to scratch it.

Cash only.
author: Lauren S.

description:
I'm a fan of the chocolate cayenne cookie! Nice kick at the end and a very chewy cookie!
Perfect snack and a huge cookie!

But the customer service could use some work, they were pretty pushy about deciding on what we wanted already. They also acted like they expected everyone in our group to buy something. It was one of those vibes where they make the customers feel like they should buy something or leave. Not ideal walking into a little place like this where there's a bunch to browse.

I'll be back just for the cookie.
author: Laura Y.

description: I had a great time with the staff and the store decorations. The actual chocolate dipped macaroon was not the best, but the shape of it made it worth it!
author: Christy L.

description: Hunky monkey cookie is super duper good. I feel like they should serve coffee or hot tea or hot milk to go with all these delish! I left 1 star out cuz it's a lil pricey but hey when you're drunk money doesn't matter!!!
author: Ploi S.

description:
Super tiny place with hilariously named cookies. They are huge and priced by the weight (but not overpriced). I'm super fun gay area. Highly recommend getting a cookie on your stroll through the Castro. 

You can stop at the theater for a show (very close by) after! :)
author: Alex M.

description:
Known for their Chocolate Macaroon Penis cookies, but damn.. their Snickerdoodle cookies are to die for! They're warm and melt in your mouth. *drools*

But if you're a first timer, the Penis cookies are a must for that photo op! They're not that bad, just very cocoNUTTY and pretty HARD, but in a good way. ;)

LOL! Just go! The photos inside are a must see and the employees are the nicest!
author: Meliza M.

description: Ok first off, don't take your boss or your grandma here! Walls are full of men, women etc wearing their hot cookie panties and cookies in the shape of penises :) I loved it. It's a small spot so don't expect any seating space but with tons of character and amazing cookies! We tried the chocolate toffee one and m&m one (I forgot the names), the basic bitch (your basic chocolate chip) and of course, I had to have their famous dicks - yes they call them that, and yes they ask you "would you like whip cream on your dick?" My favorite was the toffee, sadly, I didn't really enjoy my dick (it was a coconut macaronish type cookie).... I've had better lol
author: Meryll H.

description: Everyone who wrote bad reviews about the matcha cookie are hard AF critics. I just got the matcha cookie and it exceeded all of my expectations because of all you haters. PLEASE GET THE MATCHA COOKIE if you're a matcha lover. You can definitely taste the strong matcha flavor. You'll thank me later.
author: Hailey P.

description:
making conversation with guys behind the counter while my friend tried it for the first time, I was asked where I am from.  The person getting my friend his festive chocolate dipped macaroon where I was from and I said I'm from Sacramento and he said "I'm sorry".  

Look.  

I know where I'm at, and I know how California is.  If you want to be that way on your personal time that's your business.  But if you want to be that way for customer service you might want to re-evaluate things.  
The whole customer service industry (except for high end) has become like this because of a large generation of people would rather be relaxing at home.... than working.  Kiss my ass.
author: Christopher W.

description: I got a chocolate toffee and a fudge chocolate cookie and both of those cookies were amazing. None of them were warm, but they had the perfect amount of crisp to them. The cookies are huge and they charge by the weight of what you by. The line gets sporadically long but it's definitely worth the wait if you catch it at a bad time.
author: Kalani R.

description:
Hands down the best chocolate chip I have ever had! And I am not big on cookies, so that says a lot... try it if you just can't seem to choose any of the other fun delicious choices...or you are simply a "basic bitch". Basic never tasted so good :) 

P.S. Basic Bitch is the name of the chocolate chip cookie
author: Maria V.

description:
Want a cookie that's a mouthful of flavor, then head on over to the Castro district of San Francisco to Hot Cookie! 
These infamous macaroon d-lights are sure to please coming in assorted shapes and flavors!  No little bite size goodies here, these cookies are a handful in adults only sizes!
Covered in creamy white or milk chocolate,with sprinkles or coconut shavings, with whipped cream or without,  with so many choices it can make it so hard to choose.
No need to worry about getting too messy, these cookies melt in your mouth not in your hands thanks to a little wood...handle for holding! But I'd still take a napkin, you don't want to be caught walking around town with cookie on your face...
If you're not into macaroons they offer several other perhaps less adventurous but just as delicious cookies, bars, rice krispy treats and rum balls too!
Whatever your preference you can't go wrong, they're all so good!
So come over to take care of your hot cookie cravings, the employees are friendly and the experience is very satisfying!
author: Cheryl B.

description:
I wish I could say I had a good experience here...I just wanted a cookie. 
Let me start by saying I didn't know about the underwear when I got there. So that just started out super awkward. I was asked to take a picture with the underwear and when I declined I got told he would pay for my cookies and I could "back that ass up." I declined again, and the more he talked the more offended I got. He then tried to pass it off as as joke but the awkwardness didn't stop so I left. 
I wanted to get out of the situation more than I wanted a cookie. At least it was good diet control. 
I doubt I will ever return as I have never been talked to so rudely or lewdly in my life.
author: Nichole L.

description: It's Different... It's Fun ,, It's Delicious. It's NSFW especially if you are eating the you know what, and what else can I say?.. I know, They have the Best Nuts in San Francisco.
author: Eddie S.

description: My boyfriend and I spent the day roaming around the city and came to here. The title is extremely catchy and the names of their cookies were awesome. The staff were nice and friendly. We enjoyed checking out the pictures on the wall. The cookies were also delicious.
author: Jenn D.

description:
Because... who doesn't love cookies? 

Peanut Chocolate Chip, White Chocolate Macadamia Nut, Toffee Chocolate Chip, Snickerdoodle, brownies... Just delish! 

Open late. And they have punch cards to reward sugar addicts! 

The pics on the walls and the you-know-whats dipped in chocolate are very San Francisco. 

(You may not want to bring your kids here.)
author: Mitzi G.

description: Cookies are not good. You're going for the experience and the wall of photos. Be prepared. ENJOY!
author: Darlene Y.

description:
My roommates brought me here for a birthday cookie. I think they were hoping to surprise me with a chocolate dick shaped cookie (thankfully they were out). Despite knowing this was in the Castro, it didn't dawn on me that they would have phallic cookies, go figure. 

It's a small shop with quite the selection of decently large cookies (and they sell underwear, this didn't surprise me given the wall of photos of half nude people wearing said underwear). My roommates and I all tried different cookies. However, we unanimously agreed the chocolate/cayenne was the best!
author: Tarah P.

description: I friggin love these cookies!! My favorite thing to do is get a few day olds. They have a little white board to the right of the pastry case with all the different types of cookies they have that are a day old; but they're not stale or bad at all!!! They taste just like the ones in the case but they're only a $1 each. Love it
author: Adrienne M.

description:
5 out 5 stars, the yummiest/ naughtiest cookies in the city. 

I'm going to set the scene: it's late, you have been out at the bars in the Castro. You pass this little shop and are hit with a wall of fresh cookie smell, all plans are canceled and all the money is forfeited over to Hot Cookie. Drunk munchies is the killer of all diets and Hot cookie is the supplier. I got a snicker doodle, and penis pop. The snicker doodle was oh so warm and oh so yummy! 

After I scarfed that down I started working on the penis pop, I even got asked to take a picture with a tourist, how cool?! 

The pop was I think coconut, rice crispy and chocolate covered. I remember loving it that's all I can really tell you. The location on this place is amazing I can see it from a block away, or better yet I can see the line from a block away!
author: Nicole K.

description:
This place is hilarious, the pictures on the wall are of people in underwear/lewd outfits with the cookies.

Everything here tastes good, and they carry the penis/venus baked goods.

HOWEVER, I was tricked!! Even though it was still good, the penis cookie is infact NOT a cookie! It is a coconut macaroon! Sad day for me, I still ate it.

The other cookies here are good, and they charge by weight.
author: Elijah B.

description:
I got the oatmeal raisin cookie when I came (yes, I like oatmeal raisin over chocolate chip). 

Despite what the name suggests, the cookies are not hot. I was pretty disappointed as the smell emanating from the shop is intoxicating.  I can't remember how much I paid for the cookie, but it was a solid cookie nonetheless. 

And if you're wondering...yeah, I did buy the underwear (worth!).
author: Lander L.

description: Small hole in the wall. Lines can get long especially at night but it goes by pretty quick. I only tried the penis shaped cookie, and it was actually coconut that was inside of it. I think the whole idea of the shop is great, but the treats aren't top notch. It makes for a good midnight snack.
author: Ami S.

description: Not your average sweet spot but def a fun atmosphere! Yummy cocks and cookies! A fun spot to go with your girlfriends for some gag favors!
author: Joy V.

description:
Expensive and bland.

Bought a chocolate dipped penis cookie with coconut flakes once and it looks better than it tastes.

Skip this joint, unless you really need that picture of the penis cookie.
author: Mabel Y.

description: I had been wanting to try this place so came with a friend on a Friday evening. No line and fast service. I got the chocolate toffee cookie and a small sprinkle sugar cookie. They came out warm which made it even better. Definitely one of the best cookies I've had. I went back to get a couple more to take to my parents' place that evening :) I'd love to try the macaroon penis cookie too haha.. There's no seating area indoors but we took ours to Starbucks around the corner and had some coffee with them. Highly recommended!
author: Pooja C.

description:
My best friend recommended this place and insisted that we had to go while we visited San Fran. The shop is located in the Castro District and it's a bakery that specializes in cookies... some of them penis shaped haha. 

I ended up trying the "basic B*tch" which was of course a chocolate chip cookie. My husband had the "Boy Scout" which was a s'more with real marshmallow chunks topped with chocolate chunks. My favorite was for sure the Boy Scout over the chocolate chip. It was gooey and full of favor, sweet but not terribly sweet.

The staff was very friendly and nice and asked if we wanted our cookies warmed up which we did. It was a nice little treat while we explored San Fran and will totally go back to get some more Boy Scouts haha
author: Laura T.

description:
The treats are slightly on the pricier side as I got 1 fruity pebbles rice Krispy, 1 snickerdoodle cookie, and 2 penis cookies (a white and a dark choc.) for a total of $22. However, the treats are on the larger spectrum as it took me 2-3 days to finish the penis cookie and a few hours to finish the rice Krispy. Prices aren't displayed in-store so check ahead online or ask the person behind the display. 

I loved how home-y the fruity pebbles Rice Krispies and snickerdoodle tasted but was slightly set off with the penis cookies as I didn't know they were basically coconut macaroons. The dark chocolate one was rather really hard (haaaaaa lol) to eat and I had to break it in half with my hands. Otherwise though, these are some pretty decent treats and is as good as it's hyped
author: Trinh V.

description: Excellent cookies! We tried 6 or so over two days and all were amazing. I consider myself a good baker but these were pretty hard to beat!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Wowo!!! Another amazing cookie! Just had the mouth watering brian bar!!! Im now in love with brian!!! Xoxo thanks!!
author: Joshua P.

description: The cookies were not hot, but they were delicious. The staff was friendly and helpful. We liked our butch bar and hunky monkey.
author: Bren C.

description: Hot Cookie is probably my favorite cookie spot in the city. The cookies are absolutely amazing. I've only tried the chocolate chip, but I'm obsessed. I bought twelve cookies for some old co-workers and from what I heard they were a hit so I think it's safe to say that Hot Cookie is killing it on the cookie front. They have a tiny store with music playing outside, and the guys that were working were very helpful in helping me decide which cookies to buy. It's an awesome spot, so make sure to stop by and grab some cookies!
author: Radhika G.

description: Where do I even begin? This place is amazing for anyone who is a little naughty and likes to get their inner chubby kid on. They have the most awesome and original treats! Things can get a little "risqué" while ordering, but it's so much fun and goes with the ambiance!  Cesar (our helper of these delightful treats) was an absolute sweetheart and so funny. Didn't miss a beat!   If you're easily offended just got in and get what you crave, if you're not the faint of heart, stay a few minutes and enjoy the camaraderie with the great staff!!! So happy I got to experience it! Can't wait to go back
author: Kelly A.

description:
Neat little place down in the Castro. I came here thinking I could probably grab some of their raunchy cookies for my roommates, but ended up realizing that it's probably not a good idea to transport chocolate-covered macaroons a few hundred miles. Ya know, melting and stuff.

Instead, I stayed in line for the massive cookies. As a sweets enthusiast, my favorite foods to snack on are anything made fresh and can include more than my recommended serving of sugar. The inside of Hot Cookie on the November afternoon I was there was warm and smelled sweet, the perfect environment to sell cookies to passersby on the street. It seems like they sell their cookies by pound (that's what the weighing scale suggested, at least).

I got two fresh toffee chocolate chip and snickerdoodle cookies, and I certainly didn't regret it. I tried the toffee chocolate chip out of the bag as I was leaving store (take your cookies for a walk, because there's not much standing room in this literal hole in the wall) and it was the perfect warmth and gooeyness. Although the snickerdoodle was consumed a few hours later, it was chewy and sugary, and definitely something I'd go back for.
author: Gwen W.

description: Really good cookie joint on Castro st.  My daughter loves the baby chocolate chip cookies and my wife had the toffee chip cookie.  Nice service and great product.
author: Zen D.

description:
My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place during our first trip to the Castro district and decided it was worth a try. What a *unique* place! 

We walked in and were immediately greeted by 1) pictures all over the wall of people in the "Hot Cookie" underwear and 2) a nice man (with nice nail polish!!) who was willing to talk us through his favorite cookies. We ended up getting one Toffee Milk Chocolate Cookie and one California Chip Cookie (a crisp Almond Coconut thing). Both were pretty big and pretty good, in addition to being pretty well priced. Though we weren't brave enough to try the "Penis and Venus" treats, they were definitely entertaining.
author: Julianna W.

description:
Delicious cookie and phenomenal service! We had the fudgepacker and loved the taste of this fresh made cookie. 

You see them making the cookies right there on sight. There cookie names are fun and will get you into a colorful conversation. Worth a stop!
author: Jarrett R.

description:
Getting past the photos and the phallic-shaped sweets, at heart this place is a chocolate lover's dream.  My only advice, be careful about over ordering.  You're going to come in and see people ordering three, four cookies at a time.  

Slow down, they're probably some sort of professional cookie eaters.  Start with one.  If you're really hungry and willing to share, maybe get two, but don't go crazy.  Take it slow and come back for more after you've awoken from your choco-coma.
author: Denis S.

description: Playful cookie names and solid cookie flavors. If you're craving cookies, this is your place!
author: Susan S.

description: Loved the spicy chocolate cookie!  Honestly, when I saw the red neon lights of " Hot Cookie," I thought it was like Krispy Kreme donuts when you see the red neon lights you RUN for the hot glazed donuts coming out. Ha! Not it! But loved the spicy cookie and great fast service. Go check it out!
author: leimomi k.

description:
You could see it from a mile away. It was long, straight, and standing at attention! 

I'm talking about the line to get into Hot Cookie guys! But in all seriousness, being in the Castro and walking toward this storefront all lit up in red from the neon, I couldn't stop from thinking "Hot Cookie" MUST be some sort of dirty, raunchy, nasty and downright perverted sexual euphemism. And despite asking some friends "in the know" the question, I was assured it was just referring to the decadent and delicious baked goods this shop was selling.

Fudge Packers (chocolate cookies with chocolate chunks), Boy Scouts (chocolate chip cookies topped with melted marshmallow, graham, and chocolate sauce), and also the garden variety chocolate chip can all be found in the case. And while they're all delicious and reason enough to visit, the real fun in this place is in letting your friends know that you've gotten them a Fudge Packer or Boy Scout to enjoy at home! 

If that's not enough, there are penises in the case that you can put in your mouth. Selfies are encouraged. If you've never tried one before (I know I hadn't), you might be pleasantly surprised by the coco"nutty" flavor found beneath the white or dark exterior! MMMMM! 

I'm talking about penis cakes yo! Get your mind out of the gutter... Or stay there if that's your thing! 

If you're feeling frisky (which you really should be coming here), the real secret is in the skimpy red undies with the shops name adorned across the crotch. Purchasing a pair of these and modeling them for the camera will earn you both a spot on their wall of smutty shame AND... wait for it... A FREE COOKIE! 

After all the fun we had here, I couldn't stop thinking about the name. As soon as I got home I checked Urban Dictionary. What I found may surprise you! It's not overtly sexual, but if you use your imagination, it can lead you down some paths you may or may not want to be on! (http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=Hot%20Cookie) 

I'll leave that decision up to you, but suggest you make a B Line to the Hot Cookie if you've got a craving for something big, hot, moist and delicious!
author: Michael T.

description: I don't even know what to say!   This place was worth the 2 mile walk from my hotel.  That said I earned my coconut macaroon!   It was delicious and made for a good laugh with my friends when they saw the photo.   Very small location but it's offerings are big.   My partner in crime got an oatmeal raisin cookie that was dry but had good flavor.    We also got a snickerdoodle and it was one of the best cookies I have ever had.
author: Courtney T.

description:
HOT D*MN! 

I don't usually go to cookie shops since I think cookies are pretty iffy desserts/snacks that I shouldn't have to buy from a gourmet shop...but I had to stop by and check out the genital macaron filled items! 

TBH, I think the genitals are a tourist trap. You come in, and you realize that it doesn't look as appetizing (go figure?) as the cookies and brownies here. 

Small store front, waited in line for about 10 minutes. You can't miss this spot! It's next to the Jane Warner Plaza, if you're wondering. Huge red sign too!

I ordered:
-1 oatmeal chocolate chip with walnuts (~$3.25)// HMMM. It looks better than it tastes. A bit too overcooked, since it was extremely dry on the outside. However, I like that it's not overpowering of oats and good amount of chocolate chips.

-1 Sticky Nikki (~$3.25) // One of their two new cookie concoctions. Sea salt caramel with chocolate cookie dough is the best way to describe this! Highly recommend! I love how its sweet, salty and the perfect texture. Can't get enough of this!

Pros:
+Great service! Super friendly staff. 
+Good selection of cookies! Can I have them all?!
+Standard prices. I mean, its like getting 2 scoops of ice cream for around $6-$7 too, right? 

Cons:
-Some type of menu on the window would be helpful. Felt rushed in picking out my cookie since there was a line behind us and I didn't see the selection until I got to the front. 

Tips/Observations:
-Stamp card available! Buy 12 get 1 free!
-They "weigh" the cookies to charge you. Is it $1 per 100 grams? No idea still...

Overall, I'm mad that I finished that Sticky Nikki...because I need more in my life!
author: Hurjane V.

description:
Tiny store
Got the penis rainbow sprinkled cookie (special for pride week) 
Heavy..had to be like 2 pounds
Regret not getting a second
Cashier couldnt care less about me. Whatever made a good cookie thats all i care about.
author: Song K.

description: Best place ever, they have the best cookies! I wish they had a bigger store so they could serve more customers! Everything is always good here
author: Trevor R.

description:
I absolutely love stopping here as I am passing through Castro!

The Cookies are all fresh as well as delicious!

What is bringing me here to yelp to write this review is the service I received. 

On Sunday, I stopped in for a cookie and left without my wallet. I had 20$ in it as well as my I.D, Debit Card and Clipper Card. I did not know I had lost it until I received a call from my co worker that one of the hot cookie employees walked all over to my place of employment to drop it off for me.

I do not know his name, I do know he was working in the evening on Sunday. 

In addition to that, Vanessa had reached out to me on Facebook to notify me that I had left it behind. 

I am so grateful to have such honest employees here in the neighborhood. 

Thank you for being good hearted people!

We need more like the two of you. :)
author: Aaron Z.

description:
Came here for the novelty and a fun Instagram photo...walked away with an amazing macaroon cookie that just happens to be in the shape of a penis.

I'm not even a fan of coconut and yet I loved the cookie. It was not overly sweet and the coconut flavor was not overpowering. The clerk, who I wish were a tad friendlier, asked if I wanted cream on the tip but I worried it would be too messy since I was taking it to go. Next time I'll plan to eat it on the spot and will ask for extra cream on the tip!

Hot Cookie is located in the Castro district, which is one of the first gay neighborhoods in the United States and according to Wikipedia, remains one of the most prominent symbols of lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT) activism and events in the world. It was quite apparent with the abundance of rainbow flags hanging everywhere. I'd say the it's like the West Hollywood of the LA area and Capitol Hill of the Seattle area. #lovewins
author: Angela C.

description:
Another spot to indulge my sweet tooth ... Oh no. My boyfriend and I came to Hot Cookie after a night out in Castro with our friends. When we walked past and saw the plethora of cookies and sweets, we couldn't resist. And to top it off, I got my boyfriend to eat a penis shaped chocolate-covered coconut macaroon. Priceless. 

Although they're infamous for their male and female genitalia shaped treats, we also tried their amazing looking cookies. We decided on one that had marshmallows, chocolate, and it was sticky, gooey, sweet goodness. Their cookies have that perfect outer crunch while the inside of the cookie is soft and gooey. The shop it TINY but their display case was full and abundant. The staff are awesome and super fun. It's a little pricey - we paid $11 for one cookie and one penis shaped macaroon. But the experience alone was worth it.
author: Courtney P.

description:
I have to actively avoid Hot Cookie because I would gain 20 pounds in a week if I walked in every time I craved it. It's so good - too good. My guilty pleasure, for sure.

Hot Cookie is most well known for their penis cookies, but I go for the classic chocolate chip (jumbo size, please!). It is perfectly baked, soft and chewy but with enough crisp. Im not a cookie connoisseur but I've gotten cookies elsewhere that would have uneven baking or burnt edges. I've never had an overcooked or undercooked cookie here. They're always perfect.

Why do you do this to me, Hot Cookie?!

My favorite cookie of all time is their toffee chocolate chip. That cookie is a drug, I swear. They don't always have it but when they do I highly suggest trying it! I ate one in 3 minutes and then went back in for another one to save for "later" - I intended later to mean "in a few hours" but it just became "in a few minutes".

Anyway, bottom line - come to see some funny penis cookies. Eat them too, they're delicious. But don't sleep on the chocolate chip or toffee!
author: Rachel F.

description:
This place is good but not life-changing spectacular. However, I love bringing friends here for the experience. If you haven't heard already, this place sells the infamous penis macaroon cookie. It makes for funny photos, memories and laughs. And the cookie itself is quite good. 

Toffee Milk Chocolate is my favorite. I love soft and chewy cookies so this is perfect. I also occasionally get the day old cookies (cause they're cheaper) to sample new flavors and know what to get next time. 

The decor here is interesting (very Castro) but the shop is kind of small. It fits a few people at a time, so you'll most likely have to wait outside.
author: Melinda L.

description: Seriously the best cookie and brownies we've ever had. And the service was phenomenal. Would definitely recommend to everyone
author: Marisol S.

description: I originally came out to hot cookie to try there dicks cookie but they were all sold out :( I ended up trying there coconut macaroons instead and that was so good! I will definitely be back to try there dick cookie soon
author: Michelle M.

description: What a cool place!..Penis cookies galore. I had a chocolate one. It was a tasty macaroon..perfectly chewy with just enough sweetness. It took me about 2 days to eat it lol, but I thoroughly enjoyed it anyhow! This place is certainly worth a visit.
author: Alexis J.

description: Taking a pic with a chocolate macaroon shaped Iike a big dick is a must when in Castro District. My friends and I enjoyed Hot Cookie. I enjoyed it a little too much and left my credit card there.  They are not very good about answering their phone is my only gripe! I called and left messages about 3 times. I went back and they had my card.  I also picked up 3 more white chocolate dick cookies to bring home and my friends loved it!
author: Cara H.

description: The guy that helped us was super friendly and patient on giving us time to decide what we would be getting. He was even kind enough to provide us with some samples. Their brownies were my favorite! Must try!
author: Jennifer N.

description:
First Time I've been here.  Never been to San Fran and we decided to head to the Castro District to go clubbing.

Our first stop on my birthday weekend outing was Hot Cookie.  My sister's friend kept mentioning this place.

It's a hole I'm the wall. Literally only three people fit at the front where you order. The person taking your order is really nice. 

They have a wide variety of cookies and different flavors. I picked the cookie they are famous for. Their man part macaroon cookie.  They have it in white chocolate & milk chocolate.  They ask you if you'd like whip cream on the tip of the cookie. 

This tiny place gets a long line of customers. 
It's so worth it to come here on your visit to San Francisco.
author: Maria C.

description: Cookies that come in all shapes and sizes. Try their penis on a stick! Good, but nothing spectacular. Tip: Avoid going here on the weekend. There are no lines during the weekday evenings.
author: Steven W.

description:
Finally tried the penis cookie! It's not an actual cookie, but a macaroon! (The coconut American kind, not the French kind)

I chose the black penis because well..

It's covered in chocolate and the macaroon is crispy at the tip and soft on the inside :)

8 bucks for the black macaroon shaped cock
author: Andy H.

description: I really wanted to like this place. I got the chocolate cayenne cookie. It was not soft nor warm. I read reviews and saw that the cookies tend to be crunchy on the outer parts and soft on the inner portion. Unfortunately, this was just hard throughout. It seems as though they were baked too long. The flavor was spot on though. The cayenne had a cool kick. But the texture was so off putting that I couldn't even finish the cookie. Maybe I just had back luck and caught a bad batch.
author: Lexi R.

description: Cookie shaped dicks. What an enjoyable way to eat the cookie walking around in public with a gigantic penis shaped cookie in your mouth. Lol. Found this place through google I just searched best dessert places in San Francisco. This caught my attention because of the penis shaped cookie. I care more about looks for dessert than taste that my preference. However, taste really matter when it's your actual meal of the day. Other than that, dessert is just a bonus lol.
author: Ace A.

description: I've been here at least three times. The chocolate covered coconut macaroon and chocolate chip cookie are amazing. I love the names for their items - great sense of humor with a sexual twist. The penis shaped macaroon is bit high priced so I get their lower priced items, which are around the $4 range. The place is really small so be prepared to order. The staff is always friendly and patient even with the long lines.
author: Rachel S.

description: So much better now that they switched owners....the cookies were too hard before, now they have better flavors and are the perfect softness the way a cookie should be....I get the day olds and they taste great...
author: John H.

description: Apparently, if you don't want to wait in line for a cookie you can yell out your price and get what you want!   Doesn't seem to hold the spirit of n egalitarian business environment, no?  #boycotthottcookie
author: Vincent P.

description:
This place is awesome. There are pictures of people on the wall eating a hot cookie while wearing the underwear. I also saw a Britney Spears look alike in one of the pictures. 

So I bought a mini size chocolate chip cookie for myself. I had two bites then walked back to my bicycle. I was juggling my phone, cookie and sprite and I dropped the cookie. Boo :(
author: Lydia N.

description:
Ooooooo, hot...hot cookie. The oh so infamous place for that particular shaped manhood cookie. Hehe. 

It was a sight to behold. Such girth, sweetness, wideness, moisture, sprinkled with delicious fuzzies.

There were many different varieties and sizes of cookies on display. I also saw the cookie shaped like the woman's body parts aka Venus. Kind of cute with coconut flakes covering the boobies and undie area. Feels like a small shop inside since it had just enough space to step inside, browse, pay then leave.

I liked that taste of the item I choose. See pictures. LOL. Chocolate covered macaroon with dried coconut flakes covering the balls area. Sweet and moist was good with me. Thanks to my friend bringing me here or else I'd be too shy going here alone & had to ask her to hold it so I could take pictures of it. It's a good size snack to fill you up. And they place it in a small bag to take it togo.

Noticed ladies and men like it. Well, it is located in the Castro District...
author: Andrea S.

description: So good!!! I had their white chocolate and rainbow sprinkled penis cookie. It was a coconut macaroon underneath and it was delicious. I've been here twice and they have not disappointed me yet. Yum!
author: Michaela C.

description:
Definitely interesting place to check out especially all the photos on the wall. The cookies here are really great and a HUGE serving size! Service was super friendly and awesome. There's no place to sit down at so you'll have to take the cookies to go.

I loved the peanut butter chocolate cookie the most! The snickerdoodle, toffee chocolate, and white chocolate macadamia were all really great too. It came out to about $20 for 6 cookies so prices were pretty reasonable.
author: Linda X.

description:
Did they stop making the Chocolate Rum Balls?  My only guess as to why they may have stopped was maybe they were cited for serving alcohol without checking IDs?  No joke, those things packed a punch.  When I came here a couple weeks ago, the cashier had never even heard of a Rum Ball before so that makes me think either he doesn't friggin give a heck about their inventory, or they stopped making them.  

Please advise at your earliest convenience.  In the meantime, all of their cookies are to die, you seriously can't go wrong.  I wish they would make a chocolate chip with walnuts instead of pecans.  Their brownies are more sexual than the penis cookies, even while not being cut in a phallic shape.
author: Emma H.

description: This place was super cool. Loved how it fit in with the neighborhood vibes. Unfortunately the only vegan cookie is a super small ginger snap. It was tasty, but I wish there were more options!
author: Emily H.

description:
Delicious, homemade, melt in your mouth cookies. And they're open late! 

Recommend: the classic chocolate chip, chocolate chip and toffee, butch bar 

Skip: the snicker doodle just doesn't do it for me.
author: Leeyen R.

description:
Most tasty cookie in the Castro. 

It was amazing and we loved the amazing shapes. Closes to the real thing!
author: John D.

description:
A crappy cookie from a four star joint? Whoops. What did I do wrong, folks... I ask you? Seriously. Hit me. 

I love the idea. I love all the photos of people in underwear inside. I love how nice the people working there are, and I love the crowd coming in for cookies. I love the idea of penis shaped cookies. So did I order wrong? I came in at nine thirty and got the last cayenne chocolate cookie. 

I should have gotten the penis cookie. Maybe this review would have had a happy ending then. The cayenne cookie was dry. Dense. Not crunchy, except the bites around the edges. Not sure, but perhaps this was due to it being the last one, or perhaps it just sat around for a long time? Or maybe it should have come out of the oven two minutes sooner. 

Of course, I'd still be confused because the cookies are not literally hot. As in, they are not warm. I get it... The name is a pun... But I really expected, also, an actually hot cookie. Because those are melt-in-my-mouth delicious with gooey chocolate that gets messy all over my fingers. That's love, baby. 

I bought underwear for myself because why the hell not, and hot cookie, if you're reading this, what if you have the baking times posted somewhere so folks could plan to come when they're warm and delicious and straight out of the oven?
author: Tina S.

description: Visited SF with my BF and his sister took us to this cute little spot. I HAVE NEVER SEEN ANYTHING LIKE IT! But WHY are they so good! We got the Penis and Venus Macaroon filled chocolate and I was extremely hyper for the rest of the day! I love SF because everything is (almost) walking distance. It's definitely too inconvenient to drive around because there isn't parking anywhere! Definitely recommend this place! I'll be visiting once again when I come back to SF!
author: Tiffany N.

description: This place is iconic. It's an SF cookie treasure joint and Castro's most recognizable foodie joint. Hot Cookie is straight comedy. The naughty pics on the walls, the human sexual-organ shaped cookies, the friendly service, is all what makes this place. It's very unique. The cookies are whatever tasting but they tastes really good. Nothing too crazy about them but they are yummy and good priced. This is a great place to go after being drunk or being possibly high lol. It's all good times here. Have fun!
author: Allister D.

description: Penis shaped macaron was surprisingly good! So happy I got to stop by before I leave sf for two years. At eight dollars a pop, I would definitely share it with two to three people. Don't forget to snap a bunch of pics before you do!
author: Vanessa K.

description: Today I arrived in San Francisco and after checking into my hotel decided to take a stroll in the Castro. Sometimes the simplest things can make your day and running across Hot Cookie was exactly one of those finds. A small cookie store with such a wide assortment of some of the best cookies I've ever had. My favorite was the Coca Cayenne Cookie, the Cookie with a surprising spicy bite at the end. The Toffee Chocolate Chip was amazing as were the rice crispy treats. All the cookies are traditional cookies with the most incredible twists to them that Tony the owner has created in this landmark cookie shop over the past 20 years. Tony knows how to make his tasty treats Sweet & Sexy! Definitely check it out! It'll be love at first bite!
author: David M.

description:
This place has the best cookies in the city, and their customer service is great too! 

I ordered some cookies and milk to be delivered to my daughter at work for her birthday. The courier was unaware of the recipient's name so the goods were dropped off at her office for general consumption. I'm sure no one in the office had a problem with cookies mysteriously showing up in the middle of the workday. However, the point was to surprise my daughter for her birthday, but since she was not made aware that the cookies were for her, she merely joined in on the communal cookie nibble.

When I didn't hear from my daughter about the cookies, I asked if any had shown up at work. She told me what had transpired so I emailed the company to suggest that their couriers know the recipient's name in the future to avoid this problem. Someone got back to me right away and offered to deliver replacement cookies and milk today! Yay!
author: Trixie S.

description: We didn't realize we would be stopping here but a cookie sounded great. Everyone out of our group of six was happy with their picks. I had a cookie with some pretzels in it and I loved it!
author: Conor S.

description:
What's a trip to the Castro without scoping out some hot guys and delicious cookies from Hot Cookie?? I finally had the chance to stop by to check out their famous goodies, and I wasn't disappointed. We came after dinner at Nomica, and there was only a short line around 9pm on a Friday night. We tried:

-Peanut Butter: Definitely the favorite out the bunch, and one of the better peanut butter cookies I've had in a while! It was super chewy and had great peanut butter flavor- a must order for any peanut butter lover!
-The Penis (Coconut Macaroon Covered in Chocolate): This was actually really good, if you like coconut macaroons. The macaroon was nice and chewy, and very coconutty. The dark chocolate also helped to cut the sweetness. Recommended, although this was pricey, but also large enough to share between a few people.
-Toffee Milk Chocolate Cookie: This cookie was nice and chewy, but it was a bit too sweet for me. I liked the toffee bits, but I probably wouldn't get this again.
-Fudge Packer: This is like a double chocolate chocolate chip cookie, and it was way too chocolate-y for me. It still had a great chewy consistency, but I wouldn't get this again.

I definitely spent a lot more money than I intended here, but I love chewy cookies so will definitely be back in the future! Parking can be difficult to find on a Friday night in the Castro, but there is a decent amount of street parking spots available.
author: Amy D.

description: Lavanna (sp?) will warm your heart, soul, and your tummies. Have her hand these beautiful and tasty treats and your day will be brighter in every way possible.
author: Anjo C.

description:
I'm a cookie guy, and the cookies didn't disappoint!

We stopped by for the experience, and it was a fun one.  I hadn't heard of the place before, but it was worth the visit.  Penis shaped cookies, fun pictures on the wall, it's a definite dessert stop when in San Francisco!
author: Chad D.

description: Got the fudge packer and chocolate dipped Rice Krispie both were pretty good, yes they have naughty cookies here and they're cool to look at I just wasn't drunk enough to buy one lol.
author: Tony D.

description: I dragged my friends here with me just after midnight on New Years Eve, and I'm so happy we stopped by! I've always wanted to go inside, and I was so excited to try the cookies! We were greeted and helped out by Lavana (at least I believe that was her name!) and she was so helpful, kind, and friendly! I would go back just for that amazing service! We tried so many cookies and brownies - the group favorite was the cayenne chocolate cookie, and the peanut butter brownie! So bomb, definitely will return. Thank you so much !!
author: Rachel N.

description:
My friend was so excited about Hot Cookie and took me here!

It's definitely trendy, hip and dirty...and if you're a big fan of cookies, you'll definitely enjoy it! I tried a whole bunch of different cookies. Some of them were baked fresh out of the oven, while others have been sitting out for a bit. They were definitely fresh, sweet, gooey and delightful.

The place is small and there's a bunch of erotic photos on the wall as well as phallic shapes macaroons.
