I'm not a cookie connoisseur by any stretch of the imagination...I thought the cookies were tasty, but don't have much to say about them. Definitely worth a stop in, even if just for the novelty...
author: Alex L.

description:
You see there is a long line and so you join to try their cookies.

When you get to the counter and look to see the type of cookies they sell your eyes are quickly diverted to cookie choices in the shape of various penises.  After getting over the shock you end up having a choice of about ten different non-penis shaped cookies for three bucks each.
We got home and heated them up and they were tasty but far from the best cookies I have had.

The crazy experience and long line and friendly staff gets them a four.

Maybe the genital shaped treats would have been tastier.

I would give this place another shot when the line is shorter.
author: Paul W.

description: Love the cookies here, never disappointed and the staff is always friendly. Don't shy away from the male anatomy cookie, it's delicious.
author: Sarah T.

description:
I've been here a few times and have always ordered the snickerdoodle.  It's absolutely delicious! It's completely moist, sweet and delicious.  It's actually the only cookie I've every ordered here, but it's so good that I can never bring myself to change.  I'd always figured that the penis cookies were pretty overrated and touristy, but the other day, I brought some friends from abroad around the Castro and we stopped by Hot Cookie.  Since I was trying to show off the Bay Area and San Francisco, I figured I'd better order one.  It was pretty fun.  I love macaroons, but the one that made this penis cookie was a little dry.  Coconut macaroons are my favorite thing to bake, so maybe I'm just partial to my own, but it definitely could have been  more moist.  Oh well though, I don't regret it!

Pros: Delicious cookies, quick moving line, and, with regards to the penis cookie: it's a whole lot of fun!

cons: kind of pricey, especially for the penis cookie.  It's $8, which I was ok with while showing friends around, but it's also a pretty dry cookie and it'd be a hard cost to justify a second time.

too bad I'm not hot enough to share a photo of myself in the underwear . . . YET  But I'll get there! 

Yay Hot Cookie!
author: Kevin K.

description:
Sometimes you're whiskey drunk and walking down the street and suddenly discover a store peddling junk-shaped cookies. What's a boy in the Castro to do? If you're like certain people who will remain unnamed, you end up buying underwear from them and agreeing to pose on the sidewalk in your new skivvies for a free cookie. Dignity has a price. We're talking $4 here, people...

OK, not all of the cookies are quite so phallic, but from my taste-test, they're all damn delicious! I most recommend the Boy Scout, which seems to be a mix between a chocolate chip cookie and a s'more. Just ridiculously good.

The staff is friendly, even though I'm sure they deal with a ton of obnoxious humans on a daily basis. The cookies are delicious, the line moves quickly,  and the underpants run REALLY small. 

Enjoy.
author: Matt E.

description:
White chocolate macadamia
White chololate cranberry
Chocolate chip

MY FAV!
Best cookies in SF!
They actually got me to come here 3 days in a row.
Maybe tomorrow is the 4th.
author: Candice L.

description: Ok, $8 for the penis cookie was not tooo worth it, but the guy who served me was pretty funny. And I thought I could keep a straight face throughout the whole thing, asking for a penis cookie and all. Then he asks "do you want whipped cream on your dick?" And I just couldn't keep my cool, especially after we left when he said, "enjoy your dick!" I'm sure he's prepared for when all the foodies come and ask for this popular item, but it was still funny. The cookie is a coconut macaron and it was pretty good considering I'm not a fan of coconut.
author: Lilian K.

description:
As nelly would say, IT'S GETTING HOT IN HERE. And that's what you'll be saying when you take three steps into the store (that's really about how far it goes in cause it's small) and you see the wall covered of photos of people in hot undies. I mean in Hot Cookie undies. Such a perfect wall to go with their provocative cookies that most people come here for. I'm not gonna lie, I drove 50 miles out and parked three blocks down the castro to get some of the D myself. 

I originally came here for the penis cookies, it's true. It wasn't until walking in that I saw they sell boob/vagina cookies as well and that V sold me. I'm not sure if anyone actually researches or asks to even know what the cookies is actually made of, but if you're like me, you just came for a naughty photo with the cookie. The cookie is actually a macaroon cookie, macarOOn as in the coconut kind, not that light, colorful, cream filled one. Personally, I love coconut flavors and macaroons, especially when dipped in chocolate, so this was amazing to me! As for my friends which none of them like coconut or macaroons, they took a bite and didn't like it. Any of their other cookies are actually really delightful, soft, and flavorful from visits I've had. 

Lesson of the story is if you're cool with coconuts then you'll be into deez chocolate covered coconut macaroon nuts. If not, their other cookies are also good, and if you need some suggestions, the classic chocolate chip, toffee chocolate chip, and cocoa cayenne are a few of my favorites!
author: Maleah M.

description:
LOVE ME SOME HOT COOKIE!!! This little tiny shop with the red hot lights HOT COOKIE is inviting and sweet. We always bring home some chocolate chip ,  snicker doodles , Toffee Chip cookies they are great!

I say it's a GREAT COOKIE SHOP ! 

They do charge by the weight of the cookie hmmm how much does that oddly shape cookie weigh ? hehe 

Thanks HOT COOKIE!
author: Michelle M.

description:
When visiting SF, my friends recommended the Big Black Dick chocolate covered macaroon cookie at a cozy bakery in the Castro neighborhood.

The cookie was good, but nothing to write home about. The BBD was a bit stale and difficult to chew. Honestly, the chocolate haystack macaroon at Boudin Bakery proved to be way more scrumptious (and fresher!).
author: Justyna N.

description:
When you visit a new place, you hear about some spots you should definitely go before your trip is over from everyone. Hot Cookie is one of those places that people tell you go in SF. why are they so famous and popular? Because of the unique cookies that they sell... Especially, the ones called "Penis" and "Venus" cookies. I had such high expectations, from all the reviews and what I have heard, but at the end, it was a chocolate covered coconut macaroon, nothing that special (other than the shape, of course). 

The other cookies they sell are pretty nice, but overall, I feel that they are a bit overpriced (the price is based on the weight). The penis cookie came out to be about $7.50, and a cookie to be about $3. more than 10 for 2 cookies... 

It still is a fun place to visit, and they offer "yesterday's cookies" for 95 cents, what a steal!
author: June S.

description:
Believe it or not, I've been here 3 times and never once gotten a cookie in the shape of a dick... which if you knew me you'd know how highly out of character that is. 

If I could have all my food in the shape of a dick**, I would. It's a funny shape and I'm a gal who likes to laugh. Simple as that... and don't even act like you've never pretended a popsicle or other phallic food was a D for a laugh because everyone has done it. EVERYONE. Even Mother Teresa at some point was like... "anyone wanna watch me eat this banana?," I guarantee. 

The most popular item here is the chocolate penis and nut sack cookie, but just know that they do sometimes sell out, so get 'em while they're hot. 

My girl surprised me with a cookie crumble thing loaded with berries that probably wouldn't have been my first choice (dick cookie, obvi) but it was ridic delicious and the perfect snack for our beachside fitness hike. I actually liked it better than any of the other cookies I've had here, even though this cookie was smaller than their typical almost frisbee-sized cookies. 

The place is tiny and piece of Castro history. Learned today that Cleve Jones used to work here for a hot minute before it was called Hot Cookie. He and I highly recommend stopping in to chat with the owners and check out all the Hot Cookie underwear pics on the wall. Hubba hubba.

Go forth and eat a D. 

**note- not an actual dick. keep that sh*t to yourself.
author: Candice G.

description:
The penis cookie here is infamous. It's chocolate covered coconut. You can add whipped cream on top. Honestly, I wasn't so impressed by this because it was really dry and overly sweet. BUT I am totally willing to come back to try their regular cookies next time!

-Kristen

The penis cookie wasn't that tasty. One bite was okay but after that I started to get sick of it. :( it is huge in a size though ;)

-Edmund

2 stars from Edmund. 2 stars from Kristen.
author: Kristen L.

description: Really neat place! Super small with only standing room to order and to get in & get out. So many different cookies to choose from and they're ginormous! I got the penis cookie for 8 buckeroonis and it was huge. Very coco-nutty (ha ha ha *cricket noise) but I didn't even finish it because it was too much. Probably won't go back just because I'm not a huuuge cookie fanatic, just wanted to see what the penis cookie was like! Try it once if you haven't been!
author: Amy T.

description: A must go place when visiting the Castro! Pricey but worth it! I also enjoyed looking at all the photos covering the wall, as well as taking a picture directly out front with the Castro sign in view.
author: Kelly M.

description:
Most delicious penis you'll ever have in your life - literally.

This bakery makes gourmet cookies that are perfectly chewy, chunky, and hearty inside and out. We got almond flavored, caramel pretzel stick flavored, chocolate chunks on chocolate, snickerdoodle, and these delicious peanut butter fudge bars.

But the main event? Dun dun dunnnn - those dark chocolate covered penis-shaped cookies on popsicle sticks with macaroon cookie on the inside. And WOW! I thought the were just for kicks but they're easily the best macaroon cookies I've ever had. The coconut flakes are toasted to a crisp on the outside before they dip them in chocolate. The inside is chewy and just so delicious! Even more delicious that they're big and black.

I can see this being the go-to spot to pick up some bachelorette/bachelor/birthday party favors, gifts, etc. Hey those chunky, thick cookies can be for kids' birthdays or for your grandma. Just be sure to pick yourself up a penis cookie to indulge in.

I got one for my sister before she left for NY so she'd have a nice little treat on her long flight. But she was kind enough to chop it up to share with our parents. She definitely made sure to chop them up first haha.
author: Ivy C.

description:
For anyone who doubts the existence of heaven...

You obviously haven't been to Hot Cookie.

Hot cookies of all kinds can be found here. All. Kinds.

Every time I've stopped by on my way to the comic book shop, or whatever other tomfoolery I'm getting up to in the Castro, cookies have been hot, fresh, gooey deliciousness.

Mouth watering pleasures abound. 

Love you Hot Cookie!

Most passionately,

A Kinsey 3 from Sacramento
author: Jenny P.

description:
If you love cookies, this is definitely a must-go-to for you!

Note that there's no seating space here so you just have to order and eat the cookie around.

What's interesting is when you walk in the tiny store, you get to see tons of people wearing their hot cookie underwear plastered on the wall.

What's even more interesting is that they have cookies in a shape of a penis, haha!
author: Aj C.

description:
Oh Hot Cookie, if there was ever a cookie shop that stood out the most to me, this would be the clear winner in flavor and uniqueness!

An icon in the Castro District, this tiny shop draws all kinds of passersby in with their big red sign, fun Hot Cookie brand underwear hanging from the ceiling, and of course the sweet smell of their actual products!

The store itself is literally just the glass display in the front with space for about 4 or 5 people to look in at a time, but the place is so decorated and the employees are all very friendly and helpful that you can't resist sticking your head in (innuendo?) haha. 

Overall, if you're ever in the Castro or are taking the MUNI Metro right across from it, stop in, say hi,  and see not only their famous penis and venus cookies, but also their other flavorfully fresh and crisp cookies! :)
author: Kyrie S.

description:
After leaving the bar with a tummy full of rum, the night should finish with something sweet. But what's open at 1am and not Jack in the Box? Hot Cookie! It's in the Castro and the ambiance is so fun when you walk in. The cookies are enormous and cleverly named. For example the chocolate-chocolate chip is called "the Fudgepacker". They all taste amazing! The have Dicks on a stick, huge rice crispy treats, and chocolate covered brownies on a stick. 

The walls are covered in a collage of pictures customers have brought in of them wearing the Hot Cookie underwear that is for purchase. It's pretty entertaining.
author: Leti G.

description: Cookies are chunky which is nice but it's too sweet for me. Just okay for a $3 cookie.
author: Ya-Chu C.

description: The cookies were just okay. The matcha cookie didn't have much of a matcha flavor. The store was tiny and looked dirty and the staff wasn't too friendly. I would go back to show a friend from out of town, but other than that I wouldn't head back.
author: P M.

description: Best cookies ever! The Snickerdoodle and Cocoa Cayenne are my favorites. If you're in the Castro, you have to stop and get a cookie! Great staff, delicious cookies and pictures of people wearing nothing but undies on the walls. What more can you ask for?!
author: Aimee T.

description:
Great place to stop in for a cookie fix before or after a movie at the Castro Theatre. 

The cookies are hearty, but not too heavy.  I got the Hunky Monkey (banana chocolate chip with nuts a dusting of sugar; it's also gluten-free apparently), the Basic Bitch (regular chocolate chip) and the Pecan Chip.  I thought all the cookies were good, but I think I liked the Hunky Monkey best; it was super light and tasty, and not too banana-y. Cookie names are witty and fun.

You pay by weight and I would say pricing is about average. Counter service has always been friendly and fast.
author: Kristina D.

description: So Fantastic!! It's tiny and cozy and delicious! One of the highlights of our weekend and we will absolutely go back! You can't beat the quality cookies, hunky bakers and tiny red undies for sale!! (We bought some!)
author: Tommie S.

description: What a fun experience! I came here at the suggestion of several friends. I brought my 18-year-old son to experience hot cookie in San Francisco as well. He opted for the photograph and underwear deal which netted me a very delicious cookie on a stick covered in chocolate. I believe it was a coconut macaroon shaped in a very unusual shape for a cookie. Regardless, the cookie itself was absolutely fantastic and lasted me two days! Each bite just as good as the previous. The cookies were delicious and fresh. The service was great, accommodating, encouraging and fun. And somewhere on the walls you'll find a picture of my sweet child. Have fun. Definitely not for overly religious, closed minded or those who are easily offended by the human body. Don't ask why that has anything to do with a cookie store. Go. Enjoy.
author: Amber S.

description:
Food:  COOOOOOKIES!!!!!  In ranking order of what I like...

-Fudge Packer - Yeah I know...don't let the name deceive you.  It's really a tasty and chocolaty of course.  Don't forget those chocolate chunks.  YUM.
-Snickerdoodle - A very flavorful and above all else...MOIST...version of this cookie.
-Pecan Chip - Definitely a solid Chocolate Chip Cookie here.

Service: Always a friendly bunch here.  

Ambiance: Well it's a take out place...so no where to sit.

Overall:  Everytime I'm in the castro...you will automatically know that I will be making a stop here.
author: Spencer Q.

description: Hot Cookie? How 'bout NOT Cookie.  Waaaay too much sugar. Every cookie tastes like it has 75% marshmallow. For a store that specializes in cookies, they should understand that the flour and butter create the extraordinary sensation... not the sugar. Sugar is low priority. TOO MUCH SUGAR!!!
author: Anne S.

description:
Date:  6/1/2015   Time:  2:50 PM    70°  sunny and warm

One of my fellow yelpers asked me a few days ago what business was I going to mention for my 600th review. At the time he asked me, I really didn't give it much thought until late Saturday evening.  

Who received the honor of my 600th review? Well, none other than Hot Cookie in the Castro District. This was a trek, catching a ferry across the bay to SF aka Baghdad by the Bay to hook up with the F Muni to the last stop - 17th & Market Streets - and return. 

As I ventured up Market Street, I couldn't help but think who's hotter - Hot Cookie, the business, or Hot Cookie of Empire? Both Hot Cookies are bad asses in a good way...lol. Then, there is the bold attitude exuding from both Hot Cookie and Ms. Cookie of Empire fame. There's nothing wrong being a fan of the two COOKIES. (In its own way, Hot Cookie has its style. Ms. Cookie has class, sass, style and she is one smart, tough cookie.)

Hot Cookie is a small cookie shop with an assortment of cookies (oatmeal raisin, chocolate chip, white chocolate macadamia, snickerdoodke, pokies, etc.) and some naughty, naughty cookies. I had to compose myself from giggling and/or laughing at the tray of chocolate covered penis cookies. The cookie looked about 5" long and I kinda wondered why they were chocolate covered instead of vanilla or lemon covered cookie? It's gotta be the flava of chocolate...lol. The bottom of the cookie was decorated with shredded coconut. Ooh boy...is it getting hot in here or what? It's 70° outside and it was probably more than 70° inside this small cookie store. I must've been hot and bothered eyeing the naughty cookie (wink, wink). Well, to the side of the cookie counter was a self-serve refrigerated case filled with cool beverages. I decided to forego the soda and juices. 

I kept it clean and bought three cookies (oatmeal raisin, chocolate chip and a pokie, which is an M&M cookie). I enjoyed the cookies that I bought, which cost $8.50. Darn it; they were out of my favorite cookie, the snickerdoodle. It's okay because I left out of Hot Cookie content and did a little snickering...hee hee (like Michael Jackson) and headed back to the bus stop in perfect timing for my bus ride to the Union Square/Westfield Shopping area.

Somewhere down the long road to the future, I will return to Hot Cookie for more giggles and laughter, and, of course, my snickerdoodle cookie.
author: Carol C.

description:
I didn't expect the penis cookie to taste like coconut.

$7.50 in this tiny cookie shop gets you a long, chocolate-dipped, penis-shaped macaroon (not macaron). Despite the price tag, the cookie is pretty good, and you get 3 stamps on your stamp card for this gargantuan thing.

It's an SF thing.
author: Adele F.

description:
A dessert landmark for the Castro that will stir up some conversations based on the phallic treats that they are known for. I'd forego the shock factor treats and steer towards the actual cookies, as they provide a hot and delicious experience for your taste buds. 

My go to cookies of choice are the white chocolate macadamia and (ultimate pick) is the toffee chocolate. I appreciate the nice gooey, soft texture of the middle and nice firm crisp on the edges. 

Whether it's for a late night snack or something to indulge in, this is a great treat to pick up if you're passing through the neighborhood!
author: Vincent L.

description: SO OVERPRICED and the penis cookies taste like penis. They have a coconut filling I did not like. Would never go back or reccomend. At least I got the cool picture though
author: Simon R.

description: A bit pricey, but if you are in the area it's a fun place to check out. Don't forget to get your bodily shaped cookies dipped and finished off with whip cream! The cookie was actually really good, not too sweet and moist even though we finished our cookies the following day.
author: Karen U.

description:
Hot Cookie is small, like really small. You basically order and get out or else you'll be in everybody's way. 

I'm not the biggest fan of overly sweet sweets and unfortunately Hot Cookies' cookies are extremely sweet to me. 

I've tried their iconic, gigantic penis cookie and I swear it made my cavity fillings hurt....but it made a great funny picture prop! 

They also sell Hot Cookie undies and I actually bought a pair and loved it. They look damn sexy! Hahaha!! 

Do come here if you haven't!
author: Alice X.

description:
The chocolate chip cookie from here was almost as divine as the decor. I can't turn down a good cookie, and Hot Cookie almost makes things too easy with their amazing display of cookies the size of my face. I picked up my cookie towards the end of the night, so I'd love to come back earlier on in the day when they're fresher! 

ps. I would shamelessly order the naughty desserts if calories were of no issue. Who doesn't want to chomp down on a naughty looking, chocolate covered phallic dessert in public?
author: Lisa I.

description: I like to stop by for a cookie when visiting the Castro Theater. I stopped by today and got the cookie with pretzels and caramel. Delicious!
author: Denise C.

description: Every time I come the City I do my pilgrimage to Hot Cookie. They are so dam good! I swear they are addictive. Today I had the chocolate chip/toffee & the white chocolate. If I could think of one reason to move to the City, this place would be it. Sadly. I am back up here in red neck town California but at least I'm only an hour and forty five minutes away
author: Julian B.

description: Hot Cookie is a small store off Castro that should definitely be one of your stops if you're visiting to try one of their delectable sweets. But be warned - some XXX-rated shaped treats should not be seen by or given to children! Yes, I've ordered a penis cookie, but didn't really like the coconut on it though (I'm not a big coconut fan). It's really big and I'd recommend sharing it (and yes, I realize how wrong that sounds). Their cookies are great! I'm a fan of the classic chocolate chip - something in their dough makes it so satisfying. Everything here looks decadent and there's a ton of options to appeal to everyone. Again, the space is small, I think you can have up to five customers inside before the line goes out the door. The side walls are decorated with Polaroids of people in red Hot Cookie underwear to look at (at your own discretion) while you're waiting. A lot of the goods have chocolate, so if that's what you're looking for then Hot Cookie your place!
author: Jamey P.

description: Nice selection of cookies and a friendly staff! Not the greatest cookie ive ever tasted, but definitely a great bite if you're around! Keep in mind that the place although is more suitable for adults due to decorations on the walls :)
author: Daniel G.

description: Love the Cookies here.... first time trying this place. I walked in and the place smelled so good. After i purchased some cookies, i walked out eating one with my mom. After devouring the cookie, i went back and got some more to take home.:)
author: Liz C.

description: Dick cookies are always amazing and a go to. Theirs looked really good but the cake tasted awful. It was tasteless and dry. Should've just been a cookie shaped as a dick instead of the count macaroon filling. Waste of $8.50. Hoped for more.
author: Kerry G.

description: Been here only twice because this place is located in the Castro and it quite the drive out from Sunset district. Parking is also not easy to find around here. Both times I got their famous penis macaroons! Yes, it's exactly what it sounds like: a coconut macaroon (not the French ones) shaped into a penis, covered in dark chocolate, sprinkled with coconut shavings served with a popsicle stick. The first time I came here, they only had the chocolate ones. Last Friday when I came here for the second time, I discovered that they offered a white chocolate one! Decided to stick to the chocolate ones because that was the original. Ordered two of them and couldn't eat them until about 6 hours later. To my surprise, they were still very moist and soft! One penis macaroon was enough for my boyfriend and I to share. It was very filling. Definitely recommend trying if you're in the area!
author: Cynthia T.

description:
my friend and I tried the penis cookie of course and it was soooo good. It's a coconut macaroon covered in chocolate , it was subtly sweet not too overwhelming. It's a good size as well I want to say it's about 6-7 inches for $8.
 If you're ever in the city this place is a must stop. For the cookies and also their staff was super cool and friendly!
author: Natalie G.

description: Some of the best cookies in town. The green haired ethnic goddess named La Bamba is a gem!!
author: Chris H.

description:
I came to get it.  Yeah, you know what it is.  Who doesn't want a penis-shaped cookie that's possibly true to size?

I'm not the biggest fan of macaroons but this one was good, thanks to being covered in chocolate.

After learning we were sharing this hunk of junk, canned whip cream was sprayed all over it before giving it to us.

It's much to handle, I couldn't finish it that night even with my friend taking a few bites.  I wasn't able to get to it till the 3rd day but it was still as good as it was that first night.

They have cookies of other flavors I would have liked to try.  I shall save those for another trip to the Castro.
author: Christine A.

description:
You know, it's impossible for me to not give this spot all 5 stars. Like, what's not to love about phallic shapes desserts in a store adorned with pictures of nearly naked patrons? 

Really though, gimmicks aside they've got some pretty decent snacks. As in, I'd actually go here for the cookies even if they weren't shaped how they are.

It's a super small spot, literally just a hole in the wall with a counter. Kinda like a grab your cookies and run dealio they've got running here. They're open super late at night as well, because who doesn't love some after drinking cookie delights am I right? Definitely gonna be keeping this spot in mind whenever I have some late nights in the Castro!
author: Sean H.

description:
Cookies!

I was very skeptical of a cookie store in the Castro because, well, gays don't eat. Whether they do or not doesn't take away the fact that these cookies are tasty little treats.

The penis cookies and the underwear you can buy there add to the gayness of it all, but take away from the fact that these cookies are good!

The coconut macadamia nut is my absolute favorite. They weigh the cookies so it can get a little pricey but if you go near closing you can find a good deal on some good cookies. I have never had a dry cookie there yet. They may not be hot like their name suggests but they are delicious. Let all the gays stay at the bars, I'll be at hot cookie getting my cookie on.
author: Andy V.

description:
Yo this place is amazing. And a very interesting experience. It's a really small shop with no places to sit or anything. And the entire wall is covered by pornographic photos, it's pretty great. 

The penis cookie is a definite must try, just for the Insta or Snapchat at least. I'm not a fan of coconut, but the cookie tastes more along the lines of a Samoa Girl Scout Cookie. But for those who actually like coconut, the penis cookie is a safe bet.

Besides their famous penis cookie, the other cookies are really damn good too. I got the toffee chocolate chip cookie which was AMAZING. The cookie was really big, and super duper chewy. Like I have dreams about the toffee cookie, no joke.

Unfortunately, this place is pretty pricey. Not sure about individual prices, but a toffee cookie and penis cookie cost me a little over $10. But it's well worth it!

All in all, this place is definitely worth a quick stop if you end up in Castro district.
author: Rebecca Y.

description: Great place in the heart of Castro. Love their offerings of silly cookies right up Castro's alley. No complaints! Great stuff!
author: Meishi M.

description:
Went here last night with my two bff's and my cousin! Omg the cookies were amazing! The staff was fantastic! But wait, wait a minute.... how could I have never heard about the famous penis cookie!? HELLO!? Amazing and delicious!!!!!!!!!! Dark chocolate penis cookie all the way! With whipped cream no less! Right on! My bff and I are both L.A. pastry chef's and we will most definitely be back to this awesome little local spot! Thanks for the welcome penis san Francisco! No pictures cause we shoved that thing in our mouths! Lmao
Xoxox
author: Ronnie A.

description:
Question:
What is big, black and coconut flavored?

Answer: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-cookie-san-francisco#7C3ztZ_0wV6WRzjtJwUJ9A
Go get one for yourself today!

However, if you are like me and do not like coconut, there are other options for your tasting pleasure. (Pix are circa May 2013.)

*Chocolate chip cookie http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-cookie-san-francisco#WflcINuwYh0nRhLkNbPcWg
*White chocolate macadamia nut cookie http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-cookie-san-francisco#SGfrM1A6IE4gP8NPgIEP2A
*Ginger cookie http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-cookie-san-francisco#irl2hOMm3rvHoYUtQX2m7g
author: Elena N.

description: No matter how drunk I am, these cookies are never good. I've tried them all, even the rice crispy treats. Go for the cookies, stay for the puns.
author: Celie H.

description:
Hot Cookie: a Castro classic!

It doesn't matter if you're gay, straight, trans, bi, or whatever tickles your sexual pickle - everyone loves fresh baked cookies. 

Personal faves are the toffee chocolate chip and the chocolate covered macaroons. Snicker doodles are pretty good too.

Love that they're open late (until 11 pm) so you can grab a sweet treat after dinner in the 'hood or seeing a flick at the Castro Theater. Beats an overpriced bag of M&M's or creme brûlée any day of the week. Amiright?
author: Abby S.

description: Best cookie I have ever had! The toffee milk cookie is the best! It is a little pricey... but what isn't in San Fran so so worth it
author: Sarah B.

description: Ha, what an awesome little cookie shop! The shop it self is a load of fun on its own, just go in and see for yourself! The cookies here are fresh and delicious. I love a good oatmeal raisin and here they do it well. The cookie was warm, chewy, and not too sweet. I also got a white macadamia cookie. Large chunks of nuts and chocolate. I wish I had more room to try them all. Definitely a place to check out if you find yourself in the area!
author: Vincent T.

description: I loved my oatmeal and raisin and something else cookie so much we came back like 4 more times during our vacation!  Service is super fast, the hot cookie photos pasted all over the walls are fun to look at.  The brownie and other chocolate items tasted really great too. Lots of people walked out with a chocolate dipped dick shaped something on a stick.  Only in the Castro!
author: Mee-Jin Y.

description:
As San Francisco as it gets.

Who doesn't love photos of near-naked patrons and penis-shaped macaroons? This hole in the wall has a spread of treats ranging from cookies to fudge-dipped brownies. My friend and I chomped on our phallic macaroon ($8) on a bench across the street and got plenty of stares. 

100% worth it.
author: Miss M.

description:
Random cookie stop that turned into a rice krispie stop :) fun looking shop, delicious looking treats and friendly staff! Hard to choose from the array of baked goods on display at this cozy store front but the rice kirspie definitely called out to us. 

We devoured in while standing in line at Beaux, I'm sure people were staring but most likely because they wanted a bite :)
author: Jannies L.

description:
The allure of a hot cookie on a cold rainy evening drew us in.

The cookies were fairly priced and tasted good. The brownie was rich. 

But the cookies were not warm. This was a bit of a disappointment, but I guess it made sense that they weren't all warm.
author: Candice C.

description:
If you're ever in Castro, you gotta stop by this place :) It's known for their unique cookie shapes...like the penis shaped cookie/macaroon. I personally found the chocolate covered coconut macaroon to be a little too sweet, but it makes for interesting photo ops...it's a silly concept after all.

I've also had their cookies here too, and they're comparable to Pacific Cookie Company if you've had those. Crispy on the outside, but soft and fluffy towards the middle.

Overall, the cookies are overpriced, but they tasted pretty good. Nothing spectacular, but worth going to this shop just for the experience and for their concept.
author: Alicia L.

description:
+ Penis Macaroon
Yes, the Penis Macaroon. Came here with some friends to see what this special macaroon is all about!  They're huge and so coconutty! The macaroon is enjoyable but it is not something I would actually crave from time to time. Basically, good but not special.  Next time, I'll try their cookies.

+ Staff
Extremely patient and friendly. Did not mind us taking our sweet time and giggling like little kids.
author: Alex L.

description: I came for the penis cookie I'd heard about but alas found out it was actually a coconut macaron. As chocolate chip is more my thing, I opted for one of those instead and it was perfect. I have a huge sweet tooth and even I had to stop half way through because I could've sworn I was developing diabetes on the spot. Such a sugar rush. I happily finished it next day though and it was still chewy and perfect.
author: Alex Q.

description:
OMG......

I want MORE 

Flavors: (2) Toffee Cookie, (1) White Chocolate Cookie, (1) Chocolate Chip Cookie & napkins please..... MMMMM sarap......yes, I eat all of this before I hit the bars - lol
author: Ryan R.

description:
If you like Penis, you've come to the right place.  Hot Cookie will provide you with a decadent, mouthwatering, thick, dark chocolate PENIS and BALLS shape cookie.  It's HUGE!  I couldn't take it all in one sitting.  I had to to work myself up to it, then slowly lick it.  Their chocolate chip cookie is also delicious and highly recommend.  They close late too so it's a huge plus! Customer service here is generally good.  Do buy their HOT COOKIE UNDER GEAR!  It makes perfect stocking stuffers!

Cheers! ~ :p
author: Edwin R.

description: Great cookies, gets busy, gets expensive, and for the past few times I went there they have always gotten my order wrong. This place is probably best to get one cookie at a time such as the penis shaped one, but once you order more than one they start putting random cookies in your bags. Maybe before paying you should ask them to double check your order before you pay over 20 bucks for cookies you didn't even want. It's cookies... like come on! It's not that complicated.
author: Edgar H.

description:
Holy cow, these are good! Chewy, flawless, melt-in-your-mouth deliciousness.

They all seemed very fresh and I tried several kinds. My favorites were ginger, oatmeal raisin, and chocolate with white chocolate chips & what tasted like a hint of chili. Didn't get to try the famed penis macaroon but I just might have do that someday should I find myself in the Castro.

The workers are helpful and generous. Give it a try. You won't regret it.
author: Ellery D.

description:
Only here could you find a "big black dick" cookie and it be delicious. 

Macaroon, chocolate and coconut... Mmm... They offer whipped cream on it too!

There typically is a line but that's cuz the cookies are good and it's really trendy. But way over hyped for a penis shaped cookie. 

The service was great! The stuff they sell is adorable - I want those undies! 

Cute.

Parking: street and crowded
author: Laura S.

description: I bought a boy scout cookie yesterday.... and... lets just say my cookies never made it home.  I love this place and all the cool pics of people in their hot cookie undies... I advise you to taste the boy scout... its moist.. chewy... and just makes you happy.  I love them... I
author: Sheree S.

description:
The best cookie shop in SF 

Impossible to choose a favorite flavor. Take your conservative friends and family for a little educational trip with a sweet ending.
author: Melanie M.

description: The sticky Nicky cookie which is a chocolate chip cookie with pretzels and caramel on top. It was warm and soft and absolutely delicious! The cookies are pretty large but they charge by the weight ($13.50 per pound). The other cool thing they do is sell yesterday's cookies for $1.
author: Jenine G.

description:
Such a fun place! Their chocolate chip cookies are by far the best. And they're so big!!! I also tried to the chocolate chip snickerdoodle which was good. I want to go back to try their chocolate fudge cookie. 

Be warned that the place is tiny. There's no space to sit or anything. There was no line when I went on a Sunday afternoon so hopefully it's always like that!
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
I've been here two days in a row this week and I kid you not, I would go back if I lived closer to it. This place is small but mighty! It's always open late whenever I'm in the city and I'm always lucky to have the cookies I want available. The cookie are about 3ish dollars each? I spent about $16 on five cookies. A little pricey but it's worth it because of the size and taste. I've tried their snickerdoodle, chocolate chip, peanut butter, toffee chocolate chip and sticky nicki cookies. 

My faves would have to be their snickerdoodle cookie and sticky nicki cookie which consists of sea salt, caramel drizzle, chocolate chunks, and pretzels on top. Perfect combination of sweet and salty! I know they're famous for their coconut macaron penis dessert but their cookies are to die for!
author: Arisa Leanne R.

description:
Great cookies. Walked the city for eight hours one day and bought about 16 cookies before the walk for me and a friend. I thought that maybe we overdid it but we ate them all within a few hours . They had this fudge peanut butter bar that was also really good! 

My surprise favorite of the cookies we got was actually the sugar cookies with sprinkles on them.
author: greg s.

description:
Holy Moley, talk about cookie galore! This place is definitely worth the trip and visit if you are a cookie addict like myself! 

The cookies are HUGE here, like the size of a mini personal pizza.  They sell it by the weight, but it comes out to be about $3/ cookie. You can also get "yesterday's" cookies are $0.95 each -- probably just as good if you're not too picky. The cookies are pretty yummy for the most part. Solid recipes but nothing crazy spectacular. They have lots of variety and great service. 

Here's the details: 
Cocoa Cayenne: my favorite. Chocolatey, soft center, with white chocolate bits in a cocoa dough, and just the perfect pitch of spicy kick. Loves! 

Chocolate Chip Cookie -- aka the Holy Grail. It's pretty bomb here. Tastes like a classic homemade cookie. Lots of chocolate chips, gooey chewy center, and a crusty shell. 

Toffee Chocolate Chip -- their famous cookie. I'm not really a fan. It's pretty good, sweeter and more caramel than your typical chocolate chip. 

California Chocolate Chip -- the mixology everything cookie. There coconut shreds, almonds, chocolate chips, and more in this cookie. Crunchy, chewy, chocolates, and toasty. Not my favorite, but good if you like a loaded cookie.
author: Ellen W.

description: Whoever thought of selling penis shaped cookies in the Castro is pure genius! I couldn't resist lining up for this cookie after seeing all the raves and reviews on Yelp. Priced at $7.50, this chocolate covered macaroon cookie is damn expensive for a cookie, but at least it was huge ;) The kind employee added whip cream to my cookie and even helped box up the cookie for me so that I could bring it back home safely. I must say I really enjoyed this cookie. I didn't think it was super sweet at all. It was the perfect amount of chocolate combined with coconut. Even my friend who didn't like coconut enjoyed this cookie. Whenever I will be back in the Castro, Hot Cookie here I come!
author: Lucy Y.

description: Cookies here are priced according to their weight. I got the toffee chocolate chip and my friend got the cayenne cocoa, which were about $3 each. Of the two I enjoyed the cayenne cocoa more. If you're looking for something different they have a phallic shaped cookie and a bust/torso shaped cookie.
author: Helen H.

description: Really good cookies and pretty fair prices, or at least what I'm used to coming from another large city. Penis cookie is a bit overrated in my opinion and was not as good as the other cookies we ate! I would deff recommend making the stop here
author: Rachael L.

description: A city as forward as San Francisco call the chocolate chip cookie the basic bitch. Less unpack that.the chocolate chip cookie is the original cookie that inspired the creation of other cookies. The other cookies gets called their correct name but the chocolate chip cookie gets called the basic bitch. If anything you should call your chocolate chip cookies legendary because everybody loves the chocolate chip cookies. But the war against chocolate in this city has a very liberal Alt right feeling to it. Just saying
author: Trey R.

description:
I came here not expecting much, thinking it's just one of those tourist traps where you're basically spending a couple of bucks to get a picture of yourself doing scandalous things with a cookie and your mouth just so you can post it on a social media account of your choice.

But the thing about Hot Cookie is that their cookies are actually really good and well worth the $.  Their most famous option comprises of a huge macaron covered in chocolate so if you're into coconut, you'll love this...but it was really their coffee toffee that blew my mind. Thin, chewy, and marvelously sweet and warm, I'd come back just for this. Their butch bars are also a heavenly pairing of chocolate and peanut butter baked into a dense brownie. Dare I say both of these were orgasmic!

If you're a virgin, you should come here and get what everyone expects of you. But I promise you'll be back for basically everything else they offer.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
My friend lives up a hill in the Castro. A steep hill. And that is why I don't feel bad about going to Hot Cookie every time I'm in the Castro.

It really is a must stop place, and depending on how recently they made snickerdoodles, you may not have a choice as your nose takes you directly inside.

It also is a cheap respite from the cold, paying $0.50 for a small cookie and a minute in a warm bakery.

Anyways, this is a tiny little bakery in the Castro that you will smell before you see. About 3 people can be comfortably in the customer area, so if you get claustrophobic, beware. You will see everything they have in the display case, and the milk fridge next to it (which is genius). They offer a variety of cookies such as chocolate chip, toffee chocolate chip, white chocolate, white chocolate macadamia nut, to name a few. Then they have the not so family friendly cookies like the fudgepacker, the penis shaped chocolate covered cookies, and more. Oh, and if you are really cheap, they usually have some day olds. Every cookie I've had here has been excellent, and I will take friends from out of town here.

They also sell a variety of clothes from aprons to underoos.
author: Michael C.

description:
Who would've thought a huge penis cookie would be so delicious, LOL. 

Everything from the chocolate covering, to the coconut shavings, and the cookie itself is perfect. It's a little pricey at about $7-8 bucks, but definitely something worth trying for the experience and the laughs.

It's huge so don't be afraid to pair up with a friend and double team it!
author: Micki H.

description: I had heard so many things about Hot Cookie from friends, that I couldn't wait to stop by once I was in the city. Hot Cookie is a small (very small) bakery in the Castro that is home to the infamous Penis Cookie. My friends and I decided to go around 6ish and we were left with very little options. There were only 2 penis cookies left so we snagged them and shared between the 4 of us. The guy at the front was very helpful but who would want to pay $8 for 1 cookie! What surprised me was the flavor, it was a strong coconut flavor. It was good but I think 1 time is enough. I'll be back to try different cookies.
author: Melanie B.

description:
- Can't go wrong with the chocolate chip cookies!
- Friendly staff.
- Good location and stays open late.
- No bathroom or place to sit.
author: Mari E.

description: Came here with my friend because she wanted to try the interesting shaped cookies. The cookies are coconut macaroons covered in chocolate with some coconut shavings on the top. The cookie was around 5 dollars, I think its a one time thing. I wouldn't go here on purpose because I crave the cookie, but its one of those oh let me try it once kinda thing. The taste is soft, crispy with some chewiness to it. I enjoyed it. Definitely good to try this at least once and do it for the picture !
author: Amy Y.

description:
I was intrigued by the huge black penis cookie that I saw on the Yelp picture album so after a nice brunch at Starbelly, I obtained a huge black penis from Hot Cookie. It's pretty much a big macaroon that was shaped into a huge black penis. So, if you like macaroons, you'll like the taste of the huge black penis. My guess is most people don't love the taste of macaroons and only buy this for the novelty. Nothing wrong with that, but if your experience mirrors mine, you're going to buy the penis, take a few pictures, bite it a couple times, then get rid of it somehow. I don't think mine was "fresh" but I don't think they can come fresh since the chocolate needs to harden. But dang, how much better is any baked good that's warm?

An important thing is that everything else (other than huge black penis) looked really tasty/fresh. Retrospectively I wish I also got one of their non-penis cookies because they looked so good. Since I had just came from brunch (and I'm preparing for a Hawaii beach body), I wasn't really in the mood for a cookie.

They sell lots of Hot Cookie underwear here and on the wall are many pictures of people wearing the underwear in different places. I think you can take pictures of yourself wearing the underwear and post it on their wall. Castro loves sophisticated underwear.

So reiterating the first paragraph I typed up, the huge black cock cookie is really just a cool novelty, especially for visitors to SF's Castro street. Come in a group, get one, laugh and stuff, then go about the rest of your day. Oh, and actually get a different cookie also to really taste what the bakery is all about.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Why did I come here? Well for the phallic penis macaroon of course! (NO SHAME) 
After looking at all the reviews and pictures for this place, my girlfriends and I decided to give this place shot. We bought the chocolate covered penis macaroon and to ease the tension between the staff and I, we tossed in a chocolate toffee cookie. 

After finding a location for us to devour this dessert, we dug in. I was pretty surprised how amazing this dessert tasted. The chocolate coated macaroon sprinkled with coconut flakes was the perfect sweetness level. The inside was also very moist and the texture was soft and chewy. 

The chocolate toffee cookie ($2.60): Chewy, sweet, and PERFECT. I'd assume toffee makes everything sweeter, but for this cookie, it was also perfectly sweet. It wasn't definitely not too sweet and it satisfied my cookie cravings.

5 Stars for the service and the dessert! Love that they make desserts that have the perfect sweetness level. 

Parking: Pretty easy to find street parking in Castro

Service: Great and friendly staff

Price: $2-$7. The Penis Macaroon was about $6ish
author: Winnie M.

description:
fun cookies 
different experience  and pricey
author: Tabitha D.

description:
After visiting Castro for years, I finally decided to try this place out. Really good macaroons and cookies! Typical San Francisco pricing, but it's no surprise there. The underwear is cute and comfortable, too.

I'm giving three stars simply because of service. The two behind the counter were extremely rude for no reason whatsoever. I was greeted with a snappy "what do you want?" and wasn't able to make eye contact with either employee once. Twice the guy serving us turned to his coworker and made a quiet comment causing the coworker to laugh and look right at me and my husband. I work customer service in a big box store, and this exact behavior would get you fired.

It's easy to find good bakeries places in San Francisco with friendly staff. I'd take my business there next time  unless I'm dying for something sweet and don't want to leave Castro.
author: Bastijn M.

description:
Anthony - who? Pffffffffft, in my opinion (as in Anthony Cookies, which is more highly rated with similar number of reviews...in my opinion, Anthony's not even in the same range of awesomeness).

I hate and love that I found this place.  Hate because I always stop here for a giant cookie or two every single time I'm in the Castro (or some weekends make a point to go to the Castro just to pick up some cookies!).  Love because they are the best fresh, ooey, chewy cookies ever.  Best cookie I've tried in SF, in my opinion (or at least for those of you who like a soft/chewy inside with a lightly crisped edge).  

My personal favorites are the Snickerdoodle, M&M, and White Chocolate Macadamia.  My husband - being an extreme chocolate lover - prefers the M&M, Double Chocolate Chunk, and Chocolate/Toffee Chip.

If you haven't tried these cookies - maybe do your diet a favor and don't stop in.  Scratch that - just do it, you're worth it... diet's for Monday's anyway, right ;))
author: Rachael S.

description:
Located near the Castro Theater a few doors down, this place served a variety of desserts.

There were a variety of interesting desserts like the penis and vagina shaped chocolate(?) ones.

My friend and I ended up getting a few small tart looking ones and a chocolate brownie. The chocolate brownie was amazingly good, but also very decadent. I could taste the richness and the sugary frosting was a sensory overload.

Overall, of the things I tried it was very good, but probably best in small portions.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Absolutely LOVE the penis macaroon. Has anyone ever compared it to the Samoa Girl Scout cookie? Because that is exactly what it tastes like! It was amazing, yummy goodness.

I also got the chocolate toffee cookie. The edges were a little overdone, which I was disappointed in, but the center was a much nicer cook. 

If you're only getting one thing, get the macaroons. I wasn't sold on the idea of coconut but got it anyway because *how can you not buy a penis shaped macaroon?* and am now a believer.
author: Rachel F.

description: great cookies.... crispy yet moist and chewy at the same time. Fun pitstop with friends or to sneak a cookie solo  .....shhhhh!  ;-)
author: Chase L.

description: Went to your establishment because Yelp says you are ope u too 2am. 1:40am and you are closed. Let down.
author: John V.

description: The toffee chocolate chip cookies are so good! We stopped in for something sweet. And you can get your peen cookies here, too. A sure shot novelty when you are in the Castro!
author: Mika D.

description:
Stopped off in Hot Cookie while on a bike tour of San Fran due to our guides recommendation. I got a smore's cookie, and it was a campfire party in my mouth. (very aggressive analogy for this type of place, but ya know...)

How do you get a picture on the wall? Also try the chocolate penis.
author: Andrew Q.

description: I planned to get the Penis and the Venus, but they ran out of the ladies when the hubby and I went. This is the BEST coconut macaroon I've ever had! The coconut is perfectly toasted and the chocolate isn't too sweet. Perfect balance of flavor. The Sticky Nicky was also equally yummy. Will definitely come back!
author: Tiffany I.

description:
I tries to purchase the unders wear but  it is too small 
My mother found it pleasing however

Best and thank you 
Roo
author: Ryuta O.

description: One of the hot spots at the Castro...this little nook of a store is so hard to miss. All their cookies are baked just right. I love how their cookies are just the right sweetness with the right flavor combinations. My all-time fave is the White Chocolate Chip macadamia, I recommend you try it.
author: Billy A.

description: Hot cookie. What an amazing bakery in the heart of San Francisco! You can tell they're homemade recipes made of heart. Delicious. Yum!
author: Firas K.

description: Love the uniqueness of this place and the fun premise. I heard they had vegan options but when I went they only had one option. Mini ginger snaps. All the other cookies looked good but they needed more vegan options:(
author: Dianne L.

description: My wife really wanted to go here for desert on our last night in San Francisco. The cookies all had funny names and looked delicious. We orders the Sticky Nikki, Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip and the Fudge Packer. The cookies where hard on the outside and moist on the inside. I give this place 4 stars as the wait was very long and while standing in line you have homeless people asking you for change. Other then that, the quality of the food is great and we will be back whenever we are in San Fran again.
author: Anthony R.

description: I think the cashier complimented my hair today, and I can't believe I haven't rated it sooner so
author: First Name L.

description:
Oh boy. Where else are you going to procure a dark phallic shaped coconut macaroon from? 

If you're into coconuts and macaroons, look no further than Hot Cookie, the San Franciscan bachelorette party phenomenon... or ya know, a casual Tuesday night. 

They also have fantastic appropriate looking cookies as well -- the snickerdoodle and toffee chocolate chip ones are my favorite! 

So definitely head down to this Castro favorite on a night when you're feeling particularly frisky. 

Happy Eating, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description: Great cookies, pictures of half naked people on the wall and all in the beautiful Castro...could you ask for more? Well you probably could but you don't need it....spoil yourself with fantastic cookies and great workers
author: Andrew M.

description: I love this place. I recommend you get one of everything.
author: Mandi W.

description: First, I'm not super crazy about cookies but the chocolate chip cookie we had today was bomb. Fresh, tasty, and not overly sweet. The cookie was $2, but the size of it was pretty good. The shop is small, but it's a grab and go so it doesn't even matter. The guy behind the counter was welcoming and nice. I would definitely recommend this place and come back.
author: Maggie W.

description: Best cookie ever. ....risqué pictures. Best...Delicious, mouth watering cookies!!!!!!!#
author: Sharine d.

description:
In the Castro district is this tiny cute bakery with great baked goods.
There is a nice variety of cookies and brownie treats and novelties like the "dick on a stick" cookie.
Worth the trip and the gay gossip you hear waitng in line.

Cons: from what I can see it's priced by the pound... like $5.95 per lb. They don't list prices. The items are large and heavy. I got 2 cookies a chocolate dipped brownie and a dick on a stick .... $18.00 !!!
author: Funtime P.

description: I've always enjoyed everything that I've purchased from Hot Cookie, until the cookie I purchase last night. This morning while eating my cookie I found  a metal spring in my cookie. Over an inch wide. Something this large must of been obviously in the batter... Such carelessness. I've attached a photo for reference. Hopefully in the future hot cookie will make sure their equipment isn't included in their cookies.
author: Dominique D.

description:
Eating a chocolate covered, 6 inch long penis cookie with coconut shavings as pubes in public would be totally unacceptable elsewhere, but in the heart of the Castro district- you'll see things that will make this the least of your worries. 

I decided to stop in to grab a Venus cookie, which I suppose it's named that because it's easier to say then Woman Frontal or Boobs & Vag Cookie. I thought it'd be funny to give to my mother, since macaroons are her ultimate fave along with chocolate. Also she either gets really scared of stuff like this or laughs at it. The macaroon Penis and Venus are pretty heavy, hence their hefty price tag for a cookie. My Venus cookie came out to be $6.75, I would say it was probably 1/2-1 pound. The macaroon cookies are moist, chewy, chocolate as a perfect coating and of course the details of coconut shavings.

The guy helping me was such a cutie and was pretty quick to get me in and out of there. The place isn't exactly big, I would say fits 4-5 people- max.

You know this place has gotta be good when you see tons of folk of many ages, not just trying their signature cookies but their other classic cookies as well!

(I will let you know, I had to refrain from many puns ... as many reviews here are very pun- filled. I love it. It's SO hard ... to resist! Hehe.)
author: Janet N.

description:
My friend and I were craving a sweet treat before going back home. Hot Cookie was the perfect spot. 

Naughty, cheeky little place with yummy treats. I got a almond joy type mini cookie (almonds, coconut, dark chocolate) and a big white chocolate macadamia cookie for me and a big toffee milk chocolate chip cookie to take home for my boyfriend. My friend got a big white chocolate macadamia cookie and a big pecan milk chocolate chip cookie for herself. 

The mini almond joy cookie was pretty damn good. Chock full of nuts so it had a great texture in my opinion. Right amount of chocolate. 

The white chocolate macadamia cookie is a favorite because it is buttery goodness. A little too sweet but still bomb. 

The toffee chip I never got to try because it got gobbled up by my boyfriend too quick. My friend gave me most of her pecan chip because she doesn't like too much chocolate and this one had a lot. Still good! 

Great place for a quick cookie.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Dipped chocolate macaroon on a stick that is shaped as a male organ! How awesome and entertaining is that?  A must try indeed and very suitable to the theme for Castro!  That size can satisfy up to 3 people, if you know what I mean!  

A snapshot of a Coconut Macaroon in his mouth - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-cookie-san-francisco?start=100#uuMpWFZTrFb6qKdKfpCurA

Their Chocolate Chip cookies were good, but not the best I have ever tried!  Their Cocoa Spiced Cheyenne Cookie packs a bit of a punch with the Cheyenne ingredient added to the mixture of sweet flavors!

Simply a trademark in Castro!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I expected a hot cookie... Is that wrong? Like an ooeey gooey cookie. Nope. Just penises. Penis cookies to be exact.

I was very excited for the chocolate chip coconut cookie. It was dry and not very exciting. Pretty bummed, as I have a deep love of chewy delicious cookies.
author: Rachel C.

description: I got the milk toffee cookie. The cookie tasted ok. Rated 4 stars because of how friendly the staff was and how great the atmosphere was.
author: Billy N.

description: Oh my goodness. Best snickerdoodles I have ever eaten. Thank goodness I live too far away to stop in daily. These cookies are so yummy.
author: Sheri H.

description:
Meh. The cookies are ok. We tried 4: chocolate chip, coconut chocolate chunk, pecan chocolate and peanut butter. 

Ingredients are mediocre. Would rather have a hot hotel fresh cookie.

The decor is great!!! Service was ok.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
I am no cookie NOMster, but my bf who loves cookies unconditionally said the ones here were some of the best he's ever had ;) 

They charge the big cookies by ounce. They are very vague about how much it costs (~$2.50 they say) but we ended up paying almost $8 for three large cookies.. so I don't know. 

I would recommend going for the mini cookies so you can sample a variety of flavors :) Eat them IMMEDIATELY when they're still warm so the chocolate goozes out. After awhile, they become crispier on the edges and chewy in the middle. 

The store is tinyyyy. Service varies by employee, but one time, the lady gave us a free mini cookie! I will definitely be back to try the infamous Penis & Venus cookies. At $6.75, they are a bit expensive, but they are H-U-G-E.
author: Samantha C.

description:
I use to take the M-line to Castro just to get Hot Cookie. It's a small place but has big incredible treats! Note: cash only and open late! Thank goodness for the latter because sometimes I just gotta have one of their cookies at 11pm!

I know they're known for their penis and Venus coconut macaroons covered in chocolate but I simply adore their cookies. Their cocoa cayenne and snickerdoodle flavors are my two favorites! 

If you're near the area, please stop by and try one of their treats. You can also admire their wonderful collage of people wearing their signature undies haha
author: Claudine M.

description: Super fun penis shaped cookie dipped in chocolate with sprinkles! I would have preferred a chocolate chip or pb cookie over the coconut one however. Too much coconut! But def a fun excursion!
author: Stephanie H.

description: Their chocolate-covered coconut macaroon is the greatest - and funniest - thing I've ever tasted.  I've been coming here for years and the macaroon is still just as amazing as the first time I ever tried it.
author: Alexandra F.

description:
Hot Cookie, I wish I could write a book-y,
About your delicious milk chocolate toffee cookie,
Unfortunately, all I have here
Is a poorly written poem, I fear.

Yelp, I must confess,
I promise I am not writing this under duress,
But if you do try this delicious confection,
You will surely grow an incurable affection.
author: Liz G.

description:
Fun and delicious cookies.
I got the penis cookie (of course) and they asked: "would you like whipped cream on your penis?"
Made my day!
author: Natan G.

description: Popped in today on way to see Bill Moyers at Castro Theater. Had a couple of small chocolate chip cookies. Guy at the counter was nice but the music playing was offensive and misogynistic. Big turnoff to hear denigrating music, especially in this neighborhood.
author: Greg D.

description:
Oh yes, it's all about the Penis Cookies!
I won't lie, that's the only reason I came to Hot Cookie and I have no shame in admitting that. I wanted one of those Phallic Chocolate dipped Coconut Macaroon's for my Birthday and that is exactly what I got (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-cookie-san-francisco?select=LDfxY_tnqiH6q1COVIReQA#ZbFYT0XS91tDC-z7-SdZ1A). $7.25 for that and a small Almond Butter Cookie I thought it was a little pricey until I took it out of the bag and saw the actual size of the thing.
Which makes me ask the question - how did they get the shape of the cookie? Did they mold it by hand or did some guy offer up his junk as a molding shape? If it's the latter then good for him.

The Cookie itself was surprisingly good, I went with low expectations thinking that it was more for the novelty factor than anything but I admit that I was wrong. Soft chewy Coconut dipped in a decent amount of Chocolate to form a thick shell and it wasn't the really nasty, really cheap stuff either.
The Almond Butter Cookie (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-cookie-san-francisco?select=LDfxY_tnqiH6q1COVIReQA#_Av3Pf-HwA2OobA7odCheA) was also very good - crumbly with a very strong Almond flavor and lot's of Almonds baked on top.

The shop itself is very small, just a counter with enough standing room for about 5-6 people. The name of the place is a little deceiving as the cookies are not hot. Maybe the ''hot'' is a play on the Penis and Venus cookies... Whatever, as long as they carry on making those naughty Macaroon's I'll be happy.
author: Emmalouise B.

description: Was gifted a box of regular cookie assortment. They are large and chewy and have all characteristics of a good staple cookie...but after eating them, I had this weird aftertaste that was similar to splenda or stevia. I don't know if they advertise their ingredients anywhere so I wasn't able to look into it further. Some others I ate them with picked up on this aftertaste too but not sure if other customers have experienced this. If you're not sensitive to those aftertastes, these cookies are good, but for me, the aftertaste killed my experience of buying them again.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
This place is just fun to visit in Castro for the penis coconut macaron. It is huge and thick. As far as flavor it is too sweet and not something I would likely get again. 

They have something for whatever gender you're into, like the breast/vagina combo as well. 

I tried the regular cookies and they weren't anything special. So I feel like this place is more for the novelty genitalia cookies~
author: Sarah L.

description: I have been here several times in many different stages of sobriety and one thing remains constant--these cookies are usually hot and always delicious. There is hardly ever a wait and everything comes out hot and fresh. They have a good selection of flavors and I have yet to be disappointed with any of them. Definitely a great stop, especially if you're craving something sweet around the Castro.
author: Ryan R.

description:
What a great cookie!  I know, you're thinking it's just a cookie, what's the big deal?  

Yea, a cookie so gooey, soft, sweet, full of chocolate and toffee and the size of 3 cookies!  Please get one, about $3 for a cookie.  I got the toffee and chocolate, but there are many varieties.  There are also cookies in shapes of body parts, if you know what I mean.  *wink *wink
author: Darika S.

description:
Very unique cookie shop in the Castro district.  They have a novelty chocolate dipped coconut macarroon cookie in the shape of a penis and of lady bits - "penis" and "Venus"

Overlooking the novelty, the coconut macarroon was very good and I am not a fan of coconut macarroons.  It is not that that sweet but still chewy.

The cookies were unique, soft, chewy, and delicious.  Surprisingly, nothing was overwhelming sweet.  The cayenne chocolate cookie was the most surprising - good kick but still balanced

The one I would pass on is the brownie, which was more like a crumbly chocolate cake.  It was still good but not really brownie like.
author: vanessa t.

description:
Its more for the looks and the appearance of the items rather than the taste. Its about an average when it comes to taste. I'll be honest, we tried it out as well because it was different from your other cookie shops with penis shaped cookies etc. 
We tried the penis & venus and a white chocolate macadamia.
author: Varun A.

description:
You're waiting for a train, a train that will take you far away... And are hankering for a NSFW cookie.. Replace train with muni. 

Cookies are sorta $$$ so before I drop $$$$ on The cookie I wanted to try the standard fare. I ordered:
Snickerdoodle
Chocolate chip cookie
Toffee chocolate chip 
Total bill, $10 after weighing in.

I like them though because they're ooey gooey licious, especially the toffee chocolate chip ZOMG. GET IT NAO. The rest were okay-to-aite meaning not memorable.
author: Sarah W.

description: I wanted to love this place. The lights, the name, the photos of almost naked people plastered all over the walls, and the hilarious names of their desserts (fudge packer, anyone?) were all great! The man behind the counter was super sweet and helpful too! My cookie, however, was stale and blah tasting. I threw 3/4 of it in the trash.
author: Jen B.

description: Love this place I make it a must when I go to the Castro district the cookies are amazing
author: Lorena D.

description:
I always have to make at least one stop here everytime I'm in SF (Usually several visits LOL).

Cookies are a little expensive but so good.   I love the toffee cookies.   Great service and nice and cute employees.
author: Jamie P.

description:
More than a name!! These really are hot cookies! 
Nothing better than a warm, gooey chocolate chip cookie and that's exactly what I got. Also highly recommend my second all time favorite cookie - the snickerdoodle. Both warm and just the right chewy to crunchy ratio. How sad I was that I only bought two :( Next time, a whole dozen for my trip home from the city!
author: Allison X.

description:
I've never been to just a cookie shop until coming into this place. I see it as a hot spot for people coming from the local bars and needing something to fill their stomach other than all of the alcohol I consumed. I say this from experience. 

The place is super small, and a line can easily be out of the door with about four people. I got the penis chocolate covered macaroon cookie and it was delicious. Can't wait to go back with some friends again. I think it's a cool shop and in Castro it's a must to at least try once. I just want the "Hot Cookie" undies lol
author: Kendra F.

description:
Delicious! I think they may be some of the best cookies I've ever had. 

Ordered two large cookies and a brownie with nuts for $7.25. Apparently they charge by weight which makes more sense. 

Next time I'm gonna need to try out the chocolate covered penis shaped cookie (including vein details and balls) on a stick. Although all in good fun, I'm not sure if I'm gutsy enough or have the "balls" to eat this cookie in public.
author: Esther A.

description:
Hot Cookie in the busy strip of downtown Castro, serves blush-worthy cookies in a small space illuminated in neon lights.

Took my friend from out of town to get a penis cookie--you can't leave SF without visiting Castro and eating a nut-free macaron/coconut chocolate-covered dick cookie, right?! I got the HUGE cookie and my friend had the toffee cookie. It was pretty pricey being $10 for two cookies...but I shook it off, seeing as we were doing a "touristy" thing.

Service was welcoming, non-judgmental, and efficient as we stopped by on a Friday night around 11PM. We were looking for a sweets place that was open after 9PM, and yelp lead us here. Shoutout to the homie who was a friendly and informative cashier, who took the time to calm my nut-allergy questions by asking about the ingredients in the penis cookie.

I wouldn't come back here just to get my sweet tooth fix, but I would recommend coming here to get the penis macaron cookie (for lady-parts-lovers, there is also a boob/body cookie as well!) as a staple Castro move.
author: Jodi H.

description:
This review is only based off of the regular cookies I tried. I was in the neighborhood (too early for my dinner reservations at Frances) and had been wanting to try this place. 

I wanted to get my boyfriend a Snickerdoodle cookie, but noticed that the Peanut Butter cookies and Snickerdoodles were placed side-by-side. The cashier warned that these cookies touch all the time and she wouldn't risk it since my bf is allergic to peanuts :( 

My sister had the snickerdoodle and I had the toffee chocolate chip. Both were soo delicious, crispy on the outside and the right amount of crispy and chewiness in the middle just how I liked it (I am not a fan of soft chewy cookies that just remind me of unbaked dough). Waaay better fresh, so best eaten right away. I had some cookie leftover and it's just not the same after sitting out. I'll have to come back and try the more inappropriate cookies next time!
author: Sandy T.

description: This is probably the only touristy place to visit in the Castro unless you wanna try the theater. Their cookie selection is great, especially the special ones ;) but way too expensive! It would be much more worthwhile to get the ingredients and make a d*ck shaped cookie from the comfort of your own kitchen while your mom walks in and says, "hey...is there anything we should talk about?"
author: Calvin H.

description: Still 5 stars... Hot cookie will always have 5 stars in my book. My go to is still the Coco Cayenne (read: I ALWAYS GET THE COCO CAYENNE) - I did recently discover the mini almond cookies... they make an excellent appetizer cookie :)
author: Shannon H.

description:
Of course, I only came here for the you-know-what looking cookies, chocolate covered macaroons to be exact. They taste good, but I can't eat it in one sitting even when I am sharing with friends because they are gigantic and hella sweet. Yes, I used hella. SF for you. 

I think they'd make a great gag gift!

People who work here are very friendly, helpful and patient! The place itself is very tiny, I would not recommend coming here with a big group unless you guys already know what you want.

I would come back here to try the other cookies and baked goods :)
author: Solongo B.

description:
I strictly came here for the penis cookie. I got that + 4 mini cookies and it came up to $10. 

The cookies were good-- nothing special. The penis cookie is actually a huge coconut macaroon so beware if you're not into coconut. However, if you are, the cookie is pretty delicious.  

Yes, it was way too expensive but where else are you going to find a huge penis cookie?!
author: Jenn T.

description:
God this place is to die for! Wish I lived right on top of it, every single cookie is amazing and I hate telling you my secret but the sticky Nicky is the one!! 

The chocolate covered brownie is so killer and everything seems to be made with love. Staff are always very pleasant, buy some underwear!
author: Miranda S.

description:
Do NOT be fooled by the wall plastered and covered in photos of half-naked men (actually more than half-naked ;)

This is NOT a sex shop or an underwear shop for that matter. This is a cookie shop. Yes, they are real cookies and yes, they are pretty damn DELICIOUS - hot, chewy, and crispy on the edges. 

And if you have a great sense of humor, go ahead and get yourself a penis cookie. You're in San Francisco..no one's judging ;)
author: Annie N.

description: It's a small bakery on a busy street. The staff were nice. I ended up getting the penis cookie and a regular chocolate chip cookie which were both good. The pictures inside the bakery were awesome. Good place to get sweets.
author: Brittani J.

description: I love this place u can smell the cookies when u walk in the oatmeal cookie was amazing definitely recommend this place
author: Veronica C.

description:
Cookies here are sold by the weight, so it's hard to gauge the cost, but I like that you pay for what you actually get, rather than get disappointed by getting the little one, when it's a set price.

I chose the while chocolate coconut and macadamia cookie, a coffee, and have to admit I really wasn't that impressed.

I found the taste of the cookie very plain and doughy, it didn't really have a flavour, and whilst moist, felt a little undercooked.

The coffee came in a urn that was supplied by another company (I believe), and felt like it had been there for a while, and a little burnt.

The shop itself is pretty cramped and everything looks and feels a little greasy.

Whilst the novelty of people exposing themselves in pictures on the walls and the genitalia cookies speak of the sexual liberation that SF hosts, I found them rather crass, and vulgar. Chomping down on, or giggling at, a penis cookie to me isn't titillation (or hot!), it's distracting, when really the focus of a cookie shop, should be on making amazing cookies!
author: Ray C.

description:
I tried the penis cookie out. My friend bet that as a straight man I'm too insecure with my sexuality to eat one. I proved her wrong. 

The cookie itself was wonderful. Not to mention the place is very clean and smells amazing. And staff was friendly and helpful. I'm a big fan of coconut and dark chocolate so it gets huge points for that. I also learned very quickly that you should share it, not eat it in one session like I did. 

The negatives are that the balls split apart and fell on the floor once I finished eating the shaft. Also the price is a bit high. It may be a novelty cookie, and a very good one at that, but still rather expensive. 

Other than that the selection otherwise is great and I'd be inclined to try some of their other options next time I'm in the Castro.
author: John S.

description:
My friend got me some goodies from Hot Cookie. They were pretty good but I'm not sure they're worth a trip to the bakery on its own. I'd probably come only if I happened to be in the area or if wanted to get the penis macaroon as a gift or something.

-{GET} PENIS & VENUS (chocolate dipped macaroon) - Chewy chocolate and coconut yumminess!! These things are HUGE and can easily be shared between 3-4 (or more) people. Honestly, the macaroon itself doesn't taste much different from other macaroons I've had, but they make a great gag gift.

-{MAYBE GET} GINGERSNAPS - I can't decide if I really like these cookies. They're full of ginger flavor, which I love, and they even have bits of ginger in them. But I'm not too fond of the texture. I love soft gingersnaps and these are definitely INCREDIBLY soft, but rather than being chewy soft, they were more brittle/crumbly, almost a sandy texture.
author: Jessie L.

description:
My trip to to SF wouldn't have been complete if I wasn't able to pop into Hot Cookie and snag one...or two...of their legendary Butch Bars. It's really hard to miss this bakery --  its large sign outside of the storefront is a major focal point of Castro St. Well, at least for this sugar-obsessed individual it is. 

For the phallic-minded, Hot Cookie becomes the best of both worlds. It not only is empowered to quell a sugar and chocolate yearning, but it also is capable of tapping into one's naughty side. Indeed, if you're feeling frisky, Hot Cookie may be able to help out...but only so far. Yes, penis-shaped cookies are in abundance. For me, however, my only mission was to obtain my Butch Bar. And I did.

At around 1pm or so, Hot Cookie was dead. At our arrival, the case was being staffed by an extremely pretentious twink who was showcasing a nasty case of 'tude. Asking to purchase two Butch Bars was clearly an inconvenience for this individual, evidenced by his unattractive, sour demeanor. In addition, he seemed bowled over at the fact that I wanted to buy TWO Butch Bars. To myself, I was like, "Yes, bitch, I want TWO! You have a problem with that?" For a few seconds, I could feel my inner bitch rising up to make an appearance. Luckily, I managed to pay for my spoils and walk out the door before she presented her ugly self.
