The Butch Bars were less of a cookie and more like candy. Notwithstanding, anything with chocolate and peanut butter is near perfect in my book. I enjoyed nursing on those bars in the hotel over a 2-day period. 

Aside from that lovely employee that was unpleasant, Hot Cookie offers some delicious baked goodies, in all "shapes and sizes," that are sure to put a smile on your face. This little bakery will undoubtedly be one of my many pit stops when strolling through the Castro.
author: Gary R.

description: The venus cookie i.e. the penis cookie was definitely not worth the $8 I paid. It was rather bland with a coconut aftertaste. The employees though were fun and engaging but man was that cookie really disappointing. Overpriced and would not come again. Definitely a tourist trap.
author: Eric S.

description:
I have been wanting to go to Hot Cookie for a very long time.  I finally got the chance to the other day.  I was going to get a chocolate chip cookie, but I decided to go for a chocolate-cayenne one with white chocolate chips.

It was delicious! There was a burst of heat from the cayenne that dissipated slowly.  And it wasn't too sweet, which surprised me.  It was well balanced, and I devoured the whole thing.

I was kind of spaced out as I had a very long day, and the gentleman behind the counter was patient and had a friendly smile.

It's very small, only two to three people can fit inside.  But you can't miss it since there's a huge sign, and it's close to the historic Castro Theater.
author: Vira P.

description:
Gimme that D! The "D" cookie that is...

After seeing the countless check-ins from fellow Yelpers and of course seeing the pictures, this place was immediately bookmarked. Luckily, one day I was in the Castro area and was on a mission to get one of their infamous chocolate dipped penis macaroon cookie with coconut pubes on the "balls." I noticed they also had some without the "pubes" for those who do not like coconut. The dick cookie itself is massive and it actually took a couple of days for me to finish the whole thing. I also decided to grab some of their other cookies which were just as amazing. Whether you're looking for some delicious cookies to innocently dip in some milk or get down and dirty with their sexually suggestive shaped cookies, then Hot Cookies is the place for you.
author: Cristal C.

description: The Snickerdoodle and the Cayenne Chocolate cookies are heaven.  You can, of course, go for the famous genital-shaped cookies, but the good ol' fashioned round ones are where it's at.  Always friendly staff, and a punch card towards a free cookie.  Who needs a late night pizza when you can go get a late night cookie?!
author: Kelly E.

description:
What can I say... this place seems to capture the spirit of Castro and it was an experience coming here late at night.  Very popular / busy joint and the baked goods are worth it.  Got a big chocolate dong with whipped cream and took it back home to eat.  However, not before messing with my friend when he fell asleep.

The cookie was delicious.  A little pricey, but I guess they have the market cornered on chocolate, macaroon dongs.
author: Randy S.

description: Such a funky little spot, but fun! Good cookies for that late night sweet tooth. Right on Castro, open late, this place is great for grabbing a treat and taking in some of the great diversity the city has to offer!!
author: Hila P.

description:
You so NAAAAAASTY! 

Alright alright... Maybe it's... WE soooooo NAAAAASTY!

But come on! Who wouldn't enjoy a nice, simple, tasty dessert? It juuuust so happens that this particular shop has ding-a-ling shaped macaroons and chocolatey covered chi-chi cookies. Perfect for anyone's sweet tooth if you ask me! Oh and how dare would anyone ever hold the Castro district to any less! 

Mmmmmm Kayyy, girlfriend?! *z-snaps*

Behind the glass case also stood regular shaped cookies for those who may be a bit squeamish or timid. 

Flavors include chocolate chip, macadamia nut, snicker doodle, toffee, and even brownies! 

I had so much fun coming here with Crisy G. for the first time; however, we both agreed that one ding dong cookie was too huge to handle in one session. 

With that said, I'm glad I finally had the chance to pop my Hot Cookie cherry!

*lights cigarette*

It was gooooooood, boo.
author: Ann S.

description: Amazing baking! We had peanut butter cookies; they were probably the best we've ever had. Decent pricing too. Great and helpful staff. Do stop by when you're in the area!
author: Gareth P.

description:
Delicious cookies? Absolutely. The toffee chocolate chip ones are dangerously addictive. 
Tiny storefront location? Two's company, three's probably not going to fit. 
Great location for a sweet goodie after a movie or dinner, just be ready to have to shout at the counter person even though they're only about 18 inches away because the music is cranked up to "break the lease" volume. Last time I was there it was profanity laced rap that was almost bad enough to make me leave and get a bag of Oreos at Walgreens.
author: Steve G.

description: I literally bought 40 bucks worth of cookies to take home. They have the best cookies and super creative funny names the Boy Scout and sticky Niki will not disappoint you!!! Happy to support this small whole in the wall! Favorite cookies ever!!!
author: Korina K.

description:
4.5 out of 5 stars. This is the only place that I know that has chocolate dicks, and lots of goodness. When you walk in here, notice all the hot cookie under wear pictures. I don't understand it but whatever. 

They have a nice selection of cookies from chocolate chip to snicker doodle. They also have rice Krispy treats, milk, and more dicks.
author: Vinson H.

description: Have asked numerous times for a gluten free option over the years.  Still nothing gluten free.  I do have the pleasure of watching all of my friends enjoy their cookies and desserts.
author: Thang H.

description:
Wow, these are some of the best cookies I've had, and almost all I do on the weekend is eat cookies. Forget Anthony's and forget Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, and come here instead.

All I had room for after just coming from eating at Ike's Place and Bi-Rite creamery was one cookie and the Butch Bar, which I had to get due to my obsession with peanut butter.

I got the Pokie cookie, which is a standard chocolate chip cookie with M&M's, but it was incredibly good. It was really soft and chewy throughout, and it was still a little warm too. Perfect cookie consistency. And The Butch Bar was one of the best things I ever ate - it was a massive layer of pure peanut butter sandwiched between two fudgey pieces of chocolate. So so good.

It's also at a fun, lively location, right in the heart of the Castro by the intersection with Market. Luckily for me, my wife was pretty frazzled and out of sorts after seeing some guy walking around completely bottomless, so I didn't have to share my cookie with her and got it all to myself.

If I visit San Francisco again, I'm definitely coming here before i get too full to try several more of the amazing cookies they have to offer.
author: Mike C.

description:
Came here specifically for the choco-dong. Aka: penis & venus cookie.

The total come out to $8.50 ($7.50 plus $1 tip). Probably one of the most expensive cookie that I've paid for. It's also probably one of the most obnoxious one as well.

The choco-dong is basically a coconut macaroon cookie covered in a thick layer of dark chocolate. I ate a part of the tip (heh) and thought the cookie had way too much chocolate on it. The cookie itself was kind of hard and difficult to chew. Wasn't a fan of the choco-dong overall. 

The other cookies that my friend got was pretty good, especially the toffee one.
author: Anna H.

description:
How can you go wrong with fresh cookies? You can't! These cookies are soft and delicious. 

These cookies are huge! I had trouble choosing so I picked two: Snickerdoodle and toffee milk chocolate. Snickerdoodle, which is one of my favorite cookies, and this one really delivered. It was extra soft and had gooey parts which really hit the spot. Toffee milk chocolate was also very soft and I loved the toffee and chocolate mix.

My only complaint? The cookies are big and you pay by weight. I could have had half the size of cookie and would have been really happy. My two cookies came to just over $5.50 total. A bit pricey even if they did taste good.

Pro-tip: they take credit and debit now. $5 minimum for debit and $10 minimum for credit.
author: Colene C.

description:
After being bookmarked for so long, I finally had the opportunity to try Hot Cookie! 
Located across the Castro Muni station, this place sell some tasty treats, if you know what I mean.. They have cookies - chocolate chip, toffee, peanut butter to name a few and some 'special' ones! By special, I mean penises and boobies. 

Thanks to Hot Cookie, I had my first BBC and it was about 5-6 inches long for $7! =0 
It's actually a giant macaroon cookie covered in chocolate and sprinkled with coconut shavings. I am not a huge fan of macaroon cookies, but it was worth the experience to finally try it. Definitely great for pictures to show your friends the BBC you're sticking in your mouth ;)
I couldn't eat the whole thing and just had the tip of it.. 

I also had their chocolate chip, peanut butter, and toffee cookies which were delish! I actually got the peanut butter for my bf but didn't which one was his (bad at cookies), and ate half of all of them, haha. I prefer the chocolate chip & peanut butter though. The toffee was a little different but still good. Don't forget to buy some milk with those yummy cookies too!
author: Mandy G.

description:
Home of the penis and female figure cookie.  They are coconut macaroons dipped in chocolate.

This place is tiny.
The small chocolate chip cookie was pretty good.  It was the chewy kind.  It kinda has the vibe of a homemade cookie crossed with a store-bought cookie.

Its not the best I've had but it was good.
Maybe I was distracted by everything going on inside the store, but I couldn't see the prices for the cookies anywhere.
author: Heejin L.

description: This is the best place to ruin any diet!!! Their macaroons and the kinky brownie square thing are incredible.
author: Julie Z.

description:
Delicious! 
I got the white chocolate macadamia cookie and didn't get to eat it until the end of the day- it was still moist and soft and delicious even then. Especially enjoyed the wall of photos of ppl in their signature hot cookie undies and the penis shaped cookies- definitely worth a visit to this Castro institution.
author: Mollie M.

description:
I've been here at least a dozen times and the cookies are great. Lots of variety and the prices are solid considering the cookies are pretty big. There have been a couple times some of the cookies were on the greasy/oily side, but still delicious nonetheless. 

The place is tiny so I always make it a point to get in and out pretty quickly. Staff is always friendly and helpful.
author: Andreea M.

description:
Small cookie shop located in the Castro. Be prepared to see lots of unmentionables when you enter. Ex: Penis & Venus cookies? 
The staff are friendly!

I only tried a piece of my boyfriends ginger snap cookie. It was okay! I'm not a huge cookie fan. He seemed to enjoy it a lot though so this place must be good. 


Side note: lots of homeless people asking for cookies. Strange, instead of money they ask for a hot cookie!! We were there for 10 minute tops and received two people asking for cookies lol. I guess that shows it's good?!  By the way, should you decide to buy the homeless man a cookie (hes the one sitting right outside, his preference is chocolate chip), he's probably just going to put it in his pocket and not even eat it. :0
author: Emily C.

description:
This review is solely for what I've seen yesterday. 

Working at the Castro, I often find myself going to this place for a quick dessert - a hot cookie, if you will.

As I entered the place, i was surprised by the person manning the station. He was wearing the usual apron, but oh boy... he was shirtless aside from that. What really made me turn around and not even get anything was that I can see his underarm hair. 
That's just gross!!! Even cooks wear hairnets, but really... I don't think it's sanitary to be serving food while your pits are exposed. Even now it makes me cringe.

I'm sure that's a health issue and would really think TWICE and HARD to ever come back. eww.
author: Jan R.

description: A place famous for a certain shaped Chocolate covered macaroon, also has tasty cookies!!  They also now take cards, which is a plus!!
author: Chad S.

description:
I've been living in the Castro for almost a decade and never stopped by Hot Cookie. What can I say? I'm just not the type of person who craves a cookie on the go. But the other night after we finished dinner nearby our house guest was like "what, no dessert?". So we walked down to Hot Cookie - possibly the only dessert place open in the evenings in the Castro.

I got the Sticky Micky. Not sure what was in it other than pretzel sticks and possibly toffee. In any case, it was a big dollop of baked sweet salty goodness. It was so yummy I ate it all even though my tummy hated me afterwards for overstuffing it. Hubby got the chocolate covered brownie. Intense chocolate. I'm not sure I could have more than the one bite I had but it disappeared quickly.

Cookies are charged by weight. For the Sticky Micky, Chocolate Covered Brownie and a small Almond Cookie it was $12.

Really over the top original cookies. Stick to the crazy stuff to really get what this place is about.
author: Jean K.

description:
Hilarious! Naughty! Unforgettable! Delicious! 

I love Castro for its colors and now for its cookies! 

I got the peanut butter and some heavy chocolate cookie for about $5. Did I like it? Well, let me say this: I love sharing... But I loved the chocolate cookie so much that I didn't offer my friend a piece! I wanted it all for myself!
author: Yasemin P.

description:
Darling Sweet Shop! Needed a sugar Fix & the M&Ms Chocolate Chip Cookie was the best 3$ Biscuit I've ever had. So chocolatey, gooey, and Delicious.

That is ALL.
author: Julian I.

description:
Yay, a cookie place that stays open after dinner!  The cookies are huge, soft and gooey.  If they were warm they'd be perfect!  (So many Castro jokes to be made here...)

Toffee Chip: 5 stars

California Chip: 5 stars

Chocolate Chip: 4.5 stars
author: Letitia L.

description:
In the Castro, it was a cold and a deserted Wednesday night.

No men, boys, or beast anywhere, in sight. 

Hot Cookie is where I, roam the street. 

A $6.25 chocolate covered penis macaroon was my treat. 

Taking the Muni Metro & imbibing my treat with, an insensible self-pride. 

Many passengers on the Metro looking at me, "shockingly stupefied".

Penis: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/qZFRnzb-VTfkMC2vDoWJVA?select=fmb74yvfp3dWrWxQfPzUTw
author: Matt G.

description:
Ladies AND gentlemen! If you are looking for some D anytime of the day..then go here! 6 inches of black D should satisfy your cravings.

Ha ha, all silliness aside, Hot Cookie is located in the Castro. A perfect place to find all sorts of unique and interesting things. 

Hot Cookie is more known for their penis and venus cookies, but their normal cookies are spectacular. I love their toffee chocolate chip cookie.

Anywho, the penis cookie is actually a coconut macaroon dipped in chocolate. So, if you do not like coconut macaroons then definitely buy it for novelty purposes. It's a big cookie! So do not expect to down that beast in one day. (That's what she said).
author: Kathy N.

description:
I'm shocked it's taken me this long to write a review for Hot Cookie, because I almost view this location as a rite of passage for new gays. I distinctly remember baby-gay Bryan, taking Caltrain + Muni to not only the big city, but the CASTRO, all by himself. This was a time where the Icon condos were a hole in the ground, Beaux was a nightclub called JET and the neighborhood wasn't overrun by coffee shops. It was a rite of passage to cruise the Castro as a teenager-- window shopping for underwear or laughing at all strange toys in the sex shops, where the workers just let underage-me into the store with a wink.

Hot Cookie was one of those places I remember going into then as a visitor and enjoy patronizing today as a resident-- it's still the same experience. The bright red "Hot Cookie" briefs in the window and plenty of photos of shirtless men, locals and tourists, who became unofficial models. Of course I loved it then, and I love it now. 

There are plenty of options-- including the popular chocolate covered penis/venus macaroons. I stick to the cookies usually-- the M&M Pokie or the Toffee Chocolate Chip are favorites. The Cocoa-Cayenne was the first time I had some sort of cookie with a slow burning heat (I've tried replicating it at home-- they do it better!) 

Hot Cookie is a gay Castro institution, in my eyes. That first day I set foot in there, I observed a bar named after me, the Sexy Bryan Bar! I laughed and told the worker, who probably was barely in college, that was my name and I appreciated it was spelled the "right way". He laughed with me, grabbed a Sexy Bryan Bar and gave it to me with a wink. I knew I was in the right neighborhood.
author: Bryan B.

description:
Love the cookies and got a pair of underwear to ship back home. Right down with touristville 
Great cookies
author: Laxmikanta S.

description:
When they've got it together, this place rocks.

otherwise, look and move on, don't buy the dry, over-baked stuff they put out.

When it's good, it's down to your toes oh my gosh is that good or what? good. 

Enjoy!
author: William M.

description:
Best chocolate chip cookies. And it's in Castro? And it's open late?! Why do I not have this place in Florida? 

I make some pretty damn chocolate chip cookies myself, but the one they make here made me humble. They were huge and melted in my mouth. I had to bring some home on the plane for family, and well, only a few survived. The brownies were also good. You can't beat the penis shaped creation, although I don't know what it was exactly. 

I will be seeking this place out once again if and when I return to SF.
author: Nina M.

description:
"Thank you Ethan for wrapping my To Go sweets, I flew 24h with it and Im enjoyin it now In The other side of the world, you were right!!"
 Amazing place and service, not to miss if you're around Castro.huge choice of cookies and other delights, I can't wait to go back!!
author: Ka L.

description: It's just the dick cookie experience. Not the best cookies ever (I actually like specialtys cookies more --wheat germ AMAZING). I'm cookie obsessed though, but sure, go for the outrageous castro cookie experience and get yourself a big black dick cookie and call it a day.
author: Brittini S.

description:
Hot Cookie is one of those places you just have to go to, at least once. It's kind of touristy, but it's also a fun place in a fun spot... and they sell cookies. I don't think you'll find this particular assortment anywhere else. 

Pros: 
- Cookies are pretty good - not the most amazing you've ever had, but they're definitely tasty. 
- The variety of cookies is decent... if you don't go often. 
- Fun shapes. Enough said. 
- Kitschy decor, pictures on the wall are fun to look at while you browse the cookie case.
- Location is convenient to the Castro Muni stop, so it's a good place to go anytime you're visiting (or leaving) the Castro.

Cons:
- Cookies could be better, could be served warm (consistently).
- There could be more variety, or maybe a menu that rotated so it's not the same thing every time.
- They're not particularly cheap, but they're not an awful value either.
- No place to sit and enjoy... neither in-store, nor anywhere nearby really.
- The inside is super tiny. Literally fits about three customers. 

Net/net worth a visit for a "gotta have it now" cookie craving or to satisfy your curiosity. But if you're looking for THE BEST cookies or something that is truly unique or satisfying, go elsewhere.
author: Catie F.

description:
I'll make it simple: best freaking cookie i've ever had. Well worth the drive to the Castro district.

Tried the chocolate peanut butter, snicker doodle, and regular chocolate chip. 

Tip: SF parking, especially in the Castro, is VERY difficult. If you're not dying to go inside, drop someone off while they get the cookies to go.
author: Sean C.

description:
Their penis and boobies macaroons are awesome! Hahah never thought I would ever tell the cashier "Can I get the penis and the boobs?" XD
The size of the penis and boobs macaroon is really big . And wayyy too sweet. After like 3 bites I can't eat it anymore. But it's pretty good tho. 

They only take cash or debit card.
author: Pinhwa S.

description: Chocolate toffee cookie and fudge brownie cookies were so yummy. Peanut butter chocolate was a close runner up. Fun place and friendly and hot service!
author: Jacqui C.

description:
$3 bucks for a cookie, really.  I wanted a quick desert so I had to wait outside since the place is the size of a shoe box. Got in, picked 1 cookie and was charged $3-. 

I expected the cookie to taste helluva great not just ok for $3.00
author: Michael C.

description:
Edit 4/9/16: NOW ACCEPTS DEBIT AND CREDIT

I've been coming here for YEARS!

It's my guilty pleasure though, I NEVER feel guilty for coming here. haha.

The ONLY complaint I have is that it's so freaking tiny in there! Don't mind me, I'm just being a whiny brat.

Pros all around! The staff, the decor, the music, the people who are in line with you- everyone is so damn happy!! I love it! 

I went to Elementary school back in the days down the street (Harvey Milk Civil Rights Academy) whoot whoot!!! and I remember coming here as a kid. My sister lives near by so when ever I am in the Castro this is my first stop.


What I get; Oatmal raisin, Snickerdoodle, toffee AND of course a Chocolate PENIS!!! yummy!

I don't get them ALL at the same time though I should... that would be epic. 

Lines can get really long but it's totally worth it ESPECIALLY when you get there when the cookies are fresh hot out the oven.
author: Drea W.

description: Great cookies, staff, and atmosphere. Every time I go to hot cookie I feel that I can just be myself. It's so much more than just a cookie shop. It's a safe place to let loose and have fun.
author: Elise R.

description: From a lifelong cookie lover.. this is the best place to get cookies in all of the Bay Area, or even California for that matter. You have a ton of choices and they are all great! And they add their own spin on things that make it perfect for the Castro! If you are in the Castro and you aren't visiting hot cookie you are doing something wrong. Cannot wait to go back when I visit the Castro again!
author: Brennan A.

description:
As any of my friends will tell you, I would cross a country to try a new dessert. In the case of Hot Cookie, not only did I actually do that, but I would most certainly do it again. 

This is an adorable little store front in the heart of the Castro. They have a fun little twist on their cookies by adding items like the Penis and Venus, which I have yet to try, but fully intend on doing so. On my visit I tried the snicker-doodle, the double chocolate fudge and the chocolate cayenne pepper cookie (name?). They were all soooo wonderful! I really tried to share with my friends, but ultimately I finished those cookies in a day or so.

Do not pass this place up!
author: Scott H.

description: We had the chocolate chip toffee cookie and it was phenomenal. The best part about this small place though is the pics on the wall. Gotta love the ambiance!
author: Natasha V.

description: The energy here is amazing! Im originally from LA, so the penis cookie was a must! They let me choose my own size. Size doesn't really matter, but in this shop it does.
author: Monica Colleen D.

description:
Everytime I'm around the Castro I always stop by Hot Cookie for some goodies.  They have some goodies that look like your "goodies" or my "goodies", but they're goodies all the same if you know what I mean.  Their cookies are delicious and not overly sweet.  They run about $3 each and their "special shaped" cookies run about $7 a cookie.  Their popular "special shaped" cookie is actually more like a maccaroon and is actually very good.  It tastes like an Almond Joy.  

Their space is pretty small and cramped.  There isn't much room to wait so it would be helpful if you have an idea of what you want to order.  Everything is pretty good so you won't be disappointed.
author: Christine D.

description:
Hole in the wall in the Castro.  Their only vegan option was a gingergread cookie - which the guy ended up forgotten to put in the bag!

My girlfriend went back to get it, and I got two (we were seeing a show at the theater).  They were OK; I'm just not a big fan of sweet foods like this in general. 

Still, if you need your cookie fix in the Castro, then I guess this is the place.
author: Peter N.

description: Scrumptious and, as others have mentioned, often whimsically shaped cookies. Everything might be a bit expensive, but bear in mind that they charge by weight for treats that can be quite large and heavy. There's only a counter here, with no space for seating, so you'll need to eat your purchases on the go, or enjoy them in more privately sinful ways. A nice way to stuff your mouth full, especially if you're not up for other means of doing so. ;)
author: Vincent L.

description: All hail the penis cookie, covered in chocolate with coconut shavings on the balls. Just so you know, they do have other assorted sweets. I got penis cookies for my parents' 25th wedding anniversary, and it was a RIOT. Now I'm on a rampage of prank gifting many of my parents' friends and friends' parents. The cookie itself is alright through. I'm not a huge fan of coconut macaroons but you're totally in luck if you do like them. This is definitely something to cross off your bucket list if you are visiting the Castro District. I'll get over this phase eventually but in the meantime, it's hilarious!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Pros:
- giant chocolate-covered coconut macaroon on a stick is DELICIOUS
- seriously, that cookie was dense, chewy, perfectly sweet, and the right amount of chocolatey
- chocolate toffee cookie was thin, crispy and chewy
- friendly employees
- conveniently located next to a city patio where you can eat and watch people go by

Cons:
- tiny shop that can only fit 2 people at once
- macaroon on a stick is $8 (but it is pretty large and well worth it)
- kind of embarrassing to eat the cookie in public... but no one in the Castro is judging you :)
- they might run out of the special cookie (I bought the last 2 when I visited on a Saturday afternoon)

Bottom line: I recommend making a detour to get the special cookie: it's unique to SF and super tasty.
author: Jiann M.

description: Cute little place in the Castro! They had samples of a pecan cookie, and the employees also let me charge my phone that was barely surviving at 3% battery. Cookies were perfectly delicious and not too sweet!
author: Nahi K.

description: Best cookies! When u walk by the bakery u can't not go in. The smell fills the Castro streets with the sugary, pretzels and chocolatly flavors! The dick cookie is a must get well.... Because ur in the Castro! The cookie with Carmel and pretzels is also to die for. I recommend getting at least three a person, because they literally are better than a meal
author: Seana R.

description:
One of my RA's and I took about 40 freshmen to Hot Cookie last Friday night around 12am. Considering that they closed at 1am, we were scared there wouldn't be a variety, but we were wrong. Majority of the students brought the finely crafted penis cookies, and the rest of us got a mixture. The combination of cookies and naked men walking around in Castro was delicious. We will be back again very VERY soon :-) 
CASH ONLY$$$$$$$$$
author: Court S.

description:
Penis shaped cookies. San Francisco, I'm not even surprised. 

Pictures of men in their signature underwear all over the store. Possibly to entice customers? I was enticed.

Snickerdoodles: As delicious as everyone claims. A must try.

Rum balls: Can definitely taste the rum. Very fudgey.
author: Trang B.

description: Every time I come here they put more than what I ordered in the bag and never check the order so they know it's right... So I always get over charged... My fault I should pay more attention when they pack it:.. Cookies are great though
author: Natalie K.

description: I really love the "yesterday's" cookies here. But unfortunately the fresh made cookies are pretty expensive. The music is also very loud most of the time. I always have a hard time hearing and talking to the staff. Their cookies are pretty tasty though.
author: Cloud G.

description:
Of all the years I have been here and I have not written about Hot Cookie. WTF?

All the offerings are good. At late night, who doesn't want a chocolate chip cookie, or rice crispy with chocolate, or brownie.  Damn, how many nights have I sweetened my sweet tooth here and my stomach. 

My current love is the rice crispy bars. It is just filling after a nice leisurely day in the neighborhood. The size is huge. It must be a serving for 4 or just one big appetite and super fast metabolism.  Sigh......I fall for the first.

Hot Cookie, you keeping on baking cuz I will always be back.
author: Marck N.

description:
PENIS COOKIE
Yes, it is the only reason I came to this bakery...so my cousin could buy a penis cookie as a gag gift for a friend. They are pretty awesome actually. The macaroon is actually delicious and the balls are shredded coconut bits. The cookie is a couple bucks, which i think is too expensive...but if i really wanted to shock someone with a giant dick shaped macaroon, i'll definitely get it from here.
author: Debby L.

description: Toffee chocolate chip is my favorite followed closely by the white chocolate chip macadamia nut. The thing is there are so many great cookie shops in San Francisco it's hard to compete. Hot cookie differentiates itself with its fun...shapes rather than by cookie flavor and quality.
author: Jess C.

description: So many things were wrong about this place. For starters: they were out of almost everything! We did get there about an hour before close, but really. Out. Of. Everything. Nearly all cookies and completely out of ice cream. And the place was a mess behind the counter. We got a chocolate cookie of sorts... which would have been delicious, but the cookie was laced with cayenne pepper, without it being labeled as such. (Is that why it's called hot cookie?) It was so gross, it ruined the excitement I had about eating a cookie. The guy behind the counter was also meh. He didn't seem enthusiastic about working in a place with sex-themed food, or happy to serve me a hot cookie. I know I won't be going back.
author: Nicole H.

description:
Um, penis cookie!  

Don't lie, you didn't come here for anything else.   

Get your penis cookie, say yes to some whip cream on the tip, take some pictures, and scram!
author: Catherine C.

description:
Ok so the Castro district has a lot of different and interesting things to see. And this is no exception. I came her to see the myth since I initially didn't believe it, but, yes their signature cookie is the penis macaroon.

Yes that's two o's. Not the usual macaron I usually order, but the other macaroon, but more specifically the chocolate penis macaroon. 

It's pretty heavy, black, stiff, sweet and salty. Yes I ordered it, yes I ate it. Nice coconut shavings at the base. It's thick, and fulfilling. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/qZFRnzb-VTfkMC2vDoWJVA?select=uiVwstoWh2jEQaTAn1Yqng

They also sell regular cookies too so yah, I got a peanut butter cookie which was also pretty good.

So if you're in the Castro area next time you come up to SF, and you see the Hot Cookie sign with the big red neon lights, stop by and get some cookies or the penis macaroon. You'll leave Castro district satisfied.
author: Mike C.

description:
Interesting place and great to get some bachelorette goodies.

Love their cookies and the infamous penis & venus cookies.  They're pricey, but it's worth it and interesting.

You can find public parking in the back of the store.
author: Audrey C.

description:
You obviously have to get the penis cookie... Unfortunately I'm not a huge fan of coconut, so though it is good... it's pretty large (haha) and I just get over the coconut flavor very fast. but coconut aside it's very good!

the other treats are awesome as well! don't get too distracted by the penises... their brownies and standard circular cookies are delish!!
author: Terra C.

description:
While plenty of tourists come to Hot Cookie to giggle over the penis macaroon (which is pretty tasty, actually), I come for the big variety of other baked goods. The snickerdoodles are amazing, and the chocolate chip isn't bad either, but the best I've had is the toffee milk chocolate cookie. Thinner than a Specialty's cookie, it's also about the size of your palm and full of toffee flavored goodness. 

Hot Cookie is a good spot if you need a snack to go with your coffee or a little something in between meals!
author: Christina S.

description:
Size definitely matters. 

After a day of wandering in the City, treats from Hot Cookie was the dessert of the day (quite, literally). The best way to describe Hot Cookie is to picture your grandma sharing all her sacred recipes with sassy, eccentric friends...the kind wearing leather and rainbows. These cookies were H-O-T, hot. Melt in your mouth chocolate chips and chewy cookie bites. I'm drooling just thinking about them. 

I got the chocolate chip toffee, peanut butter chocolate chip, and the penis cookie. I didn't want to say penis, so I pointed to the cookie and said, "I'd like that." The counter server laughed and said, "It's okay to say penis." So I chuckled and said, "I want that penis." He totally called me out, and proceeded to say, "She got a penis" as my friend and I walked out. It was hilarious. I loved it. 

All the cookies were absolutely delicious--rich and packed with flavor. My favorite was the peanut butter chocolate chip! It's like a Reeses cup's sexy cousin. All the cookies were nicely portioned too--not too gigantic, but not small either. Size matters, right? ;-)

If you are ever bar hopping in the Castro or a tourist wandering the city, Hot Cookie is a good way to end your night.
author: Joanna S.

description: Awesome cookies and open till 1am, what's not to love? We paid $5.30 for two cookies, a "fudge packer" and a "pokies", the former being chocolate with chocolate chips and the latter a good 'ol M&M. For the more adventurous there are also some interesting shapes along the same lines as the names :-)
author: Andrew S.

description:
"Once you go ....., you'll NEVER go back"

Huge, rock solid, nutty and decadently covered in thick, luscious chocolate. MmMmm, say "AHHHH". 

P.S. - I'm talking about Hot Cookie's Chocolate Covered Coconut Macaroons which coincidentally happens to be shaped into a certain male organ, you naughty people. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/qZFRnzb-VTfkMC2vDoWJVA?select=iIL5yf3Nalp0-k0BSsVlFQ Tsk Tsk...
author: Cherylynn N.

description: This place is tiny, but it packs a punch. It's exactly what I want it to be. There's nowhere to sit or hang out, so be prepared to take your cookies to go. The woman at the counter was sweet and handled a packed space like a champ. All the cookies were ridiculously soft, buttery and downright delicious. The snickerdoodle was what I've always dreamed a snickerdoodle could be. The walls are covered with hotties in their signature red hot cookie underwear, and the treats have names with a good sense of humor. Against my better judgement and pursuit of a small waistline, I'll be back.
author: Kristina K.

description:
I frigging LOVE cookies. When my friend heard I was going to SF, she said I had to go to this place because it had the best cookies ever. 

Well, I was skeptical because it definitely not your typical cookie shop... but she was right. That was a damn good cookie. I regret not buying more to take home. 

Note: The only weird part was they charge you by weight of the cookie,  and not per cookie.
author: Jfo L.

description:
I stopped by this iconic cookie shop in Castro several days ago. While they are known for their macaroons, I opted for a small chocolate chip cookie to satisfy my sweet tooth. 

I opted for the smallest chocolate chip cookie size available. The cookie was very good - good flavour and appropriately baked (not doughy, not overdone). Not much to elaborate on... tasted like a good chocolate chip cookie. 

The service was kind and friendly. The atmosphere was fun and unique. Their cookie choices ranged from typical to amusing. All around, I'm glad I stopped by Hot Cookie. 

Verdict:
Worth a stop, if you're in the Castro
author: Laila A.

description:
There's always a wait and the cookie itself really isn't that great. I really wish they would offer it in a form other than a macaroon. 

But man......... when you see that thing, you just gotta have it.
author: Lana T.

description:
Important Note! I rate this shop PG-13 to R for sexual content!

This place is smaller than my closet, but Hot Cookie's cookies are my favorite cookies in the world. Sometimes there's a huge line, but once you get inside, the walls are completely covered in photos of hundreds of different people wearing the famous Hot Cookie underwear.

Meanwhile, the cookies are sold by weight. I love their classics like chocolate chip--perfect gooey center and slightly crisp outsides. I also love some of their more inventive cookies, such as the chocolate chip cookie with pretzels and caramel on top. They also have an amazing vegan ginger snap.Then, of course, there are the cookies shaped like penises and boobs, which add to the charm of this amazing Castro bakery. 

Hot Cookie also sells y-front underwear in black and red with "Hot Cookie" on the front. Unfortunately, they only come in smallish sizes. They have small through XL, but they all run really small, so the XL only fits maybe a woman's 8 or 10, or a men's 30in. If you're going to buy underwear there, buy big unless you want to get squeeeezed.
author: Allxie C.

description: This place is okay, but i've had better. I was lured by their trademark penis to check out this cookie powerhouse in the Castro neighborhood. It's very tiny shop, and they sell a variety of cookie and sweet treats. I tried several of the cookies, however I wasn't awed by anything I had. They were good, and I'm glad I went to check this place out, but I won't and don't crave these cookies or sweet treats. But still a colorful and fun place to visit if you're in town and want to spice up your night.
author: Tracy T.

description: REAAAALLLLYYY good cookies! may be a little inappropiate but really good! Great surprise
author: Yasuko R.

description:
I come here to get the D. 

lloll... 
other than that, their cookies are reallllyyy really good!

Favorite: SNICKERDOODLEEEEE
author: Jane N.

description:
As it turns out, Hot Cookie is not named for the temperature at which they serve their cookies.

The concept was silly and fun, but I was unimpressed with the product. I had the peanut butter milk chocolate chip cookie, and it didn't taste much better than one you could find at a grocery store bakery.

I won't be back.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Hot Cookie is definitely an experience to be had, whether you're here for the penis cookie or the other treats. I'm personally not a big coconut macaroon fan, and the novelty and price aren't enough to make me try it...BUT their other cookies are amazing! 

My favorites are the Cocoa Cayenne and the Toffee Milk Chocolate. The Oatmeal White Chocolate and Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip are also pretty yummy! The cookies are all moist and chewy, with a crisp edge that I absolutely adore. Coming from a girl who loves to bake, these cookies are really somethin'! 

Cookies are weighed by the pound, so if you really want a big one, you're gonna have to pay for it. The normal round cookies are about $2.50 a pop!

The bake shop is super tiny - probably only room for 3-4 people max, so you might encounter a small line sometimes, but it goes pretty fast. The walls are decorated with patrons sporting little red Hot Cookie briefs and the staff are all really energetic and friendly! Great place to check out!
author: Deanna Y.

description:
So Castro, So San Francisco and So Delicious!!! LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. I mean how can one not absolutely totally and completely love a place that literally only sells cookies (and some pastries) that are freshly made and then warmed up before they're handed over for you to devour???

My favorites are the white chocolate macadamia, the toffee caramel crunch and the snickerdoodle. The cookies are huge too btw. Oh and super cheap! Awesome as a quick snack or desert after dining on the castro. Also perfect after a late night of bar hopping. Do it, do it, do it. You will not regret it.
author: Sami F.

description: Because sometimes, you just want that cookie in your mouth to look like a big penis. Lol! Jk. (But why wouldn't you?) Anywhoo...the cookies... Sweet, buttery, sugary goodness. A bit on the pricier side, but quite delicious.
author: Jon M.

description:
Quite possibly the best cookie I've ever had in my life! 

My wife and I visited San Francisco and we wandered into the Castro to have dinner. We had great Thai food and wanted to try something sweet. 

After looking up some options on Yelp we found out about this little cookie shop on Castro St. The smell just smacks you in the face as soon as you enter the store: delicious bakery aroma, chocolate, banana, etc. 

The chocolate chip cookie and brownie I had were delicious; I just couldn't get enough. Creamy, crispy, yummy! 

I'm sure to drop by Hot Cookie if I go back to San Francisco!
author: Jonathan C.

description:
I can't go to Castro and not stop at hot cookie!

The iced brownies are my go to, must buy, every single time!! I also adore the pookie (m&m) cookie! Really everything is delicious!!

Be ready for a line though! There is no room inside of the store for people to wait so the line is outside on Castro st. Worth it every time! I've never been disappointed!
author: L S.

description:
With all the hype of the penis cookie, you would think the rest of the cookies might fail in comparisson, but it doesnt.
Their cookies are actually quite good!
If not for the fact that a homeless man was right outside blaming us for the "economical setback" Nike is going through right now, we would have loaded up on more cookies.
But just so were clear, the penis cookie is quite badass.
author: Ella A.

description:
MUNCHIE ALERT!!!!

So, my foodie downfall is pastries; specifically soft-baked cookies.  Omggggggg...... 

Okay, so, let me calm down for a second.  I don't go to the city that often (East Bay, woot woot!!), but I met up with a friend... broke my Muni virginity, and hopped off at Castro.  I saw a bright neon sign that said "Hot Cookie" ..... I thought it was some sort of adult-themed establishment, until I passed by and saw actual cookies on display.  I immediately made a mental note to go inside on my way back.  Of course, I forgot, and my friend had to remind me.

Anyway, so, it's a heelllllaaa small place... like, you can barely turn around in there, but that doesn't matter much.  Why? Cuz the cookies were boommmmbbbbb!!!  Of course, I wanted to order chocolate chip, but of course, they were out *side eye*.  So, I ordered the toffee chocolate chip cookie (which was sooooo good!!! I thought the toffee would be overwhelmingly sweet, but it isn't... it's the perfect balance of sweet/salty!!); the chocolate chip walnut (which was ridiculously bomb as well); and this almond snickerdoodle type of cookie..... each one was flavored soooo good, sprinkled just slightly with a dash of this or that to add that sweet and savory.... oh, and the chewiness with that sink your teeth into the dough type of situation..... oh lawwddd! 

Now, I will say, you don't necessarily get them "hot" as the name "Hot Cookie" might indicate... but, just pop them mofos in the microwave for a good 15 seconds, and you would swear they just came out of your oven.... from scratch!

Oh, one more thing.... they are kinda pricey.  You pay by the pound... so my 4 cookies of various sizes came up to $7.00....... I was low key shocked.... but when I started to eat em, I quickly forgot about that. 

Highly recommended to the cookie obsessed!
Will return... especially to try the butch bar and the penis cookie.... just because of the names.
author: Ebony B.

description: This is without a doubt my most favorite place to buy a cookie in San Francisco. It's located in Castro district and you may not want your kids to enter this location , because they have some racy photos and some racy cookies ,but it is delicious by far the best cookies in town. Buy some cookies and go home smiling.
author: Nuria R.

description: I am a cookie snob.  Paul does a great job.  Fresh clean natural ingredients baked to perfection and as Paul the owner states " filled with love".  I tasted the love.  Great job Paul
author: Brad P.

description: Sooo good! I had the California lovers and it was just the perfect amount of toppings: almonds, choc chips and coconuts. The cookie was dense and chewy, just the way I like it! I'm def coming back here to try the other flavors.
author: Samantha S.

description:
Toffee milk chocolate chip cookie was really really good! Soft and chewy!!
The mini chocolate chip cookies were yummy as well. Ate 5 within a few minutes.. oops.

They're solid cookies but i wouldn't go out of my way for them... will def stop by when i'm in the Castro tho! 

I wanted to try the penis and venus but i was too shy to ask the guy working, for it HAHAHA CRY....

ALSO...I  don't know why people are saying they only take cash because they took my credit card..... what?
author: Crystal B.

description: Not sure why the ratings are so good (except if you get kick out of cookies in genital shape)... I found this to be a disapointment.
author: SwissMiss B.

description: I went there to buy a cookie because they were highly recommended in every website of Castro district. They were right! It was one of the best cookie I have ever tried. They have lots of different flavors.  I tasted the one with milk chocolate chips which was warm and that made it even more delicious. It is a little more expensive that other places but it is worth trying it! If you are visiting the Castro district you definitely have to go!
author: Lucía Á.

description: That phallic penis-shaped cookie though. You can't really go wrong when you're laughing as you're biting into a dick-shaped cookie that's as big as the one permanently attached to one of your stupid exes lol.
author: Simonne S.

description:
I did it all for the cookie, the cookie, yup...the Hot Cookie!
If you're craving something sweet and wonder what the delicious aroma of baked goods is in the street, it's this place!

It's a tiny little spot, super friendly service, a delicious variety of freshly baked cookies, rice crispy bars, and much more. Their cookies are super soft, delicious, huge, and get several, you may not want to share too much, even if you are the most caring sharing person on the planet. Satiate your sweet tooth here!
author: Akvile D.

description: OMG cookies are my drug! And these are possibly the best cookies I've ever had! Also if you want to buy the underwear buy a size larger they run small!
author: Steven M E.

description:
I'm never saddened by a cookie, yet somehow, this time, I was.

Hot Cookie is a cute name, but unfortunately, the products don't live up to said name. The peanut butter chocolate chip cookie we got was room temperature and quite hard, and heating it up only dried it out even more. 

Maybe it was an off-night, but serious cookie disappointment keeps me from wanting to return.
author: Claire S.

description:
This is an interesting place to go to to say the least. The first time I went was with a few high school friends, and I'm glad because we were able to take in the decor and laugh about it rather than stand there in shock---because the walls are covered with semi/naked pictures of people eating their penis/vagina shaped cookies--but hey! It's San Francisco, what can you expect? 

The place is really small, like almost literally a hole in the wall, and everything they have on sale that day is on display right as soon as you walk in. There's no where to sit, so get that out of your head, it's a place to stop by after work or when you visit and then leave. 

(Price) Although they're not super crazy expensive, they are a bit pricey (in my opinion). They don't charge per cookie/dessert, but by the pound and that can add up quickly, but I've never hated a past purchase before!

(Cookie) The cookies are pretty good, although they're not actually "hot" they are "warm." They're not the best in the world, but not bad non the less...you should just go to say you've gone basically.
author: Cindy M.

description: Finally got to try some of the cookies here after hearing so much buzz about it. Pretty simple place (cookies! soft serve! underwear!), with a fun staff. Ended up getting some ginger cookies (awesomely good), snickerdoodles (good) and pecan walnut (good). Loved 1 of the 3 flavors I tried, but I did enjoy the other two (gotta love the chewiness!). Will hope to try again next time I'm visiting!
author: George P.

description: The most amazing brownies I have ever had in my life. Also the dick and lady pops taste like girl scout samoas .... amazing
author: Erin S.

description:
My first night of my trip to SF in the summer of '12 and I was craving something sweet. Lucky for me I walked right past Hot Cookie when this hit. At first I mistakenly thought it was a sex shop with its orange neon lights. I was sold once I saw the delicious confections through the window! 

Went straight in and ordered a chocolate chip cookie. Man oh man, was that one good cookie. It was big, chewy, chocolatey and decadent without being too rich. It was the perfect cookie. I really needed a glass of cold milk after that. 

After I devoured my cookie, I proceeded to check out the huge, penis shaped desserts. Boy, did they look tasty. Gotta love the Castro!
author: Leslie D.

description:
Searched for a dessert place one late night while I was in the Mission District. For some reason, I completely overlooked the fact that this is in the Castro, and their specialty is a Penis cookie. Had a good laugh on the way there, after discovering this. But $6 for a Penis cookie? It wasn't even THAT good, but I guess the size made up for it. LOL! 

Fun laughs, and makes for a great instagram-worthy photo, but don't expect much from the actual taste of the baked goods here, especially for how much they charge. If anything, it's more like a novetly experince than a foodie discovery. Nice that they're open late, but like the guy there said, "After 10pm, all you're really going to get is a Penis."
author: Anne S.

description:
Dang, I just spent $16.50 on 2 penis cookies and 5 mini chocolate chip cookies and 1 mini sugar cookie. I didn't realize it was THAT expensive. Wowza! 

Tiny establishment. After you take two steps through the door, your belly of cookies may have already touched the cookie display case. The penis macaroon on a stick is yummy if you're a fan of macaroon. It is also very filling. 

I believe they change their cookie menu every so often because they had sugar cookies (with green and pink sprinkles!) and it was so delicious! They got it down, chewy and still semi-crunchy. And the mini chocolate chip, as promising as always. Yummy!

I wish they did stamp cards or some type of frequent buyer card.
author: Jess W.

description:
Finally got back round to Hot Cookie to try that Mocha Cayenne & basically all the hype is true..... this cookie is the bomb! 

Fudgy on the inside & just a little crispy on the outside. Pepper gives a slight burn afterwards - which is exactly what I'm looking for in my pepper-choc treats. Not this savory chocolate doodad but a sweet chocolate treat w/ an evil spicy kick 

Congrats Hot Cookie - you got it right! 

Also indulged in another Toffee Choc Chunk & this 1 was way better than the other I had. Nice toffee flavor to it so maybe I just had an "okay" batch last time & not the usual cookie goodness this place is known for 

I say...... 3rd time is the 5-star charm! More cookies are definitely in order!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
It's so moist. So delicious and huge...that's what he/she said! Yes, they are know for their erotic shaped cookies...balls! 

Anyway, these cookies are amazing! I got an oatmeal and cranberry cookie, while my friend got chocolate chip. We both enjoyed our cookies before the show and I was a bit bummed though that he forgot to get milk. It would have been a perfect combination! This is definitely a great place to go for something sweet and fun!
author: Joyce D.

description: This place reminds me of the time when I baked cookies in High School and sold them for $1...I would come home with $100 a day. This is a small cookie shop that attracts people because of their famous penis shaped cookie. I enjoyed the experience and overall theme if this place. I can't wait to go back!
author: Chloé E.

description: This place is awesome! I got to try a chocolate chip cookie and a rice krispy treat. Both very fresh and tasty! The guy who helped me was so nice and I actually went at time when there wasn't a huge line, which was nice! Can't wait to come back and try more things!
author: Victoria A.

description: Best cookies after a night of dancing and drinking. The yesterday's cookies are literally baked cookies from yesterday lol. My favorite is macadamia cookies. They have small and big cookies. They also have brownies.
author: Daisy M.

description: We are regulars and this place does great cookies but recently the music they play is crazy loud hard-core ghetto rap with super explicit lyrics. Completely wrong vibe for the neighborhood. The customer service was surly when we had the temerity to point out they got our order wrong as they hadn't heard it clearly.
author: Jane W.

description: This is definitely one of my late night guilty pleasure's in San Francisco. Located in the Castro district it is very easy to stop by after going out for a drink or two with friends...Thru the years I have tried numerous different varieties they offer....I will say two of my most favorite are their take on the traditional chocolate chip and also the white chocolate macadamia nut. The prices are a bit step and you purchase the cookie's by weight but it hasn't stopped my from going yet....They cookie's are amazing and the staff is always great!
author: Shawn M.

description:
I LOVE these cookies! 

It's a small little place right across the bart Castro station. 

Every time I have gone there they have not left me dissapointed. I was always greeted with a smile and helpful service. My favorites are the sniper doodle and chocolate chip. For how big they are they are cooked to perfection with a gooey center. 

I'm sad that I can't get them more often. They are a little pricey but worth it. Definitely should check it out if you make a trip to the city. 

Remember to bring cash Cuz they dnt do cards.
author: Xtina C.

description:
Super small store right near the castro theatre. It barely fits about 4 people looking at the cookies that they had. But thats a small price to pay for some of the best cookies I've ever had. I, of course, had to try the penis shaped cookie, which had coconut as a big staple flavor, and I can't figure out what else is in it. But it was so delicious. They had drinks and other things of course to wash down the rich cookies. 
But overall I would totally recommend for anyone who is around this part of san francisco, looking for a quick sweet bite to eat.
author: Dmitrius R.

description: Pretty good cookies, not stellar or anything, but this cookie shop is a must-do. Come for the penis cookies, if anything. What's life if you don't try a penis cookie at some point? A day of exploration in the Castro is not complete until you've been here.
author: Cassie P.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE HOT COOKIE
as an sf resident this is my go to sweet tooth spot, can't beat the sweets here. They're classic and yet quirky & that's what I LOVE about hot cookie.
My faves in order(hard to put a number on them, as all the sweets are delectable here)
1. BUTCH BAR ----what heaven tastes like in a peanut butter/choco ganache form
2. Toffee Choco Chip cookies
3. Snickerdoodles
4. Penis Macaroon!! (DUH) Can't leave hot cookie without trying one, they're classic, and tasty, and they don't talk back.

GO TO HOT COOKIE RIGHT NOW YOU SEXY THANG YOU !
author: Alexandra C.

description: I wasn't super impressed with these cookies.  Yeah, they have a good gimmick with the private part cookies which is funny; however, the cookies themselves were just ok.  I enjoyed the butch bar but it was almost like cheating by putting a ton of peanut butter on top of a brownie.  The cookies are serviceable but nothing super special.
author: Julie M.

description:
Saw this place when I was waiting for a bus in the Castro. Skipped across the street and ducked in to order a little dessert :-)

Of course they are known for their penis - shaped coconut chocolate covered macaroon. So of course I had to get one. Everyone in my party agreed that it was just delicious. I also tried the chocolate and cayenne cookie, which was great with the kick at the end. My absolute favorite though was the chocolate chip walnut cookie. Thick, rich, and just the right balance between crunchy and chewy.

The boys behind the counter were adorable and eager to please. The cookies were pricey but hey, you get what you pay for.
author: Rene B.

description: Great staff and amazing cookies. Just perfect when all you want is a fat, amazing cookie.
author: Ty A.

description:
penises and snickerdoodles.


hella san francisco.
author: Susy C.

description: I tried to be safe by having a chocolate chip cookie among the variety. It was definitely one of the best I've had! It was crunchy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside. The only thing missing was either milk or ice cream to complete the amazingness. I'll definitely have to come back and be more adventurist and try some other flavors the next time I'm in town.
author: Christina D.

description:
This place has amazing cookies!  Very fresh and tasty!  Wonderful selection, and nice display.  I would have given this place 5 stars, if it weren't for the RUDEST girl on earth behind the counter. It appeared that she wanted to be ANYWHERE other than serving people cookies.  The constant heavy sighing and eye-rolling would have been annoying enough... but the snippy attitude (when she bothered to speak) was just the icing on the cake!

My husband and I bought $40 worth of cookies -- and the more we bought, the more annoyed she got.  It's like we were 'disturbing' her in her home.  Crazy!

We were there on July 4th at around 11:30am.  (Maybe that's why she was so snippy... because she had to work on a holiday?!?)  Everywhere else we went in the Castro -- people were so friendly and kind!  It was awesome!

Advice to management... Get her some SERIOUS customer service training, or let her go!  Seriously, she's not doing your business any favors.

However, we will definitely be going back -- because they do have great cookies!
author: J O.

description: Love this place! It's super tiny and cramped and it gets busy on weekend nights, but the line goes by quickly! The cookies are delicious and well worth the try. One of my favorite things about this place is that the music is almost always the s***! Give it a go :)
author: Rebecca J.

description: Nice size cookie for the price. They have coconut macaroons novelty cookies for both men and women. The best part is this place is open late night. Doesn't get any better than that.
author: Laloni B.

description:
omgomgomg...

I really don't want to pump up this place cuz once you find out about
it, there won't be anything left for me!!

one word... the BUTCH BARS!!  ok...two words..haha
see pic:   http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/qZFRnzb-VTfkMC2vDoWJVA?select=WjpGDnfr_IprkKRebIWeDA

another one word...white chocolate macadamia cookies....opps, four words!!

you get my drift..  if you are in the area, get it!!

Its at the end of the "F" line, around the corner, in the heart of
the Castro!

I came home with a bag full of goodies... enough to last me for
a week...ok, two days!!
author: Dale N.

description: The cookies definitely aren't the best in the city (try Anthony's) but it's open late, fills a craving and has the infamous penis cookies. If you're visiting SF for the first time, it's a must do.
author: Abby S.

description:
Bottom line at the top: amazing cookies!!
-
Had the sticky Nikki (salted caramel, pretzel sticks, and some chocolate chips- my favorite), Cocoa cayenne (chocolate cookie with white chocolate chips and cayenne pepper- second favorite) and the toffee chocolate which I would have passed on. 

Def would come back again!!
author: Dahlia S.

description:
As Michelle S. says, there's always room for dessert! 

While Hot Cookie is definitely convenient if you're in the Castro and hankering for something sweet, my inner cookie connoisseur wasn't quite satisfied.

Yeah, Hot Cookie's cookies were soft and chewy and there was plenty of variety especially for this macademian nut cookie lover. Coconut, peanut butter, macademian nut, ginger snaps, penis cookies, you name it! 

But they were a little too sweet for my sweet tooth and were they warm? Nope. 

Maybe next time.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Discovered their cookies the first night in San Fran & ate them multiple times during my short stay.  I even bought $60 worth to bring home.  I should note that 4 of them are my 'dick in the box' penis cookies for friends.  I really wish they would have one in Seattle...but maybe it's better I'm not too close to them.  I don't think the price was too high considering how good they are.  My favs are the chocolate cayenne & snickerdoodle.
author: Kim S.

description: Not only is this place fun and in a great location. The fact that its open late and still offers amazing tasting cookies(regular or fun shaped) and amazing dipped brownies(best friend with milk) just adds to a new fun sweet addiction. AND you can get it delivered through postdates! Definite plus for late night munchies!
author: Jenn K.

description:
I've been to Hot Cookie plenty o' times. Contrary to their name, you will NOT get a "hot" cookie, what you will get is a very scrumptious cookie and/or other sweet. If they were actually hot, the cookie would be much better. Tonight I ordered my favorite, white chocolate chip macadamia nut as well as something new (to me), toffee milk chocolate. They are very large cookies and b/c they are so soft, they are able to be torn apart easily. It is a bit overly sweet for my taste though. The place is really small. (Think cramped closet small) but it does have a lot of character and appeal. It IS in the Castro district after all.

The penis cookies are yummy as well (coconut macaroons in super thick choco coating and coconut flakes). However it's hard (lol) to finish it all on my own. The location is easy to get to if you're taking muni. Get off Castro and you're right across the street! 

-0.5 for the price though. I paid roughly $5.50 for 2 cookies and had paid $6 when I bought the penis cookie. Another -0.5 b/c I want HOT cookies.

Overall, I wouldn't come constantly, but I'd try it if you haven't. I know the appeal is their signature penis cookie, but others are worth trying too.
author: Emily M.

description:
Got the penis cookie.  I like it, but it's just too much to put in my mouth.

End review.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
Quite Possibly the Best Cookie "Review" Ever:

http://whilstinsf.tumblr.com/post/24346367219/making-a-stop-for-a-treat-at-hot-cookie

#TRUTH
author: Amy C.

description:
I was genuinely shocked to see Hot Cookie's 4 star rating on Yelp after going there a couple weekends ago!

My friend and I had just eaten a light dinner and were craving a warm cookie on our way to the Castro Theater. Voila - what a well placed business for our needs! I chose one of my normal faves - chocolate chip with macadamia nuts - and that was probably the worst $2.50 investment I've EVER made on a cookie. It was:
1) NOT soft.
2) NOT warm (forgivable. But it still should have been soft).
3) NOT tasty at all. It had a weird chemical aftertaste. This was worse than any generic grocery store cookie I've ever had.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
The people are always really nice, which is always welcome!  The cookies are average, most needing some extra salt...or something.  I just know they don't taste as flavorful as other cookies, like the ones I bake at home.  One, however is really good, the toffee chocolate!  That one is soft and flavorful.  

Unfortunately, even though the guy was super nice, the last time I went, he gave me 3 chocolate chip; instead of toffee.  They were also burnt and hard.  I have to say, that part is unusual.  However, when you are paying $2.50 per cookie, totally overpriced, you expect to get the cookie you order; and definitely not hard and burnt.
author: Delicious B.

description:
ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLY RIDICULOUSLY PRICED COOKIES!!  THE MOST EXPENSIVE IN THE CITY.  AND NOT THE BEST!

If you ever feel tempted by this place, see if they have any "Yesterday's" cookies available.  This is the only way I will buy a cookie from this rip off joint.

If you've ever noticed, there aren't that many locals standing in line for this place.  I think they make most of their money off of tourists visiting The Castro or drunk people leaving the bars.
author: Daniel S.

description: Had the chocolate macaroon which was good. Was hoping for more selection but was satisfied by our purchase. Went during pride weekend as was a great stop to make during our visit.
author: Jaclyn C.

description:
Fun place. 

Good sweets. 

Try the coconut macadamia nut cookie and the spicy chocolate one, too!
author: Janelle O.

description:
I did not get the chocolate penis because it had coconut in it.  I HATE coconut.  

I got their chocolate dipped brownie (thank you, Amy C.!), a chocolate rum ball (I don't know why I got this because I do not drink and hate the taste of alcohol), and I got a chocolate fudge/chunk cookie.  

Now tell me why I refused to incur fees, pull out cash at a random ATM for a cheesesteak but I was willing to incur fees and pull out cash for chocolates?  I did.. I had to pull out freaking cash because this is a CASH ONLY joint.  I was utterly disappointed.

Anyway.

The guy that helped me was nice and helpful and seemed shocked that the 3 items was all for me but hell.. who else would it be for?  Definitely not the baby in the stroller!  

The gist-

I finished all 3 before my 3rd block on Market.. as soon as I made that right from Castro, haha.  Yes, I admit and not ashamed to admit that I inhale my food.  The chocolate dipped brownie was good but I could easily replicate this at home.  The chocolate rum ball was OK.. I am not an alcoholic person so I'm not going to ding Hot Cookie for this but the chocolate was a dark chocolate which was yummy.  Their cookie was really good.. I think I'll put fudge in my cookies at home now; definitely worth the trouble even if the dozens that I will bake will be for myself.

Glad to knock this off of my bookmarks, finally along w/ Tartine and La Cumbre!
author: Tram N.

description: Loved the penis cookie along with the other freshly baked goodies. Go early in the morning to get them while they are hot!
author: Gail N.

description: When we heard about the whole penis cookie thing, we had to see it. Without a doubt, everyone was getting it, can't say I did, but that's because I don't like coconut. Got the brownie dipped in chocolate with white chocolate drizzle on a popsicle stick. Wow. This was truly delicious. At first, when I had it, i didn't think much of it, but when I tried it later in the day, it was actually really delicious. The staff was friendly and the service was very quick. If you find yourself in Castro, would recommend!
author: Steven P.

description: Love it.  A Castro staple from before I moved to the Bay Area, and now it is a must each time in Castro!
author: Douglas P.

description:
Don't let the phallic shaped macaroons fool ya, these are some serious sweets. We loaded up on Hot Cookie loot before a dazzling show at the Castro Theater, and effortlessly devoured the spicy Cocoa Cayenne and Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Walnut. And go figure, they were HOT too. 

$2.50 a pop ain't no bake sale prices, but this place is an SF establishment so consider it an admission fee with a tasty perk. Just don't bring grandma.
author: Nique F.

description:
If you want a no fuss delicious cookie Hot Cookie is the place to go. 
I tried the chocolate chip, toffee, and peanut butter and each were delicious. They tasted amazing and the flavors were simple and classic. They are large cookies crunchy on the outside soft on the inside. Perfect texture. I was recommended to try the penis cookies, but I do not care for macaroons. Although, people who enjoy macaroons tend to love them. 
The only negative thing I can say about this establishment is that the inside is very small and it is hard to maneuver around the tiny shop especially when it is busy. 
The reason I give this 4 stars instead of 5 is because they are damn good cookies, but not life changing. Although these cookies did not change my life. I am happier knowing I have had Hot Cookie.
author: Jeena R.

description:
I would've 5 starred you guys, but you had raisins in your oatmeal cookies. 

You guys should add chocolate chip instead of raisins! Plain oatmeal will do too.

Other than that, awesome cookies!
author: Marga T.

description: They have such a friendly staff every time I go in I'm never disappointed. The desserts are good as well, my first time trying the cookies and they are to die for!
author: Vika N.

description:
Looking to get your hands on some cock?  Cookie cock that is.  This tiny hole in the wall place is GREAT!  So glad they were open late.  Cookies were scrumptious and HUGE.  Must get the chocolate covered macroon shaped like a penis. 

Walls are lined with pictures of people wearing their signature underwear.  Some naked.  Hot.  Hot, hot, huge men, I mean cookies.  The scarlet letters draw you in.  If you plan on committing a caloric sin, this is the place for you.   So worth these sinful cookies.
author: Victoria C.

description:
Most of the people in line were talking about this penis macaroon, and once you walk into the tiny shop to order, you see the chocolate covered penis shaped coconut macaroon.  Ahh only in the Castro...

But seriously, their actual cookies are what stand out:
- Chocolate chip pecan: tons of pecans
- Cocoa cayenne: my favorite - a great kick from the cayenne, not too sweet
- Toffee milk chocolate: better warmed up
- Chocolate fudge: double chocolate, but didn't love the texture as much as for the other cookies

$5 minimum for debit, $10 minimum for credit card.

The best part is you can buy underwear that says hot cookie across the front!
author: Marilyn T.

description:
Stumbled in over the weekend amidst the chaos of pride and am super glad there was no line. I asked the cute girl behind the counter what the best selling cookie was and she said her favorite was coconut but that people liked the toffee chocolate chip. I'm all for toffee, so I was sold. 

The cookie was good. Perfect soft center/mid-section with the right amount of chew and consistent texture. 

I'm definitely planning on coming back.
author: Wennie H.

description: The only place I know of that sells giant penis-shaped cookies. They are chocolate covered coconut macaroons. They do not actually taste that good (too sweet and dry), but obviously they are not known for their culinary aspects and are just a $7 gag gift. They also had other cookies that looked good but I didn't try them.
author: Cynthia W.

description:
" Do you want a penis? "... So liberating to say... Sort of like..." Do you want a cookie? " 

Get the butch bar if you know what's good for ya :P
author: Selina W.

description: I have yet to try their famous penis cookies, but I have tried their regular cookies and they are delish! So soft and chewy and sweet. Perfect for my sweet tooth. Their prices here are pretty reasonable because they go by the weight, and cookies don't weigh all that much. Cocoa cayenne, choc chip, white choc macadamia, and snickerdoodle are my go-to's!
author: Janica V.

description:
what to order: the infamous penis or vagina cookies (great gag gift- pun intended ;)) and any of their cookies
tip: very small shop! easily missed on the corner

I didn't order the penis/vagina cookie but that's what they're known for. A guy in front of us had to turn around and let us know the cookie was NOT for him lol 

Anyways I ordered the coconut macadamia, white chocolate macadamia and toffee milk chocolate cookies. I am a connoisseur of white chocolate macadamia cookies and I was disappointed by theirs. Their cookies are thinner and harder to eat, not your soft and gooey type. I also thought some parts were too crispy, buttery and sweet.
author: Thuy-Vy N.

description:
A few Sundays ago, our group went to Hot Cookie after brunch at Lime.  Needless to say, I knew we were going to make some very smart and funny remarks after downing bottomless mimosas.

My gf got the mini-pumpkin and ginger snaps cookies, while my sis and I came here for the novel item: dark chocolate covered penis cookie.  It's really an ENORMOUS coconut macaroon. 

We came up with reasons why a cookie penis is better than the real one:
1.  No shrinkage
2.  It doesn't squirt you in the eye
3. The chocolate melts in your mouth and not in your hand
4. Hello! it's covered in DARK chocolate. It's really true -- once you go black.... =0
5. For about $6, it brings you happiness and you don't have to work hard at it.  BEST. DEAL. EVER.

After a few more giggles and photo shots, we headed home and took a nap. 

I woke up thirsty and opened the fridge to get water. I see the penis cookie in the fridge. 

I immediately took it out and yelled at my sis: "hey, you're not supposed to put it in here! it's gonna get HARD!"

Her reply: "oh good. Won't have to worry about erectile dysfunction then."
author: Janice C.

description:
Small space but big taste!
What I've tried:
Chocolate covered macaroons so big hehe and macaroon was so soft and tasty. Balls in my mouth are so good especially when they are edible and so delicious since they were covered in *sings* chocolate! HA
Almond cookie was good but not my fave
White chocolate macadamia always a hit
And a fresh baked out of the oven fresh chocolate chip cookie mmmmmm delish!
 next visit I will get me a chocolate covered hot dog on a stick! PENIS!!!!!
CASH ONLY!
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
Been here couple times before, I try to avoid it...don't need those extra delicious calories

Here was our order:

"I want two white chocolate macadamia cookies and a penis"
author: Long C.

description:
So, I haven't tried the penis macaroon because I went with my boyfriend and well, he doesn't swing that way. I've also been with another friend who likes to take lots of pictures to post on the internet, so I didn't get it that time. I wasn't about to buy a penis cookie to enjoy in my own home, LOL. 

Instead, I usually just get a chocolate chip cookie, which was chunky and warm. There are a ton of sexual innuendos I could use to describe this pleasurable experience with the words "thick", "warm", "salty and sweet at the same time", "feels good in my mouth", and "swallowing" but I'll leave that up to your imagination. 

As with many vices, this place is cash only.
author: Jenn C.

description:
What is it about things covered in chocolate? What is it about things on a stick? What is it about things shaped like a phallus? What is it that is so great about a penis on a stick? Well. It's something. Together, it's a sinful combination.

They're hard and they're waiting for you.

=======================

2 chocolate dongs on a stick + 1 chocolate brownie on a stick + 1 macaroon = 15.50$

I'll come back for the underwear next time.

They should make edible underwear.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
This is the only time I will ever pay for penis. Seriously.

I also buy my undies here. Yeeeeeeeeh.

I think they also sell cookies.
author: Elle L.

description: Ok I guess I'm confused. Came mid-day on a Tuesday to get a couple of yummy cookies. Not even busy and the girl working at the counter seemed like she didn't want to be there with her eyes rolling. I asked for a chocolate chip and snickerdoodle cookie and she grabs it out of the case, shoves it in a bag, and hands it to me.. cold. Wait, isn't this "Hot Cookie"? I know the word hot means something different but maybe I'm the only one surprised that a place called Hot Cookie served cold cookies. The taste was ok but a warmed up cookie would have made it way better.
author: Tiffany H.

description: This place a great after-dinner treat. I got the pockie, which was insanely chocolatey and still tasted crispy and fresh. The pictures on the wall were very entertaining to look at (but definitely not safe for kids). Overall I was impressed by the freshness of the cookie and would definitely recommend that everyone checks this place out at least once.
author: Lucy C.

description:
First, props for the name of this wonderful establishment! It may sound hilarious but I love the fact that their cookies live up to its name. The owners coincidentally make a gigantic macaroon cookie in the shape of a penis. :D Besides that and the red briefs covering the walls and windows of this place, everything else was pretty tame. I got their ding-dong cookie and a friend also ordered this chocolate covered brownie. 

Everything looked fresh and delicious. We ate our sweet treats the next morning. Even though it was a little stale, their cookies are actually quite good. Still moist and crumbly. One of my friends is an avid baker and to see his sign of approval for their confections makes me that much more confident to say that their desserts are good. :)

P.S. Their ding-dong cookie is so big that you divide over 2-3 desserts!
author: Jenny Z.

description:
Hole-in-the-wall cookie shop a few doors down from the Castro Theater and Twin Peaks. They dish out very delicious cookies, often still warm and crunchy, my favorites being the mini chocolate chips and the pokies. Note they weigh the cookies to determine the price. Don't be surprised that a cookie will cost you $2.50

Oh, did I mention they have penis and venus cookies?
author: Matt Y.

description:
