After I decided it was in the best interest of my career to delete my prior Hot Cookie review that was blatant soft core pornography, I hesitated to write another review, since I actually cherished the first version (in a non-sexual way). And how do you describe a homoerotic cookie stand and refrain from being tongue in cheek????

With that stated, I firmly (hehe) believe these are the best cookies in SF. I love their snickerdoodles, their chocolate chocolate chunk cookies, and their peanut butter chocolate cookies. They are soooooo warm and rich and just utter perfection when they're fresh out of the oven!
author: Emily D.

description: Love their cookies! I always treat myself to one whenever I happen to be in the area.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Had the white chocolate macadamia, milk chocolate toffee and the peanut butter   All were ok  but seemed to be missing something.  Frankly, you can make better at home.  What's entertaining here are the penis cookies that they decorate with a squirt of whipped cream at the end.  Hilarious.  The challenge wall is also a trip. 
A little too pricey for what they are but about right for their locale.  
I'd go back if really hungry for a cookie and in the area but not by way of a special trip.
author: Tad H.

description:
Must stop place if in the Castro, love all the cookies! So soo good!
Pecan an chocolate chip are the best!
author: Mateo M.

description:
Small as a shoe closet, but cannot complain - service & goods were absolutely lovely (we were helped by a newbie, but she was so sweet- like the cookies!) 

Grabbed the regular chocolate chip, toffee chocolate chip & California cookie.  Yummy yummy yummy in my tummy!

We skipped the famed penis macaroon cookie, but go for it, by all means.  I cannot imagine anything there being anything less than addictive (damn their baking prowess!)


I'd be here more often if I lived close by (lucky for my pancreas I don't!)
author: Minnie S.

description: Best cookies I've ever had. But also the smallest establishment I've ever been in. I could touch both walls by just extending my arms. I grabbed the California Chocolate chip cookie and the Penis and Venus cookie and both were delicious. Don't think too much into it, go for the experience. It'll definitely be one you'll remember for a long while.
author: John S.

description:
All i got to say is wow, I'm a fan of the Black penis cookie although a bit too sweet I don't mind but beware if you are allergic or not a fan of chocolate or coconut you half been warned, you should avoid these at all cost but buy another type of cookie since they have probably around 20+ different kinds. (It's kinda weird coming into this place so many times and finally getting a x-rated cookie without laughing or grinning)
Also the black penis cookie which cost $7.50 which in my opinion was worth it tastes exactly like a bigger xxx version of Mounds with toasted coconut
Overall: I will come back to this place definitely to try the other cookies 7/10
ps. saw this guy in the back, i think he was making the cookies, all I got to say is omg i think I have a crush on him cause of him Hot Cookie gets a 9/10
author: Food F.

description: Everything is good, you won't be disappointed. Get the penis cookie, just do it. My friend got the cookies and they were perfectly chewy and soft but crunch on the sides. Definitely coming back!!
author: Sophie H.

description: All I can say is the chocolate dick cookie was really good. It took me about 2-3 days to finish it. They asked if I wanted whip cream on it. Lol. It was during Santa-con so we saw some interesting costumes. Dog friendly area. My friend got the boxer briefs. Oh the cookies are good as well.
author: Nicole F.

description: I get the touristy appeal, but the cookies were not that good.  The penis cookie was dry and not really enjoyable.  Basically, if you get the penis cookie, you are paying about $7 to take a funny picture taking a bite before you end up throwing it out.  Everything else is OK.  I would stop in just to stop in, but I wouldn't come back.
author: Jon Q.

description:
I loved the chocolate covered macaroon, but you have to be a coconut nut to do so. The chocolate chip offering was okay, but I've had better in my hometown of Sacramento (nod to Cookie Connection and Goodie Twochews).  If I'm around in the Castro again I will make a point to stop by.

They do have a line of racy cookies that are pretty hilarious.  The bachelorette party in front of us had a great time picking out their "snacks".
author: Kat M.

description: This place is fun. Graphic nudes of people wearing hot cookie underpants posted about and cock shaped coconut macaroons. Since this place is such a novelty kind of place I expected it to be crappy tasting but it's also delicious!
author: Amanda E.

description:
Stellar employees! Shout out to Jeremy  
I called all the way from NYC bc we found a batch of Hot cookie mix in our cupboard, with no instructions. Realizing that with the time difference Hot Cookie was still open, we called to find out how to make the cookies. 

Jeremy answered and happily gave me the recepies over the telephone. He was funny, friendly and extremely professional, saying that he was happy that someone in nyc was eating Hot Cookies!  Great service but most of all great attitude. 

Ps we tried  making a penis cookie. We called it a cock-ie. Ha!
author: Mary L.

description:
Of course this was the first place to catch my eye, my very first time stepping off that street car to check out the Castro. I had an urge for something sweet so I got their best selling cookie, the toffee chocolate chip and it blew my mind. Possibly the most delectable, perfectly moist and toffee-infused gourmet cookie I've had in a long, long time. I didn't even want to share-MUST GO BACK FOR MORE. 
Oh yeah, the place itself was decked out with photos of almost nude men in 'Hot Cookie' briefs and then they also had penis-shaped cookies which didn't really stand out to me, coming from living in Taipei where they sold penis-shaped custard waffles and growing up in Portland, home of the infamous voodoo donuts. 
If you're in the Castro, you must have a cookie from Hot Cookie.
author: Kalong W.

description:
Mrs. Field's who!?!?!?!?!  You haven't had a cookie until you've had a "Hot Cookie" cookie.  I'm sure everyone needs a good phallic shaped cookie, especially when in the Castro. However, if you're in the mood for something more traditional, I would recommend my personal favorites: The White Chocolate Coconut Macadamia Nut  and the Toffee Chocolate Chip.  The cookies are soft (I'm not a fan of the crunchy, fully cooked cookie), and flavors balanced.  

It hard to just buy a cookie or two, but if you want the chance to grace the photo covered walls of Hot Cookie, while clad in their signature red underwear, that's the right number to stop at :).
author: Antaash U.

description:
How have I not ever set foot in here in all my time in the Bay Area?? Oh yeah, the ANNOYING WALL OF EXPLICIT HOT COOKIE PICTURES. Is this a cookie shop or a nightclub??

Firstly, I thought Mrs. Fields had no competition but then I finally set foot in Hot Cookie with a friend. The original chocolate chip cookie is to die for. I also had some of the M&M cookie which I thought was just the candies on it, but no it was the candies ON TOP of a chocolate chip cookie - DOUBLE the chocolatey goodness!

Pros: 

+BIG COOKIES, interesting shapes and flavors, freshness.


Cons: 

- Very small shop, only about 3 people can fit in there at a time and the door is in the way if you're waiting for someone to make up their mind on what they want from the middle rack while you're waiting to get in or out or to the other side lol

- Not to be a prude but this is NOT a kid-friendly place (ahem, PENIS shaped cookies??) and if you absolutely DO get dragged in by kids who manage to break free from your shielding hands to see the big Hot Cookie sign, BY ALL MEANS at least shield their eyes from that horrible wall of shame; a wall where customers submit themselves basically wearing nothing but Hot Cookie underwear; primarily gay men of course because it's Castro...the icing on the cake was one pic I noticed of a guy actually NAKED and covering his junk either with his hand or with the underwear, or maybe the underwear was half down or something...either way very distasteful and unclassy and not to mention at the same height level of a potential kid who happens to be browsing the wall. Only saying all this because tourists do stop in Castro too...

I'm not being a hater I actually despise any business that does those kinds of picture walls, it's like just stick to your product you don't need random heavy advertising especially of THAT sort.
author: Marquis A.

description: AHHHHHH. Personally I don't feel awkward eating a 7 inch chocolate covered penis shaped thing. BUT WHEN IT IS THIS AMAZING. I meant so DELICIOUS. You wouldn't not want to show it off to others. The penis was absolutely delicious, better than it looks and better than I had expected. DEFINITELY, I would show off eating this, so others can ask where I bought it from, and I would no doubt recommend this place. Small little shop, as convenient as can be because literally across from MUNI station, in front of a bus stop and around the corner of a bus stop! Super duper convenient and delicious. Great for a snack and some dessert when craving because plenty of sweets!! Next time I will come back (maybe try the cookies) but would definitely sometime come back for the penis. Honestly if your a almond joy fan, you would love this treat; but of course, much better than almond joy.
author: Wendy T.

description: The cookies are the size of personal pan-pizzas so be prepared with the insulin shot.  Thus far, every flavor that I've tried is scrumptious.
author: T S.

description:
Hot Cookie is a very interesting spot. Notable for their cookies shaped like the naughty bits, they also have a solid array of other cookies. It's a really small place, and the walls are plastered with pics of semi-naked people wearing Hot Cookie underwear.

I opted for a chocolate cayenne cookie - quite tasty. The cayenne was pretty subtle, although hit you in the face as you continued chewing. A bit too much for me, but my girlfriend liked it.

There's a lot of novelty and hype surrounding Hot Cookie, but it's definitely a spot to stop by and check out for yourself! If it's for you, by all means, come back for more. I'll give them another go the next time I find myself in the area. The cookie I had was yummy, so I'd like to see what else they have.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Ah yes....where does one go to find a penis shaped chocolate dipped coconut macaroon, complete with "hairy" (coconut flakes) balls? 
Why the Castro, of course, you silly goose!
What a crack up this place was...very teeny, and in case you have an accident gorging on their cookies, they sell red, men's underwear with HOT COOKIE  written on the front (and a wall of fame of several people wearing them!)
Great variety of cookies, the butch bar was a chocolate and peanut butter lovers wet dream...chocolate cookie crust, peanut butter filling topped with about a quarter inch of dark chocolate. The chocolate chip and snicker doodle were huge and yummy, but definitely on the sweeter side. The cookies were fresh, but not hot, which was a disappointment in a place called  HOT COOKIE.
Go for the novelty, enjoy their sweet cookies...you're bound to find something you like.
author: Nina B.

description:
Best cookie I've ever had. No joke. What an interesting little shop in The Castro. 

I was actually looking for French macaroons (Yelp failed me lol) and they definitely do not have those here. The staff was more than helpful and sent me in the right direction. I'm STILL thinking about that cookie a week later!
author: Samantha S.

description:
Heard about this place from my recently engaged co-worker. I was trying to get ideas of how to decorate a bachelorette party and she quickly suggested Hot Cookie and their delicious array of desserts ;)
I absolutely love the choices of cookies especially the rated R ones! Such a great shop to have near by and if you are in need of something different to give someone as a gift this is totally the place to come!
author: Natasha I.

description:
I like how even though the guy behind the counter's heard it all, I still made him giggle.  

Me: (lays eyes on the penis cookie) "OMG that's so big!!"  
HIM:  HEHEHEHE....
Me: I'll take one penis cookie.
HIM: That'll be $6...enjoy your penis!
Me (laughing inside my head)

Delicious dark chocolate covered humongous & heavy coconut macaroon.  I felt so guilty eating that huge cookie.  Would I buy it again?  Probably not.  But at least I can say I crossed that off my list.  They apparently sell vaj cookies too but I didn't see any made (just the sign).  Only in Castro!  =)
author: Cat C.

description:
Have tried different types of cookies here and they are pretty good but not amazing.

Their chocolate covered macaroon, however, is the best in the city and possibly the best I've ever had.  At  most other places the macaroon filling is stale and mushy and the chocolate is gummy.  Here, however, the macaroon is luscious with a thin slightly crispy crust, and the chocolate is high-quality and has a satisfying snap.   For this item alone, they get five stars.
author: A K.

description:
So disappointed. I came in with my boyfriend and his cousin for some cookies and treats and ordered multiple things but only reiceved half. we told the guy what we wanted and then I walked out side to wait for my boyfriend to pay since it as crowded .

So to start with I order a rice krispy treat that had m&me on it I think  and never received it and ordered 4 keyan chocolate cookies but  received only one of those ,  which of the 4 items I never received I got charged for.  You really should pay more attention to your customers.  Amazing cookies but if I'm going to get charged and not even receive all my stuff I paid for I will spread the word and not return. Poor customer service.
author: Danielle B.

description: still good!  i didn't plan on  getting any cookies but ended up buying 3.  those chocolate penis popsicle cookies with coconut pubic hairs were still there!  who buys those??? lol
author: Brian K.

description:
I was wandering around the Castro with some friends when we decided that we were in the mood for something for our sweet tooth and happened upon Hot Cookie.  This small storefront is very unsuspecting, but produces some very delicious (and dare I say sinful) baked goods and has super friendly staff behind the counter to make your visit fun.  Why wouldn't you want to enjoy some sweet treats AND be able to buy some branded underwear at the same time?

I tried bites of a couple different things and have to say that the toffee milk chocolate cookie was my favorite as it was out of this world delicious.  As a self-proclaimed rice krispie lover, I appreciated that they had a classic flavor and then several variations with toppings like chocolate drizzle and M&Ms.  Of course if you like a good macaroon, they have specially shaped chocolate covered macaroons like only the Castro would.  

There is a theater nearby (that plays sing along Disney movies!), so just a warning that this place can get very busy if you are there the same time a show gets out.  By the time we walked back past the store, there was  HUGE line out the door, so I am glad I was there at the right time when I could walk in and order.  Can't wait to be back!
author: Maria K.

description:
Hot stuff.  You see what I did there?  HAHA.

Of course, came by Castro to try one of the (in)famous penis and vagina shaped cookies.  They are HUGE and cost ya $6.25, which I can say is somewhat worth what you pay for.  It's a coconut macaron cookie covered in chocolate and sprinkled with coconut shavings, or at least the penis-shaped cookie is.  The vagina cookie is by far almost double the size of the penis-shaped cookie.  Cookie itself was good, despite the fact that the chocolate was pretty much melting just by the temperature of my hand as I was holding it.  Not a fan of coconut, but the macaron was delish.

The store is super small though, wasn't what I expected.  Selection is pretty okay, they seem to have a lot of variety, but their pastries run small (their cookies are tiny).

Gotta love the walls of pictures of half-naked people trying to look sexy posing with a penis-shaped cookie.  Yeah, not really sexy.  But hey, if it attracts people, by all means.

Will I be back?  Maybe.  If I were in the area, but not for a penis-shaped cookie again.
author: Fanny H.

description: Most adorable workers ever! :D Great service and fun crew!! ^-^ Yay! I love love love there white chocolate macadamia nut! Also the Venus and Penis cookies are always a fun blast! :)
author: Ariel S.

description: Love this place!! This little store is filled with some many things to try and hundreds of sexy pics see! My favorite is the Sexy Brian bar! Warm it up 15 seconds and OMG heaven!!!
author: Jeffrey B.

description:
Found this place when I first moved to SF about 5 years ago. It really opened my eyes because I was a girl from a small town in the central valley and here I am standing in a little cookie shop, with photos of men and women on the walls in just the signiture "hot cookie" underware. Interesting.

Employees are kind and are willing to answer any questions you have about the cookies. These cookies are all very delicious! They have the regular cookies like chocolate chip and snickerdoodle. But they also have some fun, different cookies that they offer as well. 

Alright, lets tackle the elephant that has appeared in this review...PENIS COOKIES!!
Yup they have penis and balls and they are absolutly devine. They also have a womans mid section but I feel like the cock and balls is the best one. its dipped in chocolate and they add a little bit of coconut to the balls to look like...well you get the point. Its a coconut macaroon, which makes sence because they are easy to shape and mold into shapes, and its dipped in chocolate. Its a rather large cookie and I usually cut it into pieces and keep it in the freezer for a late night snack.

All the cookies are reall good and I recommend trying them all. Dont just jump right for the penis cookies, try all the little ones they have to offer. You wont be disappointed. 

A little side note: They do sell Hot Cookie Boy Briefs that are really cute and comfy to ware.
author: Lizzie D.

description:
Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip is where it's at!!! 

I've been coming here since I was in college, and the peanut butter chocolate chip is what keeps bringing me back!  I've also tried some of the other flavors and they are also pretty good. My favorites are:

Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip - My all time favorite. It has the right amount of peanut butter and chocolate chip. I love that there are chocolate chips in every bite! 

Chocolate Chip- You can never go wrong with the classic Chocolate chip! The chocolate chips are chunky and again you get chocolate in every bite. 

Coco Cayenne- My husband actually wanted to try this because they were out of the peanut butter cookie. And to our surprise it's actually very tasty!!! I know it sounds crazy to have cayenne in a cookie, but you won't be disappointed.  The cayenne pepper really kicks in as an after taste and is very subtle. If you're up to trying something new, this is the one to try. 

Chocolate fudge - I don't love this one, but my husband and all our friends love this! It's very fudgy with huge chunks of chocolate. It kind of reminds me of a fudge brownie.  Don't get me wrong, it tastes good; I just prefer more a classic cookie! !

**insider tip** They tend to run out of the peanut butter chocolate chip at times, so if you really want to try it, give them a call to see if they have it! 

Be aware that there are a lot of pictures throughout the shops of people wearing the "hot cookie" bright red briefs.  If a little nudity scares you, get past it. The cookies are totally worth it!! :-)***
author: Megha P.

description:
I've always wanted to try a dark chocolate dick and Hot cookie has answered my calls!

I went one night with my best friend and boy was it GOOD. I got the penis cookie and it tasted like a wonderful Girls Scout cookie called Samoas. So heavenly, so delicious that I tried to not eat it all in one bite. Too bad my mouth is not big enough for that :(

I heard once I go black I can never go back, but I think I could always come back to hot cookie! 

Oh if you go after 6pm there should be public parking about a few stores down!
author: Grace C.

description:
Who doesn't love a large tasty cock shaped macaroon cookie covered in chocolate?!
Especially in Castro?

I sure do.
Yum.

Made two stops in here recently and tried a few different cookies. All were pretty damn delish.
The Snickerdoodle is killer too.
author: Tim W.

description: I got a Fudgepacker cookie and it was delicious! Although it is a little embarrassing having to order a "Fudgepacker". The only reason I rated it four stars instead of five is because it's so tiny. I was in a group of three, and we completely filled the shop. It felt super claustrophobic. But the cookie was great and the service was friendly!
author: Emily R.

description:
Best cookies in the Bay Area!
Peanut butter chocolate chip are my favorite.  
Only wish they made their Hot Cookie Hot Pants in a bigger size!  Lol
author: Christine L.

description:
Who doesnt love a big ol' penis cookie now and then? I know i do!

Aside from the cookie shapes, the cookies here are pretty good. Try the Toffee Chocolate Chip, Yum City! 

Staff is very friendly, price are reasonable.
author: Mya M.

description: Cookies are delicious especially when they're fresh and "hot." They only take cash. Total tourist spot so we love to bring our friends who aren't from the city to see the "goodies" inside!
author: Nawal W.

description:
It was a great experiencing a dozen cookies, then watching various people come in.

More often than not, faces lit up with joy.  The selection is fantastic, and there a number of things that I've never seen, nor heard of...like a butch bar.  Try it, you'll like it!  (Unless you can't do chocolate or peanut butter.)

This one person didn't even look like he could eat a cookie, much less look at one... (Very toned, no-carbs-diet-looking fellow.)

Would ask for something, and then the staff would offer varieties.  (Chocolate covered? With walnuts? Do you want one with sugar, etc)  this person's eyes lit up even more.  

I've seen this look with beloved pets that realize you have more than one treat in your pocket.  This guy spun around a few times. Giggle.

I'm glad these folks provide this kind of service.  I really am.  Temptresses, all of them!

I've also ended up tipping certain performers with these baked goods.  Giggle.  I think they appreciate it more than money (sometimes).

Did I mention that this place sells their own underwear?
author: angel a.

description:
A penis cookie. Covered in chocolate with a macaroon filling. 

Where else are you gonna find such a thing? I came here around 1 yesterday and was instantly greeted by the worker behind the counter. :) A penis cookie here is $6.25 and I have yet to try it, but I am definitely having high expectations for it due to the many positive reviews! :) I wanna come back soon and get the "Venus" cookie which is a cookie in the shape of a woman's body.
author: Venus L.

description:
Hot Cookie is fabulous, and I say that as a completely heterosexual male from out of town. 

Or rather, the desserts from Hot Cookie are fabulous, and a great reason to stop off in the Castro after dinner. If you look beyond the barrage of NSFW photos tacked up on the walls of this extremely tiny shop, you'll be treated to a solid variety of sweets. The toffee chocolate cookie was the size of a baby's head, and it was perfectly soft and not overwhelmingly sweet. I could eat a couple of these at a time without feeling like a total fatass. The butch bar is the polar opposite of that cookie, a mammoth chunk of peanut butter and chocolate fudge, with graham cracker thrown in for good measure. Take more than a few bites and you'll get the sugar shakes for the rest of the day - so give it a good chop with a knife and eat it in several sittings. 

Good prices, solid service, long lines, all in a district that's friendly and outgoing. The Castro is so over the top, and Hot Cookie - big black cock cookies and all - exemplifies that.
author: Eric F.

description:
The only positive thing about this place is their service. I had a patient and friendly man service me while I was indecisively trying to make me decision.  
My friends and I wanted to try this place out since we heard so much about it...and what a disappointment it was.

There was nothing special about their cookies, minus the fact that they are in a shape of a penis and vagina. 

It's definitely overrated, I won't be coming here to waste money again.
author: Lisa L.

description:
They're probably know for their erotic cookies, I haven't tried them, but now I know where I can get one if I wanted to. 

I've tried a few of their cookies: 

Macadamia Nut and Chocolate Chip Nibblers. I didn't think they were too special.
author: Elaine N.

description: So excited. I finally got to go this place. It's in a convenient location close to Market and 17th. There was only 5 people in front of me in line and it moved rather quickly. I got to try the chocolate chip cookie, the chocolate cayenne cookie and the nut/pecan cookie. All the cookies are btw 3 to 4 dollars so a little pricey but so delish. I'm definitely coming back, plus the Castro is so much fun.
author: Ellie P.

description:
While the cookies here are expensive, they are delicious. It's easier on your wallet if you buy the day old cookies available for a steeply discounted rate, most of which are still chewy and not that hard. I usually get the Oatmeal Cranberry, toffee chocolate chip and macadamia.

Staff is usually friendly, there are a few whose customer service skills could use some work, but overall I'd say they're decent.

Finding parking is hard here, you either have to park a couple blocks away or have someone drive around while you're in the store.

Be sure to bring cash, because this place doesn't accept cards at all.
author: John A.

description: Tiny TINY place. A line out the door means there are more than 4 people in line. I'm a real fan of the Butch Bar (chocolate and peanut butter) and the Sexy Bryan Bar (seven layer bar). I also like the Pokies (cookies with M & M's inside) and the ones with toffee. I think some of the staff could be nicer, but I'm sure working in a hot closet would make me grumpy, too.
author: Dave M.

description:
Live down the street and this place is incredible. I'm also a HUGE fan of coconut macaroons, and everything is better with chocolate, so I definitely have to recommend their special that they are known for.

Also had the snickerdoodle when I went, and that was incredible as well. Honestly though, I am a chocolate person so I naturally preferred the chocolate covered one over this.

One thing that you HAVE to know is to bring cash! They are open late but honestly, can't they start taking credit card?
author: Chrissy H.

description:
There's a lot of hype about the penis cookie and pictures of people in their underwear but the best things at Hot Cookies are their traditional staples: small chocolate chip cookie and the ginger cookie (the later is even vegan!).

Both are slightly crunchy on outside and soft on the inside, melting in your mouth - just perfect. 

Flavors are clean, distinct and fresh - never oily or stale.

I'm a cookie addict and have been coming here for at least 7 years. I still think they are better than Anthony's. 

My only quibble is that customer service vary greatly by person... There are amazing welcoming, efficient staff like the lady with the shaved head. Then there are some unwelcoming, inefficient staff like this young blond who has heard me wrong a few times, only to snap back when I correct her on what flavor I want. Not sure how this has happened more than once and how she can heard something besides "chocolate chip" when I never had an issue with anyone else. 

Cookies are perfect; some staff may be over baked.
author: April K.

description: Hot cookie is a landmark in Castro. If you are visiting Castro you should definitely stop in and get a cookie. Then penis cookies are very fun to buy as gifts. I have tried the chocolate chip, peanut butter, oatmeal, and macadamia cookies. The energy of this place is always fun and they have tons of pictures up on their walls showing of the many hot cookie customers.
author: Paul D.

description:
I only had one cookie there, the chocolate Cayenne pepper chocolate chip cookie. It rocked!

The place is tiny and packed with customers, so I only got a quick glimpse at the penis shaped cakes. They looked fun. There's a cool vibe about this little store, I'd love to go again.
author: Julien N.

description: From someone who has a perennial sweet-tooth, Hot Cookie is pure heaven. The cookies are large, moist and chewy. To save some dough (see what I did there?), they sell a selection of "yesterday's" at a discount.  Oh, and you  must try their "Butch Bars," a rich chocolate peanut butter brownie concoction.  The best part is, you don't even have to be butch to love them.  I ought to know!
author: Donald P.

description:
For as much as i was paying today for my 8 cookies the least the person at the counter could have done was make sure they weren't broken and were given to me within 5 minutes that I ordered them. Within his 
Time from the order to his time actually handing me them, he checked his phone twice. This was a very bad customer experience overall.
author: Gabe G.

description:
Cookies: 
1) Cocoa cayenne cookie: at first it tasted like a typical chocolate cookie with white chocolate chips but then the spicy cayenne pepper kicks just as you swallow the delicious chewy bite!! I really liked this interesting combo of sweet and spicy! 
2) Toffee milk chocolate cookie: Best cookie consistency EVER!!! This was the epitome of what the BEST chewy cookie should be like! The cookie is very big too so you get plenty of this little gorgeous piece of heaven!! 

I really want to come back and try the rest of the cookies!! YUM!! SO GOOD!!!! I feel like I'm going to have cookie dreams about this place until I return........
author: Amiee H.

description: This place has such yummy cookies!!! My favorite is the chocolate covered macaroons! Omg amazing! ( you don't have to get the certain shape) they have individual pieces as well ..also a must try is the coco cayenne!!!
author: Brianna L.

description:
My friend brought me here because it was one of her fave cookie shops in Castro! She didn't warn me ahead of time, though because...there were 2 nerdy Asian boys in their hot red underpants dancing and prancing! @_@ Actually she said I was lucky since she never encountered that from the many times she's been there. I don't know if I would call that lucky...these might've been the most "outrageous" things these 2 nerdy Asian boys have ever done in their life! I tried not to stare; didn't want them to feel bad from seeing my eyes roll... 

Any who, the cookies were SO GOOD! I got the coconut macadamia cookies while my friend got the toffee chocolate and the chocolate macadamia. The cookies we got were so yummy. Chewy and fresh out from the oven. Cookies were thin-ish but big and it was $2 (although I think they also weigh it, so it might cost more if it weighs more?) It was one of the best cookies I've ever had. SO GOOD!!
author: Natalia H.

description: Hot Cookie reminds me of a provocative, sexy Mrs. Fields! Their Toffee Chocolate Chip Cookie was so rich and gooey that I felt guilty eating it. Delicious! Apparently this cookie is also the one that sells out first! Love it!
author: Debra T.

description:
Pricey!
The place is small and doesn't look too clean?
We came for the penis macaroon obviously! They don't display the prices. We got two and they were 7 or 8 dollars a piece.
Kind of tasty, but probably won't return. 
The place is over hyped because of that penis cookie!
author: Nona T.

description:
Yes i had the penis cookie and it was pretty damn good
 Its a macaroon cookie covered in chocolate. It actually taste a lot better than i expected considering I really don't like chocolate all that much and not a big fan of coconut. The girl working there was super friendly.

The inside is tiny however, cannot fit more than 3 or 4 people at most. The "cookie" came out to a little over $6 i believe which is not bad because its HUGE!
author: Alecia R.

description:
I am dreaming of hot cookie now... The only reason that I could possibly give Hot Cookie anything but a 5 star review is because they aren't doing business in San Diego. Ok, all levity aside... Hot Cookie is freaking amazing, by amazing I mean that we were in San Fran for three days and we hit Hot Cookie three times.  Easy tiger we did NOT go there every day... We went twice on Friday :-)

My three favorite cookies are the white chocolate macadamia nut, toffee milk chocolate and peanut butter.  The location itself is pretty tiny, but there is enough queuing space for about 6-7 people to squeeze in there. They were steadily busy all three times that we went in, but everyone was pretty respectful and were served in order.  The same girl helped us all three times and was very friendly. They have one of those rules about not using credit cards below a certain amount, but they weren't sticklers to the rule. I didn't eat any of my cookies right away, because let's face it, it's much more relaxing to stuff your face while wearing jammies in the privacy of a hotel room.  That being said, every bite was more delicious than the last.  Anyone can make a fresh cookie taste yummy, but there's we're still freaking amazing later. 

I can't wait until our next trip to San Fran so I can get more cookies!!
author: Gabe H.

description: There's a reason this place always has a line-up when walking past! Amazing cookies - my favourite by far is the cocoa cayenne, although I'm still making my way through the different flavours so who's to say for sure. Great place to stop by after a show or if you happen to be in the area. Oh, there's also a Philz around the corner so you can have a nice cup of coffee to go with all the delicious cookies you buy from here ;)
author: Bianca C.

description:
Best snickerdoodle ever.

I have had my fair share of snickerdoodles at Mrs. Fields, pepperidge farms from the supermarket and even at cute little bakeries all over town but never have I seen one look like the ones here. It is almost like a marble cake but in cookie form  with the snickerdoodle elements. There was a swirl of goodness with cinnamon sugar baked in the center. The cookie wasn't hot but it was soft and chewy, just the way cookies should be made. I almost considered getting the toffee cookie because I love love love toffee but the snickerdoodle was irresistible, I almost felt like I cheated on toffee. 

Nonetheless I found my go to place for an amazing snickerdoodle, screw the sugar cookie with cinnamon sugar on top, I have new standards.
author: Jayne A.

description:
This is such a fun store. It's small but full of personality. You'll often find a line waiting outside, even during the late night hours. 

I opted for a snickerdoodle. Its sweet, cinnamony goodness satisified my late night sweet tooth. I also had my eye on their colorfully decorated Rice Krispies treat bars. The guy behind the counter entertained our indecisiveness as my friends and I perused their selection and giggled at the giant penis shaped cookies. We're so mature.

Oh and I couldn't help but notice their photo collage of hot boys wearing the signature Hot Cookie red briefs. Rawr!
author: Mariela D.

description: Went for dinner near by. Went to hot cookie for dessert. Right when we walked in the guy behind the register said they were no longer taking cash. I selected ~5 cookies. When it was time to pay he said it $25!! I looked at the scale he put all the cookies on and it said $13! He refused to explain. I paid him, upset, and left. I walked back in to stand up for myself and he admittingly said I was ripped off by giving me a fully stamped loyalty card. I will never return!
author: Robert L.

description:
Get a fresh cookie and then go enjoy a movie at the Castro Theater. It will change your life.

Chocolate chip with pecans is the best!

Long line and small shop, so be prepared to wait your turn.
author: Bianca U.

description: The penis cookie is funny, HA HA i get it... BUT the cookies seriously did not taste that good. Sure, one or two tasted good. BUT, there was one white chocolate macadamia cookie that tasted so strange... I couldn't grasp what that weird taste it my mouth was! Then, I realized it's the taste of fish. Not fresh fish, like OLD DEAD fish.
author: Betty T.

description:
What a fun and delicious cookie concept! 

I throughly enjoyed my mini ginger snap, it was chewy & not overly sweet.  The staff are personable and the wall of photos are delightfully entertaining.
author: Cynthia C.

description: There are so many things I miss about living in SF, but not being able to walk to Hot Cookie after work is definitely near the top. You MUST try the toffee chocolate chip, I'm not sure if I'll ever have a cookie as good as this one! Knocking off a star cause a couple times I went the cookies weren't warm and soft like they usually are :( but the times that they were is enough to bring me back. Really don't like hard cookies though so I wish I could return it after taking a bite out..... Anyways, wouldn't bring my parents here or anything but if you have out of town friends visiting, take em here for a fun Castro experience!!
author: Sam U.

description:
Their cookies are tasty, but really you're paying for the right to say, "I've tried a Hot Cookie."

Chocolate chip cookies, white choocolate macadamian nuts, umm some other cookie variations with toffee, peanut butter & I forget what else. All were d-e-licious! They remind me a bit of Voodoo donuts with their quirky interior and their silly penis cookies. 

If you're in the area and are craving a cookie, stop by & try some of their chocolate chip cookies. It should satisfy your craving.
author: Rosa L.

description:
That penis shaped macaroon was ON POINT!  Best penis shaped thing I've ever eaten.  Also tried a few of their standard cookies.  Super delicious and made to perfection! 

The pictures on the wall are pretty amusing!  

Must try!
author: Chai S.

description:
The selection of penis cookies here is amazing.

If you are in the market for penis cookies, and you're in the Castro dickstrict, then you need to stop in at Hot Cookie and get yourself a giant dark chocolate penis cookie.

This store is allegedly the secret to LeBron James' amazing ball handling skills.  Quoted as saying "I like the shaft, but I save the balls for the court!"
author: Brian C.

description:
Was roaming around the Castro neighborhood and came across Hot Cookie at the corner! Definitely a small, hole in the wall type of place but they had some delicious cookies!
I ordered the pokie (m&m) and the white chocolate macadamia nut. Both were yummy, nice and soft/chewy in the center and crunchy on the edges. 
Cookies are charged by weight, but I paid less than $5 for 2 which seemed like a decent deal to me.
Hot Cookie is definitely interesting inside (walls plastered with folks in their undies!) and be sure to get a look at the male/female anatomy macaroons! 
Definitely a place to stop by and grab a cookie if you're visiting the Castro.
author: Miss H K.

description: I love chocolate chip cookies and rarely purchase anything other than a traditional chocolate chip (of course I'll eat any cookie if it's free!). We ordered a chocolate chocolate chip cookie (double fudge? I can't remember the real name) and it was probably the best cookie I've ever had. Later, we tried the chocolate chip and it blew every other cookie of my entire life out of the water. We also sampled a chocolate chip and pecan and once again, amazing. Finally, a place where I actually want to try other types of cookies. I guess that makes me adventurous. Don't miss this place.
author: Kendra N.

description: Sadly, I didn't get to try a naughty cookie since they ran out of boobies. But their regular cookies are delicious! I had a white chocolate macadamia nut cookie and it was still good the next day!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Go to Hot Cookie for the novelty factor. I mean, where else in the city can you find phallic shaped macaroons? Honestly, a visit here is worth your time and you will leave with a tasty treat (especially if you try the peanut butter milk chocolate cookies!) The staff are friendly and it will help make the most of your visit to Castro St. 

However, as a bakery, Hot Cookie leaves much to be desired. The cookies aren't anything special and are too overpriced to be worth the effort. Considering how many more quality places there are to buy a quality and delicious dessert in the area, Hot Cookie is not worth your time or money if you just have a hankering for something sweet.
author: Sophia A.

description:
I've been a long-time customer of Hot Cookie, but I've been really turned off lately by the service.  The cookies are still delicious, but not always hot as other reviewers have noted.  However, my main problem is the new staff, many of which are not very friendly.  I'll be waiting in line patiently, but they will serve the person behind me sometimes because I'm on the phone.  I can still order while I'm on my phone.  It's not like this is a library.  Another issue deals with the punch cards.  I've collected those cards for years, but I haven't seen them lately.  When I ask about it, they claim they run out.  It's been at least two months since I've seen those frequent buyer cards and they always claim they had them earlier in the week, but I missed them.  It's like they're fucking with me.  I stop by Hot Cookie at least once per week, but now I'm questioning my patronage with this establishment.  I sincerely hope the owner of Hot Cookie reads this review and talks with their young staff about good customer service.  It wasn't always like this, so something has to change.

P.S. The cookie prices are not always consistent.  I always order the Pokies cookie and sometimes they charge $2.69, $2.75, or $3.00.
author: Sherry L.

description: Very small provocative cookie shop. Pretty good cookies for $3 a piece. The toffee chocolate chip one was definitely the best. They also sell a penis cookie which I have yet to try but the regular cookies are delicious.
author: Tanya Y.

description:
Like those pizza places and dirty dog stands along the street, this place is genius for being open late. On our way home from a night out, we decided to grab some cookies. The place is small and there was a crowd forming, but the girl behind the counter was nice and the service was quick! Between the three of us, we got a white chocolate macadamia nut, macaroon, and a snickerdoodle. The cookies were still warm, gooey, and oozing with sweet goodness!

They're pricey, but then again, they're big cookies! Definitely plenty to share -- if you're not tempted to devour the entire thing...
author: Leana L.

description:
Best cookies in SF. I'm not even joking. I've been on the search for a cookie place in SF and this is by far the best one. 

So cookies are weighed by weight. You picked as many as you want in different sizes and shapes and price is by weight. The Toffee Chocolate Chip is amazing!! All the cookies are soft and chewy. In addition, they have penis-like cookies here which is pretty funny. I haven't tried it but it does look like it's yummy ;)

Parking kind of sucks. I mean, it's in the Castro area on Market. So make sure you bring change or you take the bus. But overall, definitely recommend coming here.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Yes, the penis-shaped chocolate-covered macaroon is embarrassing to eat, but it's SO GOOD. And it's not like you're going to town on it in front of the Queen; it's the Castro. Behavior like that is perfectly normal, if not encouraged. And there are queens-a-plenty.

And, yeah, the hunk of chocolate macaroon costs something like $8, but it's nearly 8 inches (or so, I dunno, I'm often lied to about these things), so it's like, $1 an inch.

Where else can you find such a deal?

No, seriously... where?
author: Adena B.

description:
Famous Penis Cookie....the excitement begins! My friends & I were visiting SF & were told to checkout this place, we couldn't resist the urge of a Penis Cookie search.

Place: tiny but the staff is really friendly.
Price: reasonable, cost is equivalent to weight of cookie.

Taste: unfortunately the cookies were not the best, were a bit cold and not as soft as i imagined they would be. I had a snicker doodle & oatmeal...were ok, as for the chocolate chip cookies they were nothing special. 

Overall experience: I think its fun to go visit at least once, if you are near and in Castro. but would probably look for another small cookie shop when craving something yummy, soft & tasteful!

**CASH ONLY**
author: Priscilla N.

description:
Apparently Hot Cookie is named for the temperature at which they serve their cookies.  We purchased several cookies, and I ate 3 of them immediately... one after another.... and not one of them was hot.  Warm?... no.  Cold.  They were cold cookies, not hot cookies.  

I do have to admit, they were some good cookies.  I would give them about 4 stars for flavor.

I had:
1. Pumpkin Muffin Top - Very good
2. Almond Paste Cookie - Very good
3. Coco Cayenne Cookie - Very good

I definitely enjoyed the cookies even though they were cold.

If you are out looking for a sweet treat with children, I would definitely shy away from this place.  The images that are plastered on the walls are a bit too graphic for most young cookie connoisseurs. 

It is a tiny, tiny shop.  Not much room at all for people to stand.  Maybe 4-5 people could fit, but it would be pretty cramped in there.
author: Eric H.

description:
Yummy. If you want an after dinner treat, go to Hot Cookie. Sometimes you can get them in erotic shapes.

We ended up picking up the chocolate chip macadamia nut and the Pokie which had m&m's on it. Both were super chewy and tasty. It's a good treat if you want something sweet for your belly. Luckily, we had a trek up the hill so we probably burned off all the calories we consumed.
author: Amy J.

description:
I am a part time baker so I am a bit critical when it comes to cookies.

I was in Castro and decided to stop by here because like a lot of people that come here, I was intrigued with the penis shaped cookies that they sell here. My friends and I got the chocolate chip and some other stuff to share....

I thought it was whatever and not really worth coming back to...I guess its a fun idea...yes penis cookie, but I pass.
author: Phuong K.

description:
How could you miss with large chocolate penis cookies served with a smile and a sense of humor?

The only thing missing was any free samples.

Large, good, G-Rated cookies (at a premium) though. Nom Nom NOM!
author: Glenn H.

description:
I thought the cookies that I tried were just a little better then ok. The shop it's self if really fun! They have TONS of picture on the walls of people wearing the hot cookie panties. It was funny and fun to look at while u wait. Unfortunately the shop is really really small so only one or two ppl can be inside at once but there is never a huge line so it's not to bad. The service was also great! The people behind the counter were all super nice and willing to strike up small conversations (almost never happens in so cal). 

Now on to the cookies! 

The penis cookie:
I think I was least impressed by this cookie. First off I'm not really a fan of coconut, so a coconut macaroon probably wasn't the smartest idea. However I figured if u come to Castro u have to try this cookie and surprisingly it wasn't too coconuty and definitely didn't have that sucky fake coconut flavor. The only reason I didn't like it was because it was just too sweet for me. They coat it with A LOT of chocolate which would be good, but the cookie is really sweet as well. I would love to see another flavor cookie so I could try it again! 

Toffee cookie: 
The cookie was nice as not to sweet. It was soft and full of toffee. However I would say that it wasn't better then a store bought cookie, just kind of the same. 

Ginger snap cookie:
This is a soft ginger snap cookie which is awesome. It was very soft and moist. It doesn't have a very traditional ginger flavor so that can be good or bad depending on your taste. My boyfriend didn't like this cookie but I thought it was good. 

Overall I would say that Hot Cookie is defiantly worth trying. There were at least 10 other cookie options so there is probably a cookie for everyone. Even the penis cookie is worth trying, just be prepared for the stares and funny comments. Also the cookies are a bit expensive so make sure u have some cash!
author: Toral S.

description: Got a cookie on a whim. I fell in love at first bite. I got a cookie with caramel and pretzels on top. It was absolutely delicious! The other cookies looked great too. I wanted to try the penis shaped macaroon covered in chocolate, but it was kind of expensive.
author: M W.

description:
Really tasty cookies.  This is a very small place 3-4 people can stand in the store at once.  I have been here a few times and there has been a line at least 5+ deep.  This is impressive since the average purchase probably takes less than 1min.

I have tried about half of the cookies sharing with other people, and they have all been very tasty.  I prefer the peanut butter or oatmeal, but the snickerdoodle was very good.  

These cookies are big I would recommend sharing.  They also have a day old cookie section that tasted just as good as the others, but for half the price.
author: James S.

description: For some reason I always end up eating the penis here, which makes me feel a bit strange and naughty.  A few days ago a friend and I discovered that Hot Cookie sells soft serve as well so we both created our very own type II Diabetes inducing ice cream sandwich (for about $8, we should have split one since neither of us could finish it). I do wish the girl would have just put the ice cream on the cookie for us so we didn't have to waste plastic cups, but whatever. It was still awesome and a fun place to take visitors and homophobes.
author: K H.

description:
I think they should rename their house specialty the Mandingo Royale. Other than National Geographic, I have never seen anything so anatomically correct. At least that's what Judge Clarence Thomas told me. It's understandably propped up on a popsicle stick and encrusted...I mean covered...in dark chocolaty sweetness.

A rather soft, foamy substance lurks underneath, a stark contrast to the erect...I mean hardened...covering so as to make the coconut-flavored filling ooze willy-nilly in one's mouth. At a whopping $4.75 (...I was so awestruck that I didn't bother to measure it), you certainly can't call the Mandingo Royale cheap, but I guess it depends on your point of comparison....and what you negotiate upfront.

Oh...and they serve cookies, too.
author: Ed U.

description: Still a fan, dropped by to get some cookies today, they aren't cheap, probably about 3 bucks average, chocolate chip and snickerdoodle cookies are my favorites, hard to find parking, so hubby had to go around.....but well worth it.......
author: Leslie Y.

description: Without a doubt, 5 stars. I'm a total white chocolate macadamia snob bc it's my favorite and THIS was the best one I've ever had. Even left over the next morning was so perfect  spicy chocolate, oatmeal raisin, oatmeal white choco cranberry, walnut were also amazing .. My boyfriend went freaking nuts over those. If you like cookies, go. Guy was super nice even though we got there right before they closed and he was conscious that we were spending $42 on cookies haha (we got several of each) perfect ending to the night
author: Mari B.

description: Great cookies. Come here everytime I'm in the city but the help sucks. #rude   need to learn customer service.
author: Rudy R.

description: Cookie I bought was delicious...issue was the workers.  One was more interested in hanging out with her visiting friends than working. She gave us the wrong change. And then the wrong cookie.  Her companion, a young African American girl, was very nice,...and corrected the matter.
author: Ara L.

description: Lucky us, we got the last penis shaped cookie! Chocolate covered and coconutty... mmm, $6 for an expensive but filling cookie.
author: Christine C.

description:
Came here after lunch at Bisou. Got the Chocolate covered Brownie. 

YUMMY :D

It would be hilarious to get a penis shaped cookie, but I have little ones on FB so it would be not so appropriate to take a pic with that thing. Hehe.. next time. ;)
author: Amy C.

description: So in love with this cookie joint! Really fun pics on the wall, fun shapes of cookies ;) and some of the best chocolate chip and coconut macaroons I've ever had. Both my mom and mother-in-law are obsessed with this place and every time I visit them, they are even more happy to see me because I come with cookies from hot cookie! I'm drooling and need another fix soon, see you guys tomorrow!
author: Chauanh D.

description:
I freakin' love HOT COOKIE.
Now that i'm no longer living in the bay, it's one of the few things I miss.
Everything is sold by weight, which can make for some serious shocks come time to pay if you're ordering whilst baked (like i do).
That said, it's worth every penny.
It's so good that I don't even notice all of the sexually explicit comments that passersby on the street shout at me...
author: Rex N.

description:
Im Usually not a fan of chocolate penis. (no pun intended)

hot Cookie, made me change my ways. 

I now crave big coconut chocolate penis' on a stick every day. MMMMmmm

I cant wait to take my mother here. 


OH and BTW... IM on the wall of fame wearing hot cookie manties too!
author: Andrew V.

description: The best cookie I think I've ever had...mine was Toffee Almond Chocolate Chip. My hubby loved his selections as well although I can't remember what he chose. This joint has a VERY tiny wait area. You gotta be in and out. We came late and we're so happy they had some left. They were still busy, but running out!! The neighborhood this place is in is gay and there are some rather small pics of naked women and many, many pics of undied men. So just think about bringing your kids in if this might be offensive....
author: Mandie H.

description:
Whenever I'm near or in the Castro area I HAVE to stop by and grab me some Hot Cookie! My favorite cookies (in order) from this spot are the M&M cookie (Pokie cookie), the toffee milk chocolate chip, the cocoa cayenne, and snickerdoodle cookie. Sooo soft and moist, I love it! They have those HUGE penises which I would love to try in cookie form, but coconut is just not for me. You can also find, fudge bars, brownies, macarons, and rice crispies here. But for now, I'll stick to the cookies since they are so expensive. (TOTALLY WORTH IT) My first time here was during the 2012 Pride festival. I literally bought $10 worth of cookies. They price by weight so I can't really say how much each cookie was but they are big too!

Even though the lines can be ridiculously long, they do a good job of keeping the line moving pretty fast. I was very impressed, but of course you can't change the asshole-ish people who push or try to cut in line. With a 6 foot plus bf on my shoulders I don't need to worry about that much :) 

They accept CASH ONLY so be prepared.

& they are OPEN LATE!
Fri-Sat open til 1am
All the other days close around 11pm.
author: April D.

description:
Descended from the 16th Mission BART station and made my walking journey through Castro to Sunset to visit a friend. I'm glad I walked instead of taking the Muni. Otherwise, I would have missed HOT COOKIE! 

The Saint Ginger Snap - at 50 cents a pop, this vegan cookie holds together really well and has a nice chewy/doughy center. Just a regular small round cookie. That's why it's a Saint compared to what you see in the main picture on this page. That large chocolate covered macaroon sure look tasty! Hot Cookie, please turn one of those into a Saint! ;) Thanks!
author: Tina B.

description:
A must-visit while in the area. Can't say anything about their regular cookies, since I went there just for the penis cookie (oh, come on - you would, too!). The cookie was HUGE (haha) and it took me a few attempts to finish it. 
For $6.25, you get an enormous macaroon covered in chocolate, shaped like a penis. It's very heavy on the coconut, so you have to keep that in mind. 
The place is quite small, but the girl behind the counter was sweet.
author: Alina B.

description:
Price: cookies sold my weight.
Space: standing room only.  Take your cookie and go.

This place fits right into Castro with its risque Hot Cookie undies, half-naked pics of men plastered all over what little wall space they have, and a giant penis-shaped macaroon staring you right in the face when you go up to order!

This place is teensy and I had to elbow my way through to get to the cashier.  I asked if the cookies were HOT (you would expect that from a place named Hot Cookie, no?), but none were.  I asked if there were other times of day that they had hot cookies, but the guy behind the counter just shrugged his shoulders and looked bored out of his mind.  Hmmm, all right - well, I was craving cookies anyway and the snickerdoodle looked pretty dang good so I decided to get myself one anyhow.  I also got a chocolate chip and white chocolate cranberry cookie to round out my cookie repertoire.

The cookies were soft and chewy with slightly crispy edges.  Exactly how I like my cookies.  However, at the end of the day I can't say these stood out in any special way.  Plus, I was really looking forward to a HOT cookie - what the heck!
author: Angela C.

description:
My friends stopped by here after touristing the Castro area.  

Maybe because I am still a little immature, but when I saw the penis shaped macaroon, I just HAD to get it (even if it meant forking over $7 dollars. :X  They even offered if we wanted whip cream with it!!!!  Haha. 

The macaroon was a good size (lol!) and it was delicious!!  A good treat to treat yourself with sometime!
author: Kristie F.

description:
Hot Cookie! The name is perfect. I went into for a Chocolate Penis Cookie that has macaroon fillings and saved coconut on the head of the penis. I absolutely loved it. I saved it for breakfast, 'cause ain't nothing like some good DICK in the morning right? hahaha (i kidd). I'll definitely come back to this little cookie shop the next time i'm in town! 
p.s. I LOVE CASTRO
author: An S.

description:
What's not to like about delicious, fresh-baked ooey gooey chocolate fudge cookies?  That's what I thought.  

I've never had a bad (stale, crunchy, old, etc.) cookie here.  They have a great variety including brownies and other baked goods too.  Awesome!
author: Laura C.

description:
63 reviews that are not recommended?
What's up with that?
I don't like to hear that this shop has rude clerks with attitude. 
The cookies were good BUT my 6 yr. old had extreme "D"....ATTENTION OWNERS: what  ingredients would cause this....I'll tell you:

Corn Syrup, Corn Oil, Polysorbate, Sorbitol, and any sugar substitute. The last three ingredients are
CANCER-CAUSING.

Sorbital can contribute to Colon Cancer.

Whatever the ingredient, please remove it. No one should have to rush to the bathroom after eating your bakery products.

Also....how are you hygienically? Disposable plastic gloves, washed hands? Any stores or restaurants need to stay on top of hygiene. Too many diseases, pandemics and germs going around the Bay Area.
Be clean!

And to all those Asian immigrants wandering around the City doing their funny exercises...STOP COUGHING, SPITTING, SNEEZING ALL OVER THE PLACE!!!  COVER YOUR MOUTH, SNEEZE INTO YOUR ARM, BUY TISSUES...HOW CRUDE AND DISGUSTING! ESPECIALLY YOUR SNOT ROCKETS.
author: Marie S.

description:
Unsurprising confession time: I've only had hot cookie while drunk. That is, until a couple of weeks ago, when I bought a cookie cake from here for a friend's birthday. Who knew they sold cookie cakes? Thanks, Yelp!

Trying to describe the cake would not do it justice, but I can say this: it was glorious. Imagine a chocolate cookie the size of a medium pizza, topped with what I'd call a chocopeen. There's the writing in chocolate, and then there are drops of *ahem* white cream. Basically, the perfect cake for a friend who is embarrassed easily.

Oh. And it IS amazing drunk food. Love the one with peanut butter.
author: jon y.

description:
If you have ever fantasized about biting deep into a penis, this is the place for you. 

They only have them available in big and black though, with coconut shavings (chocolate coated macaroon...very chewy). I vote that they expand their selection for those who like variety (think--vanilla, chocolate chip, lemon, strawberry). I'd get sick of having the same one each time--so I probably won't come back for a while. My cookie was so big that I couldn't finish it despite its tastiness; I had to throw the balls away a week later. The other cookies are very normal...G rated. I have to say though--this is probably the heaviest cookie I have ever attempted to eat. It's like a workout to hold it.

5 stars because I don't know anywhere else in the country where I could get a (tasty) dick on a stick.
author: K W.

description: Very good cookies, like very good. The last trip there I got an under baked cookie, which was not so good. But normally, this place is very good.
author: Marisa L.

description:
Mmmmm toffee chocolate chip cookies - I'd bear having to see all the penis shapes just to have you. 

And for less than three dollars ? What a steal.
author: Ashley N.

description:
This is such a cute place! I loved how it had a bunch of pictures on the wall, gave it a more approachable/personal feel. It's super small, barely 10 people can fit in, just grab your cookies and go type of deal. 

All the cookies we ordered were yummy, fairly priced and big and size.

The toffee and peanut butter chocolate chip were my personal favorites...didn't try the penis cookie (gonna have to try that next)... I like that they had a lot of white chocolate options..could maybe use some more cookies with dark chocolate though.

 Was kinda disappointed they only had 2% or whole milk and they were super small milk containers, well at least for someone like who loves to drown their cookies in mik ...besides that and the fact that the cookies weren't actually hot those are my only 'complaints'. 

The cookies are delicious though and the service is super friendly so that's all that really matters in the end for me to be a fan. I think I prefer Anthony's over this one though.
author: Melissa C.

description: Cookies!!!! So yummy! Worth the trip. I enjoy taking my friends here it's always a good time.
author: Sean G.

description: They have some great cookies.  Not a sit down kind of place and definitely in an interesting area, but great cookies.  My faves were the chocolate cayenne, chocolate chunk, and snicker doodle was the best.
author: Sapna D.

description:
Funny how the picture for this place is a phallic symbol. Yay!

The aroma of fresh cookies drifting out of this shop made me turn around and walk in. I had just finished a strawberry and nutella creme brulee at the creme brulee cart and I STILL turned around to grab a chocolate fudge cookie. DELICIOUS. Plenty of other choices but chocolate fudge, how do you resist?
author: Wilson T.

description:
The owner of Hot Cookie should be taken out to the street and flogged for what he has done. 

For four months, I was working out, handling my business, eating healthy, doing exercise, lowered my body fat percentage..and then it all went to hell one night when my friend tells me about this place that serves up fresh baked cookies in the middle of the night......fucking shit.

Oh yeah, it's for real.  

Hot and Gooey, Soft and Chewy, give me a fucking ice cold glass of milk-style Cookies.  

These are the type of thing that you order and hide in your room so that your roommates don't have a chance to ask you to try one.  And if they do, you get all Gollum-like on them and bite off their mother faahking hand for trying to take THE PRECIOUS.....THEIR MY FUCKING COOKIES AND I WILL KILL YOU AND DESTROY EVERYTHING THAT YOU HOLD DEAR IF YOU EVEN GLANCE AT THEM....DID YOU JUST LOOK AT MY COOKIE BOX...*pull out a bat*....*crack*....*contemplating incarceration while enjoying a double chocolate chip cookie*
author: Jeri T.

description: Second time here, and the cookies aren't as amazing as I would expect. The hype at this place is the Chocolate covered macaroon on a stick shaped like a penis with the choice of whip cream on the tip and coconut shavings on the bottom - hah. I believe my friend said it was on the "too sweet" side but it's a place to visit when you're in the Castro. Small little shop that gets tons of hype and opened late until 11pm.
author: Amanda C.

description:
The first time I went here, I was 16 and came with my mother.  ...Yeah.

I've come back about five or six times over the past eight or so years, usually with my boyfriend (well that isn't stereotypical).

They are of reliably high quality and delicious.  Their toffee cookie is bomb, and I loved their penis macaroon.  Maayybe a little pricey, but it's so tasty that it's hard to say.  It's definitely laugh-worthy.  Yet their food isn't just a cheap novelty.  If I'm in the Castro area, I'm going here.
author: Sasuke U.

description: The chocolate penis macaroon is so good. - "I call the left nut!" After a fun, eventful day during Pride, we went over to the Castro. I've heard my friends talked about Hot Cookie and their penis cookies, and I was finally happy that I tried one. - So one time my cousins and I were frugal about buying three penis cookies, so instead we shared one instead. It was pretty funny too because I said "I call the left nut!" While the others had the right nut and the tip. - Anyway, the cookie was delicious. My experience was good, haha
author: Lauren Y.

description: These cookies are delicious!!! I went there everyday during my visit. They didn't have any penises left when I got there, so they must be good.
author: Ernest C.

description:
I had one of the best tasting peanut butter cookies tonight at this tiny store.  The store may be small but this shindig has a humongous personality!  

You can't help but check out the pics of very happy customers enjoying the Hot Cookie goods & products that are posted on the walls. Oh what stories they will tell...
author: Michael L.

description:
Came here with my girlfriend to try the famous Penis macaroon but they were all sold out. It's okay, though, since we still got to give a mastectomy to the Venus instead. In addition to the treat having a fun-shape, it is actually a very good coconut macaroon, and incredibly filling. 

We also tried the peanut butter toffee cookie, which is just as good. The size of the macaroons and cookies are pretty big and fair-priced. Even if you're not necessarily here for the risqué treats that Hot Cookie is known for, if you're looking for some solid baked goodies I would still recommend coming here.
author: Eric S.

description:
I heard from a friend about this place..& I jus had to try it the next time we were in the city. It was AMAZING!! There wasn't a wait, but it's also because we went during the week in the afternoon. The only bad thing that I thought was that it was a small small place. They should expand it a little. The pictures on the wall were hilarious. 

Now back to the cookies. We ordered a penis cookie which was yummy!! It had the perfect crunch to the macaroon. The chocolate was perfect. We also got the PB & chocolate cookie which was like any other PB chocolate cookie. And the other was probably my favorite, the cayenne chocolate cookie. It had a kick to the bite. And it was delicious!!! I even dipped it in some coffee..which made the cayenne come out in the cookie more. Which was SOOO good!! All the cookies cost us $12 for 3 cookies!! a little pricey but they were pretty good.I would totally have to make this an must when I'm in the city!!!! :) jus wish they weren't that pricey!
author: Pynki V.

description:
Went here back when I was 18, on a school trip! The shop is really small. I liked the interesting names for the cookies. We were all giggling, despite being university students. The clerk seemed exasperated with us.  I wanted to get the cookie shaped like the female body, because it looks so cool. I got the penis cookie though. Only me and one other girl ended up buying one, maybe that's why the clerk was annoyed. This is the Castro, if you're a prude, don't go...  

Some girls were taking pictures with the cookies. I brought my cookie back to show my roommates, and they were shocked. I asked if they wanted some, and they didn't :

 It was really good actually, chocolate covered, and a very moist, not to sweet coconut macaroon type cookie inside.

 The cookies are really good and fresh. If you're a tourist or in the area, you should try it out.
author: Chrissy O.

description:
THE BEST COOKIES!!!!! The staff is nice & the cookies are incredible. The store front is absolutely tiny, so small that the only people who can actually be inside are the people paying. It's about a 2 person max but worth it to wait outside just to get the cookies.

Get the "Pokey"! You will not be disappointed.
author: Peyton S.

description: Great little cookie spot (and no I didn't get their signature cookie) but their chocolate nut cookie was really good.
author: Blake B.

description:
How did I tackle the big, bad, and dark Penis? I called for backup that's what...threesome to be exact. No, not the sexually kind of threesome...u dirty-minded peeps! Threesome as in the penis cookie, me, and a partner to eat it with! 

I was in the area for dinner and was searching around yelp for desserts and Hot Cookie popped up, its business photo of a penis cookie was what made this visit a MUST. The cookie shop was really small. You can only fit about three ppl at the most at once in there. No doubt it was a true bakery, you can smell the aroma of the baked goods a couple stores away. Since the shop was so small, I didn't want to take too much time in there and made others behind me wait, so I quickly ordered what I came for. Penis cookie's official name is "Penis & Venus". 

Me: "Can I pls get one Penis & Venus?"
Girl: "Would you like whip cream with that?"
Me: "Eh...no thanks..."

Uh...a second of awkward silence passed and we both burst out laughing! She actually asked it too quickly by accident thinking it was a cup of mocha and at the same time I was caught off-guard by the question and didn't really respond smartly. It was too funny. That made it a memorable moment for me. They were really friendly and customer service was awesome. 

Man, this thing must've weighed at least a pound or more! No wonder it cost $5.75! It's girth was really thick too, but length wasn't as impressive...maybe just about five inches from the tip of it to the bottom of the balls....hahaha. Dude, this thing is like a monster on a stick! It was completely dipped in dark chocolate on the outside and the interior was filled with coconut macaroon. Sounds like a great combo. It was , but I must admit that the dark chocolate was a bit too overwhelming for me, but the shredded coconut inside was delicious. I really just wanted to eat the inside only, so I ended up having to dissect the penis cookie with a knife and fork. Sorry, Penis.

It's a really cute thought of making cookies into different body part shapes. I wished there were actually more selection for me to choose from when I was there, but it didn't. Still, I was satisfied, I got what I went for. Mission accomplished. I give them a 3 stars only, not b/c of anything on their part, but more so b/c I'm not a big cookie fan and it really takes A LOT for me to be a fan, which was what 4-star rating meant. Hot Cookies, I will sure recommend you to others, but just not so sure I'll have another penis cookie for myself again though! :)
author: Winnie L.

description:
I always have to bring my Castro-virgin friends here. No matter what time of day, they always seem to be open!

Hot Cookie is a pretty small place, but that's all you need for a cookie shop. You go in, pick out the cookies you want, pay, and walk along.

Of course, I have to comment about their, "specialty" cookie, which is basically a penis-shaped coconut macaroon. I mean, if you're looking for some tasty BBC, I highly recommend you stop by. ;) It's big, it's filling, and it leaves you satisfied and wanting more at the same time.

And yeah, I've had their other cookies too. I particularly like their chocolate cayenne and toffee cookies. I don't know how they always get their cookies so soft and chewy, but I love it. If you're touring around the Castro or have a craving for something sweet and warm in your mouth, I say you definitely should stop by!
author: Patricia N.

description: Classics, cookies, and c***. These cookies are orgasmic. You have so much to choose from in  such a little shop. The classical cookies that I recommend everyone gets their first time is the penis and venus cookies which are chocolate covered cookies shaped like a male penis and a woman's body. The cookies are just more for the fun of eating it in the vibrant Castro area than anything, but it's fun none the less. And if you aren't feeling risky eating those cookies then go for anything else in the store because they are amazing. The cookies are tasty and soft and quite large, though they do have some mini cookies as well. I love the feel of this place as well as the cookies are a must have. Personal favorite is the Pokie which is a chocolate chip cookie that has crashed with MnM goodness. The only downside of this place is the size. It is the size of an elevator, but if you can navigate it you should have it. The prices are done by weight, but don't worry, they take card.
author: Devika B.

description: Small shop with a lot to offer. Cookies are sold by weight. You can feed two for under $4. I had the double chocolate one worth lots of big chocolate chunks. It was delicious. The photos on the walls are lots of fun to watch.
author: Javier L.

description: For those completely confident in their dessert preference, Hot Cookie delivers. You don't even have to get one of their "specialty" treats; their snicker-doodles and chocolate macaroons are offered in more...traditional shapes. It's kinda pricy, but the prices are far cheaper than the gouging going on at the Castro Theater snack bar.
author: Casey S.

description: Walking around the castro stopped here for a snack. My bf wanted a pb cookie from the day old clearance bin. The girl broke it in 1/2 and said since it broke it would be free! I purchased a choc chip cookie also. Both were soft and delicious!
author: Shawn G.

description:
Where else can you get hot, fresh, vulgar shaped cookies? This place serves THE best Snickerdoodle cookie and if that isn't your favorite the selection on the right will surely make you snicker.

Try 'em while they're hot, and be sure to tip your cookie server.

Cash only!
author: Kevin J.

description:
I heard about this place and had been wanting to go for a while. My first attempt was during Pride weekend and of course I totally forgot and wasn't able to find parking so I decided to wait. This weekend I made my way back out of SF for some errands and decided it would be the day. 

My boyfriend and I tried two cookies. He got the chocolate chip with toffee and I got the chocolate chip with macadamia nut. Both were super delicious, soft and chewy... just the way a cookie should be.

I heard their snicker doodle is the bomb, I'll save that for next time!
author: Navjot K.

description:
Penis cookie. Need I say anything else?

Edit: I actually do need to say something else. If you thought their penis cookie was orgasmic (it probably should be the only thing that is, but whatever), they have this cookie filled with toffee chunks, which is the best. cookie. ever. If the chocolate-penis-macaroon won't bring you all the way to Castro, that should.
author: Mona T.

description:
When in Castro....I always have to make a stop into Hot Cookie. 

I've never had a bad one.  They are yummy, delicious, and huge. Ummm....and I'm talking about the cookies. I usually go for the usual chocolate chip sometime with nuts and sometimes without, but I also favor their snicker doodle cookie.  

This small cookie shop is located right off the corner of Market and Castro not too far from those famously naked people roaming the corner.  You usually pay by the weight of the cookie, but every ounce is worth it.

Stop in when you can, believe me you're going to always want to stop in when you get a chance.
author: Caroline A.

description:
Free smells! Love the energy at this amazing cookie shop, and let's be honest - the cookies are divine!

The snicker doodle is out of this world and sometimes if I'm feeling a little messy I'll get the chocolate fudge (always seem to find chocolate all over my face).

Stop by and say hi to the beautiful ladies Emily and Mel - they definitely know how to load you up with some cookie love!
author: Richard M.

description:
No trip to the Castro is complete without seeing a naked guy (check) and a penis shaped cookie! 

This tiny little cookie store has Penis & Venus cookies, aka chocolate covered macaroons. They are delicious, and the most expensive cookie I've ever had ($6.00!), but the penis cookie is definitely filling!
author: Emily C.

description: Great cookies that are warm and made fresh. The snickerdoodle, chocolate chip with oatmeal, and peanut butter cookies were all amazing.
author: Lily P.

description:
I followed my nose and it led me here to a land of chocolate covered penis cookies and a wall covered with half naked men in bright red undies. I came out of Hot Cookie with 1 snickerdoodle and 1 coconut macadamia nut. When I got home, all that was left was the white paper bag they came in. 


Lesson for today: buy more cookies next time.
author: May D.

description: The cookies are fine but I bought a 2.50 $ cookie and gave them a 20 dollar bill. As I was walking out of the store I noticed that I was shortchanged by 10 dollars. I looked back to see the man behind the counter with it in his hand. I asked and got it back. Beware, count your change after you buy.
author: Daniel W.

description:
I loooooove the white chocolate coconut cookie. Omg. Next I'm trying a chocolate covered penis. ;)

By the way, don't expect a place to sit or a bathroom. Chill out side next to twin peaks or sneak it on the bus like I do ;)
author: Courtney M.

description:
Delicious!! 

Need a sweet tooth fix? Head into Hot cookie to deal with it.
