The cookies are absolutely delicious.  I'm not really an oatmeal cookie fan but the ones they make are wonderful. 

I love their mini chocolate chip cookies which were absolutely melt in your mouth sweetness. 

Can't wait until I'm in the neighborhood again so I can get my hands on another one of the HOT cookies...
author: Christine P.

description: Delicious cookies! My all time fav is the chocolate toffee! Cookies are never really HOT though and the price is a bit high but doesn't stop me from coming back over and over.
author: Kelly H.

description: You must stop in for a snack. Try to find out what is the most fresh. They will lie and say it's all pretty fresh. I've gotten something there before and it was really old. Overall you can't go wrong with a retreat from here.
author: David H.

description: In addition to having tasty, fresh-baked cookies, this is where you can also buy treats shaped like private parts.  The cookies really are good, but Hot Cookie really pulled through for me when I wanted to get a dessert for my best friend's bachelorette party last summer.  They made me an awesome giant cookie cake with one of their three-dimensional chocolate, life-sized penises placed on top, along with a personalized message.  Exactly what the bride needed.  This, my friends, is your go-to place for dick-shaped treats.
author: Kristen F.

description: Omg!!! These Cookies were completely worth the wait! In the words of my friend, "these cookies are f*cking awesome!!" I just wish I had some milk with me!
author: Ashlee D.

description: And what a cookie it was! I was completely in love with the flavor of these cookies. My husband and I came here on vacation and he had heard that the Hot Cookie was the place to go for anything cookie related. We went into the shop and I could not stop staring at the walls. All the pictures were insane! We ended up going two times in our very short three day trip. We will probably return to get another cookie when we go back in the summer.
author: Ana N.

description:
The chocolate macaroon dick at Hot Cookie is high on my list and I don't know quite what to think about that?

This place just burrowed itself into my heart and their cookies and other treats can be good too, though I recommend you ask what's fresh because I've had a few dry duds from there -- seem to be remember liking the toffee and the peanut butter but these are only for those unwilling to handle the macaroon male member.
author: Ryan S.

description: Cookies are soooooo good, got a couple different flavors to share with friends and we all loved them. super friendly staff as well
author: Sonia G.

description:
AMAZING!!!!!!!!!

I'm not one for desserts but who in their right mind could pass up a place that sells cookies that you can warm up!!!!!!!!

The place is a hole in the wall...literrally...and I LOVED IT!!!!!!!! 

Assorted cookies every where...and being that their located in the castro of course they had penis cookies :)  

I ordered the oatmeal, walnut and cranberry cookie, heated that bad boy up and thought I was in heaven!!!

Mmm mmm good...a MUST TRY!!!!

FYI - They only take cash :)
author: Sandra S.

description:
Okay. Hands down, cutest hole in the wall ever.
To put it simply, because the store is so simple; there are literally pictures of almost naked men and women all over the store with hot cookie underwear on and it's fantastic.
And then there's the Penis & Venus, the ever so famous chocolate covered macaroons with coconut shavings shaped like a woman's bust/midsection/torso-ish & a penis/ballsack.
It's beautiful.
And their cookies are baked to perfection, half baked with a chewy center. 
Love this place. It's amazing! And their flavor selections for cookies is small but dynamic.

Edit: Oh and last time I went the cashier asks "So do you want whipped cream?" and I asked "Does that cost extra?" she goes, "Ofcourse not!" and I say "WELL OFCOURSE I WANT IT THEN GIRL!" it was a beautiful moment. Shout out to her!
author: Kai S.

description:
My friend brought me here during the Castro Street Fair a few weeks ago. Supposedly their cookies have unusual and "inappropriate" shapes but when I went they were just regular round cookies....but they were delicious, some of the best cookies I've ever had. 
Also, there was so much to choose from, so many interesting combos of ingredients put into awesome (and big) cookies.
It was really worth every penny I spent, and I look forward to coming here again - perhaps when the Castro is less populated so I can find their signature cookie shapes!
author: Dodi G.

description:
Some of the best cookies in town and they're open late!

WIN WIN.
author: Robert M.

description:
Really great cookies and service. Couldn't ask for anything better. One of the types of cookies I had wanted had been broken, so the (amazingly cute) girl behind the counter asked me if I'd take it for free. I said sure. I should have gotten more than one because it was chocolate chip peanut butter and suuuuuuper tasty. I also got a chocolate chip pecan. Both had the perfect chewy texture with slightly crispy edges. And I don't know if these were just out of the oven, or if it was because it was warm in the shop, but the cookies were warm and the chocolate chips were still melty.

In short, perfect cookies. Ok, they're a bit on the expensive side, but it's worth it. And you can tell there's no preservatives or anything in them because their shelf life sucks. Not nearly as good the next day. Now I want some more.
author: Amanda S.

description: By far in the entire beautiful city of San Francisco to which is my place of birth. I had NEVER in my life had a better cookie than theirs. It's a must have if you're looking for the cookie of your choice. I'm a chocolate chip cookie junkie. The best on this earth. I've traveled the entire states and haven't had a better
author: Claude S.

description:
Toffee milk chocolate cookie....yum!!!

Tha's all I really have to say because that's all I tried. It should say something though that I went back to get a second cookie. It was soft on the inside and slightly harder on the outside. It was perfect!!
author: Andi W.

description:
If I'm getting off at the Castro Muni stop, there's pretty much no way I can avoid a stop at Hot Cookie. 

Simply put, these cookies are made fresh all day and have been consistently delicious. We've brought out-of-town visitors here for a quick look at the Castro, and nobody has been disappointed by our required Hot Cookie stop yet. I can personally attest to the utter transcendence of the Pokie, probably the best M&M chocolate chip cookie... well, pretty much ever.

If you want a quick bite of delicious dessert (and who doesn't, really?) and a little sampling of what the Castro has to offer (naked men outside, penis-shaped cookies inside), Hot Cookie is the place to go.
author: Kristen L.

description:
SNICKERDOODLE! 

Everything else is just... alright. I broke out of the snickledoodle routine ONCE, and had their white chocolate and macadamia nuts and their ginger snaps... and then I quickly turned around, went back in, and got a snickledoodle- this saved me from disliking them. 

The cookies aren't hot, like many of the reviewers said, and yes the white chocolate cookie I had was stale. So really, I'm only a fan of their snickerdoodle and nothing else. It's soft and gooey on the inside, and perfectly crunchy on the outside... yum. It also goes well with some hot chocolate from the gas station across the street on a chilly day.
author: Lucia C.

description:
Get your vice on with Hot Cookie! With suggestively named sweets it's a win-win here.

Tasty original treats in the Castro... cash only.
author: Bobby M.

description: I feel like there is some kind of double entendre going on here. My goal is to one day be on the pin up board in some of those hot little boy shorts.  Nothing like a nice hot cookie on a cool night. Rawr.
author: Dru P.

description:
Aww just ok to me.  Maybe I have too high expectation...the cookies are just ok. 

I got the Toffee Milk Chocolate and Oatmeal Raisins.  They are about $2.50 each.  The cookies are kinda dry and hard.  

One nice thing abut this store is they close very late.
author: Liza T.

description:
Yummy! 

My friends and I stumbled upon this little cookie shop as we were exploring the area at night. It's open really late, and it was just what we needed. 

At the time, we didn't notice the exterior/interior photos plastered along the windows/walls; they show people eating cookies in their underwear. The first time we went, I didn't even notice the penis shaped cookies! I guess I was a little distracted by the beautiful people that work there. The place definitely has some cute and friendly employees ;) We ordered some chocolate chip and toffee cookies that were just pulled from the oven. They were delicious. Fresh, warm, and satisfying, we headed to bed. 

I don't have any complaints about this shop. It's one of those great neighborhood places that maintains the 'charm' of the area, but doesn't blow you away. In all likelihood, I will probably stop here and get some cookies any time I'm in the area. 

Tip: Ask for a sample. 


But seriously, some of the people who work here are really cute.
author: Alex F.

description:
I've been going to Hot Cookie for the past 3 years now and it is consistently delicious! Whenever I'm in the Castro I always make a pit-stop here. They have a large variety of freshly baked cookies. I normally get the peanut butter chocolate chip, but sometimes I mix it up with the penis-shaped coconut macaroon. The cost goes by the weight of the cookie. I don't recommend you go here if nudity makes you uncomfortable because the walls are plastered with pictures of people wearing the "hot cookie" underwear. If you dare by the underwear and take a picture there you will get a free cookie!! 

You MUST go here the next time you have a sweet tooth craving!!
author: Sandhya R.

description:
All im gonna say is,
penis pop was delicious. Its a chocolate covered macaroon (the coconut one, not macarons).
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Where else can I get a coconut penis? Well, probably alot of places in Castro.. but the only edible one would be here. 

Truly AMAZING cookies, and their butch bar is OUT OF THIS WORLD. 


Crappy downside: They don't have gluten-free options. Sadly my girlfriend could only eat the gingersnap cookie (their only item which is gluten-free). It's smaller than the palm of my hand. Kinda expensive for the size and  not the greatest taste.
author: Nat S.

description: This place is pretty cute and unique to me. Its very different and the cookies are amazing . The only part is cashier is just terrible... She barley pays attention to what you want all she cares about is talking to her employees and joking around with them and act like her customers aren't there. She gave too much attitude for no reason... Need a better cashier... Seriously
author: Mimi P.

description:
I had high expectation for Hot Cookie - I mean its HOT in the name right? Regarding all the sexual theme and its location within sexy Castro, its no wonder that I want this goodness sweet dessert melt in my mouth. So when I went to the store with high hopes, I fell to disappointment when I order a Chocolate Mexican cookie and felt that its okay... The cookies are definitely decent but as most other yelpers have said - not to die for.. or even get naked for... okay maybe just for the penises and vaginas cookies.. but not for the quality of the cookie itself.

If y'all visiting San Francisco, its definitely a treat while you are in the Castro checking out hot naked guys but its mostly for a touristy thing.
author: Tuti T.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE!

Not a dessert girl but this bakery is legit.   I took a bite out of every cookie and I fell in love.  Love them and the beautiful baked gems they make.  Kind of steep, but it's a luxury so whatevs.

1 request: Please get a CC machine.
author: Alex T.

description: The best place you can get cookies from love the PB cookies and the vib they are always playing good songs go hot cookie !!!!:):):):)
author: Derrick B.

description: I know the peanut butter cookie was made really early in the morning, but at 11pm, it still tasted hot. OH MY GOD I GET IT.
author: Sam D.

description:
Hot Cookie is great at 4pm.  Hot Cookie is great at 10pm.  Hot Cookie is great after dinner.  Hot Cookie is great for a local swing by.  Hot Cookie is great for tourists.  Hot Cookie is just great.

I recommended the Pokie/Pokey, a delectable M&M studded number, or the Fudge-Covered Brownie, which is Rockefeller rich.

Also, the girl with the fun glasses deserves a shout out for having fun glasses.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
Cooooooookies....

This is the only time I pay for penis.  All 6 bucks of it.  Sadly I did not eat all of it bc it was too big (ha) and I'm not a fan of macaroon fillings or coconuts (coconut shavings on the balls), which makes up this cookie.  But the chocolate outside was t.a.s.t.y.  

They also have other cookies and treats like the chocolate peanut butter cookie and chocolate toffee cookie I ordered.  Those were scrumptious!  Soft and buttery, just the way I likes it!  They have "venus" cookies shaped in a lady's torso but they're not as exciting as the pee pee.  They also sell hot cookie panties.  Hollaaaaaa....

Located in the Castro district, you can't miss it with its big red neon sign.
author: Bernadette M.

description:
When I first moved back to San Francisco I actually briefly worked nearby this place.

Each morning the enticing smells of melted chocolate and soft sugar cookie dough would waft past my nostrils - as I made my way to work. 

It was sinfully painful.

And so late at night - after a long day, I would find myself waiting in line with the countless others stricken with munchies - just waiting for a just out of the oven penis cookie fix.

The cookies taste just as good as they smell. Though not cheap - two dollars for multiple bites of pure happiness is worth the sacrificed bus fare.

Oh and their red underwear briefs with Hot Cookie loudly printed on the tush - are perhaps the most adorable things ever. Sport a pair of these (and I'm speaking to you - both men and women) - with a plate of Hot Cookies - and you're guaranteed a (cough, cough) sweet night.
author: Jessica T.

description: Josh and Chris were super helpful and nice!!  Definitely some of the nicest hot cookie workers ive ever met :)
author: Pao M.

description:
Thumbs Up!

I vouch for their snickerdoodles, chocolate chips, toffee chocolate chips, and ginger snaps, all day every day.
author: Ryan M.

description: Simple little hole in the wall cookie store, right?  Sorta.  There are some different looking cookies here (the popular chocolate covered coconut penis for one), but the flavors of all the cookies are classic and delicious.  This little shop is open late which is great news for late night food hunters like me.  With the big quirky personality, convenient hours, and delicious treats, this place is a winner.
author: Christine W.

description:
We came here on our recent trip to SF because we wanted to get desert and see the Castro.

We tried the Chocolate Cayenne cookie and the rice krispy treat - which looked to die for.  Both were ok, the rice krispy treat was dry and lacked flavor. The cookie was also dry and overall very underwhelming. 

Maybe we should have tried the more phallic shaped ones instead.....
author: Jessica S.

description:
Classic SF Castro tourist place to go. Little window shop full of pictures of gay boys in Hot Cookie underwear and TONS of yummy cookies.

Ordered 4 to split with my sister, and they were all really good though the double chocolate chunk was a bit aggressive and not to my liking. 

It's open pretty late, which is nice when you want something sweet after going out.

Oh, and they have penis cookies/bannas.
author: Chloé M.

description:
A few friends and I stopped by Hot Cookie after hearing about their baked goods of the more risqué variety. Upon arriving at the store we were greeted by walls plastered with photos of fabulously dressed men and women baring some Hot Cookie apparel. 

Hot and bothered, I bought the most offensive thing they had for sale: a coconut macaroon coated with a generous layer of chocolate gloriously baked in the shape of the most awe-inspiring phallus of Herculean proportions, right down to the 8" long, 2" wide shaft and the scrotum decorated with coconut shavings (for that added pinch of ballsy masculinity, I presume), culminating in a creation aptly dubbed "Penis and Venus". 

In short, it was the best penis I've ever had.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
pastry on the pecan pie was a little soft but overall still tasty
Cookie itself was soft, chewy, fragrant and big (toffee milk chocolate)
author: Thefood A.

description: This super small cookie place sure packs a punch! It's amazing and delicious! I love the Venus cookie, it's a lot to eat, but so good! I love everything sold here,  one day I will try it all! Excellent quality, taste, the atmosphere was amaz8ng, and so many interesting pictures on the wall too ;)
author: Courtnee H.

description:
Hot Cookie I hate you. You're an asshole! No, I take that back.. I love you! Don't ever leave me! 

Ugh this place is a few blocks from my place. Just close enough to stumble over when I have a craving. The first time I went in I used a boy as an excuse. "Oh I'll be nice and buy him a cookie.. he likes cookies." 
Yeah .. that was just a segway to me going there on the regular. They are sooo good :(

Personal favorites are snickerdoodle and the toffee one.

That fucker at the counter gave me a regular chocolate chip cookie when I asked for toffee last time. I'd be pissed but the sugar subdued my fatty rage. He was pretty nice anyway. 

I can't articulate well because there's still cookie in my bloodstream. 

Anyhow.. 5 stars. 

I'll limit myself to one cookie a week or less to prevent diabetes and looking like a little brown version of the stay puft dude..
author: Amber F.

description:
Hot Cookie makes me smile. You can't fit more than 2 people in there at once, but it's worth the wait. In my gay opinion it's one of the best cookies around. They are big, chewy, and delicious! And I have heard they will warm them for you upon request. Come on! That's awesome. 

The walls are covered with amusing photos, you can buy hot cookie undies and there are anatomically correct cookies available should you so desire a phallic shaped morsel. They also do rice krispie treats, enormous brownies on a stick and mini cookies. 

I just love it - perfect for after a night of debauchery, or a glass of wine at Blush across the street or to just grab a cookie and have a seat in the open plaza nearby. Trust me when I say there is never a dull moment on the corner of Castro and Market! 

HOT COOKIE ROCKS.
author: Shannon K.

description: Super tasty cookies and coconut macaroons and cheery service. Try the chocolate fudge cookie- a strong contender for best cookie in San Francisco.
author: Kate B.

description: nothing better than the penis and venus. First time i tried it, i was surprised because I did not expect it to actually taste good. Not too sweet, with a very light coconut flavor. Yum.
author: Vicky H.

description: Very good cookies, most of which are G-rated. If they ever catch on, and start making ice cream sandwiches with their cookies... bad things will happen.
author: Michael S.

description:
Now This Is wired! Because if you know me I LIVE for cookies! These cookies "I don't know" they need to improve their recipes "but that's just me" there Brownies and Cupcakes are good. But the biggest thing that rankes this business it's 1 star.... is the customer service! they lack personality, charisma, joy and happiness. 
How ironic they're located in the Castro. 
Not to toot my own Horn but My Cookies are Better. 
Sadly they get 1 only Star.
author: Anthony J G.

description:
This cookie store is home to the CHOCOLATE COVERED PENIS SHAPED MACAROON COOKIE!!! And..its 8 bucks?!?!

GOOD: Chocolate Mint Cookie and Jumbo Rice Krispy Treat

BAD: Snickerdoodle. It was a bit dry for me...
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Since they only take cash, I could only afford to purchase 1 cookie. 

I decided to buy the cayenne cocoa cookie. Most of the cayenne cookies that I taste have the subtle flavor. This one packed a punch. It was super delicious with white chocolate morsels to help quell the spiciness. I would say that the recipe is really well proportioned. I can't wait to try more!!
author: Rosie M.

description: Great products. Especially the butch bar. Solid sweetie fix. Keep it up hot cookie xo
author: James S.

description:
Delicious hot cookies. 

I tried the snickerdoodle on a late Saturday night (fresh, warm, gooey) and a cocoa cayenne on a Sunday morning (not warm, but spicy with dark chocolate dough and white chocolate chunks). They're quite pricey - $2.75 a pop - but so, so good.
author: Michelle J.

description: The sexy Brian is to die for, and the white macadamia nut is also pretty good. I also got a chocolate chip cookie, but it wasn't that great. I would definitely recommend the sexy Brian. Can't wait to stop by next time I'm in SF.
author: Kaii B.

description:
This place is dangerous. I love it so much. The chocolate chip cookies are my favorite. I'm pretty sure they are 98% butter, but I just don't care. 

I'm just thankful that Hot Cookie is 5 blocks away because otherwise we'd have serious problem. 

FYI- they're cash only, so come prepared.
author: L B.

description:
DELICIOUS COOKIES and PENIS MACAROONS! 


The only downfall is the place is a little small and can get crowded. The staff is usually very quick. They need to warm up the cookies, so that they can be HOT (cookies).
author: Aimee E.

description: I mean... I couldn't go to Hot Cookie and not order the Penis & Venus along with the infamous Sticky Nikki. Both cookies were delicious and the staff was bubbly and friendly. This store couldn't be more appropriately placed than in The Castro. It's definitely a fun spot to see if you're from out of town.
author: Ivy D.

description: This place is hopping all the time, and they have the best cookies. I went with the coconut penis macaroon cookie with whip cream.
author: Ron L.

description:
So, it's midnight and you've got a $5 bill burning a hole in your pocket. You could go for a fourth meal... but you want something sweeter. 

Maybe you want something that involves hearing dance music blaring from the balcony of the Lookout while you make your purchase. Maybe you want to maximize your purchase and get a rice krispy treat that'll take you three days to eat. Maybe you want to eat a dick cookie, who knows. Or maybe you just want a thick, gooey cookie from a place that has never failed to sell a perfect cookie.

For all of your midnight munchies, cookie wanting needs, you can find them at Hot Cookie. Open late, cash only, always spot on with the baked goods.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
They have an amazing assortment of super delicious cookies, but the girl (early twenties, light reddish blonde hair) who served us had a major attitude problem.  We asked her what size "Hot Cookie" briefs my boyfriend and I should buy and she said L and M.  I decided I didn't want a pair and said, "Actually we just want the L pair, thanks!." Then I ordered a chocolate chip cookie and a white chocolate macadamia nut cookie.  She ended up ringing us up for 2 pairs of briefs and the cookies.  Then I said we only wanted the L pair and she rolled her eyes and reluctantly rung us up again.  When I walked out the door, I realized she had given me a dark chocolate macadamia rather than a white chocolate.

If you see an angry blonde chick who hates her life behind the counter, you should wait and come back when a happier gay man can serve you.
author: Sherry C.

description:
The best cookie I've had in my life.
 Can't remember the name but it was chocolate chip cookie (tons of them), salted caramel and pretzels on top. 
Warm and just of the oven. Heaven.
author: Lilian F.

description: These cookies are simply divine.  This is a must-visit for anyone coming to SF, especially in the Castro.  It's a cute, cozy little bake shop that has the most creative + inventive cookies you'll probably ever see.  Would definitely visit when I go back to SF!
author: Ashley K.

description:
Yum yum, hot cookie! 

Can I get a Snickerdoodle? A chocolate-dipped brownie-on-a-stick? 

Aw, sookie, sookie!

Hot dudes in underpants? 

Lookie-Lookie!

Got a sweet tooth in the Castro? 

Head to Hot Cookie! :)
author: Ieesha C.

description:
Being a distance runner, I tend to avoid eating sweet baked goods most of the time. It does seem paradoxical that being nearly 6 feet in height, yet just 127 pounds in weight, that I could just eat just about anything I want to whenever I want to. And yet, I don't. I steer clear of cookies, pies,  as well as ice cream, and all the other yummy things I could be enjoying, in order to keep my weight abnormally low in order to maintain my (precious) running pace and the ability to fit into my boys' size 28 jeans. No, I'm not anorexic. Just hooked on the addictive endorphins of running.

All of this (sometime silly) self-discipline and self-denial thankfully gets thrown out the window when I'm in the vicinity of Hot Cookie. I'm a sucker for the aroma of a fresh-baked cookie and completely unable to resist its siren song begging me to eat it. I'm always at its mercy.

I allow myself to occasionally enjoy one of Hot Cookie's bigger, premium-sized cookies when I'm walking out in front of their Castro Street location. Now I know Hot Cookie has a vast variety of delectable cookies, but to date, I've ignored them all, other than the straight-up semi-sweet chocolate chip cookies or the ones with the candy-coated chocolate (like M&Ms) pieces. I tend to stick obstinately with the things I truly enjoy, and I've found all the cookie bliss I desire from just these two varieties. 

I have to say that Hot Cookie will provide me with some great inspiration to do well in the upcoming San Francisco Marathon. I'll definitely enjoy more than just one their cookies after the race. I'll scarfing them down with total impunity!
author: Randall S.

description: I came for the sexy shapes... I stayed for the cayenne. Chocolate chewy, spicy, sweet hot...everything you want in a treat. Unforgettable.
author: Sue W.

description:
*get a subway cookie next door instead*
#coldcookie

For a place that totes only cookies and that they are hot is clearly falsely advertising. As dragged to by a friend we begrudgingly agreed to go check this place out. Maybe it was the high expectation similar to a new great amazing movie that you hear all about, that dismally fails in your mid.

Tiny little shop and walls decorated of that in a college bar. Pictures all over the wall of men (and a few women) in skimpy hot cookie underwear. I got a peanut butter chocolate cookie. It was not hot. It was not delicious. I was not wowed and I think a glass of milk would've been awesome

Not coming back, I'll be happy with my cookies from Keebler eleves.
author: Kevin T.

description:
CASH ONLY!!!!!

I always forget that and then have to go to an ATM, but its always worth it! The toffee and chocolate chip cookie was delicious! Nice and moist like I like it!

The place is very small and easy to miss so keep your eyes open. It's near Twin Peaks Tavern.
author: Telisa K.

description:
Everybody's got penis envy when it comes to these cookies. Stop in and you'll see why. Also a good place to get a pair of underwear.

Don't expect any inside seating because there isn't any. Or inside standing room for that matter. No problem, though: do yourself a favor and just stand outside on the sidewalk and enjoy all the interesting sights.
author: Alex K.

description:
Hello home of the penis cookies! I've definitely bought my fair share of penises for friends since moving into the neighborhood. 

But when I'm not buying the penis cookies, I am gobbling up the DELISH oatmeal white chocolate cranberry cookie. YUM! I love this cookie. It's one of my fave cookies in the city asides from Anthony's Cookies. I think the sweetness of the white chocolate is well-balanced with the oatmeal. I also really like the Double Chocolate cookie when I'm in a chocolatey mood. Super tasty, but it definitely helps to have a small glass of milk. The bf and I have also tried the toffee chocolate chip (can't really taste the toffee that much), regular chocolate chip, and M&M cookies. Those cookies are all decent (3 stars), but I much prefer Anthony's chocolate and toffee chip cookies. 

As for the penis cookie, I can't say that I've ever had one for myself. I've taken a bite of others' though... it's pretty large so there's enough junk to go around. Chocolate covered, cakey cookie on the inside, and coconut shavings for pubes. Hahh... doesn't taste bad, but it isn't anything too special. I definitely think this cookie is more for the novelty than the actual taste.

I love/hate that this place opens late... because that means that I can mostly satisfy my cookie cravings (but this is not always a good thing when I'm trying to have self-control...). I wish they would start accepting credit card though, especially since the cookies aren't cheap. Most cookies are about $2/each (depends on weight) and buying a penis cookie runs approx $6/each.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
running late for dinner rezzies nearby.. i knew i just had to stop by before they closed to finally check this place out.. there was a line out the door but it flew by quickly

picked up:
-cocoa cayenne: i loved this cookie.. the cayenne builds up as you continue to eat.. addicting
-penis macaroon: wow much bigger than expected! i normally don't like macaroons but it's too much coconut for me but it was good

for giggles.. interview with the macaroon
http://sfist.com/2013/04/05/dessertwire_in_which_we_interview_a.php
author: Raquel T.

description:
Cookies were warm and yummy. 

This is definitely more of a fun play to stop by when in the Castro than an actual destination.
author: Hannah N.

description: We had Hot Cookie treats for a recent Bachelorette Backpacking party. Jess picked up a couple of the Macaroon Penis cookies for snacking and shenanigans. Many photos were taken and everyone had some phallic shaped decadence. The cookies were very dense and delicious.  They held up well to both rough handling and transport without falling apart.  My only suggestion is to make the stick a little longer so it is easier to hold.
author: Sandyann G.

description: The name totally got me. And the cookie flavors and names are just awesome. I love that they have mini cookies approx $0.50/ ea (sold by the lb) and are open late until 10pm. Otherwise I found the quality of the cookies just OK; a little Mrs. Fields and Otis Spunkmeyer-ish. I had the white chocolate chip and oatmeal chocolate chip walnut; kinda chewy, kinda sweet, but kinda forgettable. CREAM is also closer to me in Berkeley and the cookies to me were comparable.
author: Debora L.

description: OMG!! the cookie i ate which had chocolate chunks , walnuts and pecans was one of the best chocolate chip cookie I have ever eaten in my life!! IT was soooo good!!  highly recommend this place!
author: Caina S.

description: The home of the penis cookie...ahh.  I actually didn't try it but I did have a warm, straight out of the oven chocolate chip and toffee chocolate chip and both were darn good but pricey at $2.50 each.  But honestly, I had many good cookies throughout my years on this earth and I don't think that its really hard to screw one up so Hot Cookie will not become a "must go" place in my interiary when visiting SF.
author: Monica G.

description: Finally bought a bunch of hot cookies to try.  My favorite? Cocoa cayenne! Made me happy.
author: Virgo M.

description:
Stopped by Hot Cookie while my husband and I were visiting down in the Castro.

What a cute little cookie shop that has more to offer than just cookies.  I had the chocolate chip cookies with pecans and they were so good! The cookies melt in your mouth and I had chocolate all over my hands and mouth!   As I waited for my cookies I looked at all the pictures on the wall and the red underwear hanging which make Hot Cookie such an interesting little shop!

Hot Cookie offers so much more than just cookies.  I'm from Texas and we definitely don't have any cookie shops like this here.  I can't wait to come back to SF and back to the Castro for some more hot cookies!
author: Vikki J.

description: They are Deliciously Fun! Ran into this shop walking down the street on a late night after dinner. My fiancé,  best friend, and I finished all out cookies! Didn't save a single crumb. ;-)
author: Elizabeth R.

description: Super friendly staffs; uniquely interesting shaped cookies; and they are tasty too! Got the chocolate-coated big dick cookie for $6ish! Kept my mouth full for a big while! LOL!
author: Joelle K.

description: Fabulous cookie! I had chocolate chip pecan and absolutely loved it! It's NOT a good place for most young children as there are Polaroids covering the walls of people in their underwear. Doesn't bother me, but others may be put off by this.
author: Jacqueline O.

description:
Extremely tiny place, but very popular! Not really a fan, but the penis macaroon is unique.  Tried their cookies, but I still prefer Mrs. Field's.  I wouldn't suggest making a special trip down here, but if you're in the area, and curious about the place- go for it. Oh, and they are open late, so if you ever have a sugar craving.

*Would have gotten three stars, but they do NOT accept credit cards.  There is a Walgreen's nearby to get cash back, and a Wells Fargo.
author: Karen X.

description: The chocolate chip cookie I bought here was just alright. It was kind of hard though, not the fresh-from-the-oven softness I was hoping for. It was also too expensive for what you're getting, but awesome that they stay open late.
author: Cat M.

description: Any time I'm in the mood for a phallic-shaped cookie, I know just the place to go.  All jokes aside - their cookies are pretty tasty.  Great texture - crispy yet chewy - just the way a cookie should be.
author: Rose A.

description:
They have great cookies.  I ate their peanut butter chocolate cookie and laughed at their penis shaped ones.  

I'll come back when I'm in the area.
author: George U.

description:
Delicious hot cookies! Imagine that! This little shop has a great assortment of cookies. I had the classic chocolate chip cookies, which are a bit bigger than a silver dollar. So tasty! I also got to try the fudge chcocolate chunk cookie. 

They also have some adult-themed cookies that would be great for a bachelor or bachelorette party...or if you're just cool like that. 

They also have an amazing wall of photos.  They sell undies with their logo on them. Peeps take pics of themselves showing off their goods in the teeny bikini's and Hot Cookie posts them up on their wall. There are lots of great pictures up.

The employee was very sweet and helpful. 

If you're getting off on the nearest muni stop, you have to check out Hot Cookie - if for nothing else, than for the penis cookie and pics on the wall!
author: Rosie P.

description:
Even if you never eat a cookie in the shape of a penis, it's nice to know that there is a store out there making them...

Me, I had a snickerdoodle. It was the bees knees.
author: TJ P.

description:
There are so many things wrong with this store. If they made EXCEPTIONAL cookies, all could be forgiven. Alas, the cookies are not really good. This review won't be either. 

First, THE COOKIES AREN'T HOT.
But then, they aren't called 'hot cookie' because of a perceived cookie temperature. It's sexual. They ONLY hire cute twinks that the owner wants to have sex with, and the odd female thrown in just to attract more young men that the owner is attracted to. It's as simple as that. It was never in their business plan to sell cookies that are warm.

The PRICES ARE OUTRAGEOUSLY HIGH.
Prices are not posted, except on day olds, which are .85 each or 3/$2.50. Otherwise, all cookies are some mysterious by the pound price. Which is SUCH A SCAM. That way, you can never know the price of the cookie you pick, until it's time to pay.

DON'T BUY THE UNDERWEAR.
Unless you have a small cock. Or a vagina. The underwear are somewhat unisex in nature. Of course, they won't TELL you that. I'm telling you. 

As far as the cookies themselves, they are ok. Just ok. Not bad, just ok. Very sweet. Very fatty tasting. I seriously suggest that IF you're gonna buy a cookie, you only buy the day olds. They taste just as good as the fresh ones. But for about 1/3 the price. Otherwise, you are looking at THE MOST EXPENSIVE COOKIES in San Francisco.
author: Richard V.

description:
LOVE the cookies here. They're large, feel good cradled in my hand, and melt so nicely in my mouth. I'm not talking about the penis and venus. I don't like phallic cookies with veins...and I prefer macarons to macaroons. But the cookies here are fantastic! They charge by the pound and I got so many cookies when I went. They were so good the first round that I came back a second time for more on the same day just a few hours later. 

The most memorable is the cocoa cayenne. It's not for the faint of heart. It starts out tasting mildly chocolatey. After a few seconds, the cayenne flavor kicks in and it's a little intense. Not intense in the turn your face red sense, but definitely an unusual flavor you don't encounter often. 

I also liked the toffee, walnut with chocolate, white chocolate macadamia, and snickerdoodle. I don't remember every flavor that I got but I remember every cookie was good. Definitely worth the $12 I dropped here. I'll be back in the future. Mrs. Fields has got nothing on Hot Cookie in the Castro. 

*Bonus points for the fun photos on the wall. I like to scan and see if I recognize anyone because I have slutty friends.
author: Nancy C.

description: Not just Amazing cookies and baked goods, but great customer service also! I think I was served by an angel! Should have got her name,  but she will be Angel to me and all the others in line for kick ass cookies! Love the cayenne chocolate cookies!
author: Sean M.

description: This was a fun stop but it cost $7.50 for the penis cookie! And it wasn't even that impressive, it was huge but wasn't great taste-wise. This place is more for those visiting for the novelty.
author: Allison L.

description: I love their big choco "PENIS" cookies with white coconut flakes sprinkle on the two balls! yumm!
author: Pimwalan I.

description: love hot cookie ! wish it was more accessible best macaroons !! i love that you just stop in i use to  work a block away and stop and get cookies on my break def check it out if you're in the neighborhood
author: Justynne B.

description:
The penis-shaped cookie was a hit at the bachelorette party this past weekend. Great for photo opps and such. If you don't see it in the display case, don't worry. They have them! Certain hours of the day, they are moved to the back, so that they do not melt. 

"Enjoy your penis!" the guy behind the counter called out as I was leaving the shop with the cookie. While I answered "I will," I really meant that the bride-to-be would be enjoying it... And she did! :p

The bf was surprised by how "3-D" it was. Veins, coconut flakes, and all.
author: Tinna H.

description:
I go out of my way to come here every time I'm in the bay area!!! 

love love love!!

Freaking amazing cookies of all varieties! I think the snickerdoodle and the macadamia one are my favorites! But they have one of the best classic chocolate chip cookies I've tried!  

Beware if you have innocent eyes or children get your treats to go because the walls are covered in scandalous photos of locales in (and out of O_o) hot cookie undies haha. & some of the treats are scandalously shaped as well ;) I tend to be on the conservative side, but I find it amusing. 

I've been pleasantly surprised by every cookie I've tried here.. large soft moist middle slightly crisped edges.. perfection! 

After my last misadventure at lime right down the street, after stumbling over to hot cookie a friend purchased the infamous penis shaped chocolate covered macaroon on a stick.. I normally would be too embarrassed to try such a creation, but I was caught in a very rare uninhibited drunken form.. I WAS SHOCKED!!! I had low expectations thinking it was popular only for its novelty item appeal! It was literally one of the best macaroons I've ever had!!! Sooo freaking good! I ate the whole thing!!!!! LOL... but really I still can't get over that it actually tasted that great! I'm sure the female form versions are just as tasty as well ;) 

I normally would think phallic shaped objects at bachelor/bachelorette parties are tacky but these are soo flipping tasty I'm definitely ordering several dozen of these bad boys when I or any friends have a bachelorette party!
author: Angela K.

description:
Have you ever given a blow job to a baked good?

I have. Thus, I have just one upped you. suckahhhh

They have the best, biggest, most delish, most pleasing penis macaroon I have ever indulged in. A penis shaped coconut cookie is covered in chocolate and given some fashionable coconut pubes. I recommend not trying to swallow this piece because I tried a little and while it may look hot to some passerbys, you might just die. True story.

Anyways, Hot Cookie has a ton of delicious hot cookies to sell and a ton of other hot eye candy on the walls ;D They decorate their walls with scandalous pictures of customers in their branded Hot Cookie undies. Please refrain from having an orgasm. If I slip and fall while getting my pastries. I will CUT YOU.
author: Jon N.

description:
SUPER SMALL. 

Not going to talk about their cookies, but my friend brought home a penis and she is pleased. 

Customer service is up there! So friendly and nice! 

Super fun. You have to make a stop.
author: Hayne P.

description:
Friend and I were waiting out in the cold for our movie to start at the Castro Theater when we saw our oasis of warmth: Hot Cookie.

We got the chocolate cayenne and the toffee chocolate cookie. 

Loved how the crunchy exterior housed such soft, chewy insides. Loved the spice of the chocolate cayenne. And loved how the toffee and chocolate were melted so nicely together. Drool.

We even started a domino effect...people kept stepping out of line to get some of that cookie =).

About $4 for two hunky cookies.
author: Julia L.

description:
Dear Hot Cookie, 

How I love you. You mean the world to me and you dont even know it... 

Your sweet melty-chocolate scent is stuck in my nostrils and I cant think of anything but you and your crowded, tiny storefront packed with prospective lovers. And yet, when I push/ elbow my way to the front of the line somehow I feel like I'm the only star in your sky. When I'm with you air isnt necessary anymore, I would happily give up shelter to be with you. The $12 I used to have before I bought 2 cookies is paltry compared to the blood I would spill would pay for one morsel of you. Your sweet sweet chocolaty love is all I need. 

Yours forever, 
Cookie Casanova
author: Jessica B.

description:
Eff this place. Chocolate penises everywhere, naked people on the walls, no big deal...but when the smug, rude, man hating chick behind the counter tries to school me on how the nudity is about positive body image and not sex, with her rude attitude, angry and disapproving face, and very typical SF newbee wannabee that makes everything political..  ugggg. Its like, just shut the eff and give me my cookie.  Ironically, this moron ries to claim it isn't sexual, but the exploit sex by selling underwear and having you post  a pic of yourself in them.  Also, didn't they shoot a porn there once? Positive body image MY A$$. 
Aside from  the rude idiot chick with gauges, the cookie, that I should have never bought, tasted terrible. Cold, dry, and with an aftertaste. Typical cash cow tourist trap with absentee owners, no quality control,  no management of their snot nosed brat employees.  Don't waste your time here
author: jacob s.

description: Having lived in SF, I never been to Hot Cookie until last weekend.  They sell each cookie by weight and my penis cookie, at $6 is a pretty good deal.  The chocolate outside is delicious and macaroon inside is packed with coconut flavor.  Sometimes there's nothing better than fighting over who should eat the tip or the balls covered with coconut shavings on a sunny Sunday afternoon in the Castro while 20 yards from you, there are dudes in thongs (and nothing else) having a brew.  Its one of those priceless moments.
author: Dean W.

description:
They have cookies shaped like large brown penises. When you have a friend come into town for the first time, you take them here and they have a look of shock when they see this. The look of shock increases when you purchase them one. Then you say it's a tradition to have one,  your first time in the Castro. They forget you have a cameraphone. Click. Seriously, they could charge $20 and it would be totally worth it just for that look on their face.

And yeah, the other cookies, you know, the round ones... pretty tasty too. Especially the cocoa cayenne.
author: Sean B.

description: These cookies are spectacular. I tried the peanut butter and chocolate chip cookies today. Both were perfect. I'm a fan of chewy cookies, and these are some of the best I've had. The price for one cookie is a little steep ($2.50), but they're big so I didn't mind too much. My only regret is that I didn't buy more!
author: John F.

description: I love this little bakery!  I order anything with chocolate and always fabulous. Friendly and helpful people in back of and in front of the counter!!  Delightful experience!
author: Susan V.

description: If they had more than one location, no other bakery would have a chance.  The staff is welcoming, the environment is fun, and most importantly, the cookies are DELICIOUS!     If you're considering going to Hot Cookie, just go.. you can thank me later!
author: Jake H.

description: Penis cookie is so good! Coconut macaroon cookie with shaved coconut and what a delight it was. Usually when there's novelty food or anything that sells because of a special marketing aspect like erotic edibles, they're usually not that good in taste based on my experiences. People purchase things for the fun of it and for what it is so I expected it to just be typical cake or something. But the coconut macaroon is so delicious and really big! One is definitely enough for two to share... Or three. Don't worry girls, there's enough of that D to go around... Or guys :) lol
author: Annissa H.

description:
I was excited to come in to Hot Cookie after reading the reviews and also being a lover of cookies...of course. 

Didn't get the penis shaped cookie- although hilarious and made me blush, but the other cookies we tried were underwhelming and pricey. $2.75 for a Chocolate Chip cookie? I'll make my own Nestle Tollhouse cookies over Hot Cookie any day.
author: Christine A.

description:
Tried two things: A normal cookie, and a phallic-shaped cookie.

The normal, toffee milk chocolate was delicious.
The phallic-shaped cookie wasn't so good. I don't know if you can say that it "looked tasty" but it wasn't that good. 
4 stars for the normal cookie
1 star for the "Cockie". :)
author: Ryan L.

description: The guy behind the counter, making cookies and handlng orders is a JERK!  He White,  wears a cap, and has large earrings in his ears. On my first time in the shop, he was rude and abrupt with me.  I dismissed as a bad day. Discovering how much I like one of their bars, I went back a second time and asked him if he could please let me have the "corner piece" of the bar since I like how crunchy it is.  He reply "I can't tell which one it is".  Well, all he had to do was look.  I could see it clearly from my side of the counter.  I don't know if this is racial...it feels that way...or on both occasions he has simply proved himself to be a JERK?  I will NOT go into this place again since I can take my business and money elsewhere where customer service is a priority for ALL people walking in the door.
author: Austin N.

description:
Best cookies in the area. The place is open somewhat late so you can stumble in here in the middle of bar hopping to get your fatty on and get some awesome baked goods.

Cash only so make sure you got some singles on you if you want that cookie. I normally get the brownie which is awesome and big. They also have some really great cookies like the double chocolate and snickerdoodle.

They also have a hilariously shaped penis "cookie" which is mostly a giant macaroon dipped in chocolate complete with two macaroon balls. Try it if you dare, but probably too big for most so you should probably double team it with another. ^_~

Staff is super friendly but the space is annoying very small and the line is usually out the door.

The walls are also covered with pictures of people in their "Hot Cookie" underwear which you can purchase. I've heard you can get a free cookie if you pose in their underwear and let them take pictures but I'd have to get more than just a one cookie to pose in just my underwear.
author: Kameron K.

description: Oh. My. God. I'm from Oakland and I come to San Francisco for hot cookie twice a week. Despite the $5 dollar toll. The cookies are good. But I come for one reason: Mel. She is by far the best hot cookie employee. I met her by happenstance one Wednesday night when the moon was full and the infamous sf sky was vacant for the evening. Mel was there. The clubs were hot and the drinks were cold and all I and my three friends wanted was hot cookie. And hot cookie we had. And we had Mel. And she was dreamy. She was sugary sweet, complex, and a little bit nutty. Just like the cookies. Ever since then I've come twice a week and gotten the cookies just to experience Mel. And I feel we've grown close. She should be awarded a raise if not a promotion. Thank you Mel for the days of cookies and the days of companionship. Thanks Mel. Love, always and forever, the gays.
author: Will S.

description:
The pokeys here are unbelievable. They leave no vacant spot on the cookie without a candy-coated piece of chocolate to occupy it. Ask them to heat it up for you and you get to endure a crabby glare from the counter person. But you'll also get a delicious, hot cookie that melts in your mouth, which is worth 10 crabby glares. 

Other honorable mentions: the Snickerdoodle, the Toffee Milk Chocolate, and the Butch bar. 

Cash only!
author: Rachel F.

description: My peanut butter cookie was ice cold! Isn't this place called Hot Cookie?!? I'm confused. Perhaps I was mislead. Great decor but deceptive product.
author: Nick K.

description: was lookin forward 2 coming here SO much. i wanted to buy my boyfriend the special cookie, like the man one, but he was too shy. i got so many cookies cuz i luv cookies like crazy. so i got the HOT COOKIE undies too, of course! wen i was taking like FOREVER to pick what cookies to get, my boyfriend saw a picture of someone he knew on the photo wall! soooo awesome! i luv hot cookie an would fly from MIA jus to come here and hang.
author: Sweetie S.

description:
Hot Cookie is the perfect treat for a late night snack or for standing in line waiting for a movie at The Castro. Friendly and cute counter girls. Cookies are really yummy. You don't have to say much about this place, just that you need to go.

Just prepare to stand in line for your cookie.
Also remember, CASH ONLY!
author: John S.

description:
Nom nom nom. You pay $5.25, they give you a life size chocolate covered penis macaroon cookie on a stick. Very good deal. My friend bought one and I took a couple of bites. It's the best tasting penis shaped cookie I've ever had. 

The place is small, no room for sitting. But no worries, walk around Castro with a penis on a stick and you'll fit right in.
author: Cassy H.

description:
So......WHO does this?!

Takes a spur-of-the-moment week vacation to escape some work stress.  Chooses to drive all the way up to San Francisco with one thing on his brain-Hot Cookie.

My dear, darling husband, that's who!

Ever since our last visit here, he's been looking for an excuse to come back for the cookies.  He had it all planned out.  Hot Cookie would be our main destination on our last day in SF.  We would buy a dozen hot out of the oven & scurry all the way back home to share them with the boys.  No, we would not eat a one until we got home.

Hah.  He should have known better than to take a restroom break mid-way back to our motel.  He left the cookies with me.  I held out for almost  10 seconds, but the aromas were too much to resist.  Plus, this grouchy-looking man was staring at me & I wanted to tease him.  I kept reaching in & breaking off little pieces to munch on.  Hubby literally caught me with my hand in the cookie bag.

$30 for a dozen.  White cranberry oatmeal, snickerdoodles, pecan, peanut butter, chocolate chip, pokies, double fudge....so worth the price.

I chickened out on getting a chocolate penis macaroon.  I really was thinking to get one, pose with it, & use it as an avatar.......
Bawk, bawk, bawk, bawk!
author: Lynette T.

description:
Had an intense late-night passion for cookies. Bypassed the penises and went directly for the chocolate chip cookie, pokie (chocolate chip with M&Ms) and snickerdoodle. All are fresh, very gooey in the center, and golden brown crispy around the edges

The chocolate chip cookies and M&M cookies are...mostly chocolate, held together by cookie dough. They are perfection when hot and the chocolate starts flowing everywhere (microwave those bitches)! Hot cookies from Hot Cookies truly satisfy sweet teeth. Penis shaped macaroons...you are large and impressive...but I don't need you.

And have cash, or no cookies/underwear for you
author: Jessica C.

description: Great cookies!!! Service occasionally not great great... Feel looked over, but still, where else are you going to eat cock on a stick?
author: Jason B.

description: Hilarious staff and delicious desserts! Me and my girlfriend were wandering around looking for dessert and came across this place. It's really tiny, but that almost makes it more enjoyable because you are forced to talk to the friendly and entertaining employees. We got a chocolate chip cookie, a brownie, and a chocolate dipped brownie, which came out to around $7. This seemed like a lot for pretty simple pastries at the time, but once we tasted them we realized they're absolutely worth it. The cookie was delicious and the brownies were very rich (took me 2 days to get through mine because I felt like I only needed to eat a little at a time to be satisfied). Definitely going back sometime soon.
author: Chance R.

description:
I can't quite remember when/where I'd seen images of this place, but the moment I saw it while wandering down Castro St. on my first visit I was pretty giddy. Super giddy. My friend that moved to the area from Houston a couple of years ago aka my tour guide insisted that I HAD to go there, so we made a quick stop in before we parted ways.

Huge glowing neon red sign, you can't miss "Hot Cookie" logo in the window. The space is tiny, but the brief discomfort of being in such a confined space is overlooked when you see all the delicious goodies behind the glass. They had a variety of cookies, of course, that being chocolate chip, snicker doodle, white chocolate chip, and brownies were amongst the culprits wanting to break out from the behind the glass and make it into my belly. My friend had other plans. He ordered before I did: "A snickerdoodle, white chocolate chip cookie, and a penis please," in the most serious manner and demeanor. 

Tee hee. I of course giggled like a little school girl.

And he handed me the penis cookie. "This is for you. And you HAVE to go outside and take a picture with it, like you're gonna eat it." Fannnntastic. And that's just what I did, to the amusement of other passer-bys.

I have to say, that cookie was delicious, sweet, awesomeness. It was a macaroon, dipped in chocolate and molded into a penis shape, maybe a little under a foot long. (That's what she said?) The "balls" even little bits of coconut shavings. They even had a macaroon chocolate dipped women's torso, boobs and all, but had run out of "Venus" cookies that day (chcolate dipped cookie vaginas).

Keep it classy, Hot Cookie. Put this on your list of places to drop into!
author: Alison A.

description:
Who doesn't love comfort food at 12 Midnight after a night out in the Castro?

To me, home made cookies are an essential comfort food, and Hot Cookie definitely delivers in this arena.

A cookie perfected (in my opinion) is always slightly under done in the center (we all know cookie dough is pure heaven) so Hot Cookie earns major points in my book for always pulling their cookies out of the oven before they get too overdone. 

The White Chocolate Coconut Macadamia Nut & Toffee Chocolate Chip are personal favorites, though the small almond cookies are also delicious additions if 2 just aren't enough.

Would have gone for 5 stars but the staff can be hit or miss (sometimes with a little attitude) and I hate that it is cash only. But not that big of a deal where it has deferred me over the years.

Check it out.
author: Ryan H.

description: Hot Cookie is always on my list of recommended places for visitors to SF.  Best cookies I've ever had, hands down.  Their Cocoa Cayenne is to die for!
author: Julie S.

description:
The penis shaped cookie is called the Penis & Venus. So good! If you like coconut macaroons, you'll love it! It's pretty huge, so I think sharing it would be ideal. I haven't tried the other cookies, but they look good!

Note that it's cash only.
author: Laura D.

description: I love this place. The staff are nice and their desserts are so awesome. Never disappointed when I go here.
author: Christopher S.

description: Yummy, gooey, chocolate, chocolate chunk cookie --- better than sex (sometimes). We also had a peanut butter cookie and a chocolate frosted, chocolate brownie- so ultra moist & messy. Tiny little place. I had to post about the edible stuff. So many people stuck on the penis cookies. ..yeah, yeah, talk about how delectable the majority of the fabulously baked goods are. Go, go, go. It's worth the hassle finding a parking spot.
author: Trish T.

description:
Any place that sells life-size chocolate covered macaroon penis cookies is fine by me. As someone who grew up eating macaroons at Passover every year, I can testify that Hot Cookie makes one of the best macaroons ever. 

If shoving a shaft down your throat is a little too 'weird' for you, they sell plain macaroons you can buy instead. But if I ever see you eating those plain macaroons, I will openly judge you for being boring. And unadventurous. And more boring. 

Eat the fucking penis. It's delicious.
author: Jared S.

description:
I GOT MY DICK ON A STICK!
I GOT MY DICK ON A STICK!
I GOT MY DICK ON A STICK!

Yee! 

Penis shaped macaroon covered in chocolate with coconut sprinkles on the "nutsacks". The best $4.75 that I've ever spent my money on. Fo realz!

It's even veiny like the real thing!

I want to minus three stars for the itty bitty space and limited options but the penis macaroons made my day, so thank you for that Hot cookie!

I less than three you Castro Street, I really do.
author: Jaye C.

description:
After various trips to Castro and many mentions of Hot Cookie, I finally got a chance at my own bite of a hot cookie!

I arrived at 11pm. Still open! That's a plus right there on its own (because honestly, how many bakeries stay open past 7pm??) Their selection is wide. Being as indecisive as I am, I felt overwhelmed looking at the display case full of cookies. I asked the girl working what she suggested. My friend and I shared a toffee chocolate chunk. My other friends bought some of the other flavors and graciously allowed me a bite of each.

The toffee chocolate chunk was delicious. Soft on the inside, crispy on the outside. I wish the toffee flavor was more dominant, but I really didn't have complaints about it other than that. The chocolate chip cookie was amazing! Sounds boring, but the cookie is full of chocolate (just how I like it).

While I liked the cookies, I feel like I could replicate them on my own (or find something similar elsewhere). But definitely a great place to satisfy any sweet tooth!
author: Emily T.

description:
Hot Cookie!! My FAVORITE cookie shop by far. Every time I'm in the Castro, I make it a point to stop by here and pick up a pound of their mini cookies (gives you 2 dozen cookies and runs for about $11)  I get an assortment of chocolate fudge, chocolate chip, and white chocolate chip. Those little bite sized cookies are scrumptious. Perfect! Not too sweet and a bit cakey...just the way I like. The cookies aren't too greasy either like Mrs. Fields. 

It's a simple shop...1 glass case of cookies, 1 guy behind the counter wearing red undies and t shirt selling the cookies, a wall covered with the wackiest pics of people getting aroused over these sweet treats, and they also sell "Penis & Venus" marshmallow cookies on a stick. =)
author: Lynn V.

description:
PENIS COOKIE!!!!!!! 

when i told one of my friends i was going to SF, she said "you gotta get a penis cookie!" what? i asked friends who live in SF about it and they looked at me weird and didnt know what i was talking about. "probably in Castro" 

Hot Cookie was our last stop before heading out to the airport to head back to LA. it is located right next to the Castro Theater and i think can easily be missed. its a really small bakery with a small sign "HOT COOKIE" in big red letters out front. there was a line out the door with a few people, and the people in front of us were talking about a penis cookie, so we knew we were at the right place. maybe about 3 steps into the door is the display case, so its a pretty small place. the walls are filled with pictures of people with the Hot Cookie hot pants and raunchy photos with the infamous penis cookie. anyway back to the display case, there are regular, normal, bakery items, like cookies, rice crispies...and i dont really know what else because i wasnt really looking at those things, because BAM! there it was. there were only 3 penis cookies left, and a vagina cookie. the vagina cookie was in the shape of a womans torso with coconut shavings as pubes. boring. the penis cookie however was a big ass chocolate covered penis. i mean cookie. its like, once you go black you never go back. what? anyway, i thought this was the most hilarious thing ever and had to get two to share with friends back in LA. the guy asked me "would you like a big bag for all your penises?" i couldnt help but laugh out loud. it was actually pretty good though. the whole thing was a coconut macaroon and covered in chocolate (on a stick). cash only.

"want some weenie?' 
"ill just take the tip" 
"its a cock-a-nut"
author: Lina O.

description:
Ok, I know you all seem to think that just because its in the Castro that I'm automatically going to give it five stars. 

Listen, I like the Castro. It's my new Disneyland (which I also proclaimed loudly at LEAST 5 times while drunk outside of Harvey's), but I am not biased. As a matter of fact, I love cookies SO MUCH, that if need be I would have given this place one star. *el g4sp!*

So I was waiting outside on the corner of Castro and Market looking like a fancy streetwalker (and probably a tranny because I was wearing a blazer with jeans) for Adam M. to fucking SHOW UP ON TIME, it was FREEZING and I was HUNGRY. Lookie! Across the street! PENIS COOKKKIIIEEEEE!!!!

So I walked in, struttin my stuff because I couldn't do it on the ANTM runway, and looked for *it*. *The* cookie. *The* one I had been waiting for. 

And I chickened out. x_x

So my dumbass tells the sweet guy behind the corner, "uhh..which ones your favourite? I just want something really gooey"

After about 2 minutes of decision-making, I went with the Snickerdoodle. YUM! It was so soft, so gooey, warm, and just all around wonderful. LOVES IT.

Also, I found out that the penis cookie is a macaroon? Ehhh..not my favourite cookie. PASS. (But I'll admire it from afar...:sigh:)
author: Jaime L.

description:
These are the cookies Mrs. Fields wishes she were making.  Perfectly crisp around the edges and chewy in the middle and jam-packed with tidbits galore.  Lots of semi-sweet and dark options...my favorite.  I just tried a bite of the Rice Krispies treat half-coated with dark chocolate and that one bite was enough to send me to crunchy-gooey-chocolately heaven.  One of those is enough for 3 people, I'm sure.  The oatmeal raisin cookie is out of this world.

P.S. I've heard a rumor that they sell day-old cookies at a substantial discount.
author: Valeria R.

description: Want a great cookie? This is where you get great cookies. We tried the ginger snap - classic and chewy along with a peanut butter chocolate chip (my hubby inhaled that one), and a teeny tiny adorable pecan pie. Really good. I was a little bummed out they only had Swiss miss hot chocolate so I went two doors down the coffee place.
author: Tacia C.

description:
What can I say, I came in with only one thing on my mind. When he said "I see you're eyeing my dick", I had to wink.

Let's just say it tasted and felt as good as it looked. Their macarons live up to the hype, I found myself eating long after I was stuffed and ruined my appetite for dinner, boo. I'm making this a regular squeeze when I come back to the Castro. Don't forget the milk! (:

*CASH ONLY!
author: Jeanine W.

description:
My good friend R and I dashed in here after making a stop at the will-call booth at the Castro Theater to catch one of the films showcased for the evening at the Berlin & Beyond Film Festival.  Since it was too late to catch a bite to eat (we hit Nirvana after the movie) we decided on smuggling in some cookies from this little joint.

The guys (and girls, at times) working this counter are full of personality, very jovial, and most inviting.  I ordered two of the cranberry-white chocolate-walnut-cookies, my friend bought the pecan encrusted chocolate chip cookie, and I bought two more oatmeal chocolate chip for the trip back.  They have a variety of brownies and enormous chocolate and white chocolate dipped rice krispie treats.  I would have selected one of those, but thought better, than having to sit in a theater making loud crunching sounds.

The cookies here are huge, heavy, and filling. They cost by the pound, though, so keep an eye on the number of cookies bought.  But for the perfect snack during a German film, the munching kept me occupied, as did the characters on the screen.  They were also quite reflective when we stopped back for some quarters for Bart.  He smiled and gave us change, "see you next time...."
author: Miika M.

description: OMG Best Gooey Toffee Chocolate Chip Cookie Ever! They also had Dicks on a Stick....goes well with that saying, "once U go Chocolate...U Never Go Back " Wish they came smaller 2 large to put in your mouth :D Pricing was pretty reasonable for 1 large  Regular Sized Cookie, and 2 Mini White Chocolate Chip $3.50, and they were very fresh & warm.
author: Leah B.

description:
In any other place ordering a penis (or two, or three) would result in an arrest by an undercover cop (or a really REALLY good time, but I digress...). Here at Hot Cookie, all that order gets you is a chocolate covered baked good. Although, I must say, they are somewhat anatomically correct. So depending on what you're particular "craving" is these cookies may be able to satisfy in more ways than one.

(Just kidding. That's gross. Skip the mess and just eat the damn thing. You won't regret it!)
author: Valerie C.

description: Where else will you find a chocolate covered macaroon shaped like a penis.. Nowhere else. Four words: It's so damn good.
author: Celeste M.

description: Okay let me start by saying that if it was possible to give this place freaking infinite stars I would. Hahaha dramatic much I think yes. But seriously Hot Cookie is one of the best thing that has happened to SF. Not only are the cookies here the BOMB.com but the employees here are beyond phenomenal. They sincerely care about their customers and you can tell they take pride in their work and that their jobs mean more to them than just making cookies. And that Sticky Nicky Cookie is to die for and that's on mamas.
author: Haleemah L.

description: They're cookies are good, but I took my ten and eight year old daughters thinking that it would be fun.. It was very inappropriate.
author: Jalene V.

description:
While in line, I overheard a girl talking on the phone:

"Do you want a penis tonight? It's chocolate flavored. I'm here, so I'll get some for you."

That made my night! I didn't order anything, but my friend got a snicker doodle cookie. I approved!
author: Hong L.

description:
Now I know what all the hype is about. I didn't even get to try cookies fresh out of the oven and I still loved it here. The cookies have the right amount of texture - not too hard and not too soft, just the way I like 'em. One day, when I work-up my courage, I will try that giant penis cookie.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
A tiny store (no seating), a friendly guy behind the counter, and giant cookies shaped like penises (served on a stick).  For those willing to pay $12 for unigender Hot Cookie undies, you get your photo on the wall, wearing said undies.

When presented with a large variety of cookies, I take forever to decide, and between my friend and me, it took even longer.  Good thing the counter guy was patient.  We decided on a lemon bar, an oatmeal walnut milk chocolate cookie, a chocolate cayenne cookie, and a toffee milk chocolate cookie.  We didn't come anywhere close to eating all of them.

Stoked that the lemon bar wasn't eggy, although I would have liked some powdered sugar on top 'cause it was sticky.  I probably liked the oatmeal cookie the best, and it's my friend's favorite, too.  The chocolate cayenne didn't do much for me; you could feel the heat after swallowing, but it might have been nice to have some cinnamon or something with a little bite while chewing.  The toffee flavor in the chocolate chip cookie wasn't strong enough for me.  Some of the cookies were crunchy, some were soft.

Altogether: very good, but not the best cookies ever.
author: Amy K.

description: Confession.  I have been procuring Cock-aroons and smuggling them into the Castro Theater to nibble on during flicks. If only I were so brazen to eat them off the stick as if they were corn dogs, as it was intended.  Instead, I break off chunks of the balls between my thumb and forefinger, and snack surreptitiously.
author: Pernicious J.

description:
This place has been around a while and even though I rarely go, I'm amazed at how great the quality of these cookies are.  

I've only had the cookies and the last time I was here I had a Pecan Chocolate Chip that was incredible - all the pecans were in the center of the cookie and were a hearty addition to the cookie; it was also generously filled with chocolate chips.

I'd love to try some of those brownies since those look amazing too.
author: Ken G.

description: The dick-shaped cookie was a lot better tasting than I expected.
author: David C.

description: Really good cookies! Be sure to check out their wall of fame. ;-)
author: Tracy O.

description:
I got the cocoa cayenne, chocolate toffee and M&M cookies. We had all three mixed up so when I got a spicy kick 10 seconds after eating what I thought was the chocolate toffee, I was pretty surprised only to realize it was the cayenne.It has a nice subtle kick to it. That being said, I dont think that thats very hard to achieve. 
The M&M cookies were okay. The chocolate toffee felt like marshmallows or white chips inside, less toffee.
All three cookies ended up being like $8 which I thought was very expensive for what the cookies were. 
Overall, 3 stars because the cookies were good, they were not horrible but no more starts because they weren't something to call home about either.
I would go there just to check out their collection of raunchy cookies. The place itself is really small and the walls are covered with raunchy images. Fits right into the castro..
author: Shruti T.

description:
See the picture up there? The one with the, ah, Castro appropriate theme? Yeah, that's Hot Cookie. Located in the heart of the Castro, the cookies are great (especially my chocolate covered with mint), and you just couldn't ask for a better name.

It's not how I roll, but I'm sure the aforementioned cookie can be enjoyed by both gay folks and their straight allies. In this city we don't judge. Just celebrate. And dance. And eat cookies.
author: Jason B.

description: This is the only place I know where a person can get a penis shaped cookie..
author: M C.

description:
The most delicious and fresh cookies I have had aside from my Grandmother's!!

My favorite cookie would have to be the toffee chocolate chip with a little carton of kindergarden milk and I'm good to go. 

I also love that they offer mini-cookies so you can buy in bulk for friends or have a less guilty cookie eating experience. hehe. 

Friendly and happy staff.

Great quality at a low price.
author: Goth Kitty Jen J.

description:
I stumbled upon this cookie store by chance, since I was in the neighborhood, so I decided to stop inside.  First thing I could say.."WOW!"  The walls are covered with pictures of people modeling the "Hot Cookie" red and white underwear in the store.  Most of the people are semi-nude and laying on top of counters or outside of the store.  I must commend them on their bravery since I don't believe I could ever model my underwear in public, but I was definitely caught off guard by the naked people staring at me as I tried to decide what cookie to order.  

Furthermore, the penis shaped cookies, looked awesome! Unfortunately, nobody I went with wanted to share one with me, so I decided to just order a Chocolate Chip cookie.  The cookie itself was okay.  It was soft on the inside and had a fair amount of chocolate chips, but flavor wise, I've definitely had better.

My recommendations: if you're going to go to this place for a cookie, don't go for the cookies themselves, but rather for the experience of the shop and of Castro Street.  Also, don't expect a happy, warm greeting by the employees.  They look like they have sticks up their asses and treat you just the same.
author: Merisa M.

description:
Who doesn't love a fresh baked cookie?  

They're yummy and huge.  My favorite is the toffee chocolate!

And I do love their funny 'sexy' cookies.  

And their briefs!  :-)

Enjoy, with a tall glass of ice cold milk.  

It's just a counter with cookies baking and being showcased for sale.  And it's cash only, but the prices are worth the cookies melting onto your hips!
author: Fannie S.

description:
If you're in Castro, you're going to have to take a pit stop into this joint. Try their oatmeal chocolate chip, especially when it's a fresh batch. The chocolate melts in your mouth! DELICIOUS!

The lines sometimes can be really long, so if you're okay waiting in line for a cookie, give this place a try.
author: Sarah K.

description: I admit that the best cookies in the world are sold here, however, after last night I will not return. We arrived just before closing and we were greeted with "you better hurry because we close in five minutes."  I replied with "well, five minutes is five minutes."  The shorter guy behind the counter with longer hair then threatened to call the police if we didn't leave, and then continued to hurl personal insults regarding his unflattering opinion of my physical appearance. I'll never return and they lost a good customer. Plenty of other places still great cookies, and with a friendly smile.
author: Ryan C.

description:
I bought my mom a penis cookie!

One of my lab partners was telling me about this place a while back and was kind enough to bring me a chocolate chip cookie one day. He told me that they had "rather interesting shaped cookies" and always wondered what he was talking about.. until today!

My boyfriend and I went to Hot Cookie after eating at Super Duper. Parking wasn't difficult since we parked on Market St. and walked less than 5 minutes to the Castro. This place is tiny! You could fit 2-3 people comfortably (my boyfriend had to stay outside while I ordered lol) The workers are very friendly and knowledgeable about their products. Since I have a peanut allergy, I asked them which cookies had peanuts in them and which ones didn't. They told me which ones did and which ones didn't and informed me that all their cookies are baked on the same tray. 

I ended up getting three toffee chocolate chip cookies, one white chocolate macadamia, and one chocolate chip cookie. My boyfriend asked me if I wanted the penis cookie and I told him that I don't really like macaroons so I'd pass. The worker rang me up and my total came out to be $12 and some change. Then I thought to myself, "I can't go into Hot Cookie and NOT get a penis shaped cookie" so I told the worker that I wanted a penis cookie and my total came out to be $19 and some change. Kind of pricy, but whatevs! The cookies are huge btw!

My boyfriend and I went back to the car and enjoyed our cookies, after taking numerous pictures of the penis cookie of course. The cookies are crispy on the edges, buttery, and oh so good! The toffee one reminds me of Anthony's Cookies. If you're allergic to peanuts, you might want to skip on these cookies. Both my boyfriend and I are allergic to peanuts and we could definitely taste the traces of peanut butter cookies from the pan in our cookies.

I probably won't come back for the cookies since most of their products are all cooked on one pan, but I might be back for the ooey gooey rice krispy treats! I can't wait till my mom goes downstairs and see the surprise I got her. ;)
author: Joyce E.

description:
If you're averse to decadent confections and delectably baked goodies crafted in the shape of engorged members and/or throbby honeypots, this isn't the place for you.

Otherwise, step into [sometimes a long long line to] the shoppe and indulge yourself on crispy-edged snickerdoodles and toasty-topped macaroons.
_________________________________________________
Inevitably, someone will emote "MMmmm, that's soooo good..."
author: Mikey U.

description: Everyone that comes to the Castro must get a penis cookie! It's a novelty, but the cookie itself is actually really delicious once you get over the shape of the cookie. It's covered in dark chocolate and coconut. YUM!
author: Anne T.

description:
During dinner, I was thinking about dessert.  I yelped and Hot Cookie came up.  Since it was just down the road, I figured why not.  

I tried the cocoa cayenne and the toffee chocolate chip.  Both cookies were moist and chewy.  The cookies were slightly too sweet for me.  The cocoa cayenne had a nice subtle kick.  As for the toffee chocolate chip cookie, I didn't really taste the toffee.
