His dong came out half way up the block, then he tried to put it back in while running, but it came out again.  Everyone was whistling and cheering and it was awesome.  A stranger with an English accent asked me "How did you get 'im to do THAT?" and I told him that all I had to do was offer to buy him a cookie if 'e did it.  Well, he got his cookie and he enjoyed it.
author: Jin D.

description:
I've seen this place so many times every time I go to the Castro, yet amazingly I never tried their cookies until last night. My friend suggested we get some cookies as an after snack/post movie dessert. We went into hot cookie and it was like a child's best friend- giant cookies, huge rice krispies, large brownies, okay and yes a giant penis and boobs/female body cookie (maybe that part wasn't so childish). They looked very fresh and good.

My friend and I couldn't decide on which cookies to get. Later, we settled on two cocoa cayenne cookies. Theyre huge, larger than the size of my palm (minus fingers). The total came out to be $4.80 for 2 cookies. 

They were really really good! Very fresh, yummy cookie dough, excellent chocolate, not too sweet, and just uber perfect. I really savored every bite.

For the size of the cookies, I say the pricing is fair. 

The ambiance of the place might shock some as there are very interesting self portraits of folks half naked, but hey it's the Castro and that's what makes this place very cool. I love the decorations, the uniqueness, and even the guy who sold me the cookies was cute=) (but cmon they couldn't have possibly hired him as the spokesperson resident hot cookie haha). 

I wanted to buy the penis cookie for a friend's bridal shower coming up, but recognize that it would go bad by then, but still so tempting and what a great gift! ^_^ I will have to come back and get that for someone.

By the way, CASH ONLY. 

Oh, it opens late too! I was there at near midnight on Friday night.
author: Tina C.

description: I guess everyone goes here to gawk at or try the penis and torso cookies. I personally haven't tried them yet, but have had one of their brownies. It was pretty yummy, except I definitely wish I had water or milk with it. That shit was packed with flavor and super thick. They have some pretty interesting combinations like their cayenne chocolate cookie which has a little bit of a kick, but generally isn't amazing. The actual store is really small and can only hold a max of 7 people. The walls are covered in photos of people wearing their branded underwear. The greatest part about this place is that it's open late.
author: Tephany P.

description: Awesome! Best chocolate chip cookie Ive ever had. Also really enjoyed the pumpkin cookie, tho my man did not. He loved the white chocolate oatmeal cookie with cranberries. Guess it's just about what you like in your cookie. SOOOO good:)
author: Ashley D.

description:
I love this place.  I especially love the chili cookies, the pecan cookies.  I normally wait till they have day old cookies at 1/2 the price.  I could not see paying full price for their cookies as they as so expensive.

The staff are friendly and the place is clean.  I like it that they cook their own cookies, so you know you are getting freshly made cookies.  I love that they are soft in texture.
author: Vanilla C.

description:
I have loved this place since back in 2004! 

yesterday i asked my boyfriends brother to get me a "naughty" cookie and i was so stoked to come home to see one waiting for me! 

also their chocolate cookies with white chocolate chips and pepper is so yummy!

this is a great lil place to get yummy fun treats!
author: Eli M.

description: What's not to love!!! Yummy cookies, fun service, great location!!!  I love hot cookie!
author: Jeff P.

description: Introduced by my older bro we came here for a nice adventure for our mouths and boy did we find a big one for it. The coconut macaroon dick was delish as well as the ladies body one. The brownies were nice a moist and the cookies were huge and delightful. Best sweet shop ever and a must when going to frisco!
author: Jenny C.

description:
This is one example when size DOESN'T matter. 

Finale to Sweet Hunt, sweet thing: #5: penis macaroon cookie on a stick

This HOT cookie was too much for three girls to handle. We were only able to eat 2/3 of it. The penis cookie was way too thick. Too much coconut for my liking. But loved the chocolate coat!

LoL, they even sprinkled some toasted coconut on the tip of the penis to look like you know what...
author: Sue Y.

description:
What is better than warm, soft, chewy cookies after a night of drinking? NOTHING.

Bonus points for the big chocolate covered penis cookies on a stick, sprinkled with coconut flakes!
author: Bekki J.

description: Stumbled upon this tiny cookie shop and thought I would try it out! Not only is the novelty factor quite awesome, but the cookies are very good! After asking the guy working there what the most popular flavors were, i got 2 toffee chocolate chip and 1 white chocolate macadamia nut cookie. They were still warm from the oven and smelled amazing! The flavor was excellent and there were plenty of chunks of chocolate and nuts. The only thing I wasn't particularly fond of, was that the cookies were a bit too underdone for my liking, but that's just personal preference.
author: Chelsea M.

description: it was my first time here..My bf and i were on a random trip around frisco...and i had a mean sweet tooth..and i yelped this place called "hot cookie".....Best choice ever!! The classic chocolate chip is sooooo freakin good...it has the right softness in the middle and the crispness on the edgs...yummy!! I loved every freakin minute eating this cookie!! Also the customer service was awesome..i will rave about this place forever...and will have fat dreams about this cookie until i make another trip out to Frisco...
author: Jerna' S.

description:
Hot Cookie is a great tourist attraction and most of their cookies taste great.

But their baked goods are NEVER hot. What's up with that? Also, I'm a huge fan of sugary anything + ginger...but their ginger snaps just don't do it for me.

Good for a sweet reward after Janet's Friday night yoga flow.
author: Ali W.

description: I walked by this place after yoga and thought, i deserve hot cookies, i just worked out! i waited about 15 minutes for them to open at 11am and then bought a chocolate toffee chip cookie (their most popular), mini chocolate chip cookie, and ginger snap cookie. i loved the toffee, it wasn't too crunchy, just really good melt in your mouth toffee. the choco chip was meh. the ginger snap was fantastic! love the spices and just the right amount. the staff was super friendly and awesome. the only pitfall is they take cash only...i totally under tipped my cab driver as a result of my cookie addiction. whoops!
author: sherrie n.

description: I've been walking by this cookie store for years and finally gave it a shot.  Worst peanut-butter cookie I've ever had.
author: Bob L.

description: You HAVE to check out their PENIS cookie...It's Delicious. It tastes like a chocolate covered macroon with some coconut shavings on it. (think i spelled that correct?!) Anyway, it was delicious, I'm actually craving one right now. =) You gotta try it. It looks like a novelty but, it was delicious! An edible penis hahah.
author: Shaun E.

description: STRONGLY recommend the dark chocolate dick cookie. Love that the server actually made me say the word 'penis' to get it - I was being way too polite and vague. Apart from being fantastically shaped, it was so frikkin delicious it got scarfed down in about 5 minutes  - and those are some BIG cookies. Love this place!
author: Anna C.

description:
As a wise comedienne once said: "My idea of heaven is where everyone is hot and you never get fat."

Welcome to Hot Cookie.

Photos of the iconic red boys' brief all worn by tittilating men and women (in various states of nudity) on the walls? Check.

Great racks (the baking kind)? Check.

A crapload of addictive carbs in every single moist/gooey/heavenly bite? Check plus.

The best oxymoron is the kind where you see gorgeous people represent cookies that typically cause obesity.

I love it.

(Oh, and the Oatmeal Walnut Chocolate Chip cookie is the best. Brilliant texture.)
author: C. P.

description: After leaving Chow we headed over to Hot Cookie on the waitress' recommendation and I was glad we did! The place is tiny and interestingly decorated. We ordered several tiny coconut macaroons, a couple chocolate chip cookies, a marshmallow treat and a macadamia nut & chocolate chip cookie. They were all great! I was tempted to try a chocolate covered penis, but I think maybe I'll save those for the next bachelorette party I host & have them shipped to me.
author: Stephanie G.

description: Yum!!!! I came here again recently after a scavenger hunt and their Snickerdoodle cookies are to die for! I have been craving another one ever since, I will definitely be back for more!
author: Christina D.

description: Just enjoying a nice stroll on a sunny day with wife and kid and stumbled across Hot Cookie. Since we all like oatmeal raisin cookies, grabbed two for the three of us. Was shocked, shocked! that it came out to $5. So I thought "well, this must be an amazing cookie". We all tried it. It was good. Maybe they use special raisins? special oats? special bakers? Don't know, don't care. The cookie was good, not great, and certainly not worth $2.50. I'll stick with my Mrs. Fields. If the cookie was $1.25 I would give this place 4 stars. At $2.50 each, 2 stars.
author: Dom L.

description: We came here just to check out the penis/bikini cookies. I didn't really want to purchase anything but the bf decided he wanted to try the penis cookie.... lol. It was huge and ok tasting. He also got cookies and they were ok also.
author: Jessica V.

description: Yeah yeah yeah the gentialia bakery.....but really, their chocolate spicy cookies were so good I had to go get another one the next day.  Open late and plastered with pictures of twinks in Hot Cookie underwear, which looks available for purchase.  My next Yelp pic in em!
author: Brandon B.

description: I don't like how they don't have any prices labeled for any of their items.  I also don't like how they charge by weighing their cookies.  I bought 3 cookies from them, and it turned out to be $7.50.  That's pretty much highway robbery.  Their cookies better taste heavenly if they are going to be that expensive.  Unfortunately, when I bit into them, they weren't any better than cookies that I've had elsewhere for far cheaper prices.
author: Tyler C.

description:
Is that an oversized, chocolate-dipped, penis-shaped macaroon in your pants, or are you just happy to see me?

Seriously, though?  These things weigh about a pound, and pump enough sugar into your bloodstream to send you into a diabetic coma for a year.  It wasn't cream-filled (like I thought it was supposed to be), but it was still phenomenally tasty.  

And, you know, it makes for funny pictures.  ...If you're immature like I am.
author: Heather T.

description:
I blush easily.  Examples likely to trigger said blushing:  public displays of affection from cute boys, over-the-top flattery in front of others (private flattery is encouraged), and penis-shaped cookies *blushes*.  This may come from all of those church camps I went to where they taught little boys to keep their [insert pword] in their pants. *blushes*

With the blushing sometimes comes guilt.  Guilt for getting a little too excited when I walk into this naughty cozy cookie shop and guilt for ordering, not one, but three deliciously warm cookies of my choosing.  Guilt for looking at the gay *blushes* men on the walls wearing their Hot Cookie chonies and guilt for wishing that one of said gay men *blushes* would walk home with me, nibble on my cookies, and help me get crumbs in the sheets. 

*grins while blushing*
author: Janney B.

description:
Good cookies, but lordy are they pricey! $2.50 for a "large" which is really not that big. Ok wait, the cookies are REALLY good. Yeah, the really is actually important to justify the price. I came in for the second time today, and this time got 6 small cookies for $2.40 instead of one for $2.50. (Hey, I believe in ROI.) 
Suggestion: get chocolate chip for a baseline and then try other flavors. I wasn't too in love with the M&M ones but chocolate chip and fudge were great.
So the cookies are great, and the place is very Castro-y....so ok I'll deal with the price. And pretend they don't have a million calories each.
author: Emilia S.

description:
omg have i not written a review for this place? I've been here just once, but pass it at least once a week due to Line 24 bus.

I LOVE COOKIES. Specifically, HOT COOKIE. :)  The chocolate chip cookie is so good! i'm always tempted to buy one when I pass this place. I need to try the other stuff...but for now, the thoughts of chocolate chip cookie is enough to keep me satisfied.

The pairs of underwear hanging around the place is mighty cute too.
author: Carol L.

description:
Sometimes when it's rainy and cold and gross all I want to do is eat cookies, watch bad television (that Celebrity Rehab shit on VH1 is AWESOME) and curl up into the fetal position on the couch.  Sometimes I do that when it's not rainy.  I call it a good day.

Anyways, I hadn't been to Hot Cookie in months because its pretty much fat shaped into a penis shaped chocolate cookie (that I refuse to eat because I'm a classy lady).  But I went this weekend and I THREW DOWN.

Get the day old cookies.  They are much cheaper (.85 each or 3 for 2.75 - guess what I got!) and still just as tasty.  The cayenne mocha chocolate ones are the best but every cookie is tasty.  Not so tasty if you're buying the "fresh" ones that are like fuckin' $3.  Seriously day old.  DAY OLD.

Also, I kind of want a pair of their underwear.  Again, because I'm a classy lady.
author: Evan L.

description: Awesome place for late night sweet tooth craving.. Check out the designs.. Ahahaha great!
author: Becky U.

description: I was walking around San Francisco last summer because that's how I spend my vacations... and as I made my way down Castro, I saw a sign that said "Hot Cookie".  There was a line out the door so I just stood in it.  Got something like a double chocolate chili cookie and went on my way.    It was delicious, and everyone in the Castro is very attractive, and I may or may not have imagined all of them wearing Hot Cookie undies.  Thanks, Hot Cookie.
author: Emily C.

description:
I love this place!  I drove over to Hot Cookie last night and waited 10 minutes  in the cold for my toffee chocolate chip cookie.  (They were out of them when I got there.)

Trust me, one bite of their chewy yet crispy cookies you will understand why I was willing to wait.  And of course last night was one of those bone chilling nights in our lovely town.  But was it worth it? Hell yeah! =)

There is nothing like a warm chocolate chip cookie where with almost every bite you can taste the melted toffee.  The cookie is crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. 

Forget all the hype about Anthony's cookies...Hot Cookie wins my vote hands down!
author: Cris H.

description:
I may have found it .... one of the last warm chocolate chip cookies WITH nuts in SF.  Many other places in SF might be afraid to add nuts because of allergies.  (ahem!  Specialties ...)

After dinner last night @ 2223 (review forthcoming), I went here to grab some sweets to bring home.  Luckily I was full from dinner, otherwise they would not have made it home.

Many kinds are available.  I bought snickerdooldles, choco chip with nuts, some oatmeal with nuts, and a few others.  Judging by how they were devoured by my roommate, and from the crumbs from the inside of the bag, they are mighty tasty.  They have regular and bite size too.

Actually, I did get a bit of each, and still had to lick the inside of the bag.

Open late for the bar crowd, cookies are priced by weight, rather than count, and I don't think they put their finger on the scale either.  Stumble in, get your sweets, and stumble out, but be careful you don't hit the back wall!  This is a small place!
author: Michael M.

description:
While I *do* love Specialtys' cookies, I'd have to say I prefer Hot Cookie.  The macroons are amazing, and with a glass of milk and their chocolate chip, you really can't go wrong.

Some say there is not enough coconut on top of the 7 layer bar.  I, on the other hand, am a proponent of the goopy goodness at the bottom.
author: Brianna H.

description:
I only get the famous giant penis cookies as gifts or for photo ops. I would never buy it just so I can have something to munch on. I mean, seriously, walking down Market with a big brown penis in your mouth... Awkward!

But... I stop by here from time to time to absorb some alcohol before moving on to the next bar or whatever. The cookies aren't the best things ever in life, but they do the job.

It's convenient that's for sure.
author: Richard T.

description:
I can't give them 5 stars because cookies are actually a fair way down my totem pole of desserts.  But when you're traipsing about town with some snack-crazed visitors whose blood sugar is about to tank, Hot Cookie is a lifesaver.  (Just make sure your visitors are, er...worldly.  If they enjoy phallic food, even better.)

I was hoping for more variety from an all-cookie store, but at least they had Cayenne Chocolate, and the important thing is the cookies are absolutely loaded with chips and other goodies...the dough is just there to hold it all together, really.
author: Wes M.

description:
$5 gets you two cookies.  TWO!  Yeah, not the place to go for cookies if you're cheap.  The cookies are sold by the pound and each cookie weighs about $2.50.  If you have an unrefined tongue like I do, don't bother coming here. It kills me thinking about how many cookies I could make with $5 and my pantry.  But these are nice once in a while when they're hot out of the oven. I like the chocolate toffee cookies the best. 

Tiny place, you can see the oven right behind the counter (which I didn't until someone pointed it out to me).  Lots of pictures of customers, I assume, posing in their Hot Cookie undies. Right by the 24 & 35 bus stops so you can order a cookie while keeping an eye out for the bus.
author: Yan E.

description:
Hmmm.... tons of delicious looking phallic shapes! This is the only place where I think it is very acceptable to say that phallic shaped things looks delicious! 

I got a warm chocolate cookie here (I know... I'm kinda plain). DIVINEEEEE! It was huge! The chocolate chip was moist! and it was HUGE! LOL. 

Love this place! Love its location, love its size! and love, LOVE their sense of humor!
author: Miss C.

description:
They cocoa-cayenne cookie is so good (thanks Pippi L) I might have to stop by soon to have it again. But this is coming from a girl who had the cookie, lunch, and ice cream. So this cookie trip could be in the next 30 minutes.

I haven't had a bad cookie here, I guess its the timing of walking in on a fresh, hot batch. Now if I could maybe not eat so many cookies I can don one of their "hot cookie" brief panties to prance around the house and restrict myself to 1/4 of a cookie. Bitches.
author: Cheryl D.

description:
This has been a favorite spot for me for YEARS!! Yes the undies in the window don't scream come in and eat our fattening cookies, but DAMN they are good!!! A bit on the pricey side, but worth every penny!

I'm especially hooked on the cayenne chocolate cookies, thank god I moved out of the neighborhood... but nothing has come close to replacing they're goodness! 

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!
author: Lisa S.

description: Totally a fun place to get a snack. The cookies are huge and how can you not love the penis/venus macaroons. I've gotten a couple for friends. Only drawbacks - they're kind of expensive (sold by weight - one cookie is over two dollars). I wasn't super impressed by the chocolate chip (maybe it was the chocolate and the batter was still tasty) but I have to say the snickerdoodle was freaking delishious. It was cinnamoney and undercooked and gooey in the middle. Prob the best snickerdoodle I've ever had.
author: Christina K.

description: I know these guys have plenty of fantastic reviews, but I need to pat them on the back again. This place is great, and the cookies are to die for!
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Hot Cookie is Mrs. Fields as played by Bette Midler.

For the record I haven't tried their signature, human anatomy-inspired macaroons.  I began going to the Castro theater since 1994 but have only recently discovered Hot Cookie.  One Saturday afternoon on my way to Costas-Gravas "Z," I smelled warm cinnamon which, despite 5 minutes before showtime, prompted me to stop and look.  Thankfully, the theater attendant let me in with a dozen snickerdoodles in hand.  (And yes, I kept my word and did not snack during the entire screening.)

The snickerdoodle - cinnamon with sprinkled sugar - is excellent: crispy around the edges and softer and softer towards the center.  I love soft cookies so this is fantastic.  The chocolate chip cookie practically melts in your mouth, but I do wish the chocolate taste stands out more.  Also the dough is occasionally underbaked; otherwise this could have been a 5-star review.

Film noir week at the Castro + snickerdoodles at Hot Cookie + quick stop at Books Inc. = Happiness
author: Nicholas S.

description:
I never thought a cookie shop could make me blush. My previous visit to a cookie shop was Mrs. Fields. Such a wholesome name that makes me think of some granny smith with oven mits serving me a tray filled with freshly baked chocolate chip cookies.

The name Hot Cookie can go in two directions. One:  Hot. Cookie. A freshly baked warm gooey cookie. Or Two: Hot. Cookie. A freshly baked cookie shaped in great detail of a penis. 

I'll never be caught dead walking around consuming a cookie shaped into a phallic symbol. You think I'd grow a pair, but no, I'll stick with being a little conservative about that. But kudos to them for being creative and for the good laugh.

Anyways, what keeps me coming back to Hot Cookie are their Snickerdoodles. Soooo good. Seriously. Tons of cinnamon and sugar baked into a gooey delight. Each bite makes me more and more grateful that I live in San Francisco.
author: Shereen R.

description:
I totally want to sport some of their undies. I'm a BIG ASS fan.  
.. In so many ways... 
And, if I keep eating their cookies...
Well, you get it. :)
author: Kellie P.

description:
toffee and chocolate chip cookie was worth every calorie. yums in all dimensions, truth.

this place smells like a dream.

i have fat kid dreams.

i have happy kid dreams.
author: Eliza D.

description:
Hot Cookie has so much charm.

There is nothing greater than seeing a chocolate macaroon penis cookie with coconut sprinkled ever so conveniently.

Well maybe, there's something greater but that always makes me laugh.

Either that, or its my go-to for when I'm drunk in the Castro without another penis to go home to but my own.

Jessie J., I'll see you at fat camp.
author: Kim D.

description:
The best! 
Hot, cute, yummy and friendly! 
The cookies were incredible too! Peanut butter choco chip! and the Cayenne chocolate with white chips, great!
Cash Only
Use the F line train car
author: Natasha S.

description: We drive out of our way to come here and often bring friends from out of town. I haven't had anything I disliked, but the cayenne chocolate cookie with white chips is probably the best cookie I've ever eaten. Check this place out.
author: Lauren J.

description:
5 stars for the Rice Krispie Treats made with real butter. 

I have nothing more to say.
author: Katherine B.

description:
After bouncing between three chairs (coloring/cutting, heat and wash) at Notorious salon for nearly four hours, I almost ALWAYS get a couple of cookies at Hot Cookie. Why? Is it because being at the salon is painful? No. is it because I'm a glutton? 

*DING DING DING* yes.

This reminds me of a radio commercial for Will and Grace a while back, where she mentions a Brazilian waffle. 

Will: What's a Brazilian waffle?
Grace: oh, it's a regular Belgian waffle, I just call it a Brazilian waffle because after I get waxed it hurts so bad I get a waffle to make me feel better.

So, I'm not in pain, but I still want my cookie reward. How can you resist that aroma? Warm vanilla, chocolate and cinnamon combine in the oven to form the most evil scent, luring unsuspecting people that are trying to behave on their diets and succumbing to the Hot Cookie temptation. 

Their choco chip cookies are pretty good, but I like their snickerdoodles- wide swathes of cinnamon and sugar run through this thick cookie instead of being sprinkled on top of a doughy-colored disk. No, this snickerdoodle has personality!

you know you want a Hot Cookie!
author: Mortiche W.

description: I love cookies, and I love Hot Cookie!  This place is very small, right when you walk in there is the cash register and a counter full of delicious, unique baked goods!  I tried the Chocolate Chip Macadamia.  So good! These cookies are big, so you get your money's worth.  I want to go back and try the cookie with the M&Ms in it.  The guy working was friendly, greeted me immediately, and filled me in on his favorites when I asked.  You can also buy yesterday's cookies for cheaper than the fresh ones.
author: Sarah B.

description: Tasty cookies. I'm unable to resist their temptation when walking past the shop.
author: Miriam W.

description: going to this humble bakery was one of best places in San Francisco i visited, the inviting smells, and the delightful staff, and environment was all great. I hope to visit again one day, but until then keep making baked goods!
author: Brandon C.

description: i used to live down the block from hot cookie and hardly went in unless we were super drunk after the bars closed. now, ive introduced so many friends to this place, when i come to town to visit, my husband always asks if we can do a drive by during "regular" hours. we are staying with friends in cole valley and when we brought them hot cookie, they were SOOOO excited! always great, delicious and fresh gooey cookies. the smell of the bakery is intoxicating from the street not to mention once you get inside.  we tried the oatmeal-cranberry-white chocolate (my all time go-to and fav), the toffee chip, the oatmeal walnut and the white chocolate macadamia nut.  all around, everyone was pleased with our selections and we got our sweet fix for weeks to come!  glad to see this is place is still around and thriving after all of these years!
author: Nicole R.

description:
i tried hard to resist temptations since i was stuff from dinner & about to get gelato.  

i failed.  the warm cookies are like fantastic sugary sweet sex in your mouth.
author: Helen F.

description: Penis cookie spells 5 stars to me. Supporting that would be the pictures of men prancing around in underwear that says "Hot Cookie" on it, plastered onto the walls. The cookies are great, and have delicious selections. I only allowed myself to buy 4 cookies, and I pretty much tore a bit of me away from having to decide. The chocolate cookie wih cayenne pepper in it? NOOOOOOOOM NOM NOM. The place has character!
author: Tammy L.

description:
Here getting dessert with a friend who typically asks a ton of questions about what wine to get, did the same about the cookies here. Kind of like Borat and the cheese. She got to the obvious ones: "And what are these?" 

"Those are penises," the friendly guy says, matter-of-factly with a smile.

Classic. Only in San Francisco.

Cocoa cayenne, coconut macadamia, and one that was practically pure chocolate. Good stuff. Didn't get to try the Bryan's that had seemingly every cookie ingredient ever, but she got one.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Yes it's expensive, hard to get to, impossible to park nearby, and did I mention overpriced (Two cookies is like 5 bucks!)? But where else are you going to find toffee chocolate chip cookies fresh out of the oven? Where else are you going to find fudge covered brownies? Sure Subway makes fresh warm cookies, that are often undercooked in the middle and thinner than paper. You get what you pay for, and when you buy these cookies, you get all that and more. 

I want some now.
author: Adam P.

description:
The best cookie place I've ever had! This place rams Mrs.fields and Tom's cookies in the rear and says " Take that! we rule!" 
Amazing cookies! I can't pick a favoritecookie in this place. I've been going to this place for years and has introduced this place to many of my friends and sf visitors. All the cookies are great. Peanut butter chocolate chip! white chocolate chip! Snicker doodle! Pumpkin cookie! fudge brownie! fudge penis bars! Yes!they have penis shaped cookie on a stick! AND they have boobies on a stick. It's awesome! Definitely a memorable place :)
author: Ying F.

description: Small cute cookie shop in Castro.  Only a few people fit inside at a time, so it makes sense that a line will form on the street.  I tried the Penis and the Cocoa Cayenne cookie my first visit and the Cocoa Cayenne was surprisingly good.  I only ordered it cus I've never heard of that flavor before, it  has a cayenne kick aftertaste, but it was still good.  The Penis was made with macaroons, I just had to try it haha.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
This is the gayest cookie shop in the history of baked goods or homosexuality.  It's a hilarious storefront bakery that features hot red underwear with "Hot Cookie" emblazoned on them while occupying a spot smack dab in the middle of the Castro.  Oh, Hot Cookie.  You're a delicious purveyor of confections while surrounded by all that is not heterosexual.

And the cookies are mother effing delicious.  The only negative?  If you didnt' feel obese before, shoving a super-rich chocolate-y cookie into your piehole while being surrounded by photos of ripped muscular men and beautiful women in hot cookie underoos will knock your self-esteem.

I'm just saying.


Maybe I ate another cookie to counter the guilt.  You can prove nothing.
author: Teej T.

description:
I don't really care about the cookies. I just feel like this, like The Cafe or The Castro, is a Castro street institution. Especially the Hot Cookie panties and the ten million pictures hung on the walls of people trying to look seductive.

I like the oatmeal white chocolate cranberry cookie.

And that is all.
author: Alexis B.

description: giant m&m marshmallow krispy was deliciousssssss!!!!!!!!! i picked one up while visiting on vacation!!! socal needs a hot cookie
author: Marci A.

description: The most delicious, soft, heavenly cookies you've ever eaten. Hands down some of the best cookies I've had in my 23 years on this earth. I literally go out of my way on my commute home to stop by this place. Definitely avoid if you're trying to stick to a diet.
author: Bianca F.

description:
I've never really had their cookies but I've had their chocolate penises.  I guess it was OK but it just doesn't equal to the real thing...jussst kidding.  

But hey, I give this place 2 stars since they do have a picture of me on their "hot cookie"  underwear posted on their wall.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Anyone who knows anything about me knows that I love cookies and Hot Cookie definitely get two big thumbs up.

The Toffee Chocolate Chip and Coconut Macadamia have never disappointed my palette the countless times I've had them. In fact, I'm eating a Coconut Macadamia cookie while writing this review.

This is a place you have to try at least once and you'll be hooked. I also love that they're open really late. It's a lovely thing to stumble out one of the many bars in the Castro and drunkenly gorge on a hot delicious cookie. That is what I call a good Saturday night out.
author: Zona P.

description:
I just remember going in here ONCE, and that was on Halloween a few years back when my friends and I were tired and starving and the only place that was open and had enough seats for us was Hot Cookie.

It's a memorable place for us because we took a lot of pictures here. =]

I can't remember what kind of cookie I got but I remember getting one and Iiking it! Yay!
author: Michelle B.

description:
Cookies here rock - they are delicious and use fantastic recipes. They're all sold by weight so the prices are fair, although a bit on the higher side. Try their chocolate cayenne cookie - my favorite of all time (rich chocolate paired with just a dash of heat),  chocolate chip toffee cookie and the snicker doodle which is rolled in cinammon before baking and sugar after for perfect flavor distribution. The cookies are tender on the inside and crisp on the outside, and really fresh - although not always hot, they don't sell old goods since they bake small batches and have a quick turnover. Also try their macaroons - good quality of flaked coconut and delicious chocolate dipping.

The downsides of this place is the small size - can accomodate only tree or so bodies at a time inside the shop; it's really hot - no bueno in the fall time - kind of expensive - around $2.50 per cookie when weighed, and inconsistency in the baking from time to time.

By the way way, the brownie they sell in this joint comes on a stick, dipped in chocolate. It's pretty much like eating fudge that's got flour and eggs in it. It's SO rich and when I eat one (usually at a bar near the shop) drunk people drool over it. Also where else can ya get a macaroon dipped in chocolate and shaped like a penis? ;)
author: Y K.

description:
HOT COOKIES! 

Pick 'em, buy 'em, put 'em in yer mouth...Enjoy the orgy of cookie goodness!

Consider the neighborhood...but they offer naughty novelty cookies and underpants with their logo on it (I own two pairs thanks to my friends...thanks Ruth!)
author: Peter O.

description: Imagine what it would be like if Mrs. Fields had a penis shaped cookie cutter and liked to hang her underwear in the window.  That's Hot Cookie.
author: David F.

description:
Damn you Hot Cookie! Why must I discover you the day after I decide to start eating healthier! Oh how you spite me with your buttery, chewy coconut macadamia nut ball of wonder!

Obviously this place has great cookies. I think everyone should walk around San Francisco at least 1 time eating a chocolate covered penis. 

But really, who can pay attention to the cookies when there are pictures of young men in underwear covering the wall!? My personal favorite was the one of a wholesome young man pouring milk all over his almost-naked body. I bet that was a fun photo shoot!
author: Kelsey E.

description: Best cookies I have ever purchased.  Probably better than homemade ones right out of the oven too.  The peanut butter chocolate chip is insanely good, but definitely venture out and try some of the odder sounding ones, like the cayenne chocolate one.  Spicy chocolate...oddly works so well!
author: Madison M.

description:
I have great memories, stumbling out of the Cafe on Market St..I could just smell the sweetness in the air.  
It was always so perfect after a couple of drinks and dancing!  A great was to raise the blood sugar  and you can keep on dancing.

My fav...the Choco chip toffee.  YUM!  I only discovered it because the cookie that I purchased didn't taste right.  So I brought it back and she gave me some that she like...Damn...now I'm hooked!
author: rebecca h.

description: I encourage everyone to go to Hot Cookie at least once, mainly for the novelty of it all.  It's a tiny shop (no seating), but the staff have always been friendly, and the place is chocked full of photos from people modeling the hot cookie underwear--an added plus.  The best thing to get is the chocolate covered macaroon penis cookie.  I mean, c'mon.  It tastes great and is entertaining to eat.  I've also had their oatmeal cookies, and it was flavorful and soft--just how I like them--though not the freshest possible.  If you're in the area, stop by, have a penis on a stick.
author: Jareb K.

description: This place is great. All the cookies are amazing but my fave is the oatmeal choco chip with walnuts. I buy in bulk when I get up the the city. There is no parking so I usually have someone drop me off and come back in a few to pick me up. The service is great. Last time I went I saw there were only 3 cookies and I asked if they had more and they gave me fresh from the oven cookies! The chips were still melting. Lord have mercy this place is heaven on a rainbow...get it? rainbow, castro? hahah! I'm such a dork
author: Natalie L.

description:
So after going to Ike's Place and buying the mother of all sandwiches, Kryptonite, I thought I could use a little dessert. No, not because the double sized sandwich wasn't enough. Hell, half of it is still in the fridge as I am typing this review out. I just needed a little something sweet to finish the huge behemoth of a half sandwich. So what better way to kill the sugar craving but with a cookie from Hot Cookie? Conveniently located near the Metro Station so I could just buy and walk to my train.


So I got a Semi-Sweet fresh off the new pan, a toffee chocolate and a peanut butter. Three cookies, three different kinds of sweetness. Semi Sweet will always be my favorite because of old school Mrs. Field's when it was still made with love and not half way processed like it is now. Hand made cookies are always the best and the only way to go if you want a cookie. And I must say, semi sweet is awesome! Not too sweet and the gooey-ness and chewy soft cookie from being fresh off the new pan is awesomeness in itself. The peanut butter, for some reason, didn't wow me. Maybe because it wasn't as soft as I hoped and maybe because the outer ridge was encroaching into the sweet chewy center of the cookie. And the toffee chocolate chip...If you like it sweet, this is the one for you. I should have known this would be the sweetest one of the three. Toffee? Chocolate chips? Yeah, I had a duh moment right there. 


The have brownies that I haven't tried yet. And the penis and venus cookies look like a novelty item based on the pics around the shop of people doing naughty things with them. But that is left for another time. And please, just because the name of the place says Hot Cookie, it doesn't mean they actually have hot cookies ready for you to buy. Use a little common sense, people.
author: Anthony L.

description: Judging just the taste of the cookie, a little overrated to me, nothing special about it.
author: Rohit G.

description:
penis and venus cookies are a personal favorite
you definitely shouldn't finish an SF visit without going to hot cookie!
their x rated cookies are only $6!
very cute
and i almost DIED and went to heaven because it was so amazingly delicious!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Hot Cookie is mmm mmm good!  They've got all kinds of cookies.. chocolate chip, peanut butter, oatmeal raisin, and more.  I can never leave with just one.  

The last time I was here, I was having such a great time that I called another patron a sassy b*tch.  Clearly the sugar had gone to my brain.  And that's why I keep going back.  My sweet tooth loves this sugary shack.
author: bridget h.

description:
Hubby got a craving for a late night cookie. Found this place on Yelp and it did not disappoint.  Yummy toffee choc. chip and choc. fudge cookies that hit the spot with a little carton of milk.
 Thanks Yelp!
author: Moe L.

description: Craving penis cookie?  Then this is the best place to go satisfy your cravings.  This place is totally cute and urban. The workers are cool and friendly. Many people go for the penis and vagina cookies. But their other cookies are good too. (Oatmeal cookies) . Totally recommend everyone experience walking down Castro St with a penis cookie in your hand.
author: Be L.

description:
Oh toffee milk chocolate cookie... how do I love thee, let me count the ways....

Crisp on the outside, gooey on the inside. These cookies are very sweet and buttery. The snickerdoodles are good too but really... just go for the toffee milk chocolate. My friend says this place is "ghetto" but I think he's confused because it's just outside the Castro Street station. To me, this is the ultimate in convenience. You can even jump out of the Muni station with your monthly pass... get a cookie, and then jump right back on a train to wherever with complete satisfaction of a yum yummy cookie.
author: Allison J.

description:
Pecan Chip, Coconut Macadamia, and Lemon Bar...

All I can say is Yummmmm!

Oh, and one more thing, the old school milk in the cartons like when we were in school made me want to eat more cookies.  I walked in and out of there 3 times on Saturday!
author: Steven W.

description:
Oh Hot Cookie, you are all what I thought you were to be and more! 

This place is Super Uber tiny. Big enough or maybe 5 adults to stand in just to order-no sitting. But this is awesome for a quick and out of this world cookie on the go! All their cookies are grand and their penis cookies are out of this world!- a novelty item has never tasted so GOOD:Large macaroon cookie with a thick layer of chocolate in the shape of a penis- this is forsure a must get on any visit!

Don't forget to pick up a pair of Hot Cookie undies by the way!
author: Sarah S.

description: I'm a cookie fan in general, but you hand me a melt-in-your-mouth/hand, warm chocolate chip cookie, and I MELT!  This cookie was SO good.  I went with a small group and I ordered several to try.  The chocolate chip is my favorite, but that's no new revelation; that's generally always the case.  My next feat here is having my picture placed on their wall.  ;)  I just need to hit the gym first...right after I get done eating.
author: Josh G.

description: Visited hot cookie at about 11 at night with my girlfriend and a friend of hers. Purchased multiple penis cookies and the female version. They were great cookies. Our friend even opted for the "bent" cookie and they were able to accommodate. I'm fairly certain a very burly old man in there even hit on me. Good experience, no reason to not go there once if your in the area.
author: Marty D.

description: Best cookies in town! I love the vibe & fun surrounding this place. Epic, and totally SF!
author: Paul R.

description:
Although I've only had the classic chocolate chip a few times, I have to say, I love hot cookie. The first time I went the cookies were slightly warm and the chocolate chips were gooey and melted on the inside- mmmmmm! The cookie itself was crunchy on the outside and chewy on the inside, the perfect balance. 

The second time I went, the cookies weren't warm but still almost equally delicious. A bit pricey and they only take cash but whenever I'm in the castro area I'll be sure to stop by again.
author: Julie M.

description:
I come to this place once or twice a year after a night of drinking in the Castro and want a little something sweet before I hop on MUNI.  I need to remember to go somewhere else when that drunken craving hits.  

First, the cookies have never been hot.  Not once.  Not even "came out of the oven two hours ago" warm.  Which is fine if your name isn't "Hot Cookie"! 

Second, $2.64 for one cookie??? Come on. The cookies are good, but average, not great.    

If you're in the Castro and just NEED a cookie, go for it.  Otherwise, hold off.
author: L T.

description: The premise is a bit cheesy and dated at this point, but you cannot deny that they do bring the goods. The cookies are delicious! My favorites are: ginger snap, toffee/chocolate chip, peanut butter chocolate chip, and they make the BEST snicker-doodles I've ever had. So good!
author: Eme L.

description:
HOT DAMN!
Love my hot cookie with cold milk even it it is not fashionable to eat one on Twinkie Street, USA.
Fuck you skinny bitches, Ima gonna enjoy myself tonight with a bag of hot cookies and I ain't gonna share!
OK, maybe one.............
author: JayChan H.

description: Snickerdoodle cookie is my favorite!  a bit on the expensive side..but whenever I'm in the castro...I do have to have my cookie yum!!!  2 cookies for $5..pricey...but love it..
author: Poppy M.

description:
Perfect snickerdoodles (not even my favorite cookie but oh so good)
Perfect chocolate chip (indeed my favorite, boring i know)
Perfect macaroons (squishy)
Perfect layer bars (you know, the kind with coconut, crumbs, chocolate chips, and butter)
Perfect location (been drinkin? have a cookie! been eating? have a cookie anyway!)
author: Geryon R.

description: Let's get this out of the way first: the cookies at Hot Cookie? They're at regular old room temperature. I know, right? But after you get over this initial disappointment, the cookies are A-OK. I had the cocoa cayenne cookie. Spicy, soft, sweet, and chewy. I'll be back.
author: Shawn J.

description: If you're having a bachelor / bachelorette party, this is your option for treats.  That said the service isn't the most welcoming.
author: Heather R.

description:
O.K. I'm not going to say 5 stars...

I come here often. Maybe I'm just too jaded to titter over the sexual shapes. ("Do you see this? In my mouth? I'm putting a PENIS in my mouth, and now, I'm biting it. All the way in! Yay!" O.K. I'm rolling my eyes now. But maybe this aspect would be popular with teenagers and bridal parties.)

Look, here's the point:

They make cookies. They are rich and yummy. But, unless you live in a world where $7 cupcakes and $4 muffins are acceptable, they are too expensive.

I ONLY buy the day olds -- which are $0.85/ea. Period. No cookie is ever worth more than that. N.B. You *have to* ask what they have becaue sometimes they have day-olds behind the counter.

Sure, sometimes the day-olds are a tiny bit stale, but rarely, and even then they taste fine.

Once, in a great while I buy a chocolate-covered macaroon. I can't remember how much they cost -- it was $1.65 not too long ago. They are huge, luxurious and obscene...-ly delicious.

I'm glad the tourist can pay the rent on the place by paying full whack, but the cognoscenti do the day-olds.
author: BigJohnS F.

description:
I really believed that the cookies would be hot, as in, warmed up. Ala Specialties. But they're not. They're hot, as in sexy, I guess, although I wouldn't go as far as to say they got me all bothered in my lady regions. They were just good.

What they are, are greasy, dense, rich, and lovely. Sorta pricey, but you can bring home a big bag and share with your friends.
author: Melissa J.

description: This 4-star is just for the FUN that we had with the infamous penis cookie.  The cookie itself was not very tasty, but OH THE FUN did we have with it (I would post photos...but they're quiet inappropriate lol).  Just trying to keep it classy :)
author: Liz W.

description: These are the BEST cookies I have ever had.  Every type I've ever had has been delicious, especially the chocolate toffee chip and the almond.  I have never encountered a line at the tiny spot, and no problems with service over my many visits.  Now whenever I'm in the city I must make a stop at Hot Cookie!
author: Katherine D.

description: Best cookies evvvver! Coconut macaroons and toffee cookies are the bomb. Even though we had to wait, we were totally entertained by the all the pictures on the wall. ;)
author: Kailee B.

description:
The worst part about Hot Cookie is finding parking.  After that, it only gets better.  Much of Hot Cookie's appeal is the temperature (well, and the double entendre, depending on your taste, so to speak).  Other than that, it's kind of a much better version of Mrs. Field's.  I usually get the simple semi-sweet or milk chocolate chip cookies, which are divine.  They also offer a broad array of other delectable options, including some rather risqué, don't-give-one-to-the-kids, "you're definitely in the Castro" shapes.  

They also offer silver-dollar sized mini-cookies, which are a great way to sample the fare.  And don't neglect the "day old" selection for a steep discount, which can be a nice way to try recipes you wouldn't otherwise bother with.

Another plus is Hot Cookie's hours; they're open much later than other joints in SF, to 1 or 2am, I believe, perfect for a late-night treat.  If they have indoor seating, it's not much; this is definitely a takeout place and a highlight of the Castro, and probably the city.
author: Diana G.

description:
Like cookies? Like penises? Like penises shaped like cookies? Er, I mean cookies shaped like penises? Then something is wrong with you. But I am not here to judge. Located in a tiny shop right on Castro Street between 17th St. and 18th St., Hot Cookie serves up traditional and not so traditional treats to satisfy your sweet tooth. 

The first thing you'll notice when you walk into this tiny shop is it's size. In this case, bigger does not necessarily mean better. In fact, it may be the perfect size because there's barely any room for more than 4 people in front of the counter, but that just means more counter space for the cookies, which is what really matters. Plastered all over the walls are photos of customers (mostly men) in various stages of undress, all sporting the signature Hot Cookie undies, of which I would love a pair.

They serve the usual assortment of cookies you would find in any typical shop - chocolate chip, fudge, snickerdoodles, ginger snaps, M&M's, white chocolate, and so on and so forth. The true appeal (if this sort of stuff appeals to you) are the Penis and Venus cookies proudly on display. It should go without saying that these are macaroon cookies shaped like, yes, penises and vaginas. If you like your private parts au naturale, you can enjoy them with coconut pubes.

3 stars for good, but standard cookies and relatively expensive pricing by the pound. Full review with photos on my blog, see profile.
author: Gene M.

description:
I was expecting more from my cookie experience. I have had some great cookies in my life, this was just average. Well, average to a little too much. They rely a lot on butter. Has anyone else noticed how much grease comes off one of their cookies?! I mean goodness! 
I got a chocolate chip peanut butter cookie, which is my favorite normally, and was disappointed. 
I love the decor though, I am a fan of scantily clad men ;) Even if most of them wouldn't be interested in a girl like mwa. 
The price was ridiculous, $2.50 for a cookie?? You've got to be kidding, no cookie should cost that much. Especially not mediocre cookies.
author: Hannah K.

description:
hehe try the PENIS & VENUS delicacy! or the GINGER COOKIE if you're more conservative.

The penis & venus has a couple pics up already on this site and it's pretty much a gigantic macaroon covered with chocolate and garnished with coconut. It's more expensive than a regular cookie but especially for coconut/macaroon fans (and i guess giggly penis lovers too), you won't regret savoring this awesome treat.

My favorite cookie that's closer to normal is the ginger cookie. Rather than a snap, the cookie is more soft and chewy. Just make sure you eat it the day you buy it otherwise it stiffens up after awhile (har har that's what she said =P).

Besides the yummy treats, they also have a really friendly staff. They know what you want...or will at least help you figure that out. And they're much more down to earth than Martha Stuart cuz the staff will make sure you leave with a smile.

PS: theyre open late (midnight or maybe later on friday/saturday, or maybe everyday...i just remember late)

PPS: they have hot cookie printed briefs for sale in red ;)
author: Neland M.

description:
Ew. 

They shot a porno here. 

I can't walk into this joint without having a flashback of two boys getting it on behind the counter. Don't get me wrong, I mean I usually get off on that kind of stuff, but I really don't want to know what exactly makes it a hot cookie. 

Does the Health Department know about this?!?!?
author: Fidel L.

description:
I'd give these people 5 stars if a) they weren't so darned expensive and b) the twinks who work there acted like they enjoyed standing behind a counter slinging sugar all day.

My favorite is the Snickerdoodle, which in my opinion, tastes better 'day old' because their fresh ones are just a bit too gooey for my tastes. After that the walnut pecan.

I generally try and peek in on the right to see what 'day old' are there, it's the shelf on the far right and the cookies are good and only 85 cents instead of the $2.50 or so for a fresh one.

5 stars for the place, minus one for the price!
author: Andrew G.

description:
i LOVED this place. 

Their treats are yummy, their employees are exccellent, and the undies are comfy ;)

I'll be back for sure =]
author: Peggy A.

description:
This place was created in Hell. It is the incarnation of Satan. Ya'll think the incarnation of Satan is a person or a goat or something. No. It's this cookie shop.
Dutch. Bar. Peanut butter malevolence between chocolate evil. This has no place in nature or civilized society. It is anarchy in three layers.
Cock and Balls on a stick? Perfectly respectable fair. Dutch Bar? Pure unadulterated Linda Blair.
author: J P.

description:
Dear Lord,
I stumbled there per recommendation of my fierce-food-loving friend who's been there before. Wow. Their cookies are good, kinda reminds me of a boutique Mrs. Fields. But it's not for your soccer mom because they have some umm... what's the word?...let's just say penis. They have penis shaped chocolate cookies laying on the counter. Yes sir.
We all got different types (but the regular circular cookie shape kind), mine was some sorta chocolate with chocolate one. It was amazing. Delicious. High in everything that is bad for you. Eat me right away kinda thing. I think I tried my friends peanut butter one too, and it was also good. I can't wait to go back. Feed me!!!
author: olga x.

description:
I looooove Hot Cookie.  So many pros, so little cons!  So let me list off why I love it.

1. THE COOKIES ARE SO YUMMY.  You can ask them to warm them up for you, and then they're even yummier.  I bet theyre made with a load of butter, and that's how i like it!  My current favorite is Toffee Chocolate Chip.  PERFECTION

2. An excellent selection - they will meet your every craving.  Cravin' nuts? Cravin' PB? Cravin' rice crispies? Cravin' lil cookies? Cravin' brownies!? Cravin' penis shaped chocolate pop?  you got ittttttttt.

3. Inexpensive --- HUGE PLUS!!  I am so not accustomed to cookie places that are delicious AND inexpensive (i.e. Diddy Reise does NOT make the cut).

4.  Many a time this tiny shop has served as a nice waiting area/escape from the freezing cold while waiting for the bus to come, or if you don't feel like eating outside.

5. Scandalous pictures on the wall serve as entertainment during aforementioned waiting period

6. You can buy some undies if so needed :)

7. You can take all your clothes off and put on Hot Cookie underwear and stand around inside (or outside) and no one will judge you.

8. Conveniently located directly next to Castro Theatre - good for a movie snack - before, during, or after

9. Extremely sweet cookie man gave us free brownies at the end of the night on our last visit!

Only con is that you very well may go crazy and buy a ton of goodies and spend way more than you intended - well spent though!
author: Liz C.

description:
Hot Cookie is a tiny little place with yummy giant cookies.  They say "hot cookie" but sometimes they're not hot.  

The underwear is really popular with some of my friends; they always say they want to buy them, but I've never seen them do it.  Everyone always gets a big laugh out of the penis cookies, if  I can even say penis on this site.

The only reason to mark this place down is the price.  The cookies are sold by weight, which makes it fair.  A big cookie costs more than a little cookie, even if they are in the same class of cookie.  Reasonable, yes.  But then one cookie is nearly $3!  That better be one charming motherfucking cookie!
author: Gordon E.

description: Small place with BOMB cookies!
author: Lacey M.

description:
My goodness.  You have to go here.  

I had a food-gasm when had their snickerdoodle.  I also have a soft spot (no pun intended?) for oatmeal raisin cookies, this too made my eyes tear a little with utter joy.
author: Stephen C.

description: As Paris would say "That's hot" but unfortuantely Hot Cookie is not. The cookies are ok but nothing to rave about. Friendly staff and a fun place.
author: Helen Y.

description:
This is a funky little place with yummy baked goods, some of which are shaped in... uhm, uh... interesting formations. Let's be honest: who doesn't love coconut macaroons in a variety of novelty shapes dipped in chocolate then stuck on a stick? It's simple fun... with just a dash of naughty **wink** ,  **wink**. I always enjoy nibbling on their goodies, so when my sweet tooth got the best of me last night, I stopped in yet again in hopes of finding said treats on a stick. 

It's one thing to be disappointed to find they they were running low on inventory and only had a selection of generic cookies on display (Chocolate Chip, Pecan Chocolate Chip, Macadamia Nut White Chocolate, etc). It's another thing entirely to leave with a bag of 8 cookies, and an empty wallet... because those 8 cookies amounted to almost $25. They're tasty, but not so fantastic to warrant such absurd prices. 

Sorry, Hot Cookie. But this girl's too frugal to splurge on your astronomically priced treats as often as her taste buds might like.
author: Whitney H.

description:
Every time I go here, I can only get cold cookies.  
And I've often found the staff to be condescending. 

But hey, cookies.  

Even Santa, who's been alive for 400 years, still loves these badboys.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I like their macaroons a lot.  Their butch bar was peanut butter overload.  I guess that's cool if you like peanut butter, a lot.

It's open late and has like one of the best locations in the city.

Plus... it sells penis shaped brownies...
author: Shyam P.

description:
The first word ever uttered by Rebecca H? Not mama, not dada, not birdy. Oh no. It was cookie. 

A cookie monster from birth, you can only imagine my glee when I moved here six years ago and stumbled into this place while exploring my new home one evening. 

The conversation with the guy behind the counter went something like this:

RH: Oh my god! Look at all the cookies! It smells soooo good!

CG: You want to try one?

RH: Yipee! I'll try a chocolate chip.

CG: Here you go!

RH: (mouth full of cookie) mmmmmm! Are those Snickerdoodles! Oh my god I love those!

CG: Want to try them too?

RH: Sure!

CG: Have a whole one, they are really good.

RH: (mouth full of cookies) I didn't even notice you have White Chocolate Macadamia Nut. Wowzer! That's my favorite.

CG: You have to try those. People love them.

etc...

When I finally left that store, I looked like I was pregnant with Hot Cookie's gooey, delicious and somewhat undercooked baby. Since the guy behind the counter was gay, we can only attribute his generosity to his recognition that I am a die hard cookie loving fiend. 

And he sure did create a loyal customer. Whenever I am within a few blocks of this place, I make sure to "stumble" by.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Two of my favorites: peanut butter chocolate, oatmeal walnut chocolate chip
author: Phuong M.

description:
I'd give this place 5 stars if the cookies were actually hot (or warm, really), but still they were pretty scrum-diddly-umptious. 

I got the cocoa cayenne and the pecan chip and shared it with my fellow yelper, cheryl d....both cookies were really rich and chocolatey but we definitely favored the cocoa cayenne which had a nice kick to it. 

They had other yummy cookies and rice krispie treats as well. And that penis shaped macaroon dipped in chocolate and coconut flakes. I don't think I'd be able to eat that anywhere else, but this is the castro so I probably wouldn't even get a second look. 

The next time I'll have to get me one of those hot cookie briefs as well. I think I'm hot enough of a cookie to wear one of those! hehehe...

They should get a cookie warmer and I'm sure they'll get tons of 5-star reviews!
author: Pippi L.

description:
2 bucks. 

thats it. 2 bucks and you get a delicious fresh cookie from some very nice workers.

2AM and leaving the bar, stumbling home in your whisky soaked cheap cig breath and you can barely see over the haze that is fermenting from your sunglasses. You see the Hot Cookie store with a bunch of people outside talking, flirting, making out. etc. You get in line and get a cookie... and it wont prevent the hangover, but it will be warm, fresh, and tasty.
author: angelo b.

description:
This place will always have a special place in my heart.  The reason for that has nothing to do with the cookies but for this story.

Before I moved to SF, I came here frequently on business trips and would occasionally stay an extra day or two for fun.  On one such extended stay, a walk through the Castro led me to discover Hot Cookie.  

One night, on a subsequent trip, I had dinner with my friend Michele who had relocated here from New Jersey.  Our post-dinner conversation in her Jeep turned to cookies.  It went like this:

Michele:  You know . . .  I really love white chocolate chip cookies.

Me:  Me too.  But, most places insist on putting macadamia nuts in the cookie.  And, I don't like macadamias.

Michele:  Neither do I.  That really pisses me off!!!!   (I already told you that she was a Jersey Girl and knowing Michele she was likely stoned at this point.)

Me:  Well, actually, when I was here a few months ago, I found a place in the Castro that sells white chocolate chip cookies without nuts.  

Michele:  Shut the f*ck up!  Really?!?!?!?!?!  Call them and see if they're still open.

I got their number and called hoping that they were open late.

Hot Cookie Employee:  [answers with a sultry female voice] Hot Cookie.  We serve youuuuuu allllllll niiiight loooong.

Me:  Oh, good.  You guys are open 24 hours?

Hot Cookie Employee:  Oh, no dude, sorry.  [Sultry, turned to manly] I thought you were going to be one of my friends.  We close at 11.

Michele and I laughed from non-stop from Union Square to the Castro.

We arrive.

Hot Cookie Employee:  May I help you?

Me:  Are you the guy who is going to serve me all night long?

Hot Cookie Employee:  Oh my god!

So, in summary, the have miniature white chocolate chip cookies here sans nuts.
author: Jeff P.

description:
"So do you want the two penises in a pink box?"
"Oh yea a PINK box huh"
"Oh yes"
"Can you fit both of the penises in this pink box"
"Oh yes it fits two at the same time perfectly."

WIN!

My favorite is the cocoa cayenne. When i was there everyone seemed so up beat and happy. Yea i blew 30 some odd dollars but its definitely something to try when youre in sf. Delicious!!! I bought a pair of undies. They use american apparrell! But i got too shy to want to take a pic. 
Just take the muni to castro and its directly across the street.
Claustrophobic people need not enter. Hungry sweet tooths, please do.
author: Lily N.

description: Cookies are cookies to me but I can definitely tell which ones are good and which ones taste like ...well you know.  These aren't bad, just not memorable for me and it's probably because I'm not much of a cookie fanatic...
author: S H L.

description:
This is, thus far, the easiest five star review I have written.  If an orgasm could physically manifest itself as a baked good, it would clearly be a white chocolate coconut macadamia cookie from Hot Cookie!  OMG!

I haven't tried any of the penis-shaped confections, but if/when I do, I'm certain it will be an X-Rated experience.
author: Dan C.

description: Ohhhh...... Penis shaped cookies. I'm blushing now. i cant wait to sink my teeth into one,
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description: The "package" macaroon is so delectable it's to die for. Oh em gee, I'm drooling for one right now.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Great cookies - the oatmeal chocolate walnut cookie is divine.  Buy one and sneak it into the Castro Theater the next time you catch a flick.  You won't regret it.

Just don't take your Republican parents here.  Or my parents.  Lots of cookies in the form of private anatomy that make me blush even if I'm riding solo.
author: Maulie D.

description:
This was our last stop on our culturally sweet tasting adventure...and  wow my eyes! my poor virgin eyes. ahahah ...hemm.... 

the penis cookie  (macaroon covered in dark chocolate and sprinkled with coconut...also shaped like a penis if yoiu didnt catch the name)  was good..nothing impressive except for the design.

they have regular cookies here but dont bring your kiddies... wall to wall pics of men in red hot briefs( well there's not much walls..youer walking out as youer walking in...that's how small, not the pics the bakery) ...haha?

ya know there were more people hanging around starbucks...i wonder what pics do they put up.
author: Lynn T.

description: Love coming here for a treat especially when I go to the Castro theater. Chocolate Cayenne is to die for and the junk shaped cookies are awesome! When you are there buy some underwear and take a picture trick!
author: Ro M.

description: Good selection of classics, oatmeal raisins, white choc, etc.  I got 2 full sized cookies and 1 miniature half cookie for about $6.  You do get what you pay for...yummy cookies.
author: Alex P.

description: So you know, they only accept cash here. and the cookies are kinda pricey since you won't be able to resist buying more than one because they are too freaken amazing.
author: Jacqueline N.

description:
Penis cookie ROCKS! It's BIG, BLACK, DELICIOUS and UNSHAVED! lol
Haven't tried any other cookies and don't even want to...come here only for THE COOKIE!
author: Lerka J.

description: Haven't had their penis (cookie- jeez!). Their toffee chocolate chip cookie rocks my world! The brownie (& well, Everything) is yummilicious as are the cuties who work there.
author: Rachel D.

description:
Fun little cookie shop on Castro. I like to get the penis-shaped chocolate-covered macaroon for friends. 

Expensive - usually ranges around $2+ for a cookie, but definitely worth it! 

**Cash only**
author: Gladys C.

description:
Went here tonight right before catching a double feature. 

I read the reviews and went for the Cocoa Cayenne cookie. OMG! That was SO good. EXPENSIVE... but good. AND cash only.. dude, iono, i gotta take off 1 star for that. It's the 21st century... it's plastic now. 

And the cookie wasn't as hot as the blaring neon sign said it would be. 

I had one cookie about.. 5.5 inches in diameter and it was about.. 2.50? Uh... my wallet says, "ouch?"

Oh, and instead of giving paper cookie bags, they should give something quieter... something sneaky so I can eat it in the theater. :P

Eh... i'm satisfied. If you don't like cookies, at least go to ogle at the chocolate genitals.
author: Eugenia Y.

description: Word of advice: check what is actually in your bag before leaving. We ordered a number of cookies and left the store only to realize that we were short one cookie. Went to all of the effort to return and tell them and they said that (1) I didn't have a receipt, which really wouldn't have proven much anyway since it would have been believing me that I didn't actually receive what I ordered. I was there with my 15 year old daughter and a friend of hers and I can't believe that they didn't believe me..... very annoying. The cookies that we did get were good but not sure if they are worth the $2.50 that we paid per cookie nor the rude treatment that I received.
author: Cynthia N.

description:
If you tend to be a bit squeamish when it comes to phallic imagery, eating baked goods shaped like various parts of the human anatomy, or entire walls covered in pictures of patrons wearing skimpy underwear, then you might be in the wrong place. Although, if that's the case, you shouldn't really be hanging out in the Castro.

My GF and i came by one night after dinner with some friends. We split a toffee chocolate chip cookie and it was awesome. It'd be easy for them to just ride the sexual entendre gimmick and have weak cookies, but they have great cookies.

We'll be back...a lot.
author: Travis D.

description:
Hot Cookies' cookies aren't really hot; regardless, they taste delicious! I like the snicker doodles, it's so chewy. The outside is sprinkled with right amount of sugar and cinnamon and the inside is filled with cinnamon too. 

The chocolate covered penis macaroon is just as good. It costs $4.75, but dudeee, it's huge (7 inches long including the balls), and it's covered in chocolate. I'm not a big fan of chocolate, but the combination between the chocolate and the coconut macaroon tastes divine!
author: Mandy C.

description: Nice little bakery shop. I came here with my friend who said this place is really good, so I decided to try it. I got the Cocoa Cayenne, and White Chocolate Chip. Both were really good, crispy on the edges, warm and soft in the middle. Simply the best cookies. Absolutely delicious.
author: Juk M.

description: I love this place. It's kitschy & the cookies are moist deliciousness!
author: Anthony A.

description: I bought my beloved penis-shaped cookie and a choco-cayenne cookie to go with my cayenne ginger truffle from the Truffle Guy. The penis-shaped cookie is basically a chocolate-covered macaroon. The choco-cayenne cookie was awesome! Just the right amount of cayenne and chocolate mix :). Cookies were soft and chewy, yum!
author: Laura F.

description: The cookies taste fine, but the prices are absurd.  I understand it's the Castro, and sometimes I will buy one despite the price.  But seriously... $3 for a small cookie?  This is an example of how ridiculously expensive San Francisco can be, and it is really annoying to me.  I know they need to make a profit, but come on now... it's hard to leave here without feeling taken.
author: Jackson W.

description:
Hot cookie is hot!  The perfect place to grab a couple of sweet thangs if you ever find yourself standing in line for a film in the Castro Theater.  I tried their toffee chocolate chip cookie and it was divine. 

Reviews won't give the place justice - just go and try some cookies for yourself.
author: Megha S.

description:
So cruising down Castro St, I look across the way, and what do i see? HOT COOKIE & some red cute undies hanging in the window. I thought to myself! OOoo!! cute little boutique undies shop?? this i gotta check out. Cross the street, push thru the door and come to a dead stop. 

it's...cookies? Now now, yes, the name DID say "hot cookie" but what's up with the undies hanging in the windows?! ohhhh..they are selling those "novelty" undies for $12 buck a pop?! yikes! cute, but not THAT cute.  So i figured, i'm in the shop now, i smell cookies baking, i might as well get a hot cookie. 

So i get some chocolate chip cookies, were they hot? nope. were they at least very moist and tasty? nope.  hm. 

at least they had some chocolate penis shaped cookies i MIGHT try..if i ever decide to go back. 

Hot Cookie?  A Hot Disappointment.
author: Lulu C.

description: a cookie place that stays open late, nice. Tiny place, so walk in and make room for others to browse the cookies. The cookies are huge, the snickerdoodle was perfect.
author: Heather C.

description: Cute small place with 'interesting' photos all over the wall. Cookies are big and warm and smelled awesome. So much to my dissapointment when I took a bite each of the chocolate/peanut butter cookie, the cocoa cayenne cookie, and the toffee cookie that it had this strange foreign taste to them. It kinda reminded me of what Vaseline taste like. Like a waxy lip balm undernote to it. Let's just say I really wanted to like them but couldn't eat more than a bite. That was a waste of $7 and change! I want to try Anthony's cookies next, I hear they are good.
author: Tay T.

description:
At Folsom Street Fair this past year, I had encountered a few chapped dandies flaunting their red "Hot Cookie" chonies and thought to myself "someone must've raided the clearance bin at Hot Topic." Needless to say, I failed to realize what a local phenomenon Hot Cookie is here in SF (I'm still a rookie - sue me).

I popped my HC cherry last night following a matinee showing of "Milk" at the Castro Theater, conveniently located a few doors down. My poision was a dark chocolate-dipped macaroon and a blanc-et-noir rice crispy loaf (yeah, they're that big).

Dopeness!

The roomy had 2 M&M cookies. After she was done chowing down, I went on crumb patrol. They were bomb too.

So yeah... I had a major date with the treadmill today, but it was totally worth it.
author: Matthew H.

description: You can tell by my love handles that I've had one (or one hundred) too many cookies here, usually after one too many drinks at Q-Bar.  Though the people working there vary greatly in friendliness and serving capabilities from excellent to downright surly, the cookies are always consistently good.  Sometimes the guy serving you is also a hot cookie.
author: Kevin M.

description:
This establishment is the bearer of both good news and bad.

The good news:
Open late
Creative flavor combinations
Big cookies

The bad news:
A touch pricey for my taste
No seating area (I like to sit and savor my cookies, okay?)
I have been served room temperature cookies.
author: Veggie J.

description:
Their cocoa-cayenne cookie is phenomenal!

They are quite pricey, but go early and they have their day-old selection for 1/3 of the price, and they taste just as good.
author: Emily S.

description: this was another stop on our trolley/party bus.  we came here for their penis cookie which is basically a giant chocolate covered macaroon.  i didnt have any, but the bachelorette had to.  i had a toffe chocolate chip cookie and it was really sweet.  i really wish i had some milk to go with it.  their cookies are on the thin side but big side.
author: claudia y.

description: Awesome cookies! Defiantly a must visit! It's very crowded and the space it tiny but it's worth the fight to the counter! And as an added bonus you can pick up some clean underwear in case you need them!
author: Jill T.

description: My most unique and magical cookie experience to date occurred here. It was BETTER than Charlie and the Chocolate Factory. I am sorry for being elusive, but see Rob and you will understand.
author: Andrew K.

description: Our friend was the one who told us to go to Hot Cookie since I love chocolate chip cookies. Not realizing what kind of place it was, we set out for our cookies. You can't miss this place even though it's considered a "hole in the wall." The big sign outside says it all. Stepping inside however, was surprising because it's so small and for its popularity, people were literally rubbing elbows inside. We ordered a few cookies including chocolate chip, a cayenne pepper chocolate, and something else I couldn't remember. Anyway the cookies were pretty good and hit the spot since we were craving dessert. We were thinking of getting the dick-shaped cookie to bring home for our friends but thought that it might present a problem while passing through airport security. We decided to not buy it. The cayenne pepper cookie was a waste of money though. The guy working there recommended this to us and we bought it out of curiosity. The cookie is actually spicy and burns. We couldn't finish it. But the regular chocolate chip and the oatmeal chocolate chip cookies were pretty good.
author: Jensen B.

description:
good if you want a big, coconut filled Choco-cock to give to your gay husby.

not so good if you just want a nonsexual lemon bar.
author: Julia S. J.

description:
This is where I send my husband for my ultimate pregnancy craving. 
Pokies and Toffee-Chocolate chip cookies. 
I can't get enough!
author: Karlee D.

description:
I think the military borrowed the term "shock and awe" from Hot Cookie cuz...that would accurately characterize your experience if you were among the uninitiated like I was. If you're claustrophobic and easily scared by pictures of gay men in 'hot cookie briefs" or people about to gobble penis shaped confections then this place is not for you. But if you like a good cookie then this place is for you. I just hope it's actual butter they use in the cookies...not...man...butter...

I mean lets be real right, I came into get a cookie and I get one and it was good and chewy and hot and the guy behind the counter was friendly. That's what matters. The extracurriculars make for a good laugh...once you've come to grips with where you've just walked into.
author: Ross R.

description: I love this place!  I always take friends here who are visiting from other places.  They have a delicious selection of soft cookies, and great chocolate covered macaroons.  Their owner has always been amazing about donating cookies to a non-profit that I work with.  I have NEVER had a bad experience here, and they sell cute underwear.  A Castro staple for sure.
author: Julia D.

description:
Yeah, my friend bought me a big, chocolate-covered penis macaroon cookie on a stick for the hell of it.

Yeah, it was so hyped up, it turned out to be a disappointment. 

I don't care. Everyone should eat a big, black penis macaroon once in their lives, mhm...

B========D

I guess I should stop perving, and try the other cookies to give the place a fair assessment..
author: Kay N.

description:
So, first let me say that while I agree that they are a bit pricey, you have to remember that these cookies are all hand-made at the store. So, you get what you pay for. You want a cookie for a dollar? Go to Starbucks, where they are made in a factory somewhere and are not full of love. Want a cookie that is tasty, made fresh, and screams, "DEAR LORD! I AM CHOCK FULL OF GOODNESS AND LOVE!"...then go to Hot Cookie.

They get the five star from me for that reason, but also because the staff is pretty friendly. Everytime I've gone in there, they always greet me with pleasant hellos. And I know for a fact that I've had a simple "How's your day going" or "How are you" conversations with them when I am making my cookie purchase.

The biggest fact is that the owner, Dan, was sainted by the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence, for all of his (and Hot Cookies) philanthropic involvement in the community. Kick some ass Hot Cookie!
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Sunday, Aug. 26, 9:45 p.m.

Dear Hot Cookie,

Please inform your workers that being rude and surly and not looking up from your book when you have customers in your store is impolite and bad business.  We wanted to spend money on your pricey cookies and you were not pleased we were there.  Once you finally acknowledged our presence, you scoffed at my request to heat up the cold cookie to make it a "hot cookie" like the sign said.  And for the record, 5 seconds in the microwave doesn't cut it.  Please correct this problem so future Yelpers don't have such negative experiences.

Love,
Andy G.
author: Andy G.

description:
The pastries or desserts there are alright. Nothing really special about the place... UNTIL! 
*DING DONG* There comes what the place is famously known for... DICK COOKIES!
