it is one of the well known famous touristy spot on Castro Street (of course for that reason!) There are not much options at the place, baked good are limited, but then again, why would you want to order anything else other than a dick! LOL. 

We had tons of fun with something similar among the followings (I think most people did),

"DICK/PENIS, LICK IT, PUT IT IN YOUR MOUTH!, DICK ON A STICK!, YOU HAVE A DICK ON YOUR HAND!, EAT IT!, TAKE A BITE!, HOW DOES IT TASTE???!"

Then after that, NOTHING. It was a lot of fun that lasted for a bit.

The dick cookie itself doesn't do a thing for me, the taste, dare I must say, sucks. The stuffs there aren't so "hot" or fresh and a bit pricey (as expected from a touristy place) So other than that, the place honestly, got nothing else to offer.
author: NK M.

description:
The only place in the city that you can spend $10 on cookies and not feel the least bit bad about it. These cookies are damn good and worth every penny.

My favorite Hot Cookie? Chocolate chip oatmeal with nuts.

The penis cookies are for tourists!! And don't wait until closing time to get cookies. Limited selection with the leftovers from the day.
author: Kathleen N.

description:
Nothing like it. Especially nothing like it late at night when you're craving a big cookie. 

And to add a little factiod- good for cookie cakes as well. It was my girlfriend's 1/2 birthday so I called in an order. Transcript of conversation was as follows:

me- " Hi, I need to order a cookie cake."
other dude- "Ok, what kind and what do you want it to say?"
me- "Choc chip, happy half birthday liz"
other dude- "half birthday? wait, you gotta explain this to me"
me- "its a ritual, yes I am forced to partake in it"
other dude- "ok, whatever. you want the choc penis drawn on it?"

As I said, nothing like it.
author: Rob J.

description:
Over priced over priced 

I don't mind paying for an expensive cookie but it better be good.

Also service goes a long way for god sake smile and be nice to your customers after all they are paying for an OVER PRICED cookie wannabe.
author: Jorge H.

description:
$2.64 for this cookie?

Give me a break, if they put more quality into it, no problem... pay attention to the butter and brown sugar.

... and no, I really don't need to buy one of those penis lollypop cookies, nasty ass.

go to TOM'S or MRS. FIELDS instead!
author: H W.

description: If you can handle it, mid-bar-hop (don't trip) grab some suggestive looking cookies and give yourself the sugar rush you always knew your never needed.  Good base too for further drinking, and the sugar rush makes dancing fun (albeit more dangerous)
author: Mike V.

description: The name says it all, they're hot, and they're cookies. Pretty tasty ones too. A good stop for quick, on-the-go refueling, and/or a sugar fix.
author: Amanda G.

description: Beside the penis and Venus cookies that everyone goes for, do yourselves a favor and try the macaroon and chocolate mint cookies, yummy delish!
author: Jenn H.

description:
HOT COOKIE is my lover!!! I don't even know how many times I have whined and bitched about wanting Hot Cookie to my friends, especially late at night when I'm intoxicated. 

I can eat the chocolate chip with macadamia nuts, M&M's, snickerdoodle cookies and chocolate dipped waffles ALL day EVERY day! These are the best cookies I've ever had..chewy, tasty and oh-so-orgasmic!

Have yet to try my penis lollipop or any other genital-shaped treat, probably will happen sooner than later.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Restraint.
That is the only thing that keeps me from walking in there 4 times a week.  I have to let someone else say "lets go to hot cookie" to give myself the excuse to go, otherwise I'd be there all too much for the cookies...never mind the penis cookies!
author: Sean S.

description:
I'd have given them five stars, but considering I am the not-so-proud owner of a gay porn flick that was obviously filmed inside Hot Cookie - well...it just gives me reason for pause.

That ain't right... methinks it just aint sanitary.  But then again: Maybe they'd pimp my cookie if I give em' a little nookie...

The snickerdoodles kick ass (and speaking of asses, the porn star had a nice one too)
author: Mc Matty b.

description:
Thank you Jesus (if I was religious.)

I fucking love Hot Cookie.

I love Penis shaped delights... I mean the ones filled with sugar.

Seriously, 20 more pounds and I'm totally gonna pose in the Hot Cookie underwear.  How can I do that though when I keep eating Hot Cookie!

IT'S A VICIOUS CYCLE!
author: David M.

description: You really can't resist the smell of hot cookies being emitted from this place!  After a friend of mine got a little happy from dancing at Badlands, we walked around looking for something to eat.  He walked in and picked up a few chocolate chip cookies.  Very basic, but yes, very delicious!  Move over Mrs. Fields :-)
author: Rodel R.

description: The perfect cookies with milk! My favorite is the toffee, so nice and chewy! I split the chocolate penis cookie with my cousin and it was so filling. The service at hot cookie cool too :)
author: Jasmine W.

description: Ordered the toffee cookie on the recommendation of the staff who said he eats one everyday he comes to work. He even let us try a piece of his first. It was delicious; perfectly cooked so that it was still soft in the center. We also got a brownie that was good, but not amazing. Definitely try the cookies. I want to try the snickerdoodle next!
author: Miriam H.

description: b.e.s.t. non-penis-shaped cookie evarr
author: G E.

description: I'm always in the Castro and we always stop in and get a cookie or two, and the last time I went in, I purchased some panties that say hotcookie on them, I used them for my modeling shoot!! It was fun!!
author: christina a.

description:
I want to love it.  I swear, I really want to love it!  

Typically, I do love places that make cookies and brownies and make me fatter.

But, aside from its name, Hot Cookie is nothing to write home about.  It'll do the trick in a pinch, but it won't invade my dreams.
author: Marcus C.

description: COCOA CAYENNE COOKIE. eat it and your whole life will be better.
author: Shannon J.

description:
The guy at the Barbershop recommended that I walk down the road and try this. Oh my gawd. SO delicious! There's one interesting option but I don't enjoy coconut or large dong-shaped cookies. Funny though! Every single cookie I have purchased has been wonderful but the one that keeps me coming back, over and over, is the toffee/milk chocolate wonderfulness. 

They only take cash, which is lame since cash is dirty BUT I found my bank (NO ATM FEES) a few doors down. Winning!
author: Chris H.

description: Love the mocha cayenne cookie. It's not your typical chocolate cookie. It has a nice KICK! and you don't really taste it until after it's been chewed and swallowed. Yum! Another favorite is the snickerdoodle. *drool* Delicious! I can't wait to try the others!
author: Nicole H.

description:
Hot Cookie. Everyone knows the name..but it should be renamed Cold Hard Cookie.

Yes they have penis cookies, and boob shaped cookies which I hear are very good, but the regular cookies are cold; they don't softly break in half, its more like a uneasy crumble, and biting into them isn't exactly a walk in the park.

The cookies are always hard, like they have just been out for way to long.

I would pick Mrs. Fields over Hot Cookie any day sorry.
author: Sarah R.

description: Hot Cookie, you own my soul... My girlfriend is slowly accepting how impossible it is to keep me out of this place if we're walking by...  Just enter, you'll see for your self why i'm such an addict...  Toffee Milk Chocolate- best cookie ever. every. time. CASH ONLY!
author: Bobby P.

description:
the name says it all. 

but may i add, these cookies are a no-joke, nothing-spared, hold-the-line good. its almost better than bi-rite cookies but you can't compare the chunky to the wafer thins (it's all about your preference).

they are on the pricey side due to it's quality and the location probably however, here is the lil secret, their day-old cookies are just as good as the today baked goods but with reduced price. 

i suggest on trying it. i don't find this place touristy at all--it's part of the charm of castro.
author: curi k.

description: The two cookies that i had here are absolutely delicious. The pictures in the wall are absolutely priceless.  I absolutely recommend it. And I absolutely refuse to eat the chocolate dick.
author: Javi V.

description:
There is nothing more intoxicating than the smell  of freshly baked cookies wafting onto the street. I love this little place. You step in, order your sugar and fat laden treat, and you're back out on the street in 2 seconds.
The staff are always friendly. In the unlikely event you have to wait for a moment to be served there are tons of posters and postcards advertising fun events to peruse. This place is a classic. Don't ever change!
author: J D.

description: I've passed by this place on a few occasions when I used to work in the Noe Valley area but never did go inside. We were in the area and I was craving a pastry snack and with no pastry place in sight this was the next best thing. We decided on the toffee cookie. For two cookies, it came out to be over $5. Those are definitely not cheap cookies but they were decently sized. The toffee cookie was pretty good but I felt it tasted more like a chocolate cookie than a toffee cookie. There was more chocolate chips than there were toffee (on mine anyways). They also carry penis shaped cookies which me being a tad immature, i pointed them out. Haha. I did enjoy my cookie and may come back if in the area!
author: Helen L.

description:
I love the cookies here, and I don't even like cookies most of the time. The butch bar is more like candy, with it's peanut butter filling between cookie and chocolate. Yummmm... The location is perfect, right across from the muni station so it can be my last stop as I'm leaving the neighborhood.

Their day olds are still spectacular and highly discounted, and there's usually a pretty good variety.

The only thing that's holding this back from a five star is the price for fresh cookies. It can be a little pricey if you're ordering for you and a couple of friends.
author: Shushannah A.

description:
My favorite dessert spot.  This is as good as it gets when your sweet tooth gets the best of you.  My favorite thing to get is the rice krispie treat dipped in chocolate!  Yummy!

Though, there are some things that you won't find me eating like the penis shaped cookies or the boob cookies.
author: Joyce C.

description: I was in the area with my friend francisco and my niece alicia and we were roaming the streets. whammy omg!!!!! a big ass good looking cookie caught my eye. i had a chocolate chip and i took a macadam ian cookie home for my love. truely, this place is hella cool. very tasty cookies,creative and i will definitely be back again.
author: Monica M.

description:
In the mood for some x-rated baked goods? Hot cookie's got it: chocolate covered macaroons pose as the male anatomy, complete with veins and all! YUM!

These cookies are a bit pricey; they charge by the pound and it usually comes out to about $2.50-$3 bucks a cookie. 

Their chocolate chip cookies are not amazing...you'd find better elsewhere. My favorite cookie there is their cocoa cayenne, it is moist and has an incredible kick from the cayenne. The gingersnap and rice crispy treats are ok...just ok. 

The counterperson is usually friendly and funny and the pictures on the wall are HILARIOUS. Note to self: pose in signature red Hot Cookie undies and post picture on their wall of fame someday.
author: Fancypants X.

description: Overpriced yet ohh so amazing.
author: Natalye R.

description: I love the Castro and I love this cookie shop.  My only complaint would be I wish there were more places like this.  The attendant was really helpful and nice.  I didn't see the chocolate covered penis, so I'm going to have to go back for that one.  This is a place I'll be heading to whenever I'm in the Castro.  Oh the cookie was perfect, crispy and chewy, every cookie lovers dream.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Everyone should visit this place if in San Fran. Situated slap bang in the middle of the Castro, this place is a nirvana to those with a sweet tooth and a smutty sense of humour.


 Expect to see penis cookies and boobie cookies, the edible duality is kitsch and exactly what you would expect from the Castro.


 The selections of cookies available are great and they are always warm.
author: cleoisaleng

description:
If you or someone you know likes sweets, ever menstruates, or deserves a treat, do all parties involved a favor and buy half a dozen cookies from Hot Cookie.

That should do the trick.
author: A W.

description: This place is the tits. Came here after hearing all the hype about how great it is and people were right. The cookies are worth every penny.
author: Darius A.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE

anytime i'm in sf, i will make the trek out to hot cookie. their chocolate toffee cookies are to die for. and if you're lucky, they will still have day old cookies left, that are super cheap...and if you're like me, that's a plus.
author: Suki V.

description: Forget about the penis cookie the Butch Bar is where it's at. Two turn tables and a microphone (and a butch bar). Two big square slabs of chocolate with almost an inch of real homemade peanut butter smeared in the middle. Ba- Blam!
author: Greg M.

description:
This is a kind of institution in the Castro at this point. 

The infamous penis and vagina cookies certainly grab people's attention as do the lines out the door of this tiny shop. Parking in this area sucks so if you can take muni or expect to walk to the location from a side street.

The question is are they any good or just a gimmick? Well my friend these are some of the best tasting cookies in the city. A lot of choice to choose from and I have enjoyed the hell out of them all.
author: Kevin F.

description:
Cookies are a very personal choice and I understand how some people may not enjoy Hot Cookies.

I, however, am not one of these people.

They have a pretty huge variety of different cookies with different fix-ins.  Personally, I love the Toffee Milk Chocolate ones and have to (have to) follow up an Ike's sandwich with a pair of Toffee Milk Chocolates.  I really like that the cookies they bake here are all really soft, approaching raw at the center.  That can definitely weird some people out, but I've yet to buy a cookie here that wasn't cooked all the way through.  Call it the steakhouse effect - these folks know the difference between a medium rare (BOO!) and a medium (YAY!) cookie.

They also have a selection of marshmallow rice squares and either fudge or brownies, none of which I've tried, not being a fan of brownies or fudge and come on... how can you really improve or screw up marshmallow rice squares?  Also, obviously, must note the more scandalously shaped baked goods they sell here.  Definitely pretty unique, definitely something fun to show and buy for visitors out-of-town, but they're kinda pricey and to be fair, they're not that good (if taste is still a criteria when it comes to novelty baked goods.).  The few I've purchased have either been a bit on the burnt side or just kinda difficult to bite into.  (wow... hard to avoid puns here)

Still... absolutely love this place.  Toffee Milk Chocolate cookies, my vice... I will see you again very soon.
author: Jason H.

description: I love the chocolate brownies at this place, I've tried most of the cookies, all are good but the brownies are my all time fave for sure! I just wish the space was a little bigger, if there's a line you end up waiting outside in the cold!
author: Deniz E.

description:
Give me a cookie or two or three.

This place has great cookies and baked well.

Love the pics on the wall and it built character to the shop.
They also have cookies shape as body parts and its not groom. But its not a bush nor a forest so you are good. 

Stop by when you are in the area and have a sweet tooth.
author: K L.

description: BOMB. COCONUT. MACAROONS. I drive from Napa to get my macaroon fix! Yummyliciousness!
author: Hunner N.

description:
Nothing really special about Hot Cookie.  Standard cookies that are OK in taste.  The choc chip cookies are really sweet though.

I go there occasionally just so I can say "I had Hot Cookie today."
author: Diego S.

description:
cookies so good, they melt in your mouth!
they had just come out of the over so they were warm and "especially delicious"
Its an interesting place, your eyes will have fun looking around :-D
author: Bianka G.

description: Next to the Castro Theater and the smell is enticing when waiting in line for the Castro theater.  http://www.yelp.com/biz/castro-theatre-san-francisco#hrid:pS7LLWWsnVu6akZICoVtAg      Cookies are large and tastey but a bit pricey.  For a penis on a stick, a chocolate covered macaroon and a snickerdoodle, $7.
author: Deb N.

description: Best cookies that I've ever had. Try the milk -chocolate and macadamia nut. It's mindblowing.
author: Steph M.

description: White chocolate macadamia and toffee milk chocolate are my two go-to's. Really you can't go wrong with any of their goods. Just look out because it's cash only and those cookies can really rack up fast!
author: Lindsay W.

description: josh and chris were the kitties titties! cool dudes and great cookies. loves it boys!!!! duh :-* :-* :-* that chocolate snicker doodle was bomb af
author: Angel C.

description:
After an impromptu pub crawl (which just means we hit more than two bars in our outing) out in the Castro, you must taper down the evening by satisfying a drunken sweet tooth so give a solid, "HOT COOKIE!!" shout out and stumble on over to the land of chocolate-lovely goodness.  

Now, once you're inside you'll notice the big glass case of chocolate penis macaroons on sticks, which is not only a brilliant marketing idea but they also taste pretty good.  Me though - the coconut and I aren't really friends so I pass them up for either the snicker-doodle cookie or the amazing chocolate/peanut butter bar delicately coined the, "Butch Bar" ... they also do a mighty fine chocolate chip.   

So good.
author: Sarah K.

description:
While I suspect the employees may be partaking of drugs in the back (we definitely smelled something!), the only thing that I hold against the shop is that the cookies are $2.50 a pop. 

I suppose it's a good method of portion control (do you really want to pay $5 for two cookies?!), and it also means that I'm not consuming an entire tube of cookie dough from the store that we all know would have never made it even close to the oven.
author: Carla C.

description:
NROM!!!!

As a cookie fan I knew I was in the right place when I thought I spotted a Yelper outside of it.  I can't place my hand on the Bible and swear I saw Darren I. But, dang I figure if there is a food place with Yelper doppelgangers  standing nearby I better enter and eat!


Yes, there are g-rated munchables
author: Joanna B.

description: I hate to be the naysayer but I was really underwhelmed by my cookie experience here. I got some kind of very large chocolate chip cookie and it was not hot or fresh-seeming. I love the idea of a store devoted to only selling cookies but I sort of expect each and everyone to blow me away and this did not :(
author: Richa A.

description: Ordered the Toffee chocolate chip cookie and it was really good. Had the right amount of softness and cheweyness to the cookie. I originally wanted to try the "penis" shaped macaron, but I was extremely full. Maybe next time.
author: Lily T.

description: I had a buddy visiting and I suggested we go here and walk around the castro.  Good times, the staff is really friendly, and they have this gianormous penis cookie.  It's this chocolate covered macaroon with coconut.  The guy behind the counter added some whipped cream.  I barely finished the shaft after an hour, but it was fabulous.
author: Matthew P.

description: Every time we come to SF we have to stop here.  I can't survive for very long without my Butch Bar.  It's an amazing chocolate/peanut butter bar, holy cow, I can't describe it and really do it justice.  Seriously the best dessert I have had.  The cookies are very good, too.  Nice and buttery.  MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM!
author: Jolie S.

description:
Their pumpkin cookie is the business.  I could live off of it.  

+5 because their penis cookies are the best white elephant gifts.  I'm telling you, it's a hit.  It sucks though because you end up not eating it after everyone and their mom touches it with their unwashed nasty hands so that they can take stupid facebook/myspace pics with it.  We get it, it's a big black cock...get over it.  

Ahh, I'm a hypocrite, I took one of those pics a few years back.  Oops!
author: Jacquelynne S.

description: Fun place to go in the castro to get the real gay feeling.  Penis cookie please!  And I think that their cookies are great, and they really are hot.  Love that they have mini ones too!
author: Laura P.

description: Chocolate Covered Penis Shaped Cookies. mmmm All I can say, it was a  happy ending with out a mess.
author: Ashley M.

description: Their cookies are good, not the best, and they are expensive, but I cant keep myself away.  Cookies at almost any hour are all I need.  I love cramming into the store with hella other people and trying to whisper at first and then yelling "the big black dick!  I want the big black dick!!".  Nothing beats sitting around at 3am after a night at the bar passing around the big black dick with my drunken friends.
author: Jen S.

description:
Awwwww-yeah...

This is the place to go when you win a bet with someone.  

She lost a bet... so I got to take a picture of her eating a long black macaroon cookie....  if you know what I mean.  Check it out.. not cheap... but you aren't going to find many other places that have the same novelties ;)
author: Eric K.

description:
I doughn't want to pan Hot Cookie, but I have to say that my most recent visits there have left me feeling crumby.  

If you had asked me a few months ago there would have been twice as many stars - it was one thing to pay $2.50 for a moderately sized chocolate cookie that was warm and delectable, but sadly I haven't had that experience in awhile. The last few times we've popped by and picked up our 2 cookies for 5 bux they have been stone cold, sometimes with a poorly mixed chocolate to dough ratio, overall nothing to write home about.  This last batch, though, was really sub par, the cookies managed to be overdone hard and dry on the outside, but glue like and undercooked riddled with pockets of air inside.  It makes me sad.

Ah well, I guess it is for the best, the powers that be are telling me to stop eating Hot Cookies so I can be one. Got the message loud and clear :P
author: GIR ..

description:
I love cookies.  

May she rest her soul, but Hot Cookies' cookies are better than my grandmothers.  Grandma made some good cookies, too.  And I can say that at no time did my grandma hang tiny red underpants in her front windows with the words Hot Cookie across the front spot where your junk goes.  So maybe that is the secret to awesome cookies.  Maybe.  

Actually, the secret is small batches.  I asked.

Oh and the cookies are hot when they come out of the oven, you idiots.  You have to have good timing, just like when you went to Grandma's house and there was traffic.  Deal.

The snickerdoodles are to die for.
author: John L.

description:
Yum! Yum! Yum!
They sell by weight, not by piece and I spent about $5 on 10 bite size cookies...totally worth it. And being in Castro, of course they carry "Fun" shape brownies. 

I always wonder why they put such grumpy workers there. It ruins the whole fun experience.  Maybe he should post a sign that says " No buy - no questions"
author: Maggie C.

description: Hot Cookie makes those long lines for the Castro Theatre go by so much faster.
author: anjou k.

description: This place has great cookies and other treats.  They are anything, but hot.  This place should be called room-temperature cookie and it would be true advertising.
author: Jonathan U.

description: I have since come back to Hot Cookie to have more "Pokies" and I have decided to make this cookie place my number 1 place for a cookie. No cookie can compare to the chewy, chocolaty goodness of a "Pokie". I am a huge M&M cookie fan but this takes it to a whole new level. I don't even want to know the calorie count of this cookie. All I know is that I better start running a little more before this cookie makes me not so "hot".
author: Kelley D.

description: Pretty good cookies, though they aren't served as hot as the store name would suggest. The chocolate chip was yummy.
author: Philip T.

description: Fabulous cookies. They are not only delectable but also available in varied incarnations, including Adult. Plus, they sell underpants. Yeah for one-stop shopping!
author: Janna M.

description: Cookies and Brownies are sooooo good. A little pricey ($2.50 - 3.00) for a cookie, but worth it now and again.
author: Kalen F.

description:
Ok so I think of this store as one of those cookie places that you re-fuel at while tromping through a mall.  

Except they sell men's briefs with the store name on the front  (which of course is displayed along with photos of the underwear being modeled)

This place would have recieved 3 stars because they are just a cookie store  - but -  I recently tried a cookie called Mocha Cayenne Chip.  SO inspired!  Chocolate cookie with coffee, chocolate and cayenne pepper chips - spicy sweet.    

MMMMM   

Thumbs UP:  The Mocha Cayenne Chip cookie
Thumbs DOWN:  Campy Castro establishment
author: Jeff C.

description:
Absolutely love these cookies!   
Cocoa cayenne or white chocolate macadamia nut cookies are my favorite
author: Matt V.

description:
What can one say about a place like Hot Cookie? Perhaps the only cookie store where you can buy a chocolate covered penis (made of macaroons) and then follow that up by purchasing Hot Cookie underwear. 

What you do with these cookies is best left a mystery! ;o) Just make sure you actually try them, because they are quite delicious! OH yeah, I went there... =)
author: Venatius P.

description:
My roommate works here

She has a gift for making snickerdoodles (not many people understand the importance of cinnamon like she does)

I am the luckiest girl in the world
author: mini moog ..

description:
Every time I walk past hot cookie, I fall apart like a steamy double-chunk chocolate chip cookie mess.  If only chivalrous young lads would offer to buy me a cookie and not a drink, the world and my ass would be a much happier, safer place. 

It's kind of unfair you have to pay by the pound here, because... let's be honest, no one wants to know how much sugar/flour and candy they are about to ingest, but who can resist?  This is also not a good strategy in luring the Mano-Castro demographic into the tiny store front. 

I'll show you mine if you show me a HOT COOKIE!!
author: Stanley E.

description:
Oh my how yummy this place is. We noticed it when we were walking in the castro one night. We peaked in and saw cookies, brownies, and all kinds of yumminess! I got a chocolate dipped brownie which took me 3 days to eat, and we got some cookies which were oh so delicious!

Yummy in my tummy!
author: Stacy M.

description: Penis brownies on a stick?? Now that's a HOT cookie!
author: Alex H.

description: I have to admit, I was drawn to the ever so happy looking penis cookie calling to me in all its glory but...toffee chocolate chunk cookies?  WAY more genius.  The cookie was moist, soft, and slightly chewy with the perfect buttery, nutty accent offered by the toffee and just the right amount of sweetness. The peanut butter and ginger snap also reign supreme for their kind!  The store is pretty small but has great energy and, most importantly, delicious goodies that will satiate just about any sort of cravings for sweets you might have after frolicking in the Castro.  The only thing I'd want next time I ventured down here is a warm cookie... although I'm sure that would put me in some sort of (blissful) cookie coma.
author: Kim P.

description: Must stop whenever I'm near the Castro! THE best snickerdoodle I've ever treated my tastebuds to!
author: athena k.

description:
umm... why doesn't hot cookie have 5 stars on yelp?  i'm at a loss for words.

from the tantalizing scent oozing down the surrounding streets of the castro to the tittie treats and cockies, hot cookie is by far the most amazing cookie spot ive ever been to.  

not only do they have hot pictures of girls and guys gettin' raunchy with sweet treats (and each other), their snickerdoodles are to die for.  the staff is accommodating when it comes to making sure your confection is perfectly warm, all of the cookies are deliciously thick and chewy, and they sell cute undies.  what more could you ask for?  

(+) 2384029384 stars for awesomely deliciousness.
author: Lydia B.

description:
Does anybody know the sugar equivelant of MSG?
This place is crack. Crack! Be it with or without the doobie, it's always such a pleasant desert.
author: E.Mo. ..

description:
I have enjoyed Hot Cookie for since high school. I enjoy how rice and gooey they are in the center. I like to bring people from out of town to hot cookie as a treat after a long day of walking tours. Considering the fact that Hot Cookie is pretty much a whole in the wall they have a pretty good variety of macademia cookies. I love this place because they make cookies just the way that I like them. There are very few things that I enjoy more than getting a fresh batch of cookies from Hot Cookie after a bad day.

Please not that these cookies are sold by weight and can be pretty expensive. I personally enjoy the cookie so much that the price is not a factor in my rating.
author: Nicole T.

description:
Best peanut butter chocolate chip cookies around.  I love these, and they are the perfect snack after a night of drinking/dancing at the gay bars.

Yes, a little pricey, but well worth it at 1am.  I can't help myself.
author: Christy T.

description: great deserts w/very interesting atmosphere.
author: Mike M.

description: I used to live in the neighborhood and frequent this place quite often. I haven't been in a while so I think their staff has changed based on the not so warm reception I received today. I went on Thursday while I was in the neighborhood to place an order for macaroons for a bachelorette party I was hosting on Saturday. The guy working that day said it was no problem and that I should just come in on Saturday to get them and that I didn't need to order them now. I added that I would need around 12 to 15 of them, again he responded it shouldn't be a problem. Now, fast forward to Saturday, I make the trip back in to the city to retrieve my macaroons and was not impressed by the customer service. A different guy was working this day. I walked in and he basically ignored me. I chimed up and said hello. He just looked at me an continued making cookies. Then I said I need to get some macaroons for a bachelorette party. He responds "like how many." I say  "I would like 15 if you have them." Then he starts giving me a speal about how I should have called first. I told him about my direct visit to the shop, and he responds "I'm sorry you were misinformed." So I just blow it off, then he says you know you have to pay in cash and it's going to cost you $93.75 for that many macaroons. I just smiled and said sure. He gave me a nasty stare and says "boxes or bags." I had him pack them up in boxes and he was talking to himself about how it was going to be okay, that is why he was there to help the customer, etc. I was feeling a little angry but I thought just grin and bear it. Once all the cookies were packed up, he repeated the total to me and I handed him a $100.00 to pay. He looks at my money and goes "Jesus Christ," storms off to the back room to get change. Does every one this guy encounters have correct change? Probably not! You work in a cookie store dude, get over it! I really hope the owners of this place read my review, because if I owned this place I would be furious that an employee of mine treated someone like that.
author: Sara H.

description: Damn good cookies and they stay fresh a lot longer than Mrs. Fields. I had their chocolayte chip cookies and what I find most interesting about them was the center of the cookie had melted chips.mmmmmm good!
author: Richard G.

description: Good and open late. They have mini cookies, penis shaped ones, or regular ones if that's what you want. The penis macaroons are actually good, but their cookies are my favorite! Check out their wall full of people wearing their famous red "Hot Cookie" undies.
author: Linda C.

description: Great cookies.  My favorite is the pecan.  Nutty, chocolate, chewy, crispy goodness!
author: MTBer I.

description:
I LOVE LOVE LOVE their Snickerdoodle cookies.
However, whenever I ask for a different cookie, they always give me the wrong one.  They hear Snickderdoodle fine.... but Chocolate Macadamia Cookie does not equal a Chocolate Macaroon..... or a Chocolate Chip Cookie is not a Chocolate M&M Cookie.  I don't notice until I walk out the door.... and then I don't want to go back, cuz chocolate is chocolate.
So, bring plenty of cash, buy some Snickerdoodles, and speak loudly.
author: Grant S.

description: Any place that is open late and has sweet treats is good in my book. I battled parking on pride weekend around 11pm just to go get cookies and it was totally worth it. Here's what we sampled: snickerdoodle - oh lawdy, this was serious heaven, it had like cinnamony swirls like the inside of a cinnamon roll! Chocolate covered macaroon - this thing is intimidating. By far the heftiest macaroon I have ever laid eyes (and mouth) on, no lie the size of a baseball. Best part was it was freaking delicious. It's a meal in itself though, so beware or share! Peanut butter chocolate - another solid offering, soft like the others and chock full of chunky goodness. Finally the Chocolate cayenne - yowza. At first just the usual delicious deep chocolate cookie but then comes the slight kick of cayenne pepper, very unique combo!  If I had to go with one again it would be that macaroon. The prices are not bad since the cookies are huge. Staff is sweet as pie too. Go here!
author: Alison B.

description: Good cookies for to calm down a craving for sweets yet very rich and sweet!  However they only take  in cash which is a hassle at times.
author: R C.

description: Just popped in to see the hot guys on the wall and saw the greatest cookies. Penis and Venus cookies. Macaroon cookies in the shape of a nice large penis covered in chocolate. I mean can it get better than that. Got a snickerdoodle also and it was great. i would say the penis is enough for 2. Quite large and thick.
author: Rachel E.

description: My fav is the peanut butter chocolate chip! yummmm.... I have yet to try the penis shaped ones. LOL
author: Lauren S.

description: The smells alone are worth just going into the store. One of my favorite places in San Fran!
author: Bill S.

description: i love the cookies here and also the Castro location is so quaint
author: Seaera T.

description: The penis cookie is so far the best coconut macaroon I've had...I was surprised that it was even better than Tartine bakery's coconut macaroon! Their macadamia nut/coconut/white chocolate chip cookies are yummy as well!
author: Eryn K.

description:
What other reviewers don't seem to realize is that the name "Hot Cookie" is a double entendre.  Why do you think they have the pictures of people in underwear plastered all over the closet-sized bakery?  If you're expecting warm fresh baked cookies, then bake them yourself at home (we all know nothing beats grandma's homemade cookies).  If you're like me, you don't have time to bake cookies from the Pillsbury premade dough package, let alone from scratch, nor do you have a grandma that can bake them for you (RIP Grams!).  That's where Hot Cookie comes in.  I stop here almost every time I drive or walk by, which coincidently happens quite often.  
 
Their cookies are the perfect texture- slightly crisp on the outside, and soft, melt in your mouth on the inside.  Unlike other reviewers, I've always thought the staff was very friendly- just sometimes a little distracted/aloof/stoned?  One guy that served me kept dropping my cookies on the ground- but of course, he replaced them with new ones.

The only drawback is I feel like I need to run 10 miles after I eat one of these cookies.  Instead, I trick myself into thinking if you take small bites, they're fat free.  (These cookies are also a great meal replacement)
author: Kristi M.

description: best m&m cookie ever and what's not to love about a chocolate dipped rice crispy penis.  go its worth the calories
author: Troy C.

description: If I ever went on a killing spree then was put on death row, my "last meal" would consist of just a gigantic pile of their "Butch Bars". Wow, I never knew peanut butter and chocolate could be combined and turned into something this amazing. They're kinda like the concept of the Butterfinger candy bar and the Reese's Peanut Butter Cup re-invisioned  by Mrs. Fields. The chocolate covered macaroons are pretty awesome too. I had one just to snack on before watching multiple movies at the next door Castro Theater. The thing kept me full throughout all three movies, so much rich chocolate and coconut in every big bite. Fred Phelps would probably come out the closet if he ever discovered this stuff on the lovely Castro.
author: Mike Hawk U.

description:
I can't walk through the Castro without going into Hot Cookie.
They have the best Snickerdoodles in the ENTIRE WORLD!!!
author: Michael S.

description:
we happened to be waiting at a light to cross the intersection when one of my cousin wandered off, following the scent of freshly baked cookies. couple seconds later, she comes back saying "oh I thought 'hot cookie' was a cookie shop but it's a sex shop. go look at it." she was kind of surprised since it smelled so cookie-y and the store was called "hot COOKIE." 

so cousin #2 and I walked to the window front to see briefs and other sexually suggestive items. then peeking through the door, we noticed that it was indeed a cookie shop. surprised again. 

cousin #1 got some cookies to last us until lunch and we munched on them as we walked to our hilly destination. I ate the oatmeal cookie and it was delish.
author: Caroline J.

description: A Great little place on the the corner of Market and Castro, good cookies and a Chocolate Peanut Brownie is to die for, the best of both worlds, Chocolate and Peanut butter, if you get offended by pictures of debauchery and baked goods looking like male and female genitalia and body parts stay away, but for those who can handle anything, try it out, and yes they have a good cup of coffee as well. Good service and they will box up orders and tie a bow on it to make it look like a gift.
author: Marc D.

description: I had a chocolate chili cookie which had flavors similar to a mexican hot chocolate.  It was delicious!  The spice was really nice and not too over powering and the cookie had a nice chewy texture.  I haven't had any of their other cookies but this one was definitely top notch.
author: Amy K.

description: just below anthony's.  fresh cookies, cost by the weight, avg $2 something.  the toffee chocolate chip is large, thin, soft, sweet, oily in the center.  would be nice if they had some ice cream to go with it.  snickernoodle more dense, sugary, ok.  the cranberry white chocolate oatmeal is quite good particularly.  very moist
author: Rob C.

description:
BAD, very very BAD customer service here.

The tall geeky video game store looking employee needs to be fired and sent to customer service bootcamp. 

Cookies are pretty good though. Just don't drop them on the ground by accident right after buying them. You won't be allowed a replacement. This even came after leaving a tip and engaging in friendly banter. Hence, two stars and that's still being too generous.
author: L. Renee D.

description: Eating a chocolate penis macaroon on a stick while drunk in the Castro made me appreciate penises a lot and made me wonder if they also make vagina cookies for the lesbians.  I am leaning towards no.
author: Starla D.

description: After the nth time seeing this little shop, I had to stop in, especially since I was nearly next door at the Bead Store. Obviously I had to try a cookie (given its name), but the macaroons looked so delicious, I got one too. The oatmeal chocolate chip walnut cookie was good, but probably would've been better with milk, and heated up. The macaroon on the other hand, was splendid!
author: Sally M.

description: Perfect spot for great cookies before you see a show at the Castro Theater.It's open late 2 which makes it perfect if you have that sweet tooth coming back from the mission with a burrito or some kati rolls from kasa... I just love the chocolate maccaroons,and anything else that comes out fresh really, from the  brownies to the small chocolate chips... perfect everytime :-)
author: Chris D.

description: Though I have no problem ordering a chocolate dipped macaroon shaped like a penis I do blush a little when ordering the super yummy chocolate and peanut butter bar called the butch bar. To help in the ordering process I usually follow up that order with a few of their cookies because at Hot Cookie even the items without crazy shapes or names are quite tasty.
author: Drue C.

description: NOM NOM NOM! So good. Took my first trip here during spring break with my mother who absentmindedly walked into Hot Cookie without knowing about the penis cookies! I had already heard about this shop but she walked in before I could explain anything to her. The funniest thing you will ever hear is the gasp of your mother, who was first astounded by the flavours, to be shocked at the end by large penis cookies. So funny. Any who the cookies were amazing and we stopped by again and again over the following week before she had to return home to the East Coast. My favorites are def Toffee and the Pecan one. Minus 1 star for the kind of ridic pricing (it's not like they're gourmet!) and the cash only aspects. Otherwise they fully satisfy my cookie needs!
author: Angela R.

description: These are absolutely delicious cookies. My favorites are the Cocoa Cayenne, Toffee Milk Chocolate, Pookie (M&Ms), and the Snickerdoodle. These cookies really hit the spot when you want something sweet. They are big, soft, and chewy. They are pretty pricey though and are sold by weight. for 4 cookies its usually between $9-10.
author: Mary M.

description: Sooo Over-rated! spend 3 bucks on a gourmet cupcake if u want to feel special.  There are far more superior snickerdoodles elsewhere umm starbucks is one example and its only 1.50 compared to the $2.64 here. Ridiculous- i guess you can charge more for novelty as they have vajayjay and penis shaped treats and it's the high rent castro. BTW  my cooke was NOT hot but i appreciate that it wasn't full cooked as i like it hard around the edges and doughy inside.
author: Paola L.

description: How the idea of a cookie-only bakery has not spread through this city like wildfire is beyond me. How many times have you just wanted the wonderfulness of a cookie and had to deal with mediocrity at bakeries? I feel bad for the cookie, surely one of the most under appreciated members of the desert family.  Let us replace the unofficial SF dessert, the eggy poor man's pancake, the crepe and let us replace it with a delicious peanut butter chocolate chip cookie. Until the glorious day that cookie stands all over the city start sprouting up, we will have to settle for the one and only Hot Cookie.
author: Maria D.

description: Hell yeah Hot Cookie, how'd you know I had a hankering for an interracial (half-choco dipped) macaroon in the shape of a penis.
author: Emily X.

description: Yummy cocoa cayenne cookies!! Shared the cookie with my dear friend today and we both agreed we would never hate ourselves if we got fat from eating them! Cos oh it would be totally worth it!
author: Candy C.

description:
the ginger cookies here are vegan!  they are goooooood...especially right out of the oven.  they are not ginger snaps, they are more like doughy ginger clouds of chewy delicious.  hot cookie always donates cookies to rocket dog rescue for our events and so that makes them tops in my books. plus, that is one damn fine vegan ginger cookie.

on a side note, an acquaintance of mine was invited to never return to hot cookie when he came in here really high and freaked out on the counter girl for not having white chocolate macadamia nut cookies in stock.  what an a-hole.
author: Laura B.

description: After eating these yummy cookies I was on my way to writing a five star review.  But then several hours later four of those stars cramped up in my stomach.  Super nice staff, great cookies, penis shaped macaroons, good location, "Reviewer" you ask "what more do you want?"     One thing really.  For the cookie to be cooked.  Yea.  They went there.  I opened my bag of cookies the next morning, after a long night of stomach cramps and pain, broke one open and what do I find but uncooked dough.  Cookie fail.  It's not hard to bake all the way through.  We all like soft cookies but we like sleeping through the night without being doubled over in pain just a touch more.
author: DJ S.

description: The Butch Bar (chocolate crust, peanut butter filling, thick chocolate glaze) will launch you into a diabetic coma, but really, its kinda worth it.
author: Suzanne L.

description: A couple of times I tried to go here late and they were closed - really?  They let me down.  Also, everything I've had is pretty average.  I'm no baker but I can bake better than this.
author: Aaron W.

description:
holy crap, so glad that euy led me here.  the cocoa cayenne cookie really was freakin good, dam worth the $2.60, mmm...

"hey euy, u want one of them chocolate peener cookies?"

rejected.  

perhaps i was a little frank* to her...


*haha get it?  little frank?  haha ok not funny...  8T
author: Ethan L.

description:
penis! penis! penis!
I ate a chocolate macademia nut penis!
best penis ever!
author: Joanna H.

description:
buzzing through castro in a deliciously delirioius state, hot cookie crossed my path twice. warm cocoa cayenne cookie and then a chocolate dipped rice crispie square--you floated my drunkie soul up to the sky. 

a tad bit pricey, but i usually hand over my wallet easy when i've had a 1-2 well drink from happy hour
author: Jade L.

description: I stopped eating the cookies here after they filmed that porno. That isn't to say that they weren't good before I learned of the video.
author: James J.

description: What a cool little shop- very friendly, helpful staff- fun novelty chocolates and seriously yummy cookies and bars- I wish I could give a broader review, but all I could order was the Butch Bar- oh God....  soooo good....  chocolate, peanut butter, and more chocolate....  They also give out freebies for folks who pose for photos in provided Hot Cookie Undies- Would be so risque if not for the three nude dudes further back in line...  :-)  A fun shop with wonderful food....  (The cookies didn't tempt me as much, but they seemed to be selling!!!!)
author: Tom E.

description: Holy goodness. Can I please have a dozen Snickerdoodles stat? Those are incredible. Our cookies weren't 'hot' per se... at 9pm on a Tuesday in January, but they were delicious! The Cocoa Cayenne was good [just as good as a Specialtys cookie, imho], but the Snickerdoodle -- yummmmm! Yummmmmmmm!!!!
author: Angela H.

description: I got a hot cookie at Hot Cookie and it was really good.  Better than Mrs. Fields, for sure.   How can a cookie not be good, though?
author: Honey L.

description: So my co-workers and I stopped in here to check out the penis pops. They looked divine. However, a bit pricey at $4.95 a head.  I was enticed by the rice crispy treat. I ordered the smallest one and ate it at my desk. ahhhh the guilty pleasure.
author: Jennifer S.

description: There is only one cookie here for me: chocolate and cayenne pepper. It might sound gross but it is far from it. Complex and sweet and spicy and chewy and HOT. MMMMMMMMMMMM...
author: margot b.

description: Every single time I visit San Francisco I make a stop at Hot Cookie. I love how friendly the staff is and I always get the same thing, the chocolate dipped penis shaped macaroon. Although it's a little pricey it's a huge pen...I mean cookie...and one of the best macaroons I've ever had.  It's also fun to walk down Castro St. while eating it since everyone usually asks me where they can get one for themselves.  I've brought many friends into the store and have even taken treats back home. I love Hot Cookie.
author: Gina P.

description: You people refuse to let my body fat be, dont you? AMAZING variety of freshly baked goodness. Storefront is so small that you could cut one and the cookie smell would STILL kick the little fart's ass. Peanut butter bar is why the divine touch themselves, and their perverted gentalia macaroons will make any grandmother blush with secretive glee. Their one dowside, they could use a better quality coffee for such a good cookie.
author: Mick F.

description: You've got to feel real comfortable in your body to eat in the street in the Castro. The rest of us aren't willing to leave ourselves open to surreptitious nudges and giggles, which means by the time we get our cookies home, they're cold . . . but oh so good.
author: Gourmet G.

description: Well...I was less impressed on later visits. But it might just have been my choices. Anything chocolate chippy=fully awesome (save for mini-chocolate thing, mini cookie seems to equal very not awesome). Regular sized cookies in general are good. But when I veered into rice crispy territory, well, I threw it away. And if you knew the percentage of my body that is actually composed of white sugar, you would see what that means.
author: Hallie R.

description: The cookies are pretty inexpensive, but nothing special.  It'd be nice if it were freshly baked, but I guess that's too much to ask for.  I think the real attraction of this place is because it's "cool", has a lot of interesting photos, and has that "penis and venus" cookie.  It's an ok place to go for a cookie.
author: William C.

description: There are a few pick-me-ups that I can always rely on, and Hot Cookie is one of them. I can admit to making a few random treks into town just to get a snickerdoodle from these guys. The cookies are weighed rather than sold at a flat price, so you won't wind up paying $2.50 to the little runt cookie that nobody wanted. I like Hot Cookie because they always have this almost-doughy consistency, not that crumbly sort of thing. They sell some little red briefs with the Hot Cookie logo on them, should I get some? If so, I MIGHT end up wearing them in my Yelp default photo...
author: Taylor S.

description: I have to say that I love a good cookie.  This place was really good, and I would go back time and time again if I thought I would not die of instant diabetes.
author: Matthew B.

description: Amazing cookies with flavors that will make your mouth water.  Love the peanut butter chocolate chip, oatmeal raisin, and oatmeal walnut cranberry.  This place is a must visit!
author: Beenish K.

description: I give Hot Cookie five stars for shocking me senseless.  They had red briefs tacked to the windows when I went weeks ago.  I bypassed the chocolate sex organs on sticks in favor of a chocolate brownie.  OMG!  The chocolate brownie was so delicious.  I almost ruined my beige cashmere gloves with chocolate goodness.  It was so gooey and moist.  Say, would yelp let me post a photo of the chocolate sex organs on sticks or would I be banned?
author: Camille K.

description: Baby, your thick, rigid chocolate-covered macaroon cookies make me hot all the time. Your coconut-flecked mounds of heaven make me weak. And when you put it all in a sultry pink box, I swoon.
author: Brianne C.

description: Unlike the masses, I didn't go for the giant, chocolate covered penis. I went for the mini, bite-sized cookies. They were quite tasty. I'd definitely go back!
author: Chelsea M.

description: a scrumptious but naughty little cookie shop with my favorite cookie - soft buttery white chocolate macadamia, they also have a wide variety of different flavors, even naughty fun-shaped stuff for the sex-saturated guys and gals!.  I must admit they are a little pricey but worth it.  You can also purchase a pair of red "Hot cookie" underwear and pose with it to have your picture posted on the wall.
author: binh l.

description: Why, Hot Cookie, WHY are you closed at 2:00am when the bars are closing and all I want is a Sexy Brian Bar?? Don't you know that you would make buttloads of cash if you were open until 3:00??
author: Megan W.

description: I dream about this place on a daily basis. My life goals include trying every cookie from this bakery.  It's the perfect pit stop after a few drinks at the bar next door but before catching a show at the Castro Theater. Seriously, GO!
author: Bekah L.

description:
this is my go to spot for thee BIGGEST and BEST cookies around. 
hands down one of my favorite cookie spots. 
the people are always friendly. 
the options are nearly almost the same so I know what I want before i even walk in. 
delicious!!
author: Brenda S.

description: Hot Cookie is the best, except that  it's too close to my house and I have to stop myself from going for post-dinner cookies two to three nights per week (I always get two cookies).  My first two loves were toffee milk chocolate and cocoa cayenne cookies, but now I'm into pokies (M&M cookies) and pecan-chocolate chip cookies.  Normally I love cookies with macadamia nuts, but the ones here are too dense/greasy for me to eat regularly.  Additionally, this store has two positive things going for it that most in the Castro don't have:  it's open almost all the time, and the people who work there are all really friendly and down-to-Earth.
author: Steven W.

description: Sometimes a girl just really, really craves a chocolate penis macaroon from Hot Cookie. And sometimes a girl's just gotta have it.
author: Gloria L.

description: When the cookies are fresh and not over baked, they are fantastic!  I would give them five stars, but I have gotten too many stale or slightly burnt cookies.  When cookies get burnt, they should be tossed not sold.
author: Russell C.

description: Hot Cookie my ass!  It should be called cold, hard cookie, because that is what they serve.  I was looking forward to something, sweet, soft, gooey and warm, you lie hot cookie!  There are many better places to get a cookie in this city and I suggest no one consider this one.
author: Steven K.

description: Hit or miss, if the cookies are HOT they are great. Overall the cookies are so so....
author: Shima L.

description: The secret ingridient here is butter!  My butterball finger was soaked with oil as I was eating the peanut butter cookie.  It was good though.  The white chocolate cookie with cayenne pepper was the manatee's favorite.  I was scared to eat it.  I wasn't sure if spicy and chocolate went together.   But there was that suprising kick after you taste the sweetness of the cookie.  The manatee wanted a black penis cookie.  But I insisted I was just give her my black penis when we got home.  She enjoyed it.  The cookies here are charged by the pound.  3 cookies cost $8.  Kinda expensive.  Good thing my penis cookie was free.
author: Fatty A.

description: Really freakin amazing cookies.  I have gone there on a few occasions, had the white chocolate macadamia nut, snicker doodle, and chocolate chip.  I don't even care for white chocolate but I have to say, that cookie changed my mind, it was just so sweet and chewy.  All their cookies are the perfect consistency, soft, chewy, and sweet without tasting artificial .  These cookies are not cheap, but they are worth it.
author: M R.

description:
i begged my boyfriend to take me here because i heard they made really good cookies( even tho he didnt like the idea of driving down castro). lol. my boyfriend got the m&m rice krispie treat, which he enjoyed, and i picked up the chocolate covered macaroon penis cookies. and wow! they were really big, filling, and very tasty! seriously tho, penis cookie, it will melt in your mouth! LOL. 

the shop itself was small and cute. they have a lot of pictures of guys in their underwear and whatnot. lol. id say the only thing i dont like about this place is they only do cash only. which sucks cause the only money that i have is my debit card.
author: Cedric R.

description: Wow, delicious cookies!  Too bad they are so expensive (sold by weight).  I'm often tempted by the treats here, especially the Mocha Cayanne Cookies which is amazing.  There's also a milk refrigerator so you can have a cold beverage with your treat.  The staff is friendly here and attractive.  It's a little risque inside with explicit cookies and tons of partial nudity photos, so great for adults, not so good for kiddies.
author: Michael D.

description: I wish I could give it 10 stars.  I am a cookie snob and the oatmeal/cranberry/white chocolate cookie here is the best I have ever tasted.  I am thankful it's not it my neighborhood.  I would constantly be buying clothes in the next size up.  Yes, I do think it's better than Specialty's.  For sure. I love you, Hot Cookie, even if I can feel the fat piling up on my thighs with each delicious bite.
author: Abby W.

description: Oh thank god i dont live by here.My waist also thanks god.as well as my scale,becasue if i did i'd have to stop by everyday so i could wolf down quite a few cookies.wtf are they putting in these cookies that makes them taste so good?! whatever it is these cookies are certainly heavenly,oh so soft and sweet and chewy and orgasmic and amazing and delicious and any other word that can come to mind when thinking of cookies.YUM!
author: Peeta B.

description: The best rice krispy treats since elementary school bake sales. Extra gooey marshmallow on top? OooOooh yeah.
author: Viv C.

description: These cookies, especially the small ones, choc chip are delicious.  The penis shaped cookies are great too, although my husband can't seem to bite down on the tip.
author: Pug P.

description:
you can't go wrong with a place named hot cookie!  i am faithful to this spot... it has saved my life time after time between happy hour and regular bar-hopping hours on one of my favorite streets in san fran.  the staff is friendly and you can always count on a large selection of fresh, warm, chewy, toffee-chocolately morsels... ready to melt in your mouth with a pint of cold milk or a hot cup of joe to wash 'em down.

but what really started my hot cookie addiction was when my housemate would bring leftovers home by the bagful from her work meetings  (yes, hot cookie is a patron to the lgbt community as well, donating to local non-profits such as "our family coalition").  sold.
author: gina b.

description: Location, location, location.  There you are.  It's past 6pm.  You are just getting off work and you are starving.  The 37 bus just left meaning you have 15-45 minutes to wait for the next.  Something hits you.  Something pleasant.  A sweet smell from across the street.  Oh, Hot Cookie, you dirty temptress.  OK, I'll give in once again.  But this is the last time this month.  The last, you hear me?!
author: Michael M.

description: The cookies were great. I appreciate them returning my wallet. The jerk employee who stole the H&M gift card out of it can eat poo poo and die. That's right, jerk. You didn't think I'd notice it missing. I hope the next poop you take is a painful one and that you look stupid in whatever you purchase with my hard earned cash.
author: michelle o.

description: I love cookies, and I really love Hot Cookie's cookies, and brownies and rice krispie treats.....you get the idea. A hot cookie with cold milk is divine. They even offer chocolate covered "penis" and "venus" (or is it Goddess?) cookies for when you're feeling a little bit, um, daring or such. ;-)
author: Suepattra M.

description: These cookies should be illegal.  Be sure to get them to pop a cookie in the oven for ya.  They are just too good.  Selection is great, especially for us chocolate / nutty fans.  They have penis cookies too, which make a fun gift for select friends.  Get some!
author: Dan M.

description:
some girls were visiting from santa cruz this past weekend & they are some serious cookie addicts. apparently, at ucsc they have late night cookie delivery on campus so being away from school led to serious withdrawals. i decided we should stop by this castro staple to get the goods.

one friend ordered the oatmeal raisin & explained to me that she gave up chocolate for lent. i told her that she was missing out & that jesus isn't real anyway. the employee who helped us agreed & laughed as he retrieved my oatmeal walnut chocolate chip from the case.  my other friend order four (yes FOUR) chocolate chip cookies because she would rather eat four cookies for dinner than an actual meal and a cookie for dessert. my friends are weird & awesome. 

the cookies were great, as always.
BUT did i really just pay $3 for one cookie?
i could eat an entire box of oreos dipped in peanut butter for less than that, hmph!
author: Lizzy L.

description: Their penis-shaped chocolate covered macaroons are a great deal of fun with your friends and just overall tasty! :P
author: Amy C.

description: One thing: I was expecting a "hot cookie" and to my suprise it was cold :-( also their really expensive not to be "hot" and only 2 macadamia nuts in my "chocolate macadamia nut" cookie.
author: Ishtar P.

description: Been here a couple times, and each time has been amazingly good! I especially like the walnut chocolate chip, snickerdoodle, and chocolate fudge, but all the flavors are really good. Perfectly chewy, with just the right sweetness balance. Thank god I don't live nearby!
author: Joy C.

description:
Of course, the penis macaroon is the big attraction, but in my opinion it is a tad overpriced for that particular item. 
The rest however, is perfectly priced and just as delicious, if not more! THE COCOA CAYENNE cookie is not to be missed, but you can't go wrong at Hot Cookie! My favorite sweet establishment!
author: Luke L.

description: The mocha cayenne cookies are my very favorite. I have to restrain myself to just two each time even though my brain tells me to order seven. The chocolate covered macaroons, snickerdoodles and white chocolate cranberry oatmeal all come in a close second. A perfect snack before or after catching a movie at the theater.
author: Nathalie L.

description: The Hot Cookie underwear is probably a must. Sexy Brian Bars are pretty good. The cookies are obviously best when they are hot out of the oven. The alternakids who work there are good folks and friendly (and boy must they put up with a lot from crazy customers). Good place to pick up fliers for plays, djs and everything else.
author: Tyler S.

description:
they are HOT for their chewy, moist cookies that are  baked right  in their small space. i love their sexy brians, as well as their chocolate chips macadamia nuts, oat meal raisins and chocolate covered macaroons!!! 
i find the red undies hanging on the windows and walls quite cute and fun and these items are for sale, too.
author: Nelle A.

description: Like a lot of things in the Castro, stuff can get stale and kinda tasteless here after a while.  But when everything comes together just so, and your timing is right--i.e., you show up when the cookie you want is hot--the result can be scrumptious.  A fresh peanut butter bar is awesome, but let it sit for a while and, well, better left untouched.
author: Kevin S.

description: I am a fan but I thought that the buy behind the counter would have more of a personality or something. But he just seem kind of bored with him job or may be it was just a long day! I came here and got their famous penis cookie for $4.50 I think it was that much. But it was a VERY big cookie! I think I have it stashed somewhere in my fridge some where. It taste very good with soy milk! My friend go the fudge cookie it was not as awesome as my penis macaroon though.
author: Janet Z.

description: Best cookies in the city if you ask me. Worth every penny. Plus you can pick up a pair of  underwear. What more can you ask for?  Yum!
author: Mex B.

description: The chocolate chip cookie is really good. The chocolate fudge is very rich and good, but almost too rich. I hear the snickerdoodle is good too. Oh, and they have dark penis pops, if thats your thing...
author: Nicolas H.

description: The big-ass M&M cookie (can't remember what tawdry name they gave it) and a cup of coffee from that little place a few storefronts away can give you the biggest stomachache, but in the best way possible.
author: Jody A.

description: Good cookies, with a good variety. Expensive though. Awesome pictures of people wearing their boy shorts plastered all over the walls.
author: Tim M.

description: Love the PB Choc Chip and the Coconut Macadamia Nut cookies!!!!  Amazing when they are still warm!
author: km k.

description: My friend David shared his coconut macroon penis with me and it was absolutely DELICIOUS...very moist!  I can't wait to go to Hot Cookie and load up on some cookies of my own!
author: Britt M.

description: Tepid cookie. In eight years, I have yet to bite into a hot one. No bad, perhaps on par with Mrs. Field's, but without the right-wing associations.
author: Billy A.

description: Love love love LOVE this place.  It might be because after nights of drinking and dancing around the Castro I feel the need for something sweet but on the other hand it might just be because this place is oh so good.  The cookies are fresh and if you want to have them hotter they will heat them up...  there are of course some that are of questionable shape (well not really just phallic or other?) which is fun. check it out.  Try something new or stick with the classic.  I love it and I am pretty sure you will too...  My favorite = snicker-doodle.
author: Kylie L.

description: I thought this place was pretty funny. It's in the gay district so I mean what do you expect? It's a really small place. The penis cookie was interesting. It's a macaroon on a stick dipped in chocolate and the balls part is sprinkled with coconut shavings. I thought their white chocolate macadamia cookies were really good.
author: DJ T.

description: Some friends recently came by to welcome me to their 'hood (Castro), and brought with them some TO DIE for cookies... from this place that fortunately ( or unfortunately, if i care about my waistline ) is right around the corner from me... Hot Cookies.  The cookies were even still warm, when my friends arrived with them! Now THAT is fresh and heavenly cookie goodness!
author: beth l.

description: Delicious macaroon dicks. I really, really love macaroons, and the shape is what it is, how could this not be good?
author: Nora X.

description:
yummy yummy cookies!

brownies suck ass--& not in a good way.
author: Rebekah K.

description: The cookies are good but I am giving Hot Cookie 4 stars for being open late.  I love that!
author: Lauren B.

description:
omg, the toffee chocolate chip cookies are to die for!! the chocolate is not abrasive and the toffee is baked ever-so-gently swirled throughout the cookie...mmmmm
add this to your list of places to go before you die, for sure!!
author: Sloane G.

description: Love their cookies!  They made be a little pricey for a cookie but the cookie is amazing so it's totally worth it.  I think there is something in the chocolate that makes them so mouth watering.  They do have a frequent cookie buyer card where if you buy 12 the 13th is free so that helps.
author: Jessica G.

description:
All I've had was their chocolate covered coconut macaroon "cookie" but it was the best macaroon I've EVER had! Great balance of sweet coconut and slightly bitter dark chocolate.  

It didn't hurt that it was shaped as a giant penis either.  mmmmm, chocolate covered balls...
author: Jacqueline B.

description:
I love HOT COOKIE for a few reasons.

- DELICIOUS Cookies (Plus a good selection)
- Chocolate Dipped Brownies
- Cute Underwear
- I'm on the wall (Twice actually)
- They give me free cookies when I come in all dressed up! ! ! (Hope that's okay for me to say here?)

HOT COOKIE is by far one of my favorite places in San Francisco.  The cookies are absolutely delicious, and the shop people are great!  Every time I take a friend here, and they have never indulged in a cookie from HOT COOKIE before, they always tell me how much they loved it (And they will even text me, telling me how much they want to go back!)

I personally love their Chocolate Dipped Brownies, Chunky Chocolate Chocolate Chip, & Marshmallow Bars!  The prices are a tike bit high it seems, but then again, I find myself to hardly be able to finish my cookie!  They are pretty big, and they also offer some cookies in smaller portions.  This little bakery is very little indeed, but they definitely make up for it with great photos of customers in their HOT COOKIE underwear all over the walls, and vintage antiques/decor all around the shop.  The shop people aren't too bad to look at either!

If anyone is in the area, this place is a must-see!
author: Antic B.

description: Our hotel was within walking distance and we ended up going 3 nights in a row and trying a bunch of different cookies.  Yes it's a bit expensive (I think it was $7 for 3 cookies) and sure you can make cookies at home but I was on vacation and they were really good!
author: C. B.

description: Basically hosted a bachelorette party in the city. Came straight from SFO. First stop has got to be HOT COOKIE in the Castro! A place like no other. thanks for being open late.
author: Miss B.

description: After tasting some of the best macaroons, I had to read some of the reviews here on yelp to see if everyone was on the same page as me.  Apparently, there were some stuff that I missed, especially the chocolate covered penis.  This hole in the wall shop is definately well-suited for the Castro .  If you're ever in the city, a stop over here is well worth your time
author: Andrei O.

description:
The cookies here are pretty damn good! At first I was put off by the larger cookies which can run pretty steep, but a bundle of smaller ones is a much better deal! The guys and girls working behind the counter are nice and helpful. Love the pictures of the Hot Cookie club members. 

Great Cookies: Chocolate chip macadamia nut.....yum......and Pumpkin cookies!
author: Chris D.

description: God i feel fat. I mean really fat. I just downed one of those delicious chicken cheese steak hogies (hold the mustard) wtih fries and a coke. I then went over to Hot Cookie and got a toffee milk chocolate cookie. However, I didn't eat immediately. I waited until i got home and had a pint of vanilla ice cream. I then heated up the cookie put the ice cream on top and watched Entourage. I feel fat lazy and pretty much AWESOME. Thank you V cafe and Hot Cookie.
author: John S.

description:
Came to Hot Cookie for the first time with my cousin today, she said the place was really good and I love cookies so I thought, why not? Hot Cookie is a small cookie shop that could probably fit about 4-5 people if you really tried to cram in there. They have cookies, lemon bars, rice crispy treats, and something else in the shape of a penis that was dipped in chocolate. I ordered 3 of the tiny ginger snaps, and 4 of the regular large cookies (snickerdoodle, chocolate chip, toffee chocolate chip, and oatmeal raisin). I had to wait over 30 minutes until I was back home from my bart ride to finally taste them, and they were delicious, but I wouldn't call them amazing - especially for the price. For my 4 large cookies and 3 tiny gingersnaps I spent over $12. They seem to charge by weight and I've honestly had cookies that tastes equally as delicious for much much less (refer to Bake Sale Betty's in Berkeley). 

While the cookies are good, I don't think really think they're worth over $2 for a single large cookie.
author: Monica W.

description: BEWARE: The name is deceiving....they are not hot or warm or tepid for that matter.  I was very disappointed.  My bf lives in twin peaks...so every time we drove down market, the big neon sign disclaiming "HOT COOKIE" would catch my eye.  I'd always go...mmmmm, I wanna go there.  Finally one morning we did......and to my dismay, there were no hot cookies...only cold cookies that weren't even that good.  I mean if they were cold and chewy cookies....I can deal....love chewy cookies, but no...just hard, cold cookies.  Hard, cold cookies that cost like 3 bucks per cookie (depending on weight)...not a great deal for mediocre cookies.  It's funny because now when we drive down Market...I never notice the neon hot cookie sign anymore.  I suggest you make your own at home...they will probably taste just as good (unless you are baking-challenged)...and you can eat them while HOT!!
author: Neety P.

description:
love the concept.  amazing cookies.

snickerdoodles, choco chip. yum.
author: Alyssa W.

description:
meh.  it's san francisco.  it's the castro.  a penis shaped cookie isn't that surprising or amazing or incredible that i have to automatically give this place a billion stars.

came here, skipped the penises and the boobs, and went for some cookies.  had a chocolate cookie, white chocolate cookie, chocolate chip cookie, chocolate dipped brownie, chocolate cayanne cookie, and a "pookie" cookie (m&ms).  they weigh it by the pound, and it's pretty expensive, which is mainly the reason i am rating this place with two stars.

some cookies were good, some where okay, some where not good enough to waste calories on.  so they hit average... except i can get an average cookie for much cheaper elsewhere.

sorry hot cookie; i really did try to like you.
author: H. L.

description: Cool place. Great deserts. Awesome place to show guests from out of town and get them all warmed up and ready for the San Francisco spirit. ;-)
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description: if a macaroon is shaped like a penis does that mean its no longer kosher?  hehhehe.  I had the ultimate gay/Castro experience (but you don't have to be gay to enjoy it, the Castro loves everyone) I got the infamous penis cookies here before I went to the Castro theater to see The Sound of Music (which i f--king loved!!).  I've only been here twice. Its a small little cookie place but it will feed your craving for sugary penisy goodness.
author: iced capp. y.

description: In my mind, no trip over to the Castro is complete without a stop off at Hot Cookie.  Small semi cramped storefront doesn't allow for much lingering beyond the cookie transaction.  The cookies are to die for.  I think they make the best snickerdoodle of all time.
author: Amy Z.

description: I am a Rice Crispy treat expert. I started getting them at Starbucks with my morning coffee. Then I added up how much I was spending on the extra treat (besides the overpriced coffee), so I started to make them at home. I have probably tried 15 different recipes and variations of each. Some one suggest trying Hot cookie. Excellent choice. It was very marshmallowy and gooey. Excellent. I didn't try the chocolate one I try to watch the calories.
author: Doug C.

description: Hot Cookie?  Aptly named.  Yes, indeed!  But should be "Hot and Tasty and Gooey and Yummy Cookie!"  There is no reason to say anything more!  GO! GO here and get some cookies!  Staff is super nice!  Go now and swiftly!
author: Beth K.

description: I don't think the cookies are all that great, but I get endless excitement out of shoving that penis-on-a-stick down my throat the way my friends in the Castro showed me how.
author: haley d.

description: If you are ever looking for a quality chocalte chip cookie like ma used to make this is the place to go.  Tiny little gobs of heaven they are.  On the rare occasion I am in the castro this is a must stop for a little snack delight.  Oh yeah and they have great variety as well, i am just extremly partial to chocalte chip.
author: brian m.

description: Went there last night after walking past it hundreds of times... had visitors in town so a good excuse to go in. The cookies are great- really fresh and sweet. A little pricey as 2 cookies came to almost 5 dollars but well worth the taste and experience. The staff is really friendly as well :)
author: Seema M.

description:
three words:   
chocolate.rum.balls.   

what more could you ask for?

(make sure you buy some milk to wash down them tasty balls.)
author: Grace M.

description: The only place i know where you can get obscenly shapped cookies.  Tasty, but if you take one of them out of the Castro you get lots of odd looks.  Try one of the Cyan chocolate cookies, i know it soudns gross, but they taste really good.  I swear.
author: Herbert S.

description: You're fucking crazy if you don't like the cookies this place has. I'm giving the price range three $s because unlike Mrs. Fields or wherever else you buy cookies, Hot Cookie charges by weight and the cookies are heavier than your average. The people living in the Castro have it good because I'd love to have this place closer to me.
author: Alano T.

description: penis cookies!! big fat ones!  now i'm psyched because next girls' night out is sure to be super fun with these to compare and gossip over!  These aren't the usual cookie cutter flat cookies, these are chocolate covered macaroons, bigger than some little men's stingers.  Now, only if i could stop drooling over the chewy, cinnamon swirly snickerdoodle and awesome chocolate chip cookies (boring round and flat, but damn good and fresh and addicting), [...self censored edit....]
author: Today Y.

description: Not the cheapest place to go, but holy cow, so good, i could eat these all day. And any place that sells a large, chocolate covered macaroon shaped like a penis, called "From Penis to Venus"...well, you get the picture.
author: Mama C.

description: This is not your mom's bakery... but it is the best bakery in SF! The staff is super friendly and adorable (cute little gay boys, what more could you ask for?!?!) Everything here is always fresh and yummy. Yay Hot Cookie!
author: Diane N.

description: Five stars for the cocoa cayenne cookie. Heaven on earth. And the best coda ever to a night in the Castro.
author: Ed K.

description: absolutely perfect little cookie shop. What more need be said. It isn't overpriced... it's a generously sized cookie... and a nice little shop with Castro atmosphere to boot. Why not.
author: Nelson C.

description: One Star for using real butter. One star for having a nice selection. No stars for the cookie being cold. That ain't right. Hot Cookie =hot cookies, dammit.
author: H H.

description: Not great cookies but they are often hot, gooey and convenient for sneaking into the Castro theater,
