author: patrick g.

description: my very favorite cookie place in the city! usually zero parking availability, but if you're in the area, you should wander on by. teeny little place- more like a cookie stand- that fits maybe 3 people inside. straight up chocolate chip is excellent, as are the white choc mac nut and assorted bars. on the pricey side, but hey, this is the city of $4 cupcakes, so you should be used to SF prices by now.
author: Zoe L.

description: When I lived in San Francisco I would stop here from time to time, but was never THAT impressed with the place.  This last time I was there I bought two cookies.  One was coconut with macadamia nuts and the other was chocolate chip with pecans.  OH. MY. GAWD!  I come from a family of sweet tooths and we are VERY picky about our cookies.  These two were two of the best cookies I have ever had.  Not kidding.  I am telling Robert P. I am coming up to see him, but it will really be for more cookies.  YUMMY!
author: Ben W.

description: L O V E Hot Cookie, it is a little peace of heaven right in the Castro.  Yummmmmy, I have come here and it has brought me great joy.  I keep it simple, I always have a Chocolate Chip cookie and when those things come out of the oven it's pure magic.  I can personally thank Hot Cookie for some late night weight gain, but it's definitely worth the potential extra poundage.
author: Marie B.

description: Wow. The best chocolate chip cookie I've ever had. Split with my best friend, in the Castro district, buzzed and walking around at 4 in the afternoon. I highly recommend it. The whole thing with the best friend and being buzzed too.
author: Jasmine O.

description:
expensive cookies... but very yummy and open late.
my favorite is the white chocolate macadamia nut.
such a delight.
author: miss m.

description: Hot Cookie has the most fantastic rice crispy treats known to mankind. This is not an exaggeration, it's a fact; there have been studies. They deserve 5 stars for this amazing, Guinness defying feat.
author: Allison B.

description: "hot cookie" would be more appropriately titled cold shit brownies.  Only in the Castro would a cookie vendor feel entitled to sell day old brownies with an attitude!  If i never ate a baked good from HOT COOKIE again it would be too soon.  I can only hope more honest reviews will be made that will shut that bitch down.
author: Kyle B.

description: Oh man, the cookies are delicious, hot and moist. Others may come to the Castro for other hot, delicious, and moist, uhhhhhh.... *insert your own noun here*. I feel a little guilty shelling 2 bucks and indulging in some fatty goodness, but its totally worth it.
author: Rocky K.

description: I'm quite the sucker for a good macaroon.  The fact that I can now enjoy one shaped like a cock makes it so much better.  I've also wanted a pair of those underwear ever since I've moved up here.
author: Katie H.

description:
hmm i want some cookies and underwear,
hey! let's go over there! there, where?

where you say? hot cookie!
let's go in and have a lookie!

cayanne cocoa you are spicy!
when i eat you, i then need an icee!

white chocolate coconut macadamia
more like white chocolate coconut mania!!

OH! MY! the snickerdoodle,
i think i could haaaave oodle......s! 

ok, i think i'm delirious right now. that little thing i did actually has a beat in my head. you'd have to hear it to believe it. and the only place you're going to hear it is in my shower or my car for i don't sing outside of my car or my shower. and NO, i don't sing a song about cookies on a regular basis. i just made that up in my delirium. 

side note: Hot Cookie, if you ever need a jingle for a commercial, you know who to call!
author: Regina C.

description: I'm of the belief that cookies, regardless of the quality of ingredients or cook, generally taste fantastic fresh from the oven.  That said, a fresh batch of cookies from Hot Cookie is still noticeable more chewy and moist than any cookie I've tried that wasn't homemade.  I could care less about the novelty of eating a phallic shaped sweet - the snickerdoodle will always be the reason for me to stop in.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
snickerdoodle! snickerdoodle! 
super good! these cookies are huge and delicious! it is a must must must whenever we go to the castro! the place is like a little hole in the wall, but its home to some of the best cookies in SF, kinda like the sprinkles cupcakes of cookies!
author: Calvinn W.

description: I'll admit I've never eaten one of their cookies myself, however, they get a four just because I get a penis shaped chocolate macaroon for every new boyfriend I take down to the Castro.  I guessing they can't be that bad since I've yet to see one of them not finish it all.  It's either that or I'm turning into Grace and don't know it.
author: Kris J.

description: Went to Hot Cookie for the first time last night. For me, it was not as great as people here rave it to be. I tried the mini ginger molasses cookie, pumpkin and white chip. Neither of these were hot...The ginger one was yummy, the white chip even yummier but the pumpkin was blah! It was more like pumpkin bread drop, not really a cookie. The BF got the toffee chipcookie and it was fresh out of the oven...I tried a bite of it and it was pretty good. Maybe I'll have to go back and try the other flavors and I'll change my mind about the cookies here. For now, Mrs. Fields is still the best!
author: Joy A.

description: Anytime I have dinner in the Castro I reserve dessert for Hot Cookie. I adore this little spot. I love bringing people here for the first time and not telling them anything about it ahead of time. I usually get the snickerdoodle. mmmmm. Haven't had a bad cookie yet. FYI... cash only.
author: Juls M.

description: i'm sort of in love with hot cookie. its hard to resist the warm glow of the neon sign and the delicious smell of fresh cookies. i'd say its consistently the best cookies in town, hands down. i love grabbing a toffee chocolate chip cookie when i have a bit of a wait for the 24, in fact, i just got home and i'm eating my cookie right now, its so chewy and delicious. yum yum.
author: Paige C.

description:
so if you're feeling for a nice little treat when you're intoxicated...

and you don't necessarily want a slice of pizza...

and you got a hot date to come home to...

bring home an even hotter cookie...



always a delightful treat!
author: Vince S.

description: Hot Cookie is an "oh my interesting" spot as my Mom would say. The selection is hot from Mocha Cayenne to Venus (and something else that rhymes with that) on a Stick. But yes, the cookies aren't "fresh out of the oven" hot. Though still worth the time to buy and throw in the microwave for a few seconds.
author: Leroid D.

description: I love and hate Hot Cookie. I love cookies, don't get me wrong...but I hate when I walk by late and night and smell the hot cookie goodness because it makes me want to stop my bar hopping and just pig out.
author: Mitzi Y.

description: A little better-than-average Mrs. Field's style cookies.
author: Monika M.

description: Good cookies. Maybe not the best that I've ever had, but definitely pretty fabulous. Mine wasn't really hot, which disappointed me a bit.
author: Dana L.

description: Oh, white chocolate cranberry oatmeal cookie...why are you so good? These cookies are perfect while waiting in line for the Castro Theatre. Or walking down Castro Street. Or if you're in the general 7 mile radius.
author: Evelyn G.

description: Love their cookies.  Not too sweet where it's just right.  Cookie was still soft and chewy.  The sweetie behind the counter gave us an extra cookie b/c there were 4 of us, but we only wanted 3.  Yeah.. free food.
author: AhLin C.

description: As a true cookie-lover, I am afraid I must say that this place is sadly overrated. The title gave me expectations that were not met: HOT cookie. Cookie was freaking cold. And not tasty. Don't let the merchandise fool you. A cookie's a cookie. It's not HORRIBLE, but it's not worth the extra cash you couldn't spend on Break-and-Bake.
author: Liz L.

description: Who wouldn't love a store completely dedicated to cookies that is not Mrs. Field's? My favorite is the M&M Cookie.
author: Erin O.

description: Yes the cookies are way overpriced, but who doesn't like a hot gooey cookie on a cold SF evening....that said, get the Milk Chocolate Macadamia warmed up...delicious!
author: Denny R.

description: penises and theres cookies too, a castro staple a few steps from the muni station.
author: Gabrielle F.

description:
I remember going to this place when I have a craving for a sweet tooth.  Its near the public transit station and you just cross the street to get to the shop.   The brownies are rich and moist.   This is a great place if you want to explore your taste buds on various concoctions of cookie flavors.   I remember getting the Cayenne and chocolate the flavors are supposed to compliment, however the heat of Cayenne hits you at the end and its spicy and a whoa I don't like it but let me try it again.   I took one of the brownies, whenever I travel it was the most well deserved treat after the end of a flight and three days later as I settle down to eat the delicious brownie  which I almost forgot was still in my luggage case.  Still remained chocolaty, flavorful moist and delectable it was worth the wait for the cookie.
  Remember: The top row of cookies will have several shaped like male sexual parts, but don't let that discourage to taste the moist, unique concoctions of cookies and brownies.
author: stephanie l.

description:
my moms wanted to buy the penis cookie but refrained and went for some oatmeal cherry number instead. 

Hot Cookie is everything you imagine it to be and more. Hot cookies in all shapes, colors, sizes, and textures. Yummy!
author: Hella M.

description: wild place, hella rich cookie n brownie...solid place for a cookie bookie!
author: Vimal P.

description: YUM! If you got a sweet tooth this is a great place to go!  I love their white chocolate chip cookies and their macaroons!  Okay, now I'm drooling! How can you not go in and buy something after you smell that sweet goodness oozing out of the store?
author: Mel P.

description: They have some seriously hawtt cookies here.  It makes waiting for the 24 bare able.
author: Chard M.

description: Plain and simple, pick up the chocolate covered Rice Krispies, and fall into a dream like coma of sweet satisfaction; chewy marshmallow, dark chocolate and sweet crispy rice makes this a great treat on the go.
author: Zee R.

description:
Are M&M cookies generally called 'pokies', or is that name just a Hot Cookie thing? I like going up to the counter and ordering a Pokie. "Hello, may I have a Pokie?" Good times, good times.

The day-olds are a yummy bargain if you can get to them before they run out.

There's no bad pastry here. (Yes, pastry: there are also brownies and some other tasty offerings.)

A Castro institution, if not an SF hallmark.
author: Joseph R.

description: Snickerdoodle.  It's my favorite!  I get one anytime I'm near.  Used to go there when we lived nearby, but now don't find occasion to go as often.
author: Benji J.

description: Who can ask for a cooler cookie shop? I haven't tried the penis cookies...but I have tried others and they rock my world. Worth the price, and definitely hit the spot after a dinner at Orphan Andy's.
author: Allison P.

description: I like the Hot Cookie underpants: I'd like to preface this review with the fact that I am not a cookie person.  I went here however with the expectation of hot cookies.  However the cookies were not hot.  Apparently you need to ask for hot cookies.  I did go back and get a warm cookie after an evening at the local Sausage Factory. (Italian in the Castro. TBR-To Be Reviewed)  This is a wif-fi spot apparently, which I don't understand because there is no place to sit.  It is basically a counter with glass cases full of cookies, brownies, and chocolate penises on sticks.  The milk ranges go from fat free to soy to chocolate as well.  And the Hot Cookie underpants are unisex.  Enjoy.
author: Diana L.

description:
This place is fun! It's also really small...

Anyway, I've yet to try the penis-shaped cookies, but I love the toffee chocolate one. Suddenly, the cinnamon roll I'm eating is not so tasty...I'd rather have a cookie.
author: Aileen P.

description: WTH?  Delicious cookies, funny creations, great workers.  C'mon it's the Castro!  What did you expect?  The ones your granny made?
author: Michael B.

description: If you are having a hankering for some sweet cock then this is the place to get it. I always look forward to getting the choc covered macaroon penis' when I am in that area. If this kind of cookie offends you then you might want to try one of there other many treats. This place is one of the best bakeries that I have ever tried. The best part is that they stay open late so I can get something after a late dinner.
author: Sandra P.

description: Everyone pays attention to the penis cookies, but they have so much more to offer! The brownies are delicious and huge. The cookies are soft and often warm. Service is cheerful and fast. I wish it wasn't so convenient to the rail station. It's hard to resist popping in.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
its something you dont see everyday. a erotic cookie shop!
i love it, being from portland oregon, it reminds me o voodoo doughnuts, i absolutely love it!! keep up the good work!
author: Randall J.

description: I don't know if I would go out and say that this was the best cookie I ever had, but I think it was pretty good.  Moist and chewy.  Just not hot.
author: Joanna S.

description: The combination of humor, sexuality and flavor makes this the best cookie shop in the entire Bay.  Yes, they have penis shaped cookies, but they have normal chocolate chip cookies too.  My fav has to be the cookie sand-which.  Two warm fresh cookies sandwiched together with a thick layer of melted marshmallow in the middle.  A'freakin'MAZING!
author: Michael N.

description: Who doesn't love a good cookie? I love cookies that are crispy on the outside but soft and moist on the inside. I'm glad I dropped in here to get a chocolate chip cookie because it had the perfect combo of crispiness and softness. Very fresh and sweet but not too sweet.
author: Kristen R.

description: I like to look at the penis cookies, but I prefer to eat the Pokies even more.
author: Bridget W.

description: The cookies are really good but too expensive. Do not be fooled the cookies are in fact not hot. Heated cookies cost an obnoxious sigh from the server extra. Penis macaroons are delicious even if you normally do not like having a penis in your mouth.
author: Galen M.

description: Minus a star because these are the most expensive cookies I've ever seen, but the cocoa cayenne white chocolate chip is seriously crazy good -- sweet at first with a spicy finish but still chocolately the whole way through.
author: Adam Z.

description: I make it a rule to stop by Hot Cookie when I'm in the Castro--even when I'm out for a night of dancing or after a big Sunday brunch.  I'm quite obsessed with this place that some friends have nicknamed me in reference to it.  Butch Bar, Double Chocolate Chip, and White Chocolate Macademias are my personal faves, but I haven't tried a cookie I didn't like.
author: Helen T.

description: Why do their cookies have to be so damn good?! Cookies are my weakness and the Pecan chocolate chip is by far the best cookie. You definitely need to stop by if you're in the Castro for some tasty treats! And the pics, totally entertaining and yet questionable :) Got my sister a pair of the hot cookie boy shorts and a chocolate dipped Penis. She loved it. What more can you ask for?
author: Diana F.

description: a little whole in the wall up in the castro with some hot sweets....and the cookies ain't so bad either! They are big, and fresh, and mmmmmmmmm.....get me a hot cookie, stat! Indulgent is a mild way of putting it, but i'll still get two of them! one for now and one for later. They aren't cheap ($5 + change) for two of them, but whateves! I'll gladly fork over a fiver for a taste of what they're selling whenever i'm in the castro.
author: Caddy M.

description: C'mon you owe it to yourself.....A hot cookie after dinner or a whole afternoon of bar hopping....this is the frosting you so need on the cake. Who cares you can work it off tomorrow. You deserve it. Don't be a wuss and buy the little bite size bits either. You better get the whole cookie. It's a treat that you so deserve. May I suggest the toffee chocolate chip or the fudge chocolate chip....C'mon take a hit.
author: Fil L.

description: Rice crispy treats are delicious as are the assorted cookies and brownies. Haven't had the balls to buy the Penis Macaroons yet.
author: Andy L.

description: I am convinced that this place only stays in business because there are a lot of drunk people and tourists in the Castro. Neither of these groups are known for their refined palettes.
author: Claire B.

description: Scrumptious!  This was an impromptu stop as my friend showed me around the Castro.  My chocolate chip peanut butter cookie was a little on the sweet side but the snickerdoodle was heavenly!
author: Melissa L.

description: They charge by the pound which amounts to an expensive cookie or brownie. Regardless of the price, I like the miniature cookies - I usually get one of each which is enough to satisfy my craving. I don't taste much of a difference from Mrs. Fields or Tom's Cookie. If I happen to be hanging out in the Castro, I'll come here for a sweet treat.
author: Candace F.

description: So I'm giving Hot Cookie 3 stars but I'm very conflicted. On one hand I like the cookies, the bravado it takes to make baked goods erotic and the people. On the other hand, they charge close to $5 for two cookies. Are you kidding me? That's the craziest thing I've seen yet in SF. But  I can't resist picking up a few warm cookies on a cold night. My favorite is the peanut butter with chocolate chips.
author: Kimberly H.

description: I agree with Jessica...the cookies are by and large undercooked.  And not really all that good...EXCEPT...the chocolate covered macaroons.  And I am not saying that because of the shapes.  These macaroons are moist and flavorful and covered with wonderful dark chocolate.  You just gotta put up with the stares  (no, I actually think they come in regular shapes as well).  I would come here (and frequently do) for the macs.
author: Thelma Lee G.

description:
well i was pretty disappointed cause lets just say i expected more from them. maybe it was the good yelp review i dont know. anywho, the lady behind the counter was such an asshole that my friend and i felt so juivinal that i didnt even get to experience their infamous penises. 


my boyfriend told me i had no balls and that i should go buy one; how fun huh. i DID however buy the chocolate covered brownie drizzled in white chocolate and it was delicious. but that lady really did rub me the wrong way; it will be awhile before i have enough confidence to go get that damn penis.
author: Courtney R.

description: Love this place.  Peanut butter chocolate chunk is great if there is any left by the time you get there.  You might want to call ahead to make sure it is still open if you are going late, though.  This page says 1am but I went a couple nights ago at midnight and they were already closed.  Went last night at around 10pm and they were about to close.  They used to be open much later.
author: Laura N.

description:
I love this place. The cookies are to die for and the staff is super friendly. I'm deducting one star because they cost so much. $2 for a Pokie? I'm cheap. That's why I get the day-olds.

Speaking of which, try the Pokie, and the Pecan Chip, and the Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Walnut. I could go on and on. This place is part of why I had to go back to the gym.
author: Eric M.

description: Nothing makes a dark, wet San Francisco evening more bearable than a few fresh out of the oven cookies. To be fair, mom's cookies are a touch better, but than you have to deal with mom.
author: Dale N.

description: Get the cocoa cayenne cookie! But not the chocolate chip. I didn't think anyone could mess up a good-old chocolate chip cookie, but apparently you can if the dough inside is gooey and raw.
author: Anita L.

description: Awesome place! The staff here are really friendly. Its small but the cookies taste great and are a pretty good size. I got 2 cookies there for $5.00 and I think it was worth it. They also have penis cookies which are great to surprise your friends and possibly relatives. The inside is covered with photos of people in hot cookie underwear so it gives you a bit of eye candy too.
author: R L.

description:
attention! this is rated "R", so viewers discretion is *HIGHLY* advised ...

woohoo! as yelp states, "it's as good as it gets!" 

"HAWT" cookie indeed ... 

so God knows what we all think about edible panties, edible bras, and such, but edible penis and women's torsos?????

*YEOW*

where can you go and pay $4.75 for a macaroon filled PENIS cookie, dipped in chocolate, shaved with coconut frillies? yes, the girth is roughly 2-3in and 6 inches or so, with a hard on, which is quite ___________ ... 

... lol ... 

i DID take a picture of it, but i just can't seem to post it ... lol ... i dare not to post it, just make a quick stop to the castro and get yourself a crazy cookie .. of course, this happens ONLY* in sf :)

:)

major kudos to creativity... LMAO
author: Jennifer S.

description: these are 5 star cookies at 3 or 4 star prices. i'm with my wife on the chocolate and cayenne pepper cookie. absolutely pure taste bud orgasm. i love 'em and could eat one everyday but i would have to tap into my beer money allowance i'm allowed to spend. and that ain't going to happen. do they have a beer cookie????
author: roger b.

description:
overhyped.

from a pro-cookie eater's point of view... this place is MEDIOCRE and OVERPRICED.  small and creatively decorated cookie vendor.... i think they sell lifestyle (penis shaped cookies) more than they actually sell good eats.  

the cookie: they were okay, not spectacular.  i do appreciate the CRISPY edges and GOOEY middle.... gotta hand it to them, they got the texture right.  but the flavor wasnt amazing.  the toffee chocolate tasted more like a regular chocolate cookie... and the others i tried... nothing memorable. 

the price: they go by weight and it comes to about $2.50/cookie.  i could get one just as good for cheaper at mrs. field.  and of course, my all time favorite cookie place is Bakesale Betty's, for only a dollar.  i guess Betty's has spoiled me, made me unfit to eat any other cookie.
author: Christina L.

description: if i had a dollar for everytime i engaged in some sort of questionable activity before eating these cookies, i could pay for my fat camp tuition and take a lear jet to get there.
author: Jessie J.

description: Where else can you get baked goods in the shape of a penis!? Doesn't that make your experience that much better? It's like a huge bake sale for cock enthusiasts!
author: Alyse A.

description: Loooove pretty much everything they sell, but my favorites are the cayenne cocoa cookies and the chocolate covered macaroons.  Great location.  Overpriced.  Nice staff.
author: Tuesday J.

description: best cookies.  and at a generous size.  the pecan chip is THE best cookie in the world.  and you'll never find a snickerdoodle like theirs anywhere else.  best cookies!
author: Karen O.

description: i was riding the 24 home to the castro when a fine upstanding member of  society pinched my arse (or lack thereof) and informed me that i'm apparently "one hot cookie."  i beg to differ on that point, but when i disembarked from the bus only to see the luminous red neon lights glowing "hot cookie" at me, i took it as a sign.  in i sauntered and picked up two large perfectly squishy yet perfectly crunchy chocolate chip cookies.   i allowed myself only 1/4 of a cookie during the walk home, and then warmed the rest up ever so slightly in the microwave (the delayed pleasure was well worth it).  now i bake a mean cookie, if i may say so myself, but i relished every last scrumptious bite of my hot cookies.  (and that's even though 2 not-all-that-ginormous cookies cost $4.50...wtf??)
author: Roshni R.

description: delicious hot and soft chocolate chip cookies... if i won't gain weight from eating i would OD on these every single day.
author: Elaine Y.

description: if you're going to go out of your way to get a cookie, might as well go somewhere that sells penis cookies. right? also, they taste great, they're weighed so you're not getting ripped off, and there are pictures on the walls of (attractive) people in their underwear. what's not to love?
author: bailey g.

description: Yum!  Great treats in both appropriate and inappropriate shapes!
author: Jen C.

description: try the toffee chocolate cookie. the macadamia chocolate chip is good, too, but this place is overpriced. you can have such a better experience at sweet inspirations nearby.
author: Vanessa D.

description: They are good cookies... lot's of choices, although not always hot. They charge for cookies by weight which is a little different. I had their pecan chip yesterday and was quite pleased (even though it wasn't hot!).
author: Michael H.

description: Pretty delicious. I wouldn't say it's the best chocolate chip cookie I've ever had, but there's nothing that makes me want to give them less than five stars. The snickerdoodle is pretty good, and I really like the Sexy Brian. I'll purchase the briefs one day.
author: Alex C.

description: my sonofabitch boyfriend introduced me to this godforsaken place and before i went gluten and dairy-free literally gained like 10 lbs due to frequent visits. you know how it is, settling down into a relationship and getting fat. sigh. i miss hot cookie but at least my jeans fit again. seriously, do they put like a pound of butter in each cookie? mmmmm fatty deliciousness good. and penis cookies. tee hee. penis. hee hee hee.
author: Mary V.

description: Really, if you're going to name your place, "HOT COOKIE" you ought to have some frigging actually HOT  or even WARM ones available.  I get the castro appeal with the chocolate dippped banana d!@ks avaiable and I'm sure they taste lovely but what about the HOT F-ING COOKIES!!  And almost $3 a pop!!
author: Jimmy J.

description: Hot cookies are good, and if they're not actually hot when you purchase them they are still fabulous and you can always microwave them.  The snickerdoodles are my favorite, but the chocolate chip kind dusted with little specks of cubed sugar are a close second.  But, funny story.  So I live in the Castro, and I am totally oblivious to the undies and Triple-X videos and enormous dildos shaped like rocket ships and other stuff that is all over the neighborhood.  (Case in point, I read the other reviews here and thought back a bit . . . I had never noticed the penis-shaped macaroons, 'cause I hate macaroons.  Feh, dried coconut, yuck.)  EXCEPT, my 11-year-old niece and 9-year-old nephew are staying at my house for a bit. Me: "You want to go to the cookies place?" Nephew: "SURE! YEAH! Is that the one with the underwear?" Niece, in an all-knowing voice: "Of course it is.  Everywhere in the Castro has underwear, silly!" Me: "Um . . . !"
author: Jude F.

description: delicious pasteries shaped like penis', vaginas and boobs? cakes, cookies, brownies..... it seriosuly just doesn't get any better than eating a dick made out of cookie dough. not gonna lie, it's amazing.
author: Jen M.

description: my friends were drunk on mimosas and spent almost $20 on cookies this afternoon. i had some and the chocolate with chocolate chunks was very yummy. i liked the penis on a stick though i didnt have one. i also like the undies!
author: Merredith L.

description: Mmmmm. Mini *hot* chocolate chip cookies.
author: Anna J.

description: although i've never actually stepped foot in here, it doesn't really matter, because I was given a hot cookie from Hot Cookie this past saturday and my heart melted along with the chocolate chips at first bite.  pecan chocolate chip something or other...does it matter?  i devoured it in about 3 bites, not once stopping for a breath of fresh air.  who needs air when you've got Hot Cookies anyway?  next time in town, perhaps I'll actually make my way in there and wash the deliciousness down with a cold glass a'milk. yum.
author: katie n.

description: best when drunk. not as good when sober, but still solid. had that revelation recently.
author: Marla W.

description: Is it me?  So many 4 and 5 star reviews on here, but for me it is just Ok.  I've tried their cookies on several occasions and I just don't love them like everyone here does.  Don't get me wrong, they are not bad I'm just not crazy about them.
author: Bri L.

description: the cookies ain't hot! what's up with that false advertising??
author: Michelle O.

description: tasty, super rich cookies.  that means i like it!
author: Jill k.

description: hey there hot cookie!! Get the chocolate covered fudge, yum!! Some items may not be suitable for children...
author: David P.

description: yummy cookies!  a great snack before/during/after a movie @ the castro theater!  i love the undies for sale too!
author: Sheri N.

description: The cookies are good but the employees suck. They make you feel stupid for asking what cookies were their favorite. It was service with a scowl. And, this what not the first time there I have been there or experienced the lousy service.
author: Paul N.

description: maybe a bit pricey, but i found the dozen mini chocolate chip cookies to be a great snack for two or three people. haven't bought the genitalia on a stick, but i plan to! they also carry cute boy-style undies that say 'hot cookie' on the bum. very cheeky.
author: Jenz y.

description: Definitely some of the best cookies I have ever had were at Hot Cookie on Castro Street.  We stumbled upon this purely by chance and it was proof that good things can happen in uneasy circumstances.  This place is ground zero for the "alternative lifestyle" to be politically correct and we had no idea until we got there but I have to admit that we would probably go back there just for some more cookies.  We got the Cocoa Cayenne, Pecan something and White Chocolate Macadamia.  All were great but the Cocoa Cayenne was just about perfect.  Chewy chocolatey on the inside, crunchy on the outside with an ever so slight evil bite after you've already decided you love this cookie.  It just sort of sneaks up on you.  Anyway, you can't be modest here or you just have to close your eyes, grab your cookies and run back to union square.  The cookies are expensive but I'd rather have one Cocoa Cayenne cookie than a bag full of Oreos.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Thing is, this is a destination spot. Worth a trip to the Castro just for a taste of Hot Cookie. And I admit that I went through my chocolate-covered penis macaroon cookie on a stick phase just like others, I'm sure (I hope), but every cookie here is amazing. Soft and gooey, warm and crunchy. Doesn't matter. Best dessert spot in the area, by far.
author: andrea a.

description: The oatmeal white chocolate cranberry cookies are worth every penny of the almost $3 apiece you'll pay for them.
author: Damon M.

description:
rice crispy treats from hot cookie would be the main reason that i would ever go to the castro... other than to hang out with my gay brother and his group of friends. 

hot cookie has the best cookies and well... THE BEST RICE CRISPY SQUARES! stick with plain ones the ones with m&m is just a bit too much.

the people that work their are really nice except for this one dude.
author: R M.

description: there are "hot cookies" of both kinds here!   the food variety is the ginger cookie and the two-legged variety features youngish twinks.  What else would one expect in boyz-town!
author: Richard D.

description: there are some hot cookies and SOME hot cookies. at the risk of embarrassing him, I'll mention I had a classmate who used to work here, and I think he put on a show for my female friends I was with one time when I came into the store several years ago. he was all acting a little bit too, shall we say, flirty, in front of my girl-friends? well, it was fun, although he didn't really follow up on such then-unknown theatrics when I saw him later at school. but not to worry, we did get our entertainment then, and he's hopefully happy now doing whatever it is he does. But as far as my most recent visit, I did try a chocolate based cookie with cayenne. let me say that my taste buds were greatly entertained. Lily E. let me try some of her macaroon, and I generally do not like macaroons, so this was amazing to try one that wasn't really dry and nasty.  So the question is, hot cookie, when will you really introduce me to a hot cookie, for real?
author: Ryan T.

description: this place has some pretty good cookies. kind of expensive but sometimes you gotta deal. if you ask them the microwave your cookie it's good. the penis cookies scare me a little bit.
author: Wats C.
